title: END OF HEIGHT RULES BY POLICE IS URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) A private study recommended today that police departments eliminate minimum height requirements so that an evaluation can be made to determine whether height is related to performance.

title: 8 African Nations to Open Paris Information Center
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast (Agence FrancePress)  An African center, planned by eight West and Central African countries, is to open in Paris early next year, informed sources said here.

title: JOB RIGHTS GAINS CALLED IMPERILED
description: NEWARK, Nov. 29  The Iongembattled Equal Employment Opportunity Commission was alternately described here as moribund and vital, but all the participants at a symposium marking its 10th anniversary agreed that its problems were monumental.

title: Greece Suspends Sentences Of 3 Convicted as Torturers
description: CHALCIS, Greece, Nov. 30 (Reuters)  Three policemen were given suspended prison sentences here today for having tortured political prisoners during the military regime that collapsed last year.

title: Lincoln Center Ready To Televise Its Events
description: Two years of research and experimentation at Lincoln Center with the techniques needed to bring live performances of opera, ballet, concerts and plays to television audiences around the country have now been completed.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: 10c Gasoline Tax Is Urged For '80's With $50 Rebate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)A Federal energy panel that included representatives of the White House and Federal agencies has advised the Government to impose a 10centagallon gasoline tax in the 1980's and to soften the blow with a $50 annual tax rebate.

title: PRESIDENT ARRIVES IN CHINA FOR TALKS
description: PEKING, Monday, Dec. 1President Ford arrived in China today for a visit designed to expand the new relationship begun more than three years ago when then President Richard M. Nixon visited here.

title: Mexico Heedless of Peasants' Plight
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 30Outside the squat gray building street venders try to sell illiterate peasants copies of the Mexican Constitution. In the Minisry of Agrarian Reform the peasants wander aimlessly or stand silently in groups, hoping to be noticed.

title: City Budget Austerity Is Stanching the Lifeblood of Clubhouse Politics: Jobs
description: The traditional allocators of lowlevel to middlinglevel patronage, the city's Democratic district leaders, contend that the austerity that afflicts City Hall and Albany has dried up the pool of jobs for deserving politicians.

title: Agenda Is Heavy as Legislature Reconvenes Today
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30Both houses of the New Jersey Legislature reconvene here tomorrow in what is expected to be a hectic session involving a rush of bills marking the closing weeks of the twoyear legislative session.

title: Olivier's Tall Order
description: Designers have disciples, and Diane von Furstenberg's most loyal is a young man named Olivier Gelbsmann, who used to work for her and her former husband, Prince Egon. Olivier, as he prefers to be known, and which is also the name of his dress company, obviously knows the formula: beautiful models, beautiful people lathe audience and relatively inexpensive clothes.

title: Released Spanish Leftists Demand Amnesty for All
description: MADRID, Nov. 30A noted leftist labor leader freed early this morning under an amnesty decreed by King Juan Carlos I said that he would not recognize the legitimacy of the monarchy until the Spanish people had been freely consulted and given their consent.

title: Modest Gain Seen For Economy in '76
description: The widely held view that the domestic economic recovery will gain strength throughout 1976 but will not set growth records has received the endorsement of the Conference Board's Economic Forum.

title: IRANIAN GAS DEAL TO SUPPLY EUROPE
description: TEHERAN, Nov. 30 After two years of negotiations, Iran gave its final agreement today to build a 1,000mile natural gas pipeline to the Soviet Union and to provide more than $400 million worth of gas a year to Europe.

title: Fausto Pirandello Dead at 76; Painter and Son of Playwright
description: ROME, Nov. 30 (UPI)Fausto Pirandello, son of the Nobel Prizewinning writer Luigi Pirandello and a noted painter in his own right, died today of pulmonary emphysema at a private clinic here. He was 76 years old.

title: ThirdWorld Christians Turn From Ways of the West
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 30At the fifth assembly of the World Council of Churches here, distinctive regional styles of Christianity are being exposed to each other.

title: Indiana Finds U.C.L.A Five Just as Easy as a Breather
description: Often, the nation's top college basketball teams try to use early season games against patsies to build reputations and regards Maryland, North Carolina, Notre Dame, Tennessee, Cincinnati, North Carolina State, San Francisco and Providence, all ranked The Associated Press preseason top 20, scored easy victories Saturday night against opponents not in the powerhouse class.

title: Mexico Heedless of Peasants' Plight
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 30Outside the squat gray building street venders try to sell illiterate peasants copies of the Mexican Constitution. In the Minisry of Agrarian Reform the peasants wander aimlessly or stand silently in groups, hoping to be noticed.

title: Museum of the Indian Picks Chairman and Administrator
description: John S. Williams Jr., a broker, has been elected chairman of the Museum of the American Indian's board of trustees. He replaces Stanley R. Grant, who resigned last August in protest over a court order requiring an inventory of the museum's 4.5 million objects.

title: Paris: A Huge Retrospective on Millet
description: PARISThe trulymodern painter, said Van Gogh, isn't Monet, but Millet. The huge retrospective currently devoted at the Grand Palais to JeanFranois Millet, who died 100 years ago and hasn't been the object of a major retrospective since 1887, makes this affirmation understandable and, to some extent, convincing.

title: Irish Hold Woman Sought By British for Terrorism
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 30 (AP)The police detained a woman they list among the most wanted terrorists in Britain and three other persons in a town near the border with Northern Ireland today.

title: Lava Eruptions Follow Hawaii Quakes
description: HILO, Hawaii. Nov. 30 (UPI) New 250foot lava eruptions shot from the Kilauea volcano today with a sound like jet roars and Boy Scouts told of a big wave that came out of the night and swept over their troop, killing one man, in Hawaii's strongest earthquake, in more than a century.

title: Falling Tree Kills Driver
description: BUTLERVILLE, Ind., Nov. 30 (AP)An Ohio motorist was killed today when a 65foot tree, toppled by strong winds, fell on to his car as he drove along a highway in southern Indiana, the authorities said. The driver was identified as 32yearold Michael Hensley of Milford.

title: Likeness of Robber Here Given Out by Postal Aides
description: Federal investigators yesterday circulated a composite drawing of an armed bandit who forced a postal employee into the back of his mail truck a week ago today, and together with several accomplices hijacked the vehicle containing about. $500,000 in jewels and other valuables.

title: Cruise Ship Limps Home
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 30 (UPI)The cruise ship Fairwind, one of her boilers disabled by an engine room fire, limped toward home today with 850 passengers and 500 crew members. She is scheduled to arrive at Port Everglades at 9 A.M. tomorrow. She had been due to arrive yesterday morning after a 14day Caribbean cruise.

title: Women in Bergen Fearful Following Slaying of Three
description: HAWORTH, N. J.  Geese waddle along the edge of the pond here across from the local police station, the wind ripples the water's surface, and the trees stand silhouetted against The gray winter sky, But few residents of this northern Bergen County community linger to absorb the beauty of the scene.

title: Fredericks Takes First In A.A.U. CrossCountry
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 30 Greg Fredericks of the Philadelphia Pioneer Club won a sprint in the last halfmile and captured the Amateur Athletic Unional national crosscountry championship today on the Naval Academy's course.

title: Couve Hopeful of Peace in Lebanon; Leaders' Reform Plan Is Welcomed
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 30Maurice Couve de Murville, the former French Prime Minister, ended a 10day mediation mission to Lebanon today on an optimistic note as the Lebanese public accorded a cautious welcome to a proclaimed program of national reconciliation and reform.

title: John Turk Makes Local Tuba Debut With 3 Premieres
description: John Turk dutifully played a Sonata by Michel Blavet (1700 1768) at Carnegie Recital Hall on Saturday night, but the young tuba virtuoso's musical heart obviously lies in the 20th century, whence came the rest of the pieces on his debut program. Three, in fact, were first New York performances of scores commissioned by Mr. Turk, who teaches at Youngstown State University in Ohio and is solo tuba player with the Youngstown Symphony Orchestra.

title: Released Spanish Leftists Demand Amnesty for All
description: MADRID, Nov. 30A noted leftist labor leader freed early this morning under an amnesty decreed by King Juan Carlos I said that he would not recognize the legitimacy of the monarchy until, the Spanish people had been freely consulted and given their consent.

title: About New York
description: In outoftown precincts there has long been a sort of misconception that the patron saint of New York is St. Vitus.

title: Books of The Times
description: Giftbook time, and despite recession, the perils of New York City and the unseasonably warm temperatures, the publishing industry appears to have produced the usual guazzabuglio of extravaganzas. Fallowing, arranged in ascending order of costliness, are the dozen or so that leaped out at me and cried most insistently, Buy me. and give me for Christmas!

title: ExGov. Knowles Aids Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Former Gov. Warren P. Knowles was appointed today to head President Ford's campaign committee in Wisconsin. Mr. Knowles, 67 years old, was elected to three terms as governor, leaving office in 1970. He lives in Milwaukee.

title: ANCIENT FARMERS KNEW PESTICIDES
description: Pliny the Elder said that a crayfish placed in the middle of a garden would keep caterpillars away. He also noted that mixing vegetable seeds with cypress leaves before sowing would discourage maggots from eating the plant roots later.

title: DUPONT PRIZES GIVEN FOR RADIOTV NEWS
description: The high quality of local reporting was a notable element in this year's competition for the seventh annual Alfred I. DuPontColumbia University Awards in Broadcast Journalism, the president of Columbia said yesterday in announcing the 10 winners.

title: Coronel Suarez Takes Polo Title
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 30Coronel Suarez, the brilliant Argentine polo team, won the national Championship, which is equivalent to world supremacy in the sport, with a 149 victory today over Santa Ana.

title: Competition Growing in Choice of Phone Equipment; Battles Loom Over Impact on Operating Companies
description: By this time next year, consumers will find it easier to buy telephone calling and ansswering equipment from a variety of suppliers rather than renting it from their telephone company for a monthly fee.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Britain's Oil Outlook
description: Britain's offshore oil, being developed at a cost of billions of dollars, may fully meet the country's total needs for only five years, according to a forecast by the British brokerage firm of Phillips & Drew, released yesterday. The report said that because oil fields maintain peak production for only a relatively few years, Britain might be self sufficient only during 19801985.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Cuba Is Said to Station 5,000 Troops in 10 Nations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Cuba has sent more than 5,000 regular troops to 10 countries, U.S. News & World Report said in an article published today.

title: Henrietta Stein, Developer Of Mental Health Theater
description: Henrietta Shapiro Stein, who womoted mental health educaion through suburban community theater plays, died Thursday in Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 61 years old and lived at 1140 Fifth Avenue and formerly in Great Neck, L.I.

title: West Side, Chicago's Other Ghetto, Ranks Among the Worst in Nation
description: CHICAGO Nov. 30At the corner of Madison Street and Central Park Avenue, a section of pool halls, taverns and onestory walkup apartments on the city's West Side, a young man in an anklelength fakefur coat slapped hands with three comrades as they passed around a bottle in a brown paper bag.

title: How Open the Doors?
description: The controversial question of open admission to the City University is again under examination.

title: Spurs 127, Spirits 115
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 30 (UPI) James Silas scored 15 points in the third quarter and sparked the San Antonio Spurs to a 127115 runaway. A.B.A. victory over the Spirits of St. Louis.

title: BATTLE STIRRING AN ALASKA'S GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30In the corridors of Congress, in union halls and chambers of commerce from Newport News to. Seattle and on Parliament Hill in Ottawa, a second Alaska pipeline battle is building.

title: Sealyham Is Named Best at Boardwalk
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 30 There seems to be no stopping the little Sealyham terrier, Ch. Dersade Bobby's Girl. Tonight she was named best in show for the 42d time in the United States, as she led a field of 3,714 doys in Convention Hall. The occasion was the annual Boardwalk Kennel Club show, the third largest in America this year.

title: PRESIDENT FLIES TO PEKING TALKS
description: TOKYO, Monday, Dec. 1President Ford flew to China today to expand the new relationship begun more than three years ago when Richard M. Nixon visited China.

title: Portugal's New Army Chief
description: LISBON, Nov. 30  Gen. Antonio Ramalho Eanes, Portugal's new army chief of staff, believes that the army's place is in the barracks and not in politics. General Ramalho Eanes brought about the defeat of last week's leftist military rebellion. In a victory ceremony yesterday, he said that it was relatively easy to command the loyalist troops because they were commanded by officers with military ethics who are not mortgaged to political groups and not committed to sectarianism.

title: Audit of Army Errors Indicates Subsidy of Arms Sales Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI) Auditors looking into a series of bookkeeping errors have discovered that the Army, may have violated Federal law by spending American tax dollars to make progress payments on arms sales to foreign countries.

title: Bruce Quits NATO Post In Anger, Magazine Says
description: David K. E. Bruce has submitted his resignation as United States representative at the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. according to Newsweek magazine.

title: MAYORS PROPOSE DEMOCRATS SEEK MORE URBAN AID
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 30Democratic mayors attending the annual meeting of the National League of Cities here today adopted an urban policy that they will urge as a plank in the Democratic Party platform next year.

title: China Says Oil Facilities Built at Numerous Ports
description: China has recently built a number of new petroleum loading terminals and other deepwater wharves in its coastal ports, the New China News Agency reported yesterday in Hong Kong.

title: Deaths
description: AHLGRENCarl E., November 29, 1975. Beloved husband of the late Belly Maria. Dear father of Erna Barseghisn and Herbert. Grandfather of Mark and Rene, Barseghlan, and Erik Ablates. Reposing at Welter B. Cooke Funeral Home, 3 Ave. and 85 St. Services Tuesday, P.M.

title: New Zealand Victor Bids Government Units Report
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Nov. 30 (Reuters)  Prime Ministerelect Robert D. Muldoon, fresh from his sweeping general election triumph, will seek immediate reports from Government departments on their operations as he prepares to assume the leadership of New Zealand.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: Ten thousand municipal and state workers have joined the New Jersey Blue Cross and Blue Shield maintenance plan, marking the first time that public employees in the state have participated in the program, which stresses preventive care before ailments become advanced.

title: Advertising
description: Reaching national distribution is a slow process in the spirits category, according to William V. Elliott, vice presidentmarketing of the Heublein Spirits Group.

title: Girl, 16, Wins Walking Race
description: Eileen Smith, a 16yearold highschool junior from Seaford, L.I., defeated 54 male rivals and won the 65th annual Walker Club of America 10mile handicap walking race yesterday on the Coney Island boardwalk.

title: Walter Twardowski Dies; Owned Travel Agency Here
description: Walter Twardowski, the owner and manager of a travel agency on the Lower East Side for more than 60 years, died Saturday in the Riverview Manor Nursing Home in Owego, N.Y. He was 84 years old and had lived in an apartment above his agency, at 18 St. Marks Place, for 50 years.

title: MAYORS PROPOSE DEMOCRATS SEEK MORE URBAN AID
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 30Democratic mayors attending the annual meeting of the National League of Cities here today adopted an urban policy that They will urge as a plank in the Democratic Party platform next Year.

title: KEITH M. LANGE
description: Keith M. Lange, president of the Institute for Business Planning Inc., a subsidiary of PrenticeHall Inc., financial publishers, died of cancer Friday in Doctors Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived at 390 Pulis Avenue, Wyckoff, N.J.

title: Yanks Get Windfall As City Shifts Plans
description: New York City has quietly dropped its plan to buy and raze rundown businesses abutting Yankee Stadium and is using part of the savings, $300,000, to buy equipment for the Yankees' baseball team.

title: Quotations According to Woody Allen.
description: At 40, Mr. Allen commented on some favorite subjects, including love and death.

title: HIGHER RAIL FARES IN EFFECT IN STATE
description: New Jersey's 70,000 daily rail commuters began paying more for their rides today as the State Supreme Court and State Legislature prepared to discuss the controversial fare schedules.

title: N.F.L. Scoring and Statistics
description: INDIVIDUAL STATISTICS

title: Brown Beats Cornell, 30, Gains Soccer Semifinals
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Nov. 30Marc Griffith and Tom Walsh scored goals early in the first half and led Brown to a 30 victory over Cornell in a National Collegiate Athletic Association quarterfinal soccer game. The victory advanced Brown to the semifinals at Southern IllinoisEdwardsville, scheduled next Saturday against San Francisco.

title: Finns Form Cabinet to Include Communists, Out for 4 Years
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 30 (AP)Finnish politicians agreed today on a fiveparty national emergencycoalition government that includes Communists for the second time since World War II.

title: Barbage Strike Begins as Laundry Talks Go On
description: Removers of refuse for cornmercial establishments went on strike at 12:01 A.M. today following a breakdown of negotiations on a new contract, according to Vincent D. Mc Donnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board.

title: Lincoln Center Ready To Televise Its Events
description: Two years of research and experimentation at Lincoln Center with the techniques needed to bring live performances of opera, ballet, concerts and plays to television audiences around the country have now been completed.

title: COAST GUARD DENIES WIFE'S PLEA FOR AID
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 30 (UPI)  Representative Charles A. Vanik, Democrat of Ohio, has been asked to intervene for Roberta Pace of Cleveland, who says the Coast Guard refuses to transfer her husband, James, to Cleveland, although she is suffering from a disabling pregnancy.

title: For Conrail, Model Railroad Is Computer
description: PHILADELPHIA  Hugh Stewart was operating the world's largest model railroad recently when the train suddenly disappeared.

title: Graham Hill, 46, Retired Racer, In Fatal Crash Piloting His Plane
description: LONDON, Nov. 30 (UPI)The auto racing world mourned today the death of Graham Hill, twice the world ??rivers' champion and five members of his racing team.

title: ... and Tax Inequities
description: The new taxeswhich were necessarily adopted in hasteand all other taxes should be carefully reexamined and revised, where appropriate, in order to maximize equity and minimize economic impact. These goals admittedly are not easy to achieve, nor are they always compatible. Nevertheless, glaring inequities the new city tax package demand attention.

title: Along Fifth Ave., The Signs Have An Italian Accent
description: Ginori, Gucci, Valentino, Ferragamo, Buccellati, Bulgari.Rome's Via Condotti? No, it's Fifth Avenue, New York. The 10block stretch between 51st and 61st Streets currently houses 11 Italian shops, or an even dozen if the Alitalia office is counted.

title: U.S. FirstClass Letters Go to South Vietnam Again
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Air and surface firstclass, letter mail service has been resumed to South Vietnam, the United States Postal Service reported today.

title: Picking Hot Gifts for Holiday
description: A rock for a pet, gloves that massage while you drive a peanutbuttermaking machine? Or warmup suits, women's furlined coats, embroidered sweaters, long dresses? Or stereo headsets, Elton John's latest records or graphite racquets for indoor tennis?

title: Pope Urges the Lebanese To End Fratricidal Conflict
description: ROME, Nov. 30 (UPIPope Paul VI appealed to Christians and Moslems in Lebanon today to seize every chance to end their conflict.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Mental hospitals in the state are not adequately meeting the needs of their patients and neither the Legislature nor the public can continue to ignore intolerable conditions in the institutions, according to a legislative report. The report, prepared for submission to the Legislature this week by a SenateAssembly joint subcommittee following two years of hearings and tours of state mental hospitals, observed: The size of the hospitals, the depressing physical settings and shortage of trained treatment personnel can result in the provision of little more than custodial care for some patients.

title: Levitt to Determine Size of State Budget Deficit for Special Legislative Session
description: A nonpartisan determination of the size of the state budget gap will be the first step, in Governor Carey's plan to sell a package of taxes and spending cuts to the special session of the Legislature, which reconvenes Wednesday in Albany, according to aides to the Governor.

title: Music: Symphony of the New World
description: The Symphony of the New World had two guest soloists, two choruses and two major bits of exotica on its program yesterday afternoon in Carnegie Hall, but for this listener the most enjoyable moments of the concert came with two incontestable warhorses.

title: BIG BOARD UNEASY ON NEW MEMBERS
description: Although foreigndominated brokerage houses are eligible to join the New York Stock Exchange under a Federal law that becomes effective today. the exchange's chairman has expressed opposition to their admission at this time because he fears a loss of income to present members.

title: Concert: Conductorless
description: If all orchestras were to follow the example of the Orpheus Chamber Ensemble, conductors would become extinct. Orpheus plays without one, and in a Mozart concert Saturday night at Tully Hall, did a beautiful job of it.

title: Pittsburgh Teachers Spurn Pact and Vote Strike Today
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 30 (UPI) Public school teachers have rejected an 11thhour contract offer and voted to strike the city's 62,000student school system tomorrow morning.

title: EDITH A. RICHHEIMER
description: Edith Aarons Richheimer, wife of Dr. Leonard Richheimer, a physician, and a trustee and past president of the sisterhood of Temple Beth Sholom in Flushing. Queens, died yesterday in Long Island Jewish Hospital, New Hyde Park. She was 59 years old and lived at 3569 166th Street, Flushing.

title: Wallace Guide a Rightist Writer
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Hilair du Bernier, an American expatriate journalist based in Monte Carlo, who guided and advised Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama on his trip through Europe last month, denies formal membership in the farrightwing John Birch Society. But he is the weekly overseas correspondent for the Birch Society's review of the news, and his dispatches presumably reflect the kind of counsel he was giving Mr. Wallace. Mr. du Berrier's persistent theme is the progress of Communist propaganda aid covert activity in the Western democracies. In September he reported that Vice President Rockefeller, Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger and Attorney General Edward H. Levi had all been working overtime to suppress knowledge of the influx into the West of a much higher caliber of K.G.B. agents, referring to Soviet spies. Call it dtente, Mr. du Bernier remarked, ortreason

title: Official Declares U.A.W. Is Reviewing Busing Stand
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30 (UPI) A United Autombile Workers union official says the union is reassessing its support of busing to achieve school desegregation because many of its top members consider it a losing issue politically.

title: CalBerkeley Victor
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 30 (UPI)California at Berkeley won the National Collegiate water polo championship last night, beating California at Irvine, 98.

title: Israelis Quit Abu Rudeis Oilfield; Egypt Will Take Control Today
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 30Israel, complying with the interim agreement with Egypt concluded in September, evacuated the Abu Rudeis oilfield on the shore of the Gulf of Suez today.

title: 'Skins Send Vikings To First Loss, 3130
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Never run a countdown on the Redskins. The Washington team beat the Minnesota Vikings, 3130, today when Bill Kilmer completed a 15yard touchdown pass to Frank Grant with 40 seconds left and Mark Moseley kicked the point after touchdown.

title: Taxing Requirements . . .
description: Last Wednesday, just one day after the State Legislature enacted $200 million in new taxes for New York City and one week before the Legislature is expected to begin action on higher state taxes, the Commerce Clearing House reconfirmed New York's undisputed leadership as the nation's most heavily taxed state.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Open Cut in Mountain for Road Opposed
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  I've tried to visualize a cut through the mountain, said George Coggins, standing on the terrace of his home on the slope of Beaucatcher Mountain and gesturing toward the point where the state plans to cut a swath through the mountains to build a new highway.

title: A FourParty System
description: WASHINGTONNext fall, voters may be choosing a President from one of four parties: Democrats, Republicans, the unpopulist party of George Wallace and the leftist protest party of Gene McCarthy.

title: U.S. to Aid Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 30 (Reuters)The United States Will give Jordan $27 million under an agreement signed here today. The amount is part of the annual $55 million in financial aid to the treasury to help balance Jordan budget.

title: AvantGarde Piano Recital by Rzewski
description: One has to give Frederic Rzewski grudging credit for putting together an unusual program for his pano recital Saturday night at the Kitchen. But the credit must remain grodging because nearly all of the music sounded overextended and pretentious.

title: Rangers Overcome Blues 52
description: Spurred on by two former St. Louis players, the Rangers took out their frustration on the visiting Blues last night at Madison Square Garden, winning by 52.

title: Dahomey Announces Its Name Will Be Benin
description: COTONOU, Dahomey, Nov. 30 (Reuters)  The West African country of Dahomey has changed its name to the People's Republic of Benin, President Mathieu Kerekou announced here today.

title: Battery Park City In Poll Finds 8,500 Are Still Interested
description: About 8,500 families and individuals have reaffirmed their interest in living in Battery Park City, the 100acre landfill project being built on the Hudson River, according to a survey the project conducted and released yesterday.

title: Ford Is Assailed for Vetoing Bill To Pay City to Protect Diplomats
description: Mayor Beame and Representative Bella S. Abzug, the West Side Democrat, criticized President Ford yesterday for vetoing a bill that would have provided Federal compensation to New York City for the protection it affords foreign diplomats and United Nations missions.

title: U. S. Study Says Illegal Aliens Create $16 Billion Tax Burden
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPI) The Immigration and Naturalization Service estimated today that 8.2 million illegal aliens in this country were creating a $16 billion tax burden each year.

title: Referee Disqualifies Ashe and Nastase
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 30Arthur Ashe decided he had had enough of Ilie Nastase's clowning a moment too soon tonight and his rash action led to the first double disqualification in modern major tennis.

title: Saul Is Elected Chairman Of the INA Corporation
description: Ralph S. Saul has been elected chairman of the INA Corporation succeeding John T. Gurash who retired from this position in accordance with the retirement program but continues as chairman of the executive committee.

title: Joseph V. Jack. Shot Down 5 Planes in World War II
description: Joseph V. Jack, a World War II aviator with the Royal Canadian Air Force and the United States Army Air Forces, who shot down five enemy planes, died last Monday in Point Pleasant (N.J.) Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived in Spring Lake. N. J.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: To judge from the volume of correspondence received on the subject, it would seem that potato pancakes are as dear as cheesecake to the New Youk appetite. Susan Renoir of Manhattan is a champion of her own version and writes as follows:

title: Open Cut in Mountain for Road Opposed
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  I've tried to visualize a cut through the mountain, said George Coggins, standing on the terrace of his home on the slope of Beaucatcher Mountain and gesturing toward the point where the state plans to cut a swath through the mountains to build a new highway.

title: 2 Die in Korean Gas Blast
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 1 (Reuters)At least two persons choked to death and scores were poisoned when a tank containing ammonium gas exploded today at a factory in Pusan, in southeastern Korea, reports reaching here said. Many of those poisoned were in serious condition.

title: Incurably Ill Widow Wants Right, at 75, To Have Life Ended
description: DEDHAM, Mass., Nov. 20 (AP)A Dedham widow, ill without a chance or, cure, says she wants the right to dieif not for herself then for others.

title: Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 30The country's topranked women's team qualified for the Reisinger team championship finals here in the early hours of this morning and thereby resolved a difficult problem for the American Contract Bridge League and the World Bridge Federation. The team includes Dorothy Hayden Truscott, Gail Moss, Jacqui Mitchell, all of New York; Emma Jean Hawes, Fort Worth, Marilyn Johnson, Houston, and Mary Jane Farell, Los Angeles.

title: Frazier's 36 Not Enough; Knicks Bow
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 30Walt Frazier tried to make up for the absence of the injured Earl Monroe tonight wish a 36point performance, but the missing ingredient for the Knicks was again defense and they Kansas City Kings scored a 11098 National Basketball Association victory.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HELLO, YOUNG LOVERS One of America's bestknown and bestloved short stories, O. Henry's Gift of the Magi, becomes a stage musical tonight at 7:30 o'clock at the Players Theater, 115 MacDougal Street (at Minetta Lane) in Greenwich Village. The Christmas tale of a threadbare young couple whose selfless love leads to a touching surprise comes to Off Off Broadway with music after several previous versions. There was the 1952 ballet (with Nora Kaye and John Kriza), the movie (Jeanne Crain and Farley Granger in O. Henry's Full House), television (Sally Ann Howes and Gordon McRae) and a drama staged uptown at St. Peter's Church three years ago.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 1, 1975

title: 76ers Defeat Jazz, 113 to 96
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 30 (UPI)Steve Mix, a reserve forward, got 12 points in the second quarter to spark a Philadelphia 76er rally and a 11396 victory over the New Orleans Jazz tonight in the National Basketball Association.

title: Yanks Get Windfall As City Shifts Plans
description: New York City has quietly dropped its plan to buy and raze rundown businesses abutting Yankee Stadium and is using part of the savings, $300,000, to buy equipment for the Yankees' baseball team.

title: Dr. Charles Goldman Dies; Avon Microbiologist Was 46
description: Dr. Charles L. Goldman, manager of the microbiology department of Avon Products Inc., died Wednesday of a heart ailment in Good Samaritan Hospital, Suffern, N. Y. He was 46 years old and lived at 10 Canterbury Lane, Suffern.

title: Hoover Honor Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Representative Gilbert Gude, Republican of Maryland, says he will introduce legislation to remove the memorial designation of the new F.B.I. headquarters as the J. Edgar Hoover Building. The building should not become a permanent reminder of actions taken in bad faith, Mr. Gude said yesterday.

title: Raiders Tap Falcons, 3734, in Overtime on Blanda Kick, Clinch A.F.C. West Title
description: George Blanda, the 48yearold placekicking marvel, may not get money for working overtime, but the quality of his work remains high.

title: 2 Utah Mick Hunters Saved
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 30 (AP)Searchers rescued today two duck hunters who had spent two stormy nights on a boat at the edge of Great Salt Lake. One of the hunters, George Markovich, 34 years old, said that a black plastic sheet used to signal a rescue helicopter had sheltered him and his companion, Clifford Leak, from the cold. Their boat ran out of gasoline.

title: Lag Seen in Reducing Relief Ineligibles
description: The city's Human Resources Administrator said yesterday that New York State would not be able to meet the Dec. 31 Federal deadline for the reduction of welfare ineligibles to 3 percent.

title: 1,200 Raise Issue of Ordination of Catholic Women
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30With a few plans for strategy and clarion calls for struggle, 1,200 people from throughout the country, most of them nuns, ended today a meeting on the ordination of women to the Roman Catholic priesthood.

title: NO RISE EXPECTED IN TRANSIT FARES
description: The New Year is not expected to bring an increase in the city's 50cent bus and subway fare, according to Transit Authority officials.

title: 6 Carey Panels Give Recommendations On Medicaid, Welfare and Aid to Aged
description: The principal recommendations by six of the 19 task forces appointed by Governor Carey a year ago while he public yesterday, with his office's consent, by the Community Council of Greater New York. This was preliminary to a new look at them in the light of current fiscal crises.

title: D. Howard Biggs, 71, Dies; Invented Lighting Devices
description: O. Howard Biggs, who retired in 1969 as vice president for research and engineering of the GTE Sylvania Lighting Products Group and had patented 29 inventions in lighting, died yesterday in Beverly, Mass., where he lived. He was 71 years old.

title: Judith Blegen Heady Soprano, Sings
description: Hearing a Judith Blegen song recital at this stage of her career is something akin to sampling a potentially great bottle of wine a few years before it has reached its peak. The young Metropolitan Opera soprano is already delicious in the sort of lighthearted works that made up most of her program at Alice Tully Hall yesterday afternoon. She also sings darker music with the same purity of tone, the same intelligence, musicianship and care, though only maturitywhich is not a synonym for old agecan bring a singer into contact with the cool resignation of, say, Schubert's Der Jungling and der Tod.

title: French Party Picks Chief
description: LYONS, France, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Gabriel Peronnet, Secretary of State for the Civil Service, today was elected president, of hte Radical Party, defeating, Franoise Giroud, Secretary of State for Women's Affairs. The small party aligns itself with conservative and centrist groups.

title: U.N. GOLAN FORCE RENEWED AGAIN; P.L.O. ROLE BACKED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 30The Security Council, in a compromise agreement, tonight extended the mandate of the international peacekeeping force on the Golan Heights for six months and paved the way for participation by the Palestine Liberation Organization, in talks on the overall Middle East situation to be held here in January.

title: Restoring Faith
description: The interest in and the skepticism about the conclusions reached by the Warren Commission investigating President Kennedy's assassination are greater now than at any time since the report was first released. Even David W. Belin, a former commission lawyer and a staunch defender of its work, now urges that the inquiry be reopened.

title: Dance: Beatty's Ghetto
description: One of the first important black choreographers was Talley Beatty, who still remains one of the finest. His ballet about ghetto life and death the other side of the railroad tracks, The Road of the Phoebe Snow. was created in 1959, and since then it has made its way in a number of repertories, but it is undoubtedly the version by the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater that has won it its widest currency.

title: IRANIAN GAS DEAL TO SUPPLY EUROPE
description: TEHERAN, Nov. 30  After two years of negotiations, Iran, gave its final agreement today to build a 1,000mile natural gas pipeline to the Soviet Union and to provide more than $400 million worth of gas a year to Europe.

title: Dull Giants Beaten By Cowboys, 143
description: IRVING, Tex., Nov. 30 Craig Morton, playing in the Dallas area for the first time since he ended a 10year tenure with the Cowboys, had promised a more wideopen, explosive game against his old team than the Giants displayed in their first meeting with the Cowboys this year.

title: Condominium Prices Cut in Florida But Slump in Sales Shows No LetUp
description: MIAMI, Nov. 30The glutted Florida condominium market, probably the hardest hit segment of the nation's depressed housing industry and a bellwether in Floridas sagging economy, is entering its second winter of discontent with few signs of any significant pickup in sales.

title: A HEARST ATTORNEY BARS INSANITY PLEA
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 30 (UPI)  Patricia Hearst's attorneys announced today that they would not use an insanity defense in her trial on armed bank robbery charges.

title: ExOperative Charges F.B.I. Failed to Bar Klan Violence
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 30 (UPI)  A former undercover operative for the Federal Bureau of Investigation said the F.B.I. had advance knowledge, but took no action, to prevent Ku Klux Klan violence in the South during the 1960's, The Los Angeles Times reported today.

title: Jets Lose 8th Straight Time, 207
description: There remains, somewhere, compassion for New York.For the rules remain unchanged in the National Football, League and that meant the Jets only had to play four quarters yesterday against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

title: Lakers 116, Blazers 109
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 30 (AP)With 22point performances by Kareem AbdulJabber and Gail Goodrich, the Los Angeles Lakers posted a 116109 triumph over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight.

title: Tigers Or jellyfish?
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30Suppose that during the Senate Watergate investigation President Nixon had directed Government officials not to appear as witnesses in public session. Would the Senate committee meekly have dropped its plans to question H. R. Haldeman and the others in open hearings? Would the press have let this pass without a murmur?

title: Trial to Rule on OpenBeaches Question
description: FREEHOLD, Nov. 30A trial that is expected to indicate how strongly the New Jersey Supreme Court will enforce its openbeaches policy is scheduled to begin here Wednesday before Superior Court Judge Merritt Lane Jr.

title: Rehumanizing Medicine
description: The health of the people should surely be our number one priority, yet we show little interest in this. Preventive medicine, after years of struggle to stay alive, remains the Cinderella of the medical specialties. Such free medical services as are available are sparingly used. Doctors, on the whole: are uninterested in health since their training is focused virtually entirely on disease, and there is very little profit in health.

title: 3 Killings in Jersey Stir a Wave of Fear
description: HAWORTH, N. J.  Geese waddle along the edge of they pond here across from the local police station, the wind ripples the water's surface, and the trees stand silhouetted against the gray winter sky. But few residents of this northern Bergen County community linger to absorb the beauty of the scene.

title: Soares Sees Failure of Lisbon Revolt As Major Defeat for the Communists
description: LISBON, Nov. 30  The failure of last week's rebellion is a major defeat for Alvaro Cunhal and the Communist Party's hard line, which aimed to repeat the 1917 Bolshevik Revolution in Portugal, Mrio Soares, leader of the Socialists, the country's largest party, declared today.

title: Rikers Island Guard Is Stabbed By Two Men Outside His Home
description: A Rikers Island correction officer who was on duty a?? the House of Detention for Men during the rioting last week was stabbed repeatedly outside his home in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn early Saturday by two men who he said had attacked him because of his position at the prison.

title: Synagogues on Wheels Carry Hanukkah Rites to City Streets
description: A cavalcade of 18 Lubavitch SynagoguesonWheels took up positions in the city's, five boroughs yesterday and when night fell young rabbinic students kindled the third menorah candle atop ach mobile unit, in observance of Hanukkah.

title: Museum's Treasures Tell Navy Story
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30One hundred yards away from where the Presidential yacht Sequoia is berthed on the Anacostia River here stands an old gun factory, its roof punctured by thin submarine periscopes, and now home port of some of the ocean's most sparkling and curious gems.

title: AUXILIARY OFFICER HELD IN BURGLARY
description: A 20yearold auxiliary policeman was charged last night with burglarizing the S. H. Kreis & Co. variety store at 1915 Third Avenue after four police officers found hilt hiding by an elevator.

title: Jersey's Railroad Commuters Charged Higher Fares Today
description: New Jersey's 70,000 daily rail commuters began paying more for their rides today as the State Supreme Court and State Legislature prepared to discuss the controversial fare schedules.

title: Damaged Cruiser in Port
description: NAPLES, Italy, Nov. 30 (UPI) the United States guidedmissile cruiser Belknap, crippled in a collision with the American aircraft carrier John F. Kennedy eight days ago, arrived under tow today at Gaeta, the home port of the Sixth Fleet, northwest of Naples. Navy officials said the 8,000ton warship would be examined to see whether it could be towed to Norfolk, Va., for fullscale repairs. Seven seamen died, six of them from the Belknap, in the collision.

title: Personal Finance: Gold's Tax Impact
description: Tax switching, or swapping, has long been popular among owners of stocks and bonds who want to establish paper losses to reduce income tax liability. This year something new has been added as a result of the end on Dec. 31, 1974, of the ban on individual ownership of gold.

title: MORRIS FLEISHMAN
description: Morris Fleishman, former resident of the City Council of ??ong Beach, L.I., and founder ??f Fleishman Motors Inc. there, ??ied Friday at the Long Beach Memorial Hospital, of which he ??as vice president. He was 75 ??ears old.

title: Helene Coles Wed to Sidney Stein
description: Helene Peggy Coles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome S. Coles of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Sidney Harold Stein, son of Dr. and Mrs. Philip Stein of Teaneck. N.J.

title: Football Coach Quits
description: PULLMAN, Wash., Nov. 30 (AP)Jim Sweeney, football coach at Washington State since 1968, resigned today, saying his record was not as good as he would have liked.

title: BondPrice Rise Awaited On Drop in Money Supply
description: Prices should improve today in the credit markets because of the substantial drop in the nation's money supply reported late Friday by the Federal Reserve, Wall Street analysts predict. The decline of $1.5 billion in the money supply came as a pleasant surprise to market observers because it reversed the trend of the two previous weeks when the total of checking accounts and cash in the hands of the public rose by $5.5 billionan increase unequaled in modern times.

title: Bruins Set Back Penguins
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (UPI)Wayne Cashman of Boston tapped a rebound by Jean Ratelle past Pittsburgh's Michel Plasse with 6 minutes 57 seconds to play tonight, giving the Bruins a 42 victory that extended their National Hockey League unbeaten streak to 11 games.

title: TEAR GAS DISPERSES BUSING PROTESTERS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 30 (UPI)  Jefferson County policemen used tear gas and arrested one of about 100 antibusing protesters last night when the group failed to disperse near suburban Fairdale after being ordered to do so.

title: Rights Group Says U.S. Broke Mandate In Mariana Islands
description: A complaint to the United Nations charging that the United States was violating its strategic trusteeship for Micronesia by seeking to annex the Northern Mariana Islands area was announced yesterday by the International League for the Rights of Man.

title: Prices to Rise in Hungary
description: BUDAPEST, Nov. 30 (Reuers)Hungary announced price Increases today on a wide range of consumer goods and services, with the price of sugar going up 50 percent immediately and meat 3 percent next July. The increases, approved at a Cabinet meeting yesterday, had generally been expected. A meeting of the Communist Party central committee last week decided hat realistic prices, reflecting costs at home and abroad, would be a fundamental requirement over the next five years.

title: With Double Primary Likely, Will They Vote in September as They Do in April?
description: The word among key Democrats and Republicans in Albany is that the scheduled double primary next yeara nationalconvention delenate and partyoffice primazy in April and Senatorial and other public office primary in Septemberwill stay as is. Governor Carey's inclusion of a singleprimary bill on the agenda of this week's special session of the Legislature was described as eyewash by top leaders of both parties, more as a matter of political tactics than any personal conviction.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Everything You Wanted to Know About Woody Allen at 40
description: The United Nations at 30, the International Ladies' Garment Workers Union and the Philadelphia Orchestra at 75, the United States Marines at 200, Michelangelo at 500all these were major birthdays celebrated this year, but none perhaps has the hum of history, the symphonic reverberations of Woody Allen at 40. Today, Mr. Allen, the diminutive comedian, film director, creator of Love and Death, actor, magazine writer, bestselling author, playwright, jazz clarinetist, sports buff and selfproclaimed sex maniac, begins his middle age.

title: Second Quadruplet Dies
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 30 (UPI)The second of a set of quadruplets born two months prematurely Nov. 11 died today in the Riley Children's Hospital at the Indiana University Medical Center. A hospital spokesman said that Christopher Carl Schneider died as a result of lung problems 17 days after his sister, Heidi Ann. The children were born to Mrs. Elvin Schneider of Goshen, Ind. She reportedly took fertility drugs.

title: Sales Are Halted
description: A restraining order has been issued in State Superior Court against a California company that distributes homesecurity systems in New Jersey.

title: Canadiens Top slanders
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 30Quashing their Gallic pride in a highscoring reputation, the Montreal Canadiens employed their new defensive style tonight to edge those masters of defense, the New York Islanders, 32.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Cuban  Americans demonstrated yesterday in Port Chester against an Episcopal minister's refusal to endorse a plan to erect a monument to Jos Mart, Cuban poet and independence figure. The police said about 50 demonstrators representing four Cuban organizations picketed St. Peter's Church to protest the Rev. Marco Mejia's opposition to their plan for a statue in a public park naming Mart the martyr of LatinAmerican independence.

title: '75 Hurricane Season Ends With Total of 6
description: MIAMI, Nov. 30 (AP)The 1975 hurricane season officially ended today after six hurricanes and two other storms moved destructively through the Atlantic, the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Submarine Overhaul Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The Navy has announced that the Electric Boat Division of General Dynamics in Groton, Conn., has won a $48 million contract to overhaul a nuclear submarine. Some 10,000 workers at the plant are to return tomorrow, bringing to an end a strike that began July 1. Last Wednesday members of the striking Metal Trades Council voted to approve a new threeyear contract.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary, weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at Which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: FOUR NOMINATED FOR STATE JUSTICE
description: Governor Carey's judicial screening committee has sent him the names of four nominees for the two vacancies on the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court, First Department.

title: 2 Girls Contest in Court Mother's Religious Curbs
description: TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 30 (AP)Two sisters, aged 12 and 16, have gone to court seeking freedom from their mother's religion, but a judge has ordered one back home, told the mother to reduce restrictions on the girl and sent the other girl to a foster home for a 30day coolingoff period.

title: HEADS OF 2 KOREAS DEBATE IN PRESS
description: TOKYO, Nov. 30A leading Japanese newspaper has accomplished a journalistic coup by obtaining backtoback interviews with two bitter Korean rivals, President Park Chung Hee of South Korea and President Kim II Sung of North Korea.

title: U.N. GOLAN FORCE RENEWED AGAIN; P.L.O. ROLE BACKED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 30The Security Council, in a compromise agreement, tonight extended the mandate of the international peacekeeping force on the Golan Heights for six months and paved the way for participation by the Palestine Liberation Organization in talks on the overall Middle East situation to be held here in January.

title: BELIZE CONFLICT EASED BY ACCORD
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 30Less than a month after open hostilities were threatened between Britain and Guatemala, the two Governments have agreed to resume negotiations on the future status of the disputed Central American colony of Belize.

title: ExCrewman Would Testify In Sinking of OreVessel
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30 (UPI)A seaman who says the captain of the ore freighter. Edmund Fitzgerald expressed fears over the vessel's seaworthiness two years ago is prepared testify at a Coast Guard hearing into the ship's sinking during Great Lakes storm.

title: German Who Fled the East Now Stings the Right With Posters
description: HEIDELBERG, West GermanyKlaus Staeck is a 37yearold lawyer, but the political art posters he makes have kept his law practice limited to his own defensein a score of suits that angry conservative politicians and businessmen, his targets, have filed against him.

title: Pedicab Folk Art Dying Out in Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 30The taxi, that essential of metropolitan civilization, is helping to signal the end of a unique Indonesian art form.

title: 3d Jailbreak Also Fails
description: SHREVEPORT, La., Nov. 30 (AP)A man accused of a $1 million jewel theft and two jail breaks escaped from the Shreveport City Jail today and eluded scores of officers for most of the day before being captured about a mile away. United States marshals, offduty city policemen, state troopers and a helicopter were called into the search for Edward Richard Jones, 32 years old, who was awaiting trial on federal firearms charges.

title: INDIA OPPOSITION ACTIVE BUT WEAK
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 30On a recent afternoon an opposition, member of the Indian Parliament unpacked a stack of brochures that denounced the Government's state of emergency as barbarous and clictatorial.

title: MRS. GANDHI ACTS TO TIGHTEN RULE
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 30Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, further consolidating her power in the Indian Government, today made some changes in the federal Cabinet and imposed federal rule in her home state, Uttar Pradesh.

title: American Museum's New President Is a Man Nuts for Fossils
description: I feel like the little boy who's been given the key to the candy store, said Robert G. Goelet, upon assuming the role of president of the American Museum of Natural History this week.

title: PLANS FOR CITY U. MANY AND VARIED
description: The Board of Higher Education, trying to deal with the City University's budget crisis, is confronted with a variety of proposals and counterproposals that seem to agree on only one point: that the university is about to undergo fundamental and permanent change in the way it operates.

title: NEWSPAPER UNION VOTES DOWN PACT
description: Members of the mailers union at The New York Times and The Daily, News yesterday rejected a proposed threeyear contract that their Union and both newspapers had agreed to on Nov. 11.

title: Mona Rothbaum Bride Of Ian Rieger in Jersey
description: Mona Rothbaum, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Rothbaum of Pennsauken, N.J., was married yesterday to Ian Mitchell Rieger, son of. Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Rieger of Newburgh, N.Y. The ceremony was performed in Temple Sons of Israel in. Cherry Hill, N.J., by Rabbis Fred Neulander and Bernard Rothman.

title: Many Midwest Areas Near Levels of Prosperity in '73
description: LINCOLN, Neb.Ask residents here how seriously the recession has affected them and most will answer, What recession?

title: NOW Leader Is Saddened Woman Wasn't Put on Court
description: ALBANY, Nov. 30 (AP)Karen DeCrow, president of the National Organization for. Women, has expressed disappointment with President Ford's selection of Judge John Paul Stevens to the Supreme Court seat vacated two weeks ago by Justice William O. Douglas.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Environmental Detente
description: The consequences of one of the least noted aspects of former President Nixon's visit to Moscow three years ago are beginning to emergewith credit to both the United States and the Soviet Union. The Joint Committee on Cooperation in the Field of Environmental Protection, which was formed on that occasion, recently held its fourth annual session; and because its planning has been modest rather than grandiose, its contributions may be seen as real rather than rhetorical.

title: Schlesinger and Kissinger
description: ZURICHI shall never forget, when President Kennedy was assassinated, the pain we felt for America and the bewilderment and disillusionment experienced by the many former soldiers in World War II and former inmates in Soviet camps and prisons.

title: Brooklyn College Receives Trophy
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 30The Brooklyn College football team, which defeated InterAmerican, 5012, last night in the first appearance here by a North American college football team, received some mementos of the triumph today.

title: Fire Halts Boston Subway
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30 (AP)  A fire in a subway train near the Aquarium station knocked out the Blue Line to East Boston for about two hours this afternoon, the police reported. A spokesman said all passengers were evacuated safely.

title: Woman Shot as 3 Men Try to Hold Up Her Store
description: A 55yearold woman was shot in the stomach while defending her Bronx grocery store from three armed holdup men last night, according to the police, who said one of the men opened fire when he saw the woman approach them with .38caliber revolver.

title: Memorable Moments in the Playpen
description: The powers, principalities, archangels and angels of the baseball hierarchy assemble in Hollywood, Fla., next weekend in a state of quivering anticipation unusual at these conclaves. As a rule the conventioneers approach such gatherings coolly, knowing from experience that there is nothing in store more exciting than a discussion of the spitball rule, a few player trades and a lot of drinks.

title: Tourism, Commercialization and Rosy Perspective on Bicentennial Stirring Antagonism
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30Early last spring, here in the City of Brotherly Love, a service station owner placed a sign in his window informing an ever increasing number of Bicentennial tourists that if they expected information or directions from him, it would cost them a quarter.

title: Brother of Man Police Killed Is Held in Carolina Sniping
description: FLORENCE, S. C. Nov. 30 (AP)The brother of a black tan killed by a white policeman was arrested yesterday after sniper fire on city streets hit four cars and injured three persons with flying glass. The death last month of the arrested man's brother touched off two ??ights of racial violence here.

title: The Chargers Are 011, Going on 014
description: As bad as the Jets and the Giants are, it could be worse. In fact, in San Diego, it is worse. Now that the Minnesota Vikings have lost, the San Diego Chargers are the only National Football League team with an opportunity for a perfect season.

title: Lisbon Suburbanites Tell of Yearning for Discipline
description: LISBON, Dec. 1 What we need now is some calm and discipline, Eduardo Moreira insisted today as he discussed last week's abortive military rebellion with visitors in his hillside home in the Lisbon suburb of So Mateus.

title: P.L.O. is Pleased
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 1The Palestine Liberation Organization today hailed last night's Security Council decision on the Middle East as a triumph for the Palestinian cause over the schemes of the United States and Israel.

title: Kentucky Beaten in Upset, 8977
description: EVANSTON, III., Dec. 1 (AP)  Billy McKinney, a junior guard, scored 31 points as Northwestern upset seventhranked Kentucky, 89 77, tonight.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on Pennsylvania politics that appeared in The New York Times last Wednesday, it was reported that no Republican rival of Senator Hugh Scott had alluded to disclosures that Senator Scott had received an annual payment of $10,000 from the Gulf Oil Corporation. One of the aspirants for Senator Scott's seat, George R. Packard, criticized the payment in a news release on Nov. 16.

title: High Court Backs Rezoning in State For HighDensity Housing for Elderly
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Supreme Court cleared the way today for communities in New York State to amend their zoning regulations to permit multipleunit highdensity housing for the elderly, even in areas previously restricted to singlefamily houses on plots of an acre or more.

title: Ernesto Maserati, Auto Maker, Racer, Industrialist, Dies at 77
description: BOLOGNA, Italy Dec. 1 (AP) Ernesto Maserati, the auto maker who built and raced cars in the 1920's and 30's before founding the luxury auto company that bears his name, died here today. He was 77 years old.

title: Colorado Sheriff Gets His Misplaced Man
description: Wearing cowboy boots and a Stetson, the ruddychecked, 6foot2inch sheriff of Kit Carson County, Coloradio, arrived in the Manhattan Criminal Courts building yesterday, on his first visit to New York, to pick up a prisoner who had waived extradition.

title: Refuse Piles Up in Strike Against Private Carters
description: Garbage and construction wasts daily began piling up In the city yesterday on the First day of a strike by 1,700 drivers and helpers against 450 private carting companies. The carters ordinarily collect up to 8,000 tons a day from hotels, restaurants and other commercial establishments.

title: Talking With the P.L.O.
description: A subtle shift is taking place in the focus of ArabIsraeli peacemaking efforts: The issue of the Palestinian Arabs' political future has finally been thrust into the middle of the diplomatic process.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 2, 1975

title: More Banks Cut Prime
description: A number of the nation's major commercial banks lowered their prime lending rates to the 7 percent level yesterday as participants in the credit markets marked time before the start of this week's new offerings. Among the banks that cut the rate charged bluechip business borrowers were the Chemical Bank, the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, the Ma rine Midland Bank, the Irving Trust Company, the United States Trust Company, the First National Bank of Chicago and, on the West Coast, the Security Pacific Bank and the Wells Fargo Bank. All of them had previously been charging 7 percent.

title: Syrian Praises Council for P.L.O. Step
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1Syria, opening another fullscale debate on the Middle East in the General Assembly, said today that the Security Council had made a historic affirmation last night by recognizing the right of the Palestine Liberation Organization to speak for the Palestinian people.

title: STATE'S REVENUES BELOW ESTIMATES
description: The State Tax Department reported yesterday that revenues in all major categories for the first eight months of the state's fiscal year were substantially below estimates made when the budget was adopted last March.

title: Review of Gas Ruling Refused by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) The Supreme Court declined today to hear arguments that the Federal Power Commission must grant natural gas pipeline customers a hearing before allowing their supplier to curtail deliveries.

title: HARRY MARGOSHES
description: Harry Margoshes, who was labor editor for many years of The Jewish Day, a Yiddishlanguage newspaper that ceased publication four years ago, died yesterday in Brooklyn Jewish Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived in Neshanic Station, N.J.

title: Bruce to Retire, but Denies He's Irked Over Colby
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 1David K. E. Bruce will leave his post as United States representative at the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and retire from the Foreign Service at the end of January, a spokesman announced in Brussels today.

title: Knight Sues N.C.A.A. On Squad Limit
description: Indiana's basketball coach, Bobby Knight, one of the few college coaches with more brass than Paul (Bear) Bryant, has brought suit against the National Collegiate Athletic Association asking an end to the 10player limit on teams when they travel.

title: Picatinny Arsenal Is Given a Reprieve
description: The Army has selected the Picatinny Arsenal at Dover, N.J., as the site for the new headquarters of its Armament Development Center, several members of the New Jersey Congressional delegation said yesterday.

title: Loch Ness Pictures Wilf Escape Scrutiny
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Dec. 1 (AP)The organizers of a symposium to study photographs said to prove the existence of the Loch Ness monster backed out of the project tonight. They said no useful or impartial discussion could be held at this time because of recent publicity.

title: Governor Orders a Study Of All M.T.A. Operations
description: Governor Carey yesterday directed State Transportation Commissioner Raymond T. Schuler to initiate a comprehensive management study of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's wideranging, deficitridden operations.

title: U.S. DENIES SHIFT ON PALESTINIANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The United States said today that it would participate in next month's United Nations Security Council debate on the Middle East along with the Palestine Liberation Organization but denied that this meant an end to the diplomatic boycott of the Palestinian group.

title: Christmas Tree Thieves Making Millions and Damaging Forests
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 1 (AP)Millions of dollars are being made and young forests throughout the West are being damaged in the increasingly lucrative racket of Christmas tree thefts, United States Forest Service officials say.

title: Advice for Customers Of Garbage Cartmen
description: Health Commissioner Dr. Lowell E. Bellin issued the following advice to those affected by the strike of private sanitation cartmen.

title: In Anna Sokolow's Dance, Her Beliefs
description: In the history of American modern dance, few have displayed social commitment as consistently as Anna Sokolow. From the 1930's, when she still danced with Martha Graham, but also created her anti  Fascist pieces, to the 1968 Tribute choreographed in memory of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to her recent lyrical essays on love and the unloved, Miss Sokolow has held high the banner that says dance must express experienced emotion.

title: Pronovost Makes Points Regularly
description: With Bobby Orr and Phil Esposito troubled with injuries, there's more room at the top for new faces in the National Hockey League scoring race. Though Esposito still has time to recover from two sprained ankles, Orr's fifth knee operation certainly will end his reign as the league's top pointgetter. Familiar names still dot the top 10Guy Lafleur, Bobby Clarke, Pete Mahovlich, Garry linger, Marcel Dionne, Gil Perreault and Steve Vickersbut three new ones have joined the elite list: Jean Pronovost, Denis Potvin and Bryan Trottier.

title: 3 Major Bills Face Ford With Political Risk in '76
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Congress returned to work today almost certain to complete action, in the two or three weeks left in this session, on three major pieces of legislation that seem bound to put President Ford on the spot politically.

title: Koracorp Plans. Defense Against Charges by S.E.C.
description: T. N. Taube, chairman of Koracorp Industries Inc., an apparel maker, said yesterday that the company would defend itself against charges by the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had violated Federal securities laws.

title: Anna Roosevelt Halsted, President's Daughter, Dies
description: Anna Roosevelt Halsted, the only daughter of President and Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt, died yesterday of cancer at Montefiore Hospital in the Bronx. She was 69 years old and the wife of Dr. James A. Halsted, clinical professor of medicine at Albany Medical College.

title: Bridge
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 1Four members of the 1976 American world championship team successfully defended their Reisinger team title at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals that ended here late last night.

title: Nebraska Court Upholds Press Curb
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Dec. 1The Sate Supreme Court upheld unanimously today a modified censorship of pretrial news overage of a murder case.

title: Some Concerns Threaten to Quit Italy; Recession, Labor Costs, Politics Cited
description: ROME, Dec. 1The Italian subsidiaries of several major companies have halted production and are threatening to close their plants permanently because of unprofitable operations. Still others have managed to sell off their investments in Italy.

title: Dibley Is Toppled
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Dec. 1 (UPI)Dominque Bedel, a French junior, scored an upset in the South Australian open tennis championship today when he defeated topseeded Colin Dibley of Australia, 76, 26, 64.

title: FUTURES PRICES OF SUGAR DECLINE
description: March world sugar contracts after testing the 13cent level yesterday, which chartists have been watching, fell below the level. At the close of trading on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, the quote for March ranged from 12.75 to 12.78 cents a pound, compared with 13.13 cents on Friday.

title: Driver Held in Refusal To Diaper His Horse
description: CHARLESTON, S.C. Dec. 1 (UPI)The police issued a traffic summons today to David Fuller, the driver of a horsedrawn carriage, who refused to comply with a new city ordinance requiring horses to wear diapers. The ordinance went into effect today, but Mr. Fuller vowed that he would be back on the street again with his diaperless horse and buggy.

title: ISRAEL WILL SHUN MIDEAST DEBATE IN U.N.'S COUNCIL
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 1 Ina special sixhour session, the Israeli Cabinet decided today to boycott next month's debate on the Middle East in the United Nations Security Council and approved in principle the establishment of new settlements on the occupied Golan Heights.

title: Justices Let Stand a Ban on Abortions At GovernmentAided Private Hospital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Supreme Court refused today to reviewand thug left in erred  a lowercourt ruling that permitted a private but Governmentfunded hospital to forbit a doctor to perform abortions there.

title: SOVIET DENOUNCES THE U.S. ON ANGOLA
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1  In the wake of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger's warnings against Soviet military involvement in the civil war in Angola, the Soviet Union has accused the United States of sending military men and weapons to the African country.

title: Stage: Gift of the Magi Is in Season
description: Remarkably enough it is December, and New York is beginning to need a little Christmas. (In fact we needed it last July, but who wants to be greedy?) And what could be more Christmassy, or more Hanukkahish than that old, dear O. Henry shortstory The Gift of the Magi.

title: Senate Panel Hearing Set On High Court Selection
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) The Senate Judiciary Committee today set Dec. 8 for the start of its hearings on the nomination of Judge John Paul Stevens to the Supreme Court.

title: Wounded Boy Called Dead; Respirator Is Turned Off
description: TULSA, Okla., Dec. 1 (UPI) Doctors and parents of a 6yearold boy agreed yesterday to turn off the respirator that kept him alive four days.

title: HEARST LAWYERS RESIST NEW RULE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 1Patricia Hearst's lawyers refused today to comply with new rule that requires an advance disclosure of their intention to present a mental defense, but at the same time said that they probably would offer one.

title: Probable Pairings In N.F.L. Playoffs
description: Three of the National Football League's six division races have been decided and the clinching teams, the Los Angeles Rams, Minnesota Vikings and Oakland Raiders, are all but certain to be the home teams when the playoffs begin on Dec. 27 and 28. The fourth Would appear to be the Pittsburgh Steelers. With three games in the regular season remaining for all the Super Bowl contenders, one must hedge but the probable playoff pairings are as follows.

title: MANDEL DECLARES CHARGES ARE UNTRUE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 1 (AP)Gov. Marvin Mandel said today that the charges outlined in the indictment returned against him were untrue and that there is evidence in the hands of the United States Attorney whereby he knows they are not true.

title: Legislature Again Balks At Approving New Taxes
description: TRENTON, Dec. 1The Democratic majorities in both houses today refused to approve any new taxes for a $58 million emergency supplemental budget appropriation requested by Governor Byrne.

title: Alternative Paper, the Target of a Unionizing Drive, Fears It Will Have No Choice but to Close
description: SAN FRANCISCOThe San Francisco Bay Guardian, considered by many to be one of the country's best alternative newspapers, is having its ups and downs these days, and it is quite possible that the downs may put it out of business.

title: CHINESE RESTRICTED ALONG FORD ROUTE
description: ??KING, Tuesday, Dec. 2??se security officials were working hard yesterday to insure that no sizable crowds would be on hand to watch or greet President Ford when he drove through the center of Peking after his arrival.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Dashiell Hammett, whose murder mysteries, The Thin Man and The Maltese Falcon are film classics, now will be the subject of a feature movie. Francis Ford Coppola, writer and director of The Godfather among other films, has acquired the rights to Hammett, a new novel by Joe Gores published by Putnam, which he will adapt and produce for his independent, San Franciscobased Cinema Seven company next year.

title: Rhodesia Agrees to New Talks On Rebel Demands for Control
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec 1 (Reuters)Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and the nationalist leader Joshua Nkomo signed an agreement today pledging to negotiate a settlement of the Rhodesian constitutional problem.

title: Army Tested Secret Civil Disturbance Plan at Wounded Knee, Memos Show
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1When about 250 militant Indians seized a trading post and a church in the village of Wounded Knee on the Pine Ridge Reservation in South Dakota, the United States Army gained an unexpected opportunity to test its contingency plan for handling civil disturbances.

title: Dylan Benefit Concert Sold Out in Half a Day
description: All 20,000 tickets for the Bob Dylan benefit concert at Madison Square Garden next Monday were sold out yesterday by 1 P.M., according to Garden officials.

title: Market Place
description: Frequently in these days of depressed stock values, corporations have been confronted with attempts by outsiders to buy control at share prices that appear to be below intrinsic worth.

title: The Stage: Tuscaloosa
description: The muggers are on the street, pollution and poverty are in the air and default is on the horizon, but Tuscaloosa's Calling Me...But I'm Not Going, a new musical revue that opened last night at the Top of the Gate, is filled with goodwill and optimism. The new Hank BeebeBill Heyer show is upbeat without being sentimental. The attitude is not ingenuous but pragmatic: Is Philadelphia really any better than New York?

title: Morton to Slav Giants' No. 1 Quarterback
description: Once upon a time, as in all fairy tales, the Giants had a chance to finish this season with a decent record, a .500 record, or maybe even a winning record if they could sneak in an upset along the way. That time, believe it or not, was only four weeks ago, although now it seems as remote as the days of Sleeping Beauty.

title: Gross Is Granted A 24Hour Delay On 2Year Sentence
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1Nelson G. Gross, former New Jersey Republican chairman, won a 24hour stay of a twoyear sentence he was to have begun serving today for violating the campaignfund law.

title: Man Accused in Reagan Incident Is Sent to Hospital
description: MIAMI, Dec. 1  Michael Lance Carvin, who allegedly threatened Ronald Reagan with a toy plastic revolver last month here, was ordered today to be confined to a psychiatric ward of a Fort Lauderdale hospital until his trial, possibly late in January.

title: TV: Sesame Street Takes Some New Directions
description: Dodging the slings and arrows of suspicion automatically attracted by success, public television's Sesame Street has raised about $5million for still another new season. The seventh season, which began yesterday, will add 130 hourlong, videotaped segments to the series designed for preschool children. The programs will be broadcast weekdays, usually in both mornings and afternoons, for 26 weeks.

title: Briton to Visit Nearby
description: LONDON, Dec. 1David Ennals, Minister of State at the Foreign Office, will visit. Zambia and possibly Tanzania this week to assess the Rhodesian situation from these neighboring countries.

title: Army Will Expand Picatinny Arsenal It Planned to Close
description: The Army has selected the Picatinny Arsenal at Dover, N.J., as the site for the new headquarters of its Armament Development Center, several members of the New Jersey Congressional delegation said yesterday.

title: Soviet Gives GuineaBissau MIGs to Begin an Air Force
description: BISSAU, GuineaBissau, Dec. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)The Soviet Union has handed over an unspecified number of MIG jets to GuineaBissau to form the basis of the country's new air force.

title: ARTSHOWINSURANCE GAINING IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 1 (UPI)  The House voted today to create a Federal program to provide up to $50 million insurance for each art exhibition that is part of a United States culturalexchange program.

title: Restoration Comedy Lost Since 1669 Is Discovered
description: A lost Restoration comedy, The Country Gentleman, which was banned by Charles II before it reached the stage and never printed, has been discovered by two American scholars and will be published by the. University of Pennsylvania Press in the spring.

title: Citizen Group Suggests Volunteers Be Used to Fill Gaps in City Services
description: The Citizens Committee for New York City, less than three months old and almost a quarter of the way toward its hopedfor budget of $300,000, has defined its two roles  filling in gaps in the city's bureaucracy with volunteers and working with existing community organizations to provide services lost in the budget cuts.

title: On the Rails
description: Rail service is essential to the movement of freight in the Northeast and the industrialized Middle West. For that reason, Congress two years ago approved the Regional Rail Reorganization Act to assure continued rail service despite the bankruptcy of the Penn Central and six smaller lines.

title: ARTSHOWINSURANCE GAINING IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)  The House voted today to create a Federal program to provide up to $50 million insurance for each art exhibition that is part of a United States culturalexchange program.

title: Assembly Unit Approves Byrne's Parole Reform
