description: TRENTON, Dec. 1The Assembly Judiciary Committee approved a Byrne administration bill today that establishes new standards for the release of inmates from the state's prisons.

title: Toy and $48 Million Order Greet Boat Strike's End
description: GROTON, Conn., Dec. 1One of the longest, costliest and bitterest strikes in this state's history ended this morning in a cold blowing mist as the first contingent of 10,000 submarine builders trooped back to work under hastily erected signs that said: We missed you.

title: Politics Down Under
description: New Zealand voters have confounded the experts and broken with precedent in turning out the Labor Party only three years after ushering it into power with a landslide majority. The upset victory of the conservative National Party has naturally given cheer to the rightofcenter LiberalCountry coalition in Australia, where voters elect a new Parliament next week.

title: House Expected to Approve CityAid Bill Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The House of Representatives is expected to approve tomorrow President Ford's proposal to authorize $2.3 billion in shortterm loans for New York City.

title: Proxmire Would Curtail Banks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) Contending that the entire economy could come under the control of a few large banks, William Proxmire, chiarman of the Senate Banking Committee, proposed legislation today to limit the size of banks.

title: Brother of Scott, a Figure In Hearst Case. Cuts Wrists
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 1 (UPI)Walter J. Scott, 42, years old, onetime Federal; Bureau of Investigation informt ant and brother Jack Scott, of the sports activist slashed his wrists today in an apparent suicide attempt in a crowded mall.

title: West German Output Up 1 %
description: BONN, Dec. 1 (Reuters) West German industrial production rose by a seasonally adjusted 1 percent in October over September and by 3.5 percent in these two months over the combined July and August figure, the Economics Ministry said today. But the level was still 4.5 percent lower than in October of last year, with a particularly marked 10.5 percent drop in the basic materials and production goods sector.

title: HONEYWELL LIFTS ITS SWITCH PRICES
description: Honeywell Inc. announced yesterday that its microswitch division was raising prices about 6 percent for list and contract prices covering its industrial and commercial lines. Products affected include switches, aviation, military and marine components, lighted and unlighted push buttons, plus photoelectric and proximity contnols.

title: REIT to Shift Status in '76
description: Institutional Investors Trust said yesterday it had informed its noteholders and trustee that it did not intend to qualify as a real estate investment trust for the year starting Feb. 1, 1976. The trust said should it decide to seek disqualification for the current tax year ending Jan. 31, 1976, proxy material would be sent to noteholders for their vote at a special meeting.

title: West German Output Up 1 %
description: BONN, Dec. 1 (Reuters)West German industrial production rose by a seasonally adjusted 1 percent in October over September and by 3.5 percent in these two months over the combined July and August figure, the Economics Ministry said today. But the level was still 4.5 percent lower than in October of last year, with a particularly marked 10.5 percent drop in the basic materials and production goods sector.

title: Connecticut Employees Stage Hartford Protest
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 1Hundreds of Connecticut state employees filled the hallways and galleries in the Capitol today, protesting noisily against Gov. Ella T. Grasso's determination to stretch their work week from 35 hours to 40 hours without extra pay in an effort to help the state out of a financial bind.

title: A New Drill For Scouts: A Dentist's
description: Time was when the tools of scouting were a compass and an ax, In the new Boy Scouts it could help to have a little dental floss.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is a tricky business for writers of fiction to review other people's work. One can hardly be committed to the novel or short story without also embracing a set of idiosyncratic attitudes toward them. Sometimes, as in the case of Vladimir Nabokov, these idiosyncrasies are so strong and pervasive as to make his criticism more an examination of himself than of the authors in question. Other writers seem too private to wish to share their views: I find it difficult to imagine Bernard Malamud, for example, turning his hand to criticism.

title: Minimal Grumbling Greets Start of Higher Rail Fares
description: TRENTON, Dec. 1New Jersey rail commuters who travel to work within the state paid higher fares today with a minimum of grumbling as the State Legislature wrestled unsuccessfully with plans designed to roll back at least a portion of the increase.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Dally Racing Form) Monday, Dec. 1. 19th day. Weather cloudy, track fast.

title: Rent Rise Forces Cancellation Of Antiques Show at Coliseum
description: The spring antiques and flower show at the Coliseum, one of the few remaining annual shows open to the public, at the exhibition hall, has been canceled, the victim of a 31 per cent rent increase over last year.

title: Indonesia Starting to Free Some Political Prisoners
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 1 (Reuters)The Indonesian Government is starting to release some 35,000 political prisoners estimated to have been detained without trial since 1965 on charges involving an abortive Communistled coup, Admiral Sudomo, the security chief, said today.

title: Brezhnev, Apparently Fully in Control, to Keynote Party Congress
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1Leonid I. Brezhnev is riding his reputation as a statesman into the 25th party congress less than three months hence, despite speculation about how long he plans to remain in his job.

title: Italy's Communist Tide
description: BELLAGIO, ItalyThe urbane, billiardbald Roman Communist editor, a major force in his party's Central Committee, reminded some of the other weekend guests here at a Lake Como villa of Little Orphan Annie's Daddy Warbucksnot only in appearance, but in his conservative statements. He raised his voice only once.

title: 8% CUT EXPECTED IN '75 CAR OUTPUT
description: DETROIT, Dec. 1The United States auto industry will wind up 1975 with production of 6,719,000 cars, off 8 percent from last year and the lowest level since 1970, according to trade sources.

title: It's an Ill Shea Stadium Wind That Blows Namath's Passes
description: The winds tumble over the top of Shea Stadium like some giant, invisible breaking wave. Then they splash down toward the field.

title: E.P.A. Turns From Cures to Prevention
description: WASHINGTON  In the five years since it was founded, the Environmental Protection Agency has weathered a turbulent formative period and is moving into what it sees as a new epoch in environmental management.

title: CITIES AND STATES SLOWING SPENDING
description: Spending by state and local governments has been a steady and powerful generator of jobs and incomes in the United States for most of the period since World War II.

title: U.S.Soviet Talks Open On New Shipping Accord
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1 (UPI)Soviet and American negotiators began work today on a new bilateral shipping agreement.

title: OTB Gets a Call OnTrack For Creating Bettor Interest
description: New York's Offtrack Betting system, strongly opposed by racing officials when introduced in 1971, finally received a commendation from one yesterday when Timothy Rooney, the Yonkers Raceway president, conceded OTB had and was creating new harnessracing fans.

title: Irish Hold and Then Release Suspect Sought in Britain
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Margaret McKearney, who is wanted by the British police on terrorism charges, was released from custody today after being held since Saturday by the Irish police.

title: Cash and Country Lure Rutgers Star
description: As far as the pros are concerned, I'm not that much in a hurry, said Phil Sellers, the flashy and talented highscoring forward of Rutgers. His remark, made at a news conference to publicize the opening of Madison Square Garden's 41st season of college basketball, was well advised.

title: MAILERS DISAVOW ANY STRIKE THREAT
description: The president of Mailers Union No. 6, which on Sunday rejected a tentative threeyear contract with The Daily News and The New York Times, said yesterday that he would seek further discussions with the publishers but that there was no threat of a slowdown or a strike.

title: Knicks Pick Up Butch Beard For $1,000
description: The world has turned around geographically and financially for Butch Beard, who became a Knick yesterday for the $1,000 waiver price.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: ABORTION

title: Steel Output Down By 4.9% in Week; Drop Biggest in '75
description: Steel production in the week ended Nov. 29 took its largest percentage drop for any week this year, according to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Federal Insecurity
description: After his sanctimonious lecturing about the necessity to teach the City of New York the need to assume responsibility for managing its own affairs, President Ford seems determined to have New Yorkers continue to assume responsibility for managing, and paying for, some of the Federal Government's affairs.

title: Nuclear Safety
description: An awkward inconsistency underlies the policy recommendations of those manufacturers and utilities that champion nuclear power as the best answer to this country's energy needs. First they argue strenuously about how safe today's nuclear power plants are, compared with so many other technological facts of life that the public takes for granted.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: I don't like it, but it's still a bargain when compared to the cost of driving and parking my car, said one Newark office worker who rides the Jersey Central Railroad.

title: 2 Pitchers Wind Up Arbitration Cases
description: Andy Messersmith and Dave McNally completed their cases for freeagent status yesterday before a threeman arbitration panel.

title: Stock Prices Slip After FiveDay Gain
description: Stock prices declined a little yesterday breaking off the fiveday advance of last week. The Dow Jones industrial average, which showed a gain of 1.89 at 10:30 A.M., fell back to close at 856.34, down 4.33 from where it ended Friday.

title: John Fahey Plays Impressive Guitar At the Bottom Line
description: John Fahey, who stopped by the Bottom Line for two shows Sunday night, remains as impressive and distinctive a master of the acoustic guitar as he ever was.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: LOS ANGELESVincente Saldivar, 135 ponds, Mexico, knocked out Randy Shierds, 136, North Hollywood, Calif., 8 rounds.

title: Americans and Chinese Join in Studied Exercise
description: PEKING. Dec. 1In the early morning coalsmoke on these chill winter days the people of Peking appear to gather randomly at squares and on corners to practice wuchu, a highly stylized, balletlike system of careful exercises.

title: Connecticut Seeks Arrest Of JaiAlai Entrepreneur
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 1  Arrest warrants were issued in Superior Court here and in Hartford this afternoon charging that the developer of a Bridgeport jaialai fronton lied when he testified that he had given the late John M. Bailey $250,000 for help in securing a state gaming license.

title: People and Business
description: Frank G. Zarb, the head of the Federal Energy Administration, had a gloomy prediction for the world's oil consumers yesterday.

title: Dolphins Set Back Patriots
description: MIAMI, Dec. 1 (UPI)Earl Morrall, playing his 20th National Football League season, completed his first 13 passes for 123 yards and a touchdown tonight and directed the Miami Dolphins to a 207 victory over the New England Patriots.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Issues in Carters' Strike
description: PARTICIPANTSLocal 813, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Bernard Adelstein, secretarytreasurer, with 1,700 members in the five boroughs. Negotiators representing 450 carting companiesAssociation of Trade Waste Removers of Greater New York, Salvatore Spinelli, counsel; Brooklyn Trade Waste Association, Patsy Davanzo; Queens County Trade Waste Association, Alfred F. Muscio; Carting Employers Group, Joseph Monica.

title: More British Doctors Joining Hospital Slowdown
description: The 11,000 senior doctors, known as hospital consultants, had threatened, with the approval of the British Medical Association, to refuse to treat any new hospital cases except in emergencies. With most of them reportedly working normally today, however, the immediate effect of their action appeared limited.

title: Amex Seat Price Up $5,000
description: The American Stock Exchange reported a seat sale yesterday at $50,000, up $5,000 from Nov. 26.

title: Peyser to Challenge Buckley Next Year In G.O.P. Primary
description: Representative Peter A. Peyser announced yesterday that he would challenge Senator James L. Buckley in the Republican primary next year and make an issue of the Senator's hard line on Federal aid to New York City, his residing in Connecticut and his connection with the oil industry.

title: Dr. Antin Rudnytsky, 73, Pianist and Conductor, Dead
description: Dr. Antin Rudnytsky, a pianist, composer and conductor, died Sunday in Com munity Memorial Hospital in Toms River, N. J. He was 73 years old.

title: U. OF CHICAGO PICKS A NEW PRESIDENT
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1  John Todd Wilson, acting president of the University of Chicago, has been nominated to succeed Edward H. Levi as the school's president.

title: Music: Lyric Orpheus
description: Fragmentation has long been one of the most effective expressive devices available to the composer. In moments of emotion or ??ress, it is natural to find the phrase breaking down into words, the words breaking down into syllables and the musical line breaking down into short, disjunct notes. In our time, fragmentation has been carried to extraordinary lengths as composers searched for new modes of expression. Rather often, unintelligibility has been the predictable outcome.

title: ISRAEL WILL SHUN MIDEAST DEBATE IN U.N.'S COUNCIL
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 1  In a special sixhour session, the Israeli Cabinet decided today to boycott next month's debate on the Middle East in the United Nations Security Council and approved in principle, the establishment of new settlements on the occupied Golan Heights.

title: NASSAU'S BUDGET ASSAILED BY 200
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 1Nassau County's proposed budget of close to $1 billion for 1976 was denounced at a crowded public hearing held today by the Board of Supervisors.

title: Restaurants Play It Cool With Waste
description: Leftover lobster souffle from the Four Seasons and onion soup from the Brasserie were kept on ice an extra night last night, at the end of the first day of the strike by private sanitation carters.

title: Black Revolutionary to Return To Face North Carolina Charge
description: LANSING. Mich., Dec. 1Robbert F. Williams, a black revolutionary, said today that he would return to North Carotina to face kidnapping charges, ending 15 years of flight and evasion that took him to Cuba and China in the 1960's. Mr. Williams, the 49yearold one tune president of the Republic of New Africa, a black separatist group, announced his decision after the Michigan Supreme Court refused after long litigation to block his extradition.

title: Nick Kenny, Columnist for The Mirror, Writer of Verses and Lyrics, Is Dead
description: Nick Kenny, former radio columnist of The New York Mirror who gained wider fame as a writer of verse including lyrics for such popular songs as Love Letters in the Sand and Little Old Cathedral in the Pines, died yesterday after a massive heart attack in Sarasota (Fla.) Memorial Hospital. He was 80 years old.

title: Knicks' LineUp
description: AT GARDEN GAME TIME7:30 P.M

title: Miki Says Strike Imperils Japanese Political System
description: TOKYO, Dec. 1As 860,000 government employees continued an illegal strike, Prime Minister Takeo Miki told a nationwide television audience this evening that Japan's political system cannot really work if this severe confrontation goes on.

title: 11 U.S. Poets' Work Will Be Displayed For City Bus Riders
description: Other lovers of poetry on hand yesterday for a ribboncutting commemorating a Bicentennial salute to American poets agreed.

title: MARKET DEBATES BRITISH DEMANDS
description: ROME, Dec. 1The heads or government of the nine Common Market countries struggled today with ways to overcome British demands for special treatment at the conference of industrialized and developing countries scheduled for next month.

title: Soccer Trade Seen
description: MANCHESTER, England, Dec. 1 (AP)Rodney Marsh, Manchester City forward, may join the North American Soccer League's Tampa Bay Rowdies for a transfer fee of $100,000, his club said today.

title: ROAD COSTS EASED BY WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 1 Westchester decided today to assume the major cost of improving its county road network, lifting an increasingly heavy burden from its municipalities.

title: LOAN OF ITS AGENTS OPPOSED BY I. R. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Internal Revenue Service and the Justice Department disagreed today on whether I.R.S. agents should sped their time on investigations that might not lead to taxrelated charges.

title: Police Car Defect Cited
description: DETROIT, Dec. 1 (UPI)Chrysler Corporation said today that 2,619 police vehicles equipped with its largest engines may have defective hoses that could cause a loss of power steering. The automaker said the vehicles involved were the 1975 Plymouth Fury and Dodge Coronet models equipped with the 400 and 440 cubic inch engines built specifically for police agencies.

title: Rightist Is Expected to Get 2 High Posts in Spain
description: MADRID, Dec. 1 Torcuato Fernndez Miranda, an extreme rightist who once tutored King Juan Carlos I in political philosophy, is expected to become the next speaker of Parliament and chairman of the Council of the Realm, the country's highest consultative body.

title: JAKE SCHAEFER, 81, BILLIARDS EXPERT
description: Jake Schaefer, fivetime holder of the world's 18.2 balkline billiard championship, died in Cleveland on Nov. 10. He was 81 years old.

title: Teamster Ruling on Women
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 1 (UPI)The teamsters union says women truck drivers have to stay in trucking companies' terminal facilities on overnight trips just as men drivers do. The union issued its ruling recently after a male driver for the McLean Trucking Company complained that women were getting spcial privilages because the company paid for them to stay in motels, while men stayed in the terminal facilties.

title: Chess
description: The move I intended to make I entirely overlooked, was a favorite kibitz of that master of the art of rubbing it in, Oscar Tenner of the Manhattan Chess Club.

title: Dollar Ends Down In Trading Abroad; Pound in Recovery
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 1 (UPI)The dollar, after a strong opening following Friday's sevenweek highs, was slowed by profit taking on European money markets today, while in Tokyo it closed at a fouryear high.

title: Suit on Atlanta Firefighters
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) The Justice Department filed suit today charging that the Atlanta Fire Department discriminates against blacks in job promotions. The civil suit, filed in United States District Court in Atlanta, said blacks make up about onefourth of the firefighting force but hold only 2.5 per cent ofjobs above the entry level. The Justice Department seeks a court order prohibiting any racially discriminatory employment practices.

title: U.S. Closing Thai Air Base
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 1 (UPI)The United States began closing its next to last air base in Thailand today, with six fighterbombers and two other attack planes flying out of the country an American spokesmen said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Peyser Will Challenge Buckley In Republican Primary in 1976
description: Representative Peter A. Peyser announced yesterday that he would challenge Senator James L. Buckley in the Republican primary next year and make an issue of the Senator's hard line on Federal aid to New York City, his residing in Connecticut and his connection with the oil industry.

title: Stocks Decline on Amex and OTC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market closed lower yesterday in somewhat heavier trading.

title: CITIES AND STATES SLOWING SPENDING
description: Spending by state and local governments has been a steady and powerful generator of jobs and incomes in the United States for most of the period since World War II.

title: STRAWBS MIX ROCK AND FOLK AT BEACON
description: In the fullness of time maybe the mixture of British folktype music and the hardness of American rock n roll will emerge as a real and basic part of rock history. It certainly teemed that way when Strawbs appeared at the Beacon Theater on Sunday performing the same kind of music they have been putting across for the last five years or so. The Strawbs are survivors if nothing else.

title: F.D.A. ASKS RECALL OF ASLEEPAID PILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration said today it had ordered a drug company to recall all its outstanding stocks of Sominex 2, a drug nationally sold overthecounter.

title: New Crater Opens on Etna
description: CATANIA, Italy, Dec. 1 (AP) A new crater opened today on the western slope of Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano, and began spewing lava down the mountainside.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: LYDIA DHJAN FAYON
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. ILydia Dhjan Fayon, a United Nations staff member for more than 25 years, died yesterday at the Albert Einstein Hospital in the Bronx. She was 52 years old.

title: Deaths
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M TO 4:30 P.M, MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300: NASSAU CO. (516) /4/0500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Essex County Inmates Find a New Note of Harmony
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1As an enthusiastic audience clapped to the beat of the music, the uniformed corrections officers were the only reminder that the lively production of A Soulful Gathering was being staged here today, by 30 inmates in the Essex County Jail.

title: Advice on Holiday Scrip: Spend It or Turn It Back
description: The New York City Department of Consumer Affairs warned consumers yesterday on the use of holiday scrip, or holiday money, issued by some of the city's major department stores. The agency charged that the stores had failed to tell customers that if they did not return unused scrip they had obtained they would still be charged for it.

title: Justice Waltemade Censured by Court
description: Supreme Court Justice Wilfred A. Waltemade was censured yesterdaybut not removed from the bench by the State Court on the Judiciary, which found that the justice's repeated and unrelenting display of unjudicial temperament had grossly violated reasonable concepts of judicial behavior.

title: AllAmerica Football
description: OFFENSIVE TEAM

title: Doctor Sues St. Clare's Hospital After Ouster From $40,000 Job
description: Dr. John L. Madden, for 26 years the chairman of the department of surgery at St. Clare's Hospital and Health Center in midtown Manhattan, has charged in a suit filed in State Supreme Court that the hospital dismissed him without explanation from his $40,000ayear post.

title: Europe's Unions Split Over Role in Management
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 30Georges Debunne, a Socialist who heads Belgium's powerful General Federation of Workers agrees with his trade union colleagues in West Germany on many aspects of European labor strategy. But on the concept of worker representation on company boards, which the West Germans have pioneered in the postwar era, he could not be more opposed.

title: Joy and $48 Million Order Greet Boat Strike's End
description: GROTON, Conn., Dec. 1One of the longest, costliest and bitterest strikes in this state's history ended this morning in a cold blowing mist as the first contingent of 10,000 submarine builders trooped back to work under hastily erected signs that said: We missed you.

title: FORD AND CHINESE DEFEND ATTITUDES TOWARD RUSSIANS
description: PEKING, Tuesday, Dec. 2President Ford undertook a mission of modest expectations here today after engaging in frank exchange with China's Deputy Prime Minister, Teng Hsiaoping, over Washington's policy of dtente with Moscow.

title: Equity Fund Plan Backed
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission backed yesterday a plan to reorganize the Equity Funding Corporation of America, creating a new holding company for two life insurance companies. The company filed for reorganization under Chapter X of the Federal Bankruptcy Act more than two years ago after the discovery of a massive insurance swindle. The plan, submitted to the Lost Angeles Federal Court, was described by the S.E.C. as equitable and feasible.

title: FORD AND CHINESE DEFEND ATTITUDES TOWARD RUSSIANS
description: PEKING, Tuesday, Dec. 2President Ford undertook a mission of modest expectations here today after engaging in a frank exchange with China's Deputy Prime Minister, Teng Hsiaoping, over Washington's policy of dtente with Moscow.

title: Man Seized as Bail Juniper
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (AP) Carter Augustus Camp, 34 years old, convicted in the Indian occupation at Wounded Ine, S.D., was arrested yesterday by the Federal Bureau of Investigation on a bailjumping charge. Mr. Carter, a member of the American Indian Movement, was found guilty June 5 on charges of assaulting a Federal officer and robbery of Government property.

title: BLUE LAW UPHELD FOR OCEAN GROVE
description: OCEAN GROVE, Dec. I (UPI) A judge ruled today that this South Jersey shore hamlet could block the delivery of Sunday newspapers to preserve the serenity of the Sabbath.

title: The Persistent Gap
description: After the upsurge of interest and action following the urban riots of the sixties, what real economic progress actually has been registered by black Americans?

title: Nellie Fox Dies at 47
description: Nellie Fox, a major league second baseman for 19 years, died yesterday of cancer. He was 47 years old. Obituary, Page 42.

title: Tolls Cat on 3 Bridges Spanning the Delaware
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 1 (AP)Tolls were reduced by 5 cents today on the three bridges linking South Jersey with Pennsylvania, in accordance with a courtordered rollback.

title: Urban Homesteader Program Heldin Trouble, but Salvagable
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Dec. 1A forthcoming study on urban homesteading concludes that with fewer than 300 active homesteader families in four East Coast cities the program I's in deep trouble. But the study says, the program can yet save abandoned urban housing if it full potential is exploited.

title: Consumer Safety Unit Sets Study of Christmas Lights
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Consumer Product Safety Commission said today that Christmas tree lights in general posed an unreasonable risk of injury and rules would be drawn up to make them safer.

title: PAN AM REPORTS NEW LOAN ACCORD
description: Pan American World Airways announced yesterday that it had completed arrangements for a new revolving credit agreement, involving up to $90 million, with a group of 23 banks.

title: Pittsburgh Teachers Walk Out; Both Sides Predict Long Strike
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 1Pitts burgh's public scholltheachers struck today for the third time in eight years, hoping that their pay demands will be met if they stay off the job long enough.

title: Secretary Says She Destroyed Hoover's Letters on His Orders
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) J. Edgar Hoover's secretary testified today that, following his orders, she destroyed his personal correspondence after the director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation died.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation said yesterday that the Federal Trade Commission had denied its request for further extension to submit a plan for divestiture of the Peabody Coal Company. The F. T. C. added that the company was under a continuing obligation to comply with the divestiture order and that the commission reserved its right to seek enforcement of the order.

title: New Taxes' Use to Rehire City Workers Is Ruled Out
description: The Beame administration yesterday ruled out using the $200 million in new tax revenues to cancel any of the $200 million worth of layoffs and reduced services ordered earlier this year, before the new taxes were forced on the city.

title: Going out  Guide
description: GRAPESCAPE The opening today of an exhibition of drawings and watercolors of the vineyards of the Bordeaux region marks the first showing accorded an American artist, Wayne Ensrud, at the French Institute/Alliance Franaise (6441820), 22 East 60th Street. Admission is free. The display will continue through Dec. 19, Monday through Thursday from 10 A.M. to 8 P.M., and Friday and Saturday from 11 A.M. to 5 P.M.

title: Safety of Nuclear Power Is Debated at Hearing Here
description: A national debate about whether nuclear power is either safe or economical was localized yesterday before a commission of the Legislature that is scheduled to report in February on an energy policy for New York State.

title: REZONING BACKED AS AID TO ELDERLY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Supreme Court cleared the way today for communities in New York State to amend their zoning regulations to permit multipleunit highdensity housing for the elderly, even in areas previously restricted to singlefamily houses on plots of an acre or more.

title: Dollar Off
description: The dollar closed lower yesterday in trading abroad while the pound recovered from a record low. Page 65.

title: PROBLEMS POUND IN OPTION TRADING
description: The American Stock Exchange and the Chicago Board Options Exchange have notified the Securities and Exchange Commission that they have uncovered irregularities in stock option trading, Wall Street sources disclosed yesterday.

title: City U. Board Backs Away From Own Economy Plan
description: The Board of Higher Education last night backed away from action on its own proposal to cut $55 million from the City University's spring term budget, apparently after John E. Zuccotti, the First Deputy Mayordesignate, rejected major portions of the plan.

title: Wife and 3 Others Are Held in Slaying Of Man in Jersey
description: Four persons have been charged in the July 5 slaying of a haberdasher from the Bronx, including his wife and three others she is accused of having hired to kill him out of jealousy over another woman, outhorities in Monmouth County, N.J., reported yesterday.

title: Board of Education Facing More Cuts
description: City officials told the Board of Education yesterday that the $43 million it expected to save by deferring raises for teachers had already been accounted for in the city's financial plan and could not be credited to the board as part of the next round of budget cuts.

title: So Near but So Far: Druse Families Separated by the Golan Truce Line
description: MAJDAL SHAMS, IsraeliOccupied Syria, Nov. 25Every week the Druses of the Golan Heights gather by the dozens on the gentle slopes of the valley beneath this mountain village. There, separated by thick coils of bar??ed wire and a minefield, they try with the aid of bullhorns and binoculars to reestablish the family tips that were severed eight years ago by the sixday war.

title: Plexiglas for the Table
description: Plexiglas is a very contemporary material for furniture, but most of the clear acrylic designs by Jeffrey Bigelow borrow freely from older sourcesmost particularly the modes of the 1920's and 30s.

title: City, Seeking to Reopen Tombs, Asks Federal Judge to Approve
description: City officials have formally requested that the Tombsthe Manhattan House of Detention for Menwhich was closed last year because of what were described as inhuman conditions, be reopened as soon as possible to house about 600 inmates.

title: INDONESIA TO PRESS INTERESTS IN TIMOR
description: ATAMBUA, Indonesian West Timor, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Indonesia promised today to support quietly or openly political parties in Portuguese Timor that want the territory to join Indonesia, and it said the solution to the issue now lay on the battlefield.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Up at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: JAMES P. SELVAGE OF PUBLICITY FIRM
description: James P. Selvage, a retired publicrelations man, died yesterday in an automobile accident in Vidalia, Ga. He was 73 years old and a resident of Miami.

title: STRIKE IS AVERTED IN LAUNDRIES HERE
description: A strike that could have shut 200 laundries in the metropolitan New York area was agreement was reached on averted yesterday morning whena tentative threeyear contract.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on Pennsylvania politics that appeared in The New York Times last Wednesday, it was reported that no Republican rival of Senator Hugh Scott had alluded to disclosures that Senator Scott had received an annual payment of $10,000 from the Gulf Oil Corporation. One of the aspirants for Senator Scott's seat, George R. Packard, criticized the payment in a news release on Nov. 16.

title: The Price of New York's Capitulation
description: The cure for New York's fiscal crisis may prove to be worse than the disease. There is growing evidence that orderly default might have been a more reasonable alternative to the wounds we are inflicting on our city.

title: People
description: Charles E. Perry has been appointed president and publisher of Family Weekly Inc., effective Jan. 1.

title: Advertising
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 1Amid the gilded surroundings of the venerable Breakers Hotel as the annual meeting of the Association of National Advertisers got under way today, one gets the feeling that things are looking upand it's not just the euphoria brought on by sparkling sunshine, warm weather and waving palm trees. There is optimism in the air.

title: Ehrlichman Says Nixon Wanted Files Kept From Hoover
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Files concerning the Federal Bureau of Investigation's wiretaps of reporters and Government officials were moved to the White House on orders of President Nixon because of fears that J. Edgar Hoover might use them to blackmail the President, according to testimony by John D. Ehrlichman the former Nixon adviser.

title: Private Homes Add Realism to TV Ads For a Fee
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y.Barbara Fields was watching television in her Victorianstyle bedroom the other night when, all of a sudden, her Victorianstyle bedroom appeared on the screen. Same floral wallpaper, same fluffy quilt, same brass bed.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Appellate Division of Superior Court in Trenton upheld the validity of declaring an insurance company insolvent in New Jersey after a court in another state reachesthat conclusion. The ruling by the state's second highest court clarified the power given the State Insurance Cornmission under a law setting up the PropertyLiability Insurance Guaranty Association, which makes good claims against insolvent companies from assessments levied against all insurance companies operating in the state. The associatin had argued that it had not become liable for claims against the Summit Insurance Company of New York until after it was declared insolvent by a court in its home state. However, Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran calld on the association to back up Summit's claims when a North Carolina court declared the company insolvent, and the Appellate Division supported his action.

title: U.S. DENIES SHIFT ON PALESTINIANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The United States said today that it would participate in next month's United Nations Security Council debate on the Middle East along with the Palestine Liberation Organization but denied that this meant an end to the diplomatic boycott of the Palestinian group.

title: The Man Running Things in China
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 1At the height of the Cultural Revolution eight years ago a team of Red Guards stormed into the section of Peking where senior Communist officials live and interrogated the Secretary General of the party. According to one report of the encounter, the Secretary General, Teng Hsiaoping, ignominiously confessed that he was a counterrevolutionary who had opposed Chairman Mao Tsetung for years. Denounced as a demon and a freak, he did not appear again until 1973, when he was unexpectedly named a Deputy Prime Minister.

title: Glomar Challenger Off to Drill Sea's Floor
description: Inaugurating an international effort to probe the deepest layer of the oceanic crust, the drill ship Glomar Challenger left San Juan, P.R., yesterday headed for the midAtlantic.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Waltemade Censured
description: Justice Wilfred A. Waltemade of the State Supreme Court was censured but not removed by the State Court no the Judiciary, which found that his repeated and unrelenting display of unjudicial temperament had grossly violated reasonable concepts of judicial behavior. Page 77.

title: Issues in Carters' Strike
description: PARTICIPANTSLocal 813, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Bernard Adelstein, secretarytreasurer, with 1,700 members in the five boroughs. Negotiators representing 450 carting companiesAssociation of Trade Waste Removers of Greater New York. Salvatore Spinelli, counsel; Brooklyn Trade Waste Association, Patsy Davanzo; Queens County Trade Waste Association, Alfred F. Muscio; Carting Employers Group, Joseph Monica.

title: The Peking Candidate
description: The miracle of network television takes you now to ancient China where our White House correspondent, Bucky Shores, is standing on the ancient Great Wall waiting for the ancient tea ceremony to begin. We have an excellent picture of you and the ancient Great Wall, Bucky. How is everything in China?

title: AMERICAN BRANDS IN ACUSHNET PACT
description: American Brands Inc., a major tobacco company, announced yesterday an agreement in principle for the !acquisition of the Acushnet (Company, a manufacturer of golf clubs and balls. Acushnet shareholders will have the opportunity to exchange each of the 1,865,499 shares outstanding for a new series of convertible American Brands preferred stock or $21.50 in cash, provided that the total cash payment would be limited to 49 percent and the balance paid to such holders in preferred stock.

title: New Law Limits State On StockTax Collection
description: The State Tax Commission said yesterday that a new Federal law had barred it from collecting the $60 million a year it had expected from the stock transfer tax on securities sold outside the state but recorded as transfers on the books of banks and corporations within the state.

title: Citizens Panel Suggests Ways It Can Help the City
description: neighborhood beautification towards the goal of becoming sort of a clearing house for information for volunteers who want to know about fairs, youth work, street patrols, programs for the elderly.

title: Rabbi Korff Asks Sakharov To Attend the Bicentennial
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI). Rabbi Baruch Korff said today that Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident Soviet scientist, had been invited to the United States for a bicentennial celebration, but apparently did not receive the invitation.

title: It's Heisman Day
description: Archie Griffin, the Ohio State running back who is favored to win the Heisman Trophy for the second straight year, may have been notified yesterday to fly to New York City for the announcement of the award today by the Downtown Athletic Club. The Associated Press reported that the Buckeye Star had been told by the club, which makes the award, to get his airline tickets. However, the Ohio State sports information director denied it yesterday afternoon, saying, We're waiting for the call.

title: Cairo Hails Forward Step
description: CAIRO, Dec. 1The Egyptian Government today welcomed the Security Council decision to renew the mandate of the emergency force.

title: Illinois Democrats Pick Howlett To Oppose Walker in Primary
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1The Illinois Democratic State Central Committee, dominated by Mayor Richard J. Daley of Chicago, marinated Michael J. Howlett, the Illinois Secretary of State, today as its candidate for Governor next year.

title: Notes on People
description: Permission has been granted for Leonid V. Kantorovich, cowinner of the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science to go to Stockholm for the award ceremonies Dec. 10. The 63yearold mathematical economist will leave Friday with his wife, Soviet officials said yesterday.

title: Advice on Holiday Scrip: Spend It or Turn It Back
description: The New York City Department of Consumer Affairs warned consumers yesterday on the use of holiday scrip, or holiday money, issued by some of the city's major department stores. The agency charged that the stores had failed to tell customers that if they did not return unused scrip they had obtained they would still be charged for it.

title: Single Note Intoned By Charles Madden In a Ritual Event
description: Charles Madden, who gave the second of two concerts Sunday night in a loft at 130 West 17th Street, owes his obvious debts to other avantgarde composer  performers. But that didn't make his event any less compelling in its austere, ritualistic way.

title: LAOTIAN COALITION SEEN NEAR AN END
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 1 (Reuters)The neutralist Prime Minister, Prince Souvanna Phoama, was reported today to have left Vientiane in semiretirement as more rallies were held demanding the end of the coalition Cabinet in preparation For full rule by the Communistled Bathet Lao.

title: Refugees a Problem for Thais
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 1 (Reuters)The arrival of prominent Laotians here has caused embarrassment for Prime Minister Kukrit Pramoj amid growing tensions between Thailand and Laos.

title: Redistricting Bill to Assist Rodino Bogged Down in Assembly Committee
description: TRENTON, Dec. 1The Assemby Judiciary Committee refused today to vote out a Democratic Congressional redistricting plan that was designed to create a predominantly white new district for Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr. Democratic legislative leaders agreed afterward that this meant the plan was in all probability dead

title: 218 Firms Cited in Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The number of American firms cited by the Government, for failing to report Arab requests to participate in a boycott against Israel has risen to 218, Commerce Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton said today.

title: Scott Heads Platform Unit
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 1 (UPI) Hugh Scott the Senate Republican leader, has been chosen to serve as chairman of the Platform Committee for the Republican National Conventon, according to Republican Congressional sources. Mr. Scott will preside over the committee designated to write the party platform on which 1976 Presidential candidate will run.

title: ComingOut Tournament Set for Squash Racquets
description: Squash racquets, normally played in the intimacy of private clubs before tiny audiences, is going bigtimeor at least it is trying to. It's going after more exposure and what one of its leaders calls respectability.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Judiciary Committee of the New Jersey Assembly refused to move a Democratic Congressional redistricting plan that would create a predominantly white new district for Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr. and Democratic legislative leaders agreed afterward that the plan was in all probability dead. Pushed by State Senator James P. Dugan, the Democratic state chairman from Hudson County, the socalled Rodino bill would carve out a new district for Mr. Rodino in bluecollar communities in Essex, Passaic, Bergen and Hudson Counties and remove him from his predominantly black 10th District in Newark.

title: Kuwait Buys Out Gulf and B.P.
description: The Government of Kuwait signed an agreement yesterday with the Gulf Oil Corporation and the British Petroleum Campany for a takeover by Kuwait of the remaining 40 percent of the Kuwait Oil Company not previously owned by the Government.

title: Companies Report Their Sales and Profit Figures
VIOLENCE BY KURDS ERUPTS IN BEIRUT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 1Beirut was generally quiet today, though an outburst of shooting and kidnapping in the city's Kurdish quarter emptied the downtown business section shortly after noon.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Statement by Company
description: A statement issued by the Williams Company in New York yesterday said in part:

title: City U. Board Backs Away From Own Economy Plan
description: The Board of Higher Education last knight backed away from action on its own proposal to cut $55 million from the City University's spring term budget, apparently after John E. Zuccotti, the First Deputy Mayordesignate, rejected major portions of the plan.

title: Lea4ue of Cities W arms to Beame Talk
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Dec. 1Mayor Beame told a convention of city officials here today that New York City's desperate fight to avoid default, although painful, had dramatized the problems of urban America and reawakened a sense of urgency in dealing with them.

title: Nellie Fox, Baseball Star, Dead at 47
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 1 (AP)Nellie Fox, former second baseman for the Chicago White Sox, who was the American League's most valuable player in 1959, died today at University Hospital. He was 47 years old and lived in St. Thomas, Pa.

title: E.P.A. Turns From Cures to Prevention
description: WASHINGTON  In the five years since it was founded, the Environmental Protection Agency has weathered a turbulent formative period and is moving into what it sees as a new epoch in environmental management.

title: Wigs for All Seasonsand Reasons
description: Oriental temptress one minute, little Orphan Annie the next, blond bombshell to raventressed vixen, longhaired ingenue to curlyheaded vixen.

title: Ashe Ruled Victor in Dispute
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 1Arthur Ashe scored points on and off the court today as he advanced toward his final ambitions of the tennis year.

title: Philip M. B. Boocock Dies: Nichols School Headmaster
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 1 (AP)Philip M. B. Boocock, headmaster of the Nichols School here for 32 years, died in Buffalo General Hospital last night. He was 70 years old.

title: New Taxes' Use to Rehire City Workers Is Ruled Out
description: The Beame administration yesterday ruled out using the $200 million in new tax revenues to cancel any of the $200 million worth of layoffs and reduced services ordered earlier this year, before the new taxes were forced on the city.

title: Federal Agencies Waive Fees For Release of Rosenberg Data
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Justice Department and; the Central Intelligence Agency have waived nearly $35,000 in search fees for release of the files on the convicted atom spies, Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, officials said today.

title: Coleman Predicts a Veto Of Unacceptable Rail Bill
description: President Ford finds the $10.9 billion rail reorganization bill proposed by a Senate committee totally unacceptable and would veto the legislation, Secretary of Transportation William T. Coleman Jr. said yesterday.

title: Team's Owner Unable to Pay the Players
description: The owner of the Utah Stars, one of three shaky franchises among the eight teams remaining in the American Basketball Association, said yesterday that he could not continue operation of the team.

title: MOTHER M. THECLA
description: PHILADELPHIA Dec. 1 (AP) Mother M. Thecla, a member of the Sisters of St. Joseph for 73 years, died Saturday at Mount St. Joseph Convent. She was 96 years old.

title: Abrams Assails City Plan To Shut Fordham Hospital
description: Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx last night assailed the tentative decision to close Fordham Hospital as being based on obviously superficial, inadequate and totally unacceptable information.

title: Bankers' Acceptances Up
description: Bankers' dollar acceptances outstanding in the United States rose in October for the second consecutive month, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. In October, bankers' acceptances climbed to $17.3 million from $16.8 million, the Fed said. Except for the increases in September and October, acceptances have dropped since March when bills advanced to a record $18.7 million.

title: Policy on U.D.C. Is Defended By ExBudget Director Hurd
description: T. Norman Hurd, the former State Budget Director, testified yesterday that, despite warnings from other state officials, he had seen no need to tighten the internal financial procedures of the Urban Development Corporation.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Honey rates for Tuesday.

title: The Art of Preserved Goose
description: 12to14pound ovenready gooseSalt and freshly groundpepper to taste

title: Terrorists Kill 2, Hold 50 on Dutch Train
description: THE HAGUE, Wednesday, Dec. 3Five armed extremists who want independence for the South Molucca Islands in Indonesia seized a train in the north of the Netherlands yesterday, killing at least two men and taking about 50 hostages.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2At a time when the strategic, arms talks appear to be at an impasse, a highly technical yet political debate is going on within the Administration over what treaty constraints should be placed on two new weapons systemsthe longrange cruise missile being developed by the United States and a bomber being produced by the Soviet Union.

title: Democrats Ask Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) Democratic leaders in the Senate and House called today for Congressional inquiries into the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: GEN. JOHN MEYER, S.A.C. COMMANDER
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2 (AP)John Charles Meyer, a retired Air Force general who was a leading World War II flying ace in Europe and later commander of the Strategic Air Command, died today. He was 56 years old.

title: Carey Nominee Declines
description: ALBANY, Dec. 2 (UPI)Dr. Francis B. Trudeau has asked that his name be removed from consideration as a member of the Adirondack Park Agency, it was learned today. Dr. Trudeau, of Saranac Lake, was named to the agency Nov 20 by Governor Carey.

title: ISRAELI JETS HIT PALESTINIAN SITES IN LEBANON RAIDS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 2Israeli jets attacked Palestinian camps in northern and southern Lebanon today, inflicting the heaviest reported death toll in such raids in a year and a half.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: FORD MEETS MAO IN EARNEST TALK
description: PEKING, Wednesday, Dec. 3 Chairman Mao Tsetung met with President Ford for an hour and 50 minutes yesterday, and the President said later that they had had a significant conversation about international issues including ChineseAmerican relations.

title: GEN. JOHN MEYER, S.A.C. COMMANDER
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2 (AP)John Charles Meyer, a retired Air Force general who was a leading World War II flying ace in Europe and later cornmender of the Strategic Air Command, died today. He was 56 years old.

title: Publicity Over Chairs Helps Fill Restaurant
description: Chairs are normally for sitting, but when a public agency decides to spend $3,500 each for four of them it makes people stand up and take noticesometimes angrily and sometimes pleasantly.

title: About New York
description: New York, the greatest manmade backdrop in the world, has always been a playground for moviemakers, and it was no accident that films made their start as big business here before moving on to greener Western pastures.

title: Books of The Times
description: The last time I read Chaim Potok was about six years ago. The book was his second novel, The Promise. Its central theme was the conflict between orthodox and more modern approaches to Jewish scripturesthe antagonism between those who believe the Torah to have come directly from God and those who hold that it was passed from scribe to scribe and altered in the process. The Promise seemed to me a rather pale version of Mr. Potok's entertaining first novel, The Chosen, whose central theme was also the conflict between orthodox and modern approaches to the Asher Lev, and I waited until his fourth and latest novel, In the Beginning, to read him againmy theory being that by this point he could not possibly have anything more to say about the conflict between orthodox and modern approaches to the Torah.

title: The Costs of Waste
description: The health hazards being created by the current strike of private garbage collection crews, and the initiation by the city Sanitation Department of emergency pickups to cope with the mounting refuse, underscores the desirability of closer integration of public and private sanitation services on a permanent basis.

title: Shift by U.S. Energy Aide On Uranium Is Described
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The head of the nation's energy research program opposed a controversial plan to get private Industry into the business of producing enriched uranium until just a few weeks before President Ford sent the plan to Congress, the Joint Atomic Energy Committee was told today.

title: Britain's Reserves Down $107 Million in November
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (UPI)Britain's gold and dollar reserves fell by $107 million in November after accruals of foreigncurrency borrowing by the public sector under the exchange cover program totaling $175 million, the Treasury said today.

title: Reserve Acted to Protect Dollar in Default Threat
description: The foreign exchange markets were unsettled and required central bank intervention to stablize conditions in September and October when a New York City default appeared imminent, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: 2 Centuries of Cartoonists' Thrusts Hit Home Again
description: Once upon a time; a firstrate political cartoonist could be one of the most powerful men in the country. People loved him, courted him, envied him, feared him. Abraham Lincoln said in 1864 that the cartoonist Thomas Nast has been our best recruiting sergeant.

title: Chopped Beef: For Consumers It's the Fat Factor That Counts
description: Which is the getter buy: a pound or ground chuck selling for 89 cents or one selling for $1.09? In certain cases the one selling for $1.09, according to the Suffolk County Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Minnesotans Give Brahms and Bruckner
description: If the temperature inside Carnegie Hall last night was lower than it was outside, put the blame on two very cool musicians, Stanislaw Skrowaczewski and Alexis Weissenberg. Both are hugely competent technicians, and both represent almost a superobjective approach toward music. They complement each other. Put them together, as in Brahms's D minor' Piano Concerto; and the result is a performance glittering with icicles.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Alfred Satin and his son, Harold, pleaded guilty yesterday to filing false Medicaid bills amounting to $50,000 through their Hillcrest Nursing Home in Spring Valley, N. Y. Charles J. Hynes, the special prosecutor, said the Satins had charged Medicaid for a servant, food, taxes and construction work unconnected with the home. The Satins, who have other nursinghome and property interests in New York City, agreed to repay the $50,000 before sentencing, scheduled for Jan. 22.

title: Israel Tells U.N. It Is Ready to Negotiate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Dec. 2  Israel told the General Assembly today that it was prepared to enter into new negotiations on the Middle East at any moment without any preconditions whatsoever.

title: Dance: Sokolow Tribute
description: The Contemporary Dance System is not a dataprocessing organization but a small, young dance company still in the throes of finding itself but obviously inching to its destination.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNTER DROP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell sharply yesterday in accelerated trading.

title: Overtime Paying N.F.L. Dividends
description: Of the 143 games played in the National Football League this season, eight have gone into a suddendeath overtime period. That is an astoundingly high figure in view of the history of overtime in the N.F.L. The regulation providing for the extra period was applied to regularseason games for the first time last year, and of the 182 contests only two went into overtime, one being the GiantsJets game that the Jets won, 2620. The first team to score wins the game, but Pittsburgh and Denver failed to score after 15 minutes of overtime and wound up in a 3535 tie. This season there have been no ties.

title: Candid Chef Tells Of Food and Ideas
description: CHICAGO  After a delicious luncheon of goulash, sour cream, pat, crusty bread, butter, several wines and strudel had been devoured, the conversation turned to la cuisine minceur, or slimming cookery, which frowns upon cream, eggs, sugar and butter all in the name of pampering a gourmet's palate while stifling his waistline.

title: MUSIC CONTRACT VOTED IN DETROIT
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2Musicians of the Detroit Symphony Orchestra ratified a new threeyear contract today that gives them a greater voice in the dismissal of orchestra members and a substantial wage increase.

title: Nastase Topples Orantes
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 2The day smelled of roses for Ilie Nastase, who mixed a little comedy with serious tennis and stayed in contention for the big money in the Grand Prix Masters tennis tournament today.

title: Connors Heads Davis Cup Team for Mexico Series
description: Jimmy Connors, Brian Gottfried, Harold Solomon, Dick Stockton and Erik van Dillen were named yesterday to the United States team that will meet Mexico on Dec. in the third round of the 1976 Davis Cup.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The House Commerce Committee approved today an emergency bill that would let some interstate pipelines augment inadequate natural gas supplies by buying gas in intrastate markets at prices above the Federal ceiling on interstate sales.

title: Terrorists Kill 2, Hold 50 on Dutch Train
description: THE HAGUE, Wednesday, Dec. 3Five armed extremists who want independence for the South Molucca Islands in Indonesia seized a train in the north of the Netherlands yesterday, killing at least two men and taking about 50 hostages.

title: COMMON MARKET REACHES ACCORDS
description: ROME, Dec. 2After two grueling days, the heads of government of the Common Market reached a series of agreements tonight designed to bring them closer to a working unity and to clear the way for the world conference on energy and raw materials next month.

title: COMMON MARKET REACHES ACCORDS
description: ROME, Dec. 2After two grueling days, the heads of government of the Common Market reached a series of agreements tonight designed to bring them closer to a working unity and to clear the way for the world conference on energy and raw Materials next month.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israeli jets attacked Palestinian camps in northern and southern Lebanon, inflicting the heaviest reported death toll in such raids in 18 months. The Palestinian press service said 57 people had been killed. Israeli military spokesmen said the raids had followed information of terrorist concentrations, and an official said the guerrillas' main bases, training camps and nerve centers were located in Lebanon. [Page 1, Columns 78.]

title: INFORMER SCORES F.B.I. ON VIOLENCE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)A top official of the Federal Bureau of Investigation today called the campaign against the Ku Klux Klan the bureau's finest hour, but a onetime informer said that agents rarely acted to head off Klan attacks against blacks and civil rights workers.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 3, 1975

title: ISRAELI JETS HIT PALESTINIAN SITES IN LEBANON RAIDS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 2Israeli jets attacked Palestinian camps in northern and southern Lebanon today, inflicting the heaviest reported death toll in such raids in a year and a half.

title: Conferees Back Energy Research Bill With Loan Guarantees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  A HouseSenate conference approved today a $5.9 billion energy research bill that included authority for the Government to guarantee up to $6 billion of loans for privately owned energy production facilities.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: The General Services Administration has released the names and model numbers of appliances that it found to be cheapest both in initial price and energy costs over the life of the product.

title: Additional Evidence Points to Daily Diet As a Cancer Cause
description: Cancer specialists are finding increasing evidence that ingredients of the daily diet may be causing, directly or indirectly, half of all cancers among women and 30 percent of those among men.

title: Juilliard and Philharmonic Plan Festival of 20thCentury Music
description: A nineday festival and symposium devoted to 20thcentury music will be presented at the Juilliard School in March by Juilliard, the New York PhilharmOnic and the Fromm Music Foundation with financial support from the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: Dance: Merce Cunningham's Events
description: Merce Cunningham and his Dance Company opened a week's series of his Events at the Roundabout Theater last night. Each Event will be different, and as they are numbered chronologically and individually by the company, they will run from Event No. 143. (last night) through Event No. 148 (next Sunday night).

title: U.S. Fleet Training Off Spain
description: ALMERIA, Spain, Dec. 2 (AP) Units of the United States Sixth Fleet began training maneuvers today off this southern Spanish coast city.

title: U.S. Court Puts Off Decision On Gilmour's Appeal for Writ
description: William (Buddy) Gilmour's request for an injunction against two New York harness tracks was taken under advisement yesterday in Federal Court after a twohour hearing Gilmour might end. You're being gloriously indefinite.

title: Jersey Bell Asks Rate Rise Of 20% for Home Service
description: NEWARK, Dec. (AP)The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company asked for a rate increase today that would raise basic home telephone bills about 20 percent.

title: City Lists Precautions During Garbage Strike
description: Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan recommended the following precautions to reduce fire hazards during the strike of private carting com, panies:

title: Ford in China . . .
description: The first American Presidential visit to Peking in three and a half years naturally, has opened with a discussion of the country that, inadvertently, brought the United States and Communist China together in the first placethe Soviet Union. The uneasy triangular relationship of each of these great powers with the other two put Moscow at an advantage until Washington and Peking opened their dialogue in 197172. President Ford's journey and Chairman Mao's long, intimate talk with him are intended to make it clear to Moscow that this dialogue goes on despite the vast changes that since have occurred.

title: Truck Stuck Under Track Disrupts IRT in the Bronx
description: Subway service on the Bronx IRT No. 2 and 5 lines was temporarily disrupted yesterday when a tractortrailer truck wedged beneath the elevated tracks at the Simpson Street station.

title: Newspaper Guild Ratifies 3Year Pact at The News
description: Members of the Newspaper Guild at The Daily News yesterday overwhelmingly ratified a new threeyear contract covering editorial, commercial and miscellaneous employees at the paper. The vote for approval was 605 to 90.

title: A Party Where Elegance Was the Norm
description: They could have danced all night, and almost did, at what was generally considered one of the most elegant parties of the year.

title: Panama Accepts U.S. Control Of the Canal, Bunker Discloses
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 2Ambassador Ellsworth Bunker said today that the United States would retain primary responsibility for the operation and defense of the Panama Canal for the lifetime of the new treaty it is negotiating with the Panamanian Government

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: 5 Years of Busing in Pontiac, Mich.: Gains and Losses
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Dec. 2This automobilefactory town 25 miles northwest of Detroit is where the Great School Busing Controversy first burst fully upon the Northern consciousness. In August 1971 the Ku Klux Klan bombed 10 school buses here, and from that time on busing was a national issue, not just a Southern one.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Ruling Due Tomorrow On a New Gross Trial
description: NEWARK, Dec. 2A Federal District Court judge said today that he would rule on Thursday whether Nelson G. Gross, the former state Republitan chairman who was convicted last year of illegal campaign financing activities, will get a new trial.

title: Columbia Victor, 8377, As C.C.N.Y. Rally Fails
description: Elmer Love, a 6foot6inch sophomore forward, scored 22 secondhalf points tonight, including Columbia's last 10 as the Lions posted an 8377 victory over City College in their season opener at Levien Gym. Love had 27 points.

title: STATE HEARING TOLD OF FILTH AT SCHOOL
description: TRENTON, (UPI) Dec. 2A worker at the New Lisbon State School for retarded males told a legislative panel today of instances of roaches in food and mice droppings in the cottages at the institution.

title: A.J.C. Acts to Spur Boycott Disclosures
description: The American Jewish Congress announced yesterday that it would instigate shareholder resolutions designed to force more than 100 leading American corporations to disclosel any involvement in the Arab boycott against Israel.

title: DR. SAMUEL MOORE, CORNELL PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Samuel Wilson Moore, who at his retirement in 1971 was professor of surgery at the Cornell University Medical College and attending surgeon at New York Hospital, the Sharon. (Conn.) Hospital and the Lawrence Hospital in Mooresville, N.C., died Monday at the Sharon Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived on Low Road in Sharon.

title: ROBERT M. DEARDORFF
description: Robert M. Deardorff, a freelance travel writer, died yesterday in Paris. He was 61 years old and lived in Rome.

title: Houston's Mayor Is Reelected In Big Turnout of Black Voters
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 2A heavy turnout of black voters helped to reelect Mayor Fred Hofheinz tonight in a runoff race that was focused as much on New York City's problems as on Houston's.

title: U.S. Seeks Mideast Talks, but Soviet Seems Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The United States announced today that it had formally proposed to the Soviet Union that they join in convening a preparatory meeting for a new Middle East peace conference at Geneva that could decide whether to invite the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: CLERON L. HENDERSON
description: Cleron L. Henderson, an oildrilling specialist, died Monday at his home in Westport, Conn He was 49 years old.

title: CONFEREES AGREE ON $36 BILLION BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)Senate and House conferees, reaching final agreement on a $36 billion money bill, dropped today a major Senate amendment aimed at busing to desegregate schools.

title: Harvest Failures in Soviet Limit '76 Economic Goals
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2The Soviet leadership said today that extensive harvest failures this year had forced it to scale down economic production goals for 1976.

title: Wallace Irks Meeting of Democratic Governors by Staying Away
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama. who has a way of spooking his fellow governors, did it again todaythis time without even showing up for one of their periodic meetings.

title: SOUTH AFRICA ROLE IN ANGOLA GROWS
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 2South African involvement in the civil war in neighboring Angola is being made increasingly clear in official and unofficial statements, and the situation has become a focus of national discussion.

title: INFLATION IS CALLED A PERIL TO HOUSING
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 2Harry S. Schwartz, chief economist of the Federal National Mortgage Association, said today that the nation's severely depressed housing industry had little chance of recovery until the country brought inflation under control.

title: Controllers Are Helped by Computers in Averting MidAir Collisions
description: A fast increasing number of airtraffic controllers are being backstopped by a new alert system that officials are confident would have averted the incident that brought two jumbo jets within 100 feet of a headon midair collision near Detroit last week.

title: Fire Kills Four in Family
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 2 (UPI)Fire swept a small wood frame home in suburban Wood Dale today, killing a mother and her three children and injuring five other members of the family. The police identified the dead as Maria Ochoa, 36 years old, and her children Noemi, 12, Jabriea, 4, and Fernando, 3.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Bullets Subdue Lakers
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 2 (UPI) Wes Unseld and Elvin Hayes converted a pair of free throws each in the last 18 seconds tonight to give the Washington Bullets a 107104 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Spirits Get Stars Of Stars
description: The American Basketball Association officially put the Utah Stars franchise out of business yesterday and allowed the sale of their four best playersMoses Malone, Ron Boone, Randy Denton and Steve Greento the Spirits of St. Louis.

title: Defense Plan for Miss Hearst Is Set
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 2Patricia Hearst's defense will be that she was an unwilling participant in the bank robbery for which she is charged, one of her lawyers said today.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The business manager of the Passaic County Vocation School was ordered removed from his office by the Appellate Division of Superior Court. The court reversed a lower court ruling and granted State Attorney General William F. Hyland's request for removal from office of Alex Smollok of Clifton for refusing to testify before a grand jury.

title: Stocks Off Sharply; Dow Drops by 13.14
description: The stock market, apparently. tired from its climb last week, took a sharp tumble yesterday for its biggest drop since late October.

title: Networks Slate 18 New Series In Drastic Shifts in Prime Time
description: Extensive program changes made by all three networks, affecting 42 percent of the primetime schedule, will result in the equivalent of a new television season around the first of the year.

title: 2 Mitigating Effects On Harm to Ozone Doubted at Parley
description: Two effects that it had been hoped were mitigating the suspected effect of fluorocarbon spray can propellants on ozone in the stratosphere appear to be of little consequence, according to reports presented yesterday to a chemical congress in Mexico City.

title: The General's Dilemma
description: BRASILIA, Brazil  It is easier to step into a swamp than to scramble out of it and that is the experience of Brazil's military regime. The armed forces seized power in 1964 and since then, with the aid of selected technocrats, they have governed this complex, fascinating and gigantic land.

title: Harvest Failures in Soviet Limit '76 Economic Goals
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2The Soviet leadership said today that extensive harvest failures this year had forced it to scale down economic production goals for 1976.

title: Muhammad Ali Rescues A Center for Aging Here
description: Just after 9:30 A.M. yesterday Muhammad All walked into the Hillside Aged Program Center in Washington Heights and told the director, Maria Brown, that he would like to provide enough money to keep the faltering program alive for at least a year.

title: Broadcast Pay of Congressmen Is Approved by Election Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Federal Election Commission ruled today that a member of Congress can accept regular payments for broadcast appearances without violating the statutory ceiling on honorariums that is designed to prevent bribes disguised as speaking fees.

title: Area Fives Anticipate a Top Year
description: If the first Joe Lapchick Memorial basketball tournament last weekend was any indication, the local college basketball season is going to be one of the best.

title: Mr. Steinbrenner's Dream House
description: If New York City had any class it would start paying Catfish Hunter's salary without another day's delay. The Cat is one of the chief drawing cards the city is relying on to boost Yankee Stadium attendance to 2 million next summer and thus enable the taxpayers to get some return on their $75 million investment in the park. The least the taxpayers can do is take the burden of his wages, bonuses, insurance premiums and such off the Yankees, who have long been an ornament to the big town, except for the last 11 years. Appreciating the contributions of George Steinbrenner and his partners, Fun City is not only fixing them a playground three times as expensive as Shea Stadium and assuming indirect costs that may add another $150 million, but has agreed to pay $215,000 for tarpaulin, $65,000 for security devices and $14,000 on the Yankees' own scoreboard besides putting toilets, bars and refrigerators in the private boxes on the club level.

title: Blue Shield Starts Plan for 2d Opinion On Some Surgery
description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Greater New York is introducing an experimental program to see if a second professional opinion to confirm the need for nonemergency surgery will eliminate unnecessary operations. The hospital and medical insurance plan will pay all costs and expenses involved in the second opinion.

title: STUDY DOUBTS RISE IN AID PROGRAMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The array of Federal income assistance programsfrom Social Security to food stampswill not grow much in the next 25 years as a share of the nation's total output of goods and services unless Congress and the Administration keep adding to benefits as they have done in the last 20 years, a Congressional Budget Office study concluded today.

title: WINE TALK
description: The wine book crop this Christmas bears some resemblance to the vintage in Bordeaux: smaller than last year but good. quality. This time last year, publishers were elbowing one another aside in the rush to trumpet their latest wine book and a lot of silliness got into print.

title: Pension Funds Set to Sell Bonds at Loss to Aid City
description: The five municipal employee pension funds moved yesterday to raise cash for the city's needs this week and next week by scheduling a sale of $155.6 million in corporate bond holdings at what officials said would probably be a 15 percent loss.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PAST AND PRESENT Back in 1934, The Scarlet Pimpernel, the first film derived from Baroness Orczy's novel of the French Revolution, had much to do with the continuing success of the pioneering British screen industry. Pimpernel. with Leslie Howard as the mysterious gallant who rescued doomed aristocrats from the guillotine, and Merle Oberon and Raymond Massey, hasn't been shown locally in some years. The drama gets a screening at 8:30 o'clock tonight at the Undercroft Coffeehouse of Christ and St. Stephen's Church, 120 West 69th Street (between Broadway and Columbus Avenue). The Wednesday movie series at the church also includes free popcorn with the requested $1.50 donation.

title: Profit in 3d Quarter Lifts Rails Out of Red
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) Thirdquarter earnings of the nation's railroads jumped into the profit column for the first time this year but still were 53 percent below the net figures for the same period in 1974, the Association of American Railroads said today. The association reported the railroad showed $115.2 million in ordinary net income for the third quarter.

title: About Education
description: Churchrelated colleges, whose appetite for public funds and academic prestige has led many to adopt more secular styles of operation, are beginning to take a new and more positive look at their religious traditions.

title: EXCHIEF OF NAVY ACCUSES KISSINGER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr., the raked Chief of Naval Operations, charged today that Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger had withheld information from President Ford about what he termed gross violations by the Soviet Union of the 1972 agreements on limitation of strategic arms.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, Dec. 2, 1975.

title: Coalition Opens Drive for a Women's Agenda
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  A coalition of 93 national women's organizations opened a drive today to win adoption of its 11point women's agenda for full equality.

title: EMERGENCY ENDED FOR LISBON REGION
description: LISBON Dec. 2President Francisco da Costa Gomes lifted the state of siege in the Lisbon military region today after it was clear that an attempted leftists coup had been smashed.

title: TaxExempt Bond Offerings of 3 States Given Warm Reception
description: The taxexempt market, still uncertain about New York obligations, gave a reasonably cordial reception yesterday to new bond offerings from Minnesota, Washington and Missouri. The new offerings were not large and all carried good credit ratings. Minnesota, for example, marketed $37 million of variouspurpose bonds, which were won by underwriters headed by the First National City Bank with a bid setting a 5.6097 percent average annual borrowing cost to the state.

title: CLERON L. HENDERSON
description: Cleron L. Henderson, an oildrilling specialist, died Monday at his home in Westport, Conn. He was 49 veers old.

title: Drapeau: Olympics in Danger
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 2Mayor Jean Drapeau of Montreal has conceded for the first time, in a television interview, that the 1976 Olympic Games are in danger because of construction delays.

title: In Israel After U.N. Vote, Feelings of Isolation and Frustration
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 2Rarely have Israelis felt more frustrated and alone.
