title: Moscow's Africa Policy Criticized by Moynihan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Daniel P. Moynihan said today that Soviet and Cuban military involvement in Angola meant that Moscow intended to colonize Africa.

title: Klara Barlow Stands Out As Met Elektra Substitute
description: Kara Barlow, who stepped in successfully as Isolde to save a Metropolitan Opera performance of the Wagner work two seasons ago, did the same thing for the company's presentation of Richard Strauss's Elektra on Monday night. Danica Mastilovic, who had sung the title role in the work when it was given for the first time this fall, became ill. Miss Barlow took her place and gave a remarkable portrayal in one the most demanding roles in opera.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Ewald B. Nyquist, the New York State Education Commissioner, called yesterday day for immediate emergency aid for City University divorced from the question of tuition. This development contributed to a growing optimism at the Board of Higher Education that the city might relent on its demand for a $55 million cut from the university's spring budget.

title: Muhammad Ali Rescues A Center for Aging Here
description: Just after 9:30 A.M. yesterday Muhammad Ali walked into the Hillside Aged Program Center in Washington Heights and told the director, Maria Brown, that he would like to provide enough money to keep the faltering program alive for at least a year.

title: Reserve Aide Says More Banks May Turn to Cuts in Dividends
description: Robert C. Holland, a member of the Federal Reserve Board, predicted yesterday that banks and bank holding companies would be increasingly likely to reduce their dividend payments to stockholders in the period immediately ahead.

title: $502 Million Default Set By Continental Mortgage
description: Continental Mortgage Investors, the nation's second largest realestate investment trust, said yesterday in Boston that it was in default on $502.7 million of principal and interest under shortterm domestic and Eurodollar credit agreements.

title: Dolphins Lose Morrall In Victory Over Patriots
description: MIAMI, Dec. 2 (UPI)The Miami Dolphins' reserve quarterback Earl Morall suffered a partial ligament tear in his knee during last night's 207 victory over New England and will be out for at least two to three weeks, Coach Don Shula said today.

title: DR. E. GRACE WHITE
description: Dr. E. Grace White, a marine biologist, died Monday in a nursing home near Chambersburg, Pa., where she lived. She was 85 years old.

title: Nadjari's Rao Indictments Are Dismissed by Murtagh
description: Justice John M. Murtagh of State Supreme Court yesterday dismissed the perjury indictments against Judge Paul P. Rao Sr. of United States Customs Court and two lawyers, declaring that the evidence presented to a special grand jury was in complete violation of the rules of evidence.

title: Imetal Wins Control In Copperweld Bid
description: Socit Imetal, the huge metal and mining complex owned by the Paris branch of the Rothschild family, has gained effective control of Copperweld Inc. of Pittsburgh, according to a count of Comerweld shares tendered in response to Imetal's offer. Imetall announced yesterday that up to the present, it had received tenders of about 1,593,000 common shares of Copperweld worth a total of $64.48 million including about 295,000 shares for Which delivery is guaranteed.

title: Dave Koslo Is Dead at 55; Former Pitcher on Giants
description: MENASHA, Wis., Dec. 2 (AP) Dave Koslo, a former pitcher with the New York Giants, died here last night. He was 55 years old.The cause of death was not immediately ascertained, and an autopsy was planned.

title: Report by Philanthropic Group Proposes Ways to Spur Giving
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The results of a twoyear, $2 millioni study of ways to encourage philanthropic giving were offidaily made public today amid criticism that the study had concentrated almost entirely on steps to preserve the status quo.

title: Emeric Partos, 70, Fur Designer Noted for Innovative Flair, Dead
description: Emeric Partos, the innovative fur designer who headed Bergdorf Goodman's fur salon for 20 years, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 70 years old and lived at 20 East 65th Street.

title: Retention of Picatinny Arsenal Lifts Holiday Spirits
description: DOVER, Dec. 2  There were broad smiles on the faces of many Christmas shoppers at the bankrupt Dover Shopping Center here today now that they know the Picatinny Arsenal will remain open.

title: Silas Stars as Spurs Top Squires, 119101
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 2James Silas scored 21 points and six teammates hit in double figures tonight as the San Antonio Spurs downed the Virginia Squires, 119101.

title: SPANISH REPORTED LEAVING SAHARA
description: MADRID, Dec. 2Spain is reported to have begun a military withdrawal from the Spanish Sahara territory in an effort to avoid involvement in possible fighting between Moroccan troops and Algerianbacked forces.

title: Average Yield 5.822% At 139Day Bill Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Treasury auctioned 139day bills today at an average yield of 5.822 percent.

title: ExCity Inspector Found Guilty Of Accepting Illegal Gratuities
description: The city's former chief construction inspector in Manhattan was found guilty yesterday of three counts of receiving unlawful gratuities in the latest trial to result from a major constructiongraft scandal involving city employees and building and real estate people.

title: RIGHTISTS IN LAOS ARE FACING ECLIPSE
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 2 (Reuters)All diplomatic missions were reported today to have received official word that rightist participation in governing Laos was near an end.

title: JOHN F. M'CABE JR.
description: John F. McCabe Jr., a management consultant, died Monday at Sloan Kettering Institute for Cancer Research. He was 64 years old and lived in Fair Haven. N. J.

title: Stiltwalkers Step Out for Boutique Mall
description: After four years of sitting empty, the Airlines Building across from Grand Central Terminal officially reopened yesterday, the old rows of ticket counters replaced by 48 boutiques.

title: Ohio State Star Is First to Gain Trophy Twice
description: Archie Griffin of Ohio State, one of the smallest athletes to win the annual Heisan Trophy as the outstanding college football player in the United States, yesterday became the first man to be voted the award twice.

title: Gold Prices
description: Selected world gold prices Tuesday.

title: Samuel I. Parker, 84, Won 3 Top Medals for Gallantry
description: CONCORD, N.C., Dec. 2 (AP)Samuel I. Parker, who won all three of the nation's highest awards for gallantry in combat, died yesterday at Walter Reed Army Hospital in Washington. He was 84 years old.

title: DR. E. GRACE WHITE
description: Dr. E. Grace White, a marine biologist, died Monday in a nursing home near Chambersburg, Pa., where she lived. She was 85 years old.

title: Nadjari's Rao Indictments Are Dismissed by Murtagh
description: Justice John M. Murtagh of State Supreme Court yesterday dismissed the perjury indictments against Judge Paul P. Rao Sr. of United States Customs Court and two lawyers, declaring that the evidence presented to a special grand jury was in complete violation of the rules of evidence.

title: COUNCIL UNIT BALKS AT LICENSEFEE RISE
description: The City Council Finance Committee warned the Beanie administration yesterday that it would not approve proposed licensefee increases requested by the Police Department unless the amount of money raised by the increases was sufficient to cover the administrative cost.

title: Smoking Rises Among Girls And Never Mind the Perils
description: Between her 10 and 11 o'clock classes. Lynnette ducks into the girls' lavatory of Louis D. Brandeis High School in Manhattan to smoke her seventh Marlboro of the day. Lynnette is 15 years old.

title: People in Sports
description: Bill Campbell, who managed to double his victories in his second year as Columbia's football coach (from one to two) was rewarded yesterday with a new threeyear pact, which extends through June 30, 1979. His old contract still had 1 years to run.

title: Mayors Fear Money Cuts May Harm Cities' Viability
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 2Talk about bankruptcy of cities, fed by the troubles of New York City, has most recently centered on the possibility of default on financial obligations.

title: . . . a Transition Visit
description: In these circumstances, apart from philosophic exchanges, shortterm matters undoubtedly have the greatest importance in President Ford's China visit. Disagreement about United Nations action on Korea and the vocal support of China for the North and the United States for the South are unlikely to conceal the firm intention of both Washington and Peking to restrain their clients, and to avoid any possibility of an armed clash. With Soviet penetration active in Vietnam, Laos, India and the Indian Ocean, Peking has made it clear that it now desires an active American role in South and Southeast Asia in support of the independence of the nations there. Thailand, Japan and the Philippines have been given reason to believe that American bases in those countriescause Peking no displeasure.

title: At the Potter's Wheel, Her Art Took Shape
description: Clay. It's rain, dead leaves, dust, all my dead ancestors. Stones that have been ground to sand. Mud The whole cycle of life and death.

title: Picasso SelfPortrait Is Sold for $572,670
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 A selfportrait of Pablo Picasso painted in Paris 74 years ago was sold today at auction by Christies here to an anonymous French buyer for 283,500 ($572,670).

title: RAID ON L.I. AIMS AT LOANSHARKING
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 2Acting on evidence obtained through telephone wiretaps, law enforcement authorities in Brooklyn, Queens and Nassau and Suffolk counties today raided homes and businesses of suspected Mafia members in a crackdown on what was described as the biggest gambling and loansharking ring on Long Island.

title: Dr. Dorothy Houghton Dies, FoodChemistry Specialist
description: Dr. Dorothy Houghton, a specialist in food chemistry and nutrition, died Monday at Phelps Memorial Hospital, North Tarrytown, N. Y. She was 74 years old and lived at Tarrytown.

title: FUELS BASED ON OIL ARE TERMED AMPLE
description: The American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday that its latest statistics showed both ample production and supplies of oilbased fuels.

title: Human Futures Are Promoted by the Board of Trade
description: One hundred years ago, the state of New York chartered an organization known as the New York Cheap Transportation Association, whose aim was to promote the city as the focal point for the shipment of goods between Europe and the Middle West.

title: Night Court Reprieved By U.S. Funds Until June
description: The road was cleared yesterday for the city's Night Courts, scheduled to shut down at the end of this month for lack of city funds, to remain open at least until June with the use of Federal funds.

title: Argentine Rightists Kill 11 in 2 Days In Drive on Leftists
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 2An upsurge of rightwing terrorism, in which 11 persons have been killed in two days, has followed the start of a campaign by the armed forces to exterminate leftwing subversion in Argentina.

title: POSTAL STRIKERS RETURN IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 2By a narrow vote, Canadian post office employees ended today a nationwide strike that had left the country without regular mail service for six weeks, at a cost of millions of dollars to businesses, charities and the strikers themselves.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: It was incorrectly reported in The New York Times yesterday that the developer of a jai alai fronton in Bridgeport had been charged with improperly obtaining a $100,000 loan from the Bridgeport office of the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company. The developer, David Friend, received the loan from the Connecticut National Bank of Bridgeport.

title: Royal Award Completes Profamo Rehabilitation
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (Reuters) John Profumo, the former Cabinet minister who became a social outcast after a sex scandal 12 years ago, was finally accepted back into society today as he received an award from Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Additional Evidence Indicates That Diet Is a Cancer Cause
description: Cancer specialists are finding increasing evidence that ingredients of the daily diet may be causing, directly or indirectly, half of all cancers among women and 30 percent of those among men.

title: HARVESTER LISTS A RECORD DEFICIT
description: The International Harvester Com??any ended its 1975 fiscal year with a loss of $40.9 million, its largest quarterly loss, after posting a record profit of $65.2 million in its opening quarter. The deficit reported yesterday is in contrast to a profit of $29 million, or $1.04 a share, reported in the fourth fiscal quarter of the previous year.

title: I.R.S. Official Calls Florida Sex Inquiry Money WellSpent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) An Internal Revenue Service official said today he considered expenditures for Operation Leprechaun, which gathered sex and booze information on 30 prominent Floridians, money wellspent.

title: Dave Koslo Is Dead at 55; Former Pitcher on Giants
description: MENASHA, Wis., Dec. 2 (AP) Dave Koslo, a former pitcher with the New York Giants, died here last night. He was 55 years old.

title: Seymour Hersh is Winner Of John Zenger Award
description: The University of Arizona's 1975 John Peter Zenger Award has been won by Seymour M. Hersh of The New York Times for his articles on domestic surveillance by the Central Intelligence Agency and other Investigative reporting.

title: Notes on People
description: The troubled Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions, in Santa Barbara, Calif., has five new directors to strengthen its depleted board. They were elected Monday in Washington at a board meeting of the Fund for the Republic, the center's legal entity.

title: Colts Give Giants Example Of How to Rebuild a Winner
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Dec. 2Bill Arnsparger offered some maxims today. They won't go down in literary with the epigrams. of Ben Franklin.

title: Professional Football
description: National Conference

title: City Begins Emergency Garbage Pickups
description: City officials set up emergency procedures yesterday for the removal by city sanitationmen of health and fire hazards resulting from the twodayold strike by private garbage cartmen.

title: For Festive Days, A Fabled Dish In French Lore
description: One of the fabledbut genuineglories of the French table is a dish or ingredient that has received little notice in America. Except for some rare and special occasions, it is almost nonexistent in the nation's French restaurants.

title: Samuel I. Parker, 84, Won 3 Top Medals for Gallantry
description: CONCORD, N.C., Dec. 2 (AP)Samuel I. Parker, who won all three of the nation's highest awards for gallantry in combat, died yesterday at Walter Reed Army Hospital in Washington. He was 84 years old.

title: Government Workers' Strike Is Called Off Early in Japan
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Dec. 3 (Reuters)The worst strike in Japanese labor history, a walkout by public workers that crippled the national railway system, was called off ahead of schedule today.

title: Computer Apprentice at M.I.T. Aids Composers
description: During several decades or revolutionary advances in electronics, musicians have not found computers much help in either composing or analyzing pieces of music. The computers demanded that musicians learn whole new languages of letters and numbers and programs.

title: William J. Mulder Jr. Dies; Construction Engineer, 55
description: William J. Mulder Jr. a partner in the consulting engineering firm of Edwards and Kelcey, died yesterday at Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N. J. He was 55 years old and lived in North Caldwell, N. J.

title: To Save the Schools
description: The schools have borne a disproportionate share of the essential cutbacks in New York City's expenditures. This disparity of sacrifice has been forced on the Board of Education, at least in part, because of the suspicion that City Hall and the United Federation of Teachers are still trying to channel funds into teachers' salary increments and other benefits rather than into the maintenance of direct teaching services for children.

title: 880 DELIVERERS OF MILK ON STRIKE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 2 (AP)Drivers who deliver milk to retail stores in northern New Jersey went on strike today.

title: Zambia Leader Urges Pullout
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 2 (Reuters)President Kenneth D. Kaunda demanded today that all foreign military forces withdraw from Angola and urged the formation of a government of national unity. He also appealed to the Organization of African Unity to call for an immediate ceasefire in the civil war.

title: Court Gets 4th Appeal to Cancel Intrastate Commuter Fare Rise
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2, (UPI)Opponents of intrastate fare increases on more than 30 bus and rail lines in New Jersey filed an appeal against the rises today, the fourth such appeal filed in five days.

title: Common Market Passport Is Agreed Upon for 1978
description: ROME, Dec. 2For 250 million Western Europeans a uniform passport is to be issued beginning in 1978 as a symbol of unity of the European Common Market, leaders of the community decided here today.

title: LAWRENCE RILEY, 78, WROTE '35 STAGE HIT
description: Lawrence Hugh Riley, who wrote the Broadway stage success Personal Appearance, a 1935 hit, died Saturday at Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 32 Lockwood Road, Riverside, Conn.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: It was incorrectly reported in The New York Times yesterday that the developer of a jai alai fronton in Bridgeport had been charged with improperly obtaining a $100,000 loan from the Bridgeport office of the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company. The developer, David Friend, received the loan from the Connecticut National Bank of Bridgeport.

title: FORD MEETS MAO IN EARNEST TALK
description: PEKING, Wednesday, Dec. 3 Chairman Mao Tsetung met with President Ford for an hour and 50 minutes yesterday, and the President said later that they had had a significant conversation about international issues including ChineseAmerican relations.

title: Planned Economy: Better Image
description: Economic planning is fast becoming the liberal utopian ideal of the 1970's. Despite the ??uzziness of the concept and the difficulty of defining it, planning  American style  is seen by many as the way out of the woods for the United States economy, hobbled by repeated crises, by high unemployment and inflation, and by a standard of living that seems stalled rather than ascendant.

title: Supreme Court Sustains Curb On Mailing of Some Firearms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Supreme Court unanimously sustained today the Federal law that forbids the mailing of fireanns that can be concealed on the person. The decision rejected a lower appeals court's ruling that the law was so vague that it was unconstitutional.

title: Issues in Carters' Strike
description: PARTICIPANTSLocal 813, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Bernard Adelstein, secretarytreasurer, with 1,700 members in the five boroughs. Negotiators representing 450 carting companiesAssociation of Trade Waste Removers of Greater New York, Salvatore Spinelli, counsel; Brooklyn Trade Waste Association, Patsy Davanzo; Queens County Trade Waste Association, Alfred F. Muscio; Carting Employers Group. Joseph Monica.

title: 28 LOTTERY BUYERS WIN $10.000 PRIZES
description: TRENTON, DEC. 2 (UPI)New Jersey's new version of the Instant Lottery, which began Nov, 1, has produced 28 winners of $10,000 and 34 winners of $1,776, Henry N. Luther 3d, the lottery director announced today.

title: Higher Cancer Risk Found in Marijuana Than in Tobacco
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 2Marijuana cigarettes contain higher concentrations of several cancercausing agents than tobacco cigarettes, according to research carried out by Indiana University's department of chemistry.

title: DOLLAR OFF 2D DAY; GOLD RISES SHARPLY
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 2 (UPI)The dollar, which opened yesterday at sevenweek highs, fell for the second consecutive day today on most European money markets, but London dealers said the dollar's undertone remained steady,

title: In Appalachia, Human Fuel
description: CARBONDALE, IllFor a variety of reasons, the coal mining community is a closed society. The working miner more or less eats and sleeps coal 24 hours a day. His friends are other coal miners, usually the same men he sees during his shift at work. His own wellbeing is tied to the wellbeing of the coal industry generally, and more specifically to the coal company he works for.

title: 2 Centuries of Cartoonists' Thrusts Hit Home Again
description: Once upon a time, a firstrate political cartoonist could be one of the most powerful men in the country. People loved him, courted him, envied him, feared him. Abraham Lincoln said in 1864 that the cartoonist Thomas Nast has been our best recruiting sergeant.

title: Juan Carlos Appoints a Rightist To 2 High Posts in Government
description: MADRID, Dec. 2King Juan, Carlos I, in a gesture toward the extreme right, tonight named Torcuato Fernndez Miranda, an opponent of Western European democracy, as Speaker of Parliament and Chairman of the Coundil of the Realm.

title: Nyquist Asks State Aid Rise for City U.
description: State Education Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist called yesterday for immediate emergency state mid to the City University, a development that contributed to a mood of rising budgetary hope at university headquarters.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: BUNGE IS ASSAILED IN A GUILTY PLEA
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 2A former grain elevator employee ended his grain theft trial today by pleading guilty shortly after his attorney charged that Bunge Corporation officials knew of greater irregularities at the elevator than those at issue in today's trial.

title: Feud Across the Bar
description: Three times in the last three weeks, Justice John M. Murtagh of State Supreme Court has dismissed indictments obtained by Maurice H. Nadjari, the special slate prosecutor, and in the veiled language of an opinion has struck implicitly at the heart of the prosecutor's work by telling him he was not doing a proper job before the grand jury.

title: Budget Data Not an Issue In Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2There were no news conferences in Moscow today by legislators who wished to denounce the Soviet Government's proposed budget for next year.

title: PRIORITY IS UPHELD FOR U.S. AS CREDITOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) The Government has a priority claim over other creditors for amounts due from an insolvent company which has defaulted on a Government contract, the Supreme Court ruled today. The decision was unanimous.

title: LUCY E. COOKE
description: Lucy Elizabeth Cooke, a teacher of piano and a conductor of choral music concerts who had taught in Nutley, N. J., as well as Jamestown and Springfield, N. Y., died Saturday in Cooperstown, N. Y. She was 77 years old and lived in Cooperstown.

title: From Julia Child: A New England Fish Chowder
description: Salt pork, onions, potatoes, milk and fish are the basic ingredients for a New England fish chowder, and there are as many ways of combining them in the region as there are cooks. One item I do find of great importance is a good fish stock; it gives clout and personality to the chowder, and if I don't have fish trimmings to make it with, I use a little clam juice.

title: TOP LEGISLATORS TESTIFY ON U.D.C.
description: Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut and the State Senate's majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, testified yesterday that they did not know that the Urban Development Corporal. tion had been in financial difficulty for more than three years before its collapse last February.

title: The Deuces Aren't Wild
description: AUSTIN, Tex.A tiny littleknown unheralded and underfinanced Tesearch facility in Austin has published some astonishing findings that promise an imminent and permanent return of good times. With only rudimentary equipment (For $1.49, it's a pretty good lighter) and a staff of two, S.T.B. Laboratories has just completed a tenyear study of money.

title: Hard Line
description: Choosing this moment to authorize establishment of several more settlements in occupied Syrian territory, Israel's coalition leadership has taken ea step that can only compound the country's problems in the months ahead. There is neither political nor Military validity the hotly debated decision to create additional settlements in theGolan Heights; it was in effect a gesture to the hardestline segment of Israel's internal political structure.

title: TV: NBC Updates Valley Forge
description: On paper, Valley Forge begins to look like Beacon Hill Revisited. The writer/ adapter is Sidney Carroll. The director is Fielder Cook. Both were associated with the elaborate debut of Beacon Hill. And the cast includes Nancy Marchand (Mrs. Lassiter), David Dukes (her onearmed, feckless son) and, in a bit part, Kathryn Walker (her gorgeous Bohemian daughter). Valley Forge, is, of course something else, but the credits indicate that the production has been attended with special care. And the quality does finally dominate in this Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation, which can be seen tonight at 8 o'clock on NBC.

title: It's Tempting, Soft and Easy On the Diet: A New Yogurt
description: It looks like soft ice cream. It even has a curl on top like soft ice cream. But it doesn't taste like soft ice creamand that's because it's yogurt.

title: State's Student Loan Plan Weathering All Adversity
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2 (AP)New Jersey's student loan program is weathering inflation, recession and defaults.

title: Celtics Defeat Knicks
description: Walt Frazier sat dejected in the dressing room last night, his right foot in a pan of ice water. The Knick captain had missed a deep jump shot from the left side that could have given his team a victory. Instead, the Boston Celtics won, 103100, before a capacity crowd of 19,694 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Corrections Group Urges Passage of Parole Bill
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2 (UPI)The New Jersey Association on Correction today urged the Assembly to pass the Parole Act of 1975 before it adjourns for the Christmas holidays.

title: Gordon Parks: An Artist Reminisces
description: Already late but hurrying to a 4 o'clock appointment, Gordon Parks darted through the glut of slowmoving traffic on First Avenue at 49th Street. He was anxiously scanning for an unengaged taxi to take him to a Paramount Pictures screening room for another look at his latest film, Leadbelly, which is to be released next year.

title: The Lesson From Peking
description: The most hopeful sign in the political world these days is that the communiques from all fronts are so modest. Almost everybody is piping down. Prices, unemployment, inflation and interest rates may be up, but big political promises and dreams are out of style.

title: $2.3 Billion Loan for City Voted by House, 213203
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The House of Representatives voted 213 to 203 tonight to authorize up to $2.3 billion a year in shortterm Federal loans to enable New York City to prevent a default.

title: New Funding Set for Education of Handicapped
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)President Ford has reluctantly signed a bill that establishes a new formula for the education of handicapped children, the White House said today.

title: Sales to Russians Have Scant Effect On Prices in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Soviet Union, as a result of this year's harvest, has bought more than 13 million tons of grain from the United States and additional amounts from other countries. Further purchases are expected in light of today's economic disclosures in Moscow.

title: Islanders Subdue Blues, 41
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 2Jean Potvin marched off the ice and shouted an exhuberant FrenchCanadian expletive. With his two powerplay goals and his straining stickcheck of Derek Sanderson on a critical short handed breakaway by the former Ranger, Potvin helped the New York Islanders post a 41 victory Cover the St. Louis Blues tonight before 16,291 mostly disgusted fans in the St. Louis Arena.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Vote in House on Bill for Loans to City
Music: Eto Plays Brahms
description: One of the secrets of playing chamber music for a large audience in a large hall is knowing precisely how much to exaggerate intimacies. Toshiya Eto, the Japanese violinist who played the second of his two Carnegie Hall concerts on Monday night, chose to make almost no concession to the size of the hall. He and his pianist, William Masselos, played the three Brahms sonatas for violin and piano (and the curious hybrid known as the F.A.E. Sonata., to which Brahms contributed only one movement) with the synchronization and musicianship one would expect of such duo.

title: Resolution for a 10% Pay Cut By Hartford Legislators Gains
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 2Support gathered among members of Connecticut's General Assembly today for a resolution urging the legislators themselves togive up 10 percent of their salaries to demonstrate their seriousness about cutting expenses and eliminating a mounting budget deficit.

title: Bishop Affirms Catholic Stand Concerning Israel
description: Bishop Bernard F. Law, newly elected head of the American Roman Catholic Bishops committee on ecumenical and interreligious affairs, said yesterday that Catholics should understand the Jewish view of the religious significance of Israel, but that they did not necessarily accept it when they supported Israel's right to exist.

title: STUDY DOUBTS RISE IN AID PROGRAMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The array of Federal income assistance programsfrom Social Security to food stampswill not grow much in the next 25 years as a share of the nation's total output of goods and services unless Congress and the Administration keep adding to benefits as they have done in, the last 20 years, a Congressional Budget Office study concluded today.

title: Bridge:
description: By their successful defense of the Reisinger team title in New Orleans during the weekend, Ira Rubin of Paramus, N. J., and his teammates, Fred Hamilton of Utica, Mich.; Erik Paulsen of Culver City, Calif., and Hugh Ross of Oakland, Calif., became the first players with a serious chance to represent North America in the 1976 world championship. They have already earned the right to fight for the 1975 world title in Monte Carlo in May.

title: DROP CONTINUES IN SUGAR FUTURES
description: The downward drift in world sugar prices continued yesterday on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, where the March delivery closed at 12.62 cents a pound, down from 12.78 cents.

title: TAX WITHHOLDING FACES '76 ERRORS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) Tax withholding for millions of Americans could be in error for the first six weeks of 1976 because of Congressional delay in acting on income tax legislation, the Internal Revenue Service said today. But any errors could be corrected in pay periods beginning about midFebruary an agency spokesman said.

title: DUMPSON RESIGNS AS WELFARE HEAD
description: James R. Dumpson resigned yesterday effective Dec. 31 after two years as the city's Human Resources Administrator, in charge of welfare and related programs that currently spend $2.8 billion a year.

title: From the Sands of Morocco to the Sidewalks of New York
description: The trade winds that carried the Moroccan fashion look to Paris recently have wafted across the Atlantic.

title: 5 GIVEN JAIL TERMS FOR STOCK SCHEME
description: A lawyer and two stock promoters from Texas were sentenced here yesterday to fiveyear prison terms for a $16 million securities fraud scheme.

title: College Football's Mighty Mite
description: Archie Mason Griffin turned in, three broken helmets to the Ohio State equipment manager during the recent football season. The parade of exchanges for new hard hats was caused by the intensity of opposing tacklers, who made the Buckeyes' star running back their No. 1 target after Griffin won the Heisman Trophy as a junior last year.

title: Market Place
description: While many of the nation's active investors are studying their stock portfolios in an effort to find holdings that should be sold for tax reasons in the final weeks of the year, others are scanning the stock tables in the hopes of finding bargains.

title: JOHN F. M'CABE JR.
description: John F. McCabe Jr., a management consultant, died Monday at Sloan Kettering Institute for Cancer Research. He was 64 years old and lived in Fair Haven, N. J.

title: Carey and Beame Act As Their Own Lobbyists
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Like accomplished chess players, Governor Carey and Mayor Beame were planning today several moves ahead of the game.

title: REAGAN MAPPING BIG EFFORT HERE
description: Ronald Reagan is preparing to challenge the uncommited status of the New York Republican organization by fielding candidates for delegates to the Republican. National Convention in selected areas of the state, a Reagan campaign aide said yesterday.

title: 100 Years of Commerce in the City Celebrated
description: Irving S. Shapiro, chairman of E. I. duPont de Nemours & Company, came by company jet from Wilmington. Donald M. Fordyce, president of the Manhattan Life Insurance Company, arrived in a horsedrawn carriage. He was clad in a top hat and gray tailcoat supplied by a costume company as a business leader's garb of about 1876.

title: ROBERT M. DEARDORFF
description: Robert M. Deardorff, a freelance travel writer, died yesterday in Paris. He was 61 years old and lived in Rome.

title: People and Business
description: James E. Smith, the United States Comptroller of the Currency, is facing the possibility of being cited for a contempt of court motion for refusal to answer questions about the Government's actions in a bank failure.

title: About Real Estate
description: Six years ago three young men still in their 20's chipped in $3,500 each to buy a small apartment building on Thompson Street downtown. There were 35 apartments and the building needed major repairs. The buyers set about persuading the tenants to permit the upgrading and accept rent increases averaging about $25 a room a month. Not surprisingly, there was resistance.

title: Bargain Stocks vs. the Market
description: Source: The 19,6 Stock Trader's Almanac

title: CONTRACTS DOWN 12% FOR BUILDERS
description: Despite a 33 percent increase in residential building contracts, total construction contracts in October fell 12 percent below the level of October 1974, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: Advertising
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 2 The growing number of selfcentered employees interested solely in their own futures and not their companies' came under attack today from James J. Jordan Jr., president of Batten, Barton. Durstine & Osborn.

title: TENNECO UNIT RAISES PRICE ON ITS RESINS
description: Tenneco Inc. announced yesterday that its organics and polymers division was raising prices for polyvinyl chloride homopolymer resins effective Jan. 1. The new price is 24 cents a pound for general purpose resins and 25 cents a pound for film and low molecular weight resins.

title: Council Bars the Use Of Rutgers Students As Firemen for City
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 3The City Council voted here today to kill a controversial plan to use 16 Rutgers University students as low paid city firemen in a plan to cut the city budget.

title: Synecdoche Well Defined But Misused
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Even good Homer nods, things are almost never what they seem, all that glitters is probably rhinestones at best, and to speak of disposing of someone is just a plain old euphemism, not a trendy synecdoche.

title: REVENUE SHARING GALLED IN DOUBT
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 3Car. la A. Hills, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, told a convention of city officials here today that there were no assurances that Congress will act to extend general revenue sharing next year. The officials say that a failur to do so would be catastrophic for some municipalities.

title: U.S. Intelligence Chiefs Deny Falsifying Vietnam Troop Data
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The outgoing civilian and military intelligence directors denied today that there was a conspiracy to downgrade Communist troop strength in Vietnam before the 1968 Tet offen sive.

title: ZUMWALT CHARGES CALLED RIDICULOUS
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 3The State Department today de, scribed as preposterous the charge by Adm. Elmo R. Zumwalt Jr. that Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger had withheld information from President Ford about alleged Soviet violations of the 1972 agreements on strategicarms limitations.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Retrieved Decoys Are Sufficient Bounty
description: A bitter, howling, northeast wind grew stronger as dawn approached.

title: Police Memorial Lobby Is Dedicated by Beame
description: The Police Memorial Lobby, which honors police officers killed in the performance of duty and is on the main floor of Police Headquarters, was dedicated yesterday by Mayor Beame.

title: U.N. TO MEET TODAY ON ISRAELI RAIDS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 3The Security Council met behind closed doors today to consider Arab complaints about yesterday's Israeli air attacks on Palestinian camps in Lebanon, but it was stalled by an Egyptian demand for participation of the Palestine Liberation Organization in the debate.

title: J. P. Stevens 3Month Profit Up 30%
description: J. P. Stevens & Company, a major producer of textile products, reported yesterday a 30 percent increase in earnings for the fiscal fourth quarter, ended Nov. 1, on a sales gain of 2.8 percent. The company's results for the full fiscal year, however, fell substantially from the yearearlier level with 12month earnings down 492 percent and sales down 11.1 percent.

title: James Waring, Choreographer Of Modern Dance, Dead at 53
description: James Waring, the choreographer and dancer, died Tuesday evening at Mount Sinai Hospital as the result of a malignant tumor. He was 53 years old and most recently had been On the faculty of the University of Maryland at Baltimore.

title: FOR ARGENTINES, GOOD LIFE FADES
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 3 Many of the gracious and relaxing things that Argentines esteem in life are being blighted by the prevailing state here of political violence, acute inflation and social discord.

title: Police Lobby Dedicated
description: The Police Memorial Lobby, which honors police officers killed in the performance of duty and is on the main floor of Police Headquarters, was dedicated yesterday by Mayor Beame. The names of the fallen are cast on five bronze tablets mounted on the walls. The honor roll dates back 120 years and contains 261 names.

title: People and Business
description: Earl L. Butz, the Secretary of Agriculture, warned yesterday that without remedial legislation before Dec. 31 he would be forced to impose rather severe production quotas on rice.

title: M.A.C. LENGTHENS EXCHANGE DATE
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation has extended the deadline for exchange of $1.6 billion in publicly held city notes for 10year M.A.C. bonds from Dec. 10 to Dec. 29, the corporation announced yesterday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Acts of War . . .
description: If air bombardment of population centers is Israel's only answer to the Palestinian problem, and terrorism the only answer of Arabs, then Arabs and Israelis and other peoples across the worldare in even greater danger of unending Middle East war than heretofore imagined.

title: Editorial Article 2  No Title
description: Inquiries requested concerning possibte purchase of Inventory, Accounts Receivable. Fixtures and Equipment and Real Estate used in the operation of Robertson's Jewelry, Store of Gainesville, Florida. Please Address Lawrence W. Roose @ P.O. Box 790. Gainesville. Florida 32602.

title: Rockefeller Backs U.D.C.; Says Audit Will Praise It
description: Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller defended the Urban Development Corporation yesterday as one of the achievements of which he was most proud and said an, audit about to be released gave it a very good bill of health on the management of its projects.

title: AUSTERITY EFFORT LOSES IN HARTFORD
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 3  An emergency program of spending cuts, proposed by Gov. Ella T. Grasso to the Connecticut General Assembly was suddenly and surprisingly defeated today.

title: Presidential Candidate Held: Cited in CBS's Ford Blackout
description: BOSTON, Dec. 3 (AP)Jacob J. Gordon, whose Presidential candidacy caused CBS earlier this year to refuse to carry a Presidential address, was held without bail today for failing to appear at a Federal court hearing.

title: The Cosmopolitan Club Cited On Open House for Roaches
description: The Cosmopolitan Club, an exclusive women's club, has been playing unhappy host to some very unwelcome guests recentlyroaches.

title: Panel CIears Bailey On JaiAlai Funds
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Dec, 3The State Gaming Commission cleared the late John M. Bailey today of charges that he had accepted a $250,000 cash payment to help the developer of a Bridgeport jaialai fronton to get a state license.

title: CORRECTION
description: As a result of transmission errors a dispatch from Canada in The New York Times last Friday incorrectly related circumstances preceding the resignation of Yves Menard as a vice president of Air Canada. It said the airline had signed a $100 million contract with a company that sold a villa to him; the figure should have been $1 million. It also said that testimony indicated that the airline had provided a Lebanese official with a $500,000 expense account; the figure should have been $5,000.

title: Rikers Guards Fail to Show Up In 6Hour Protest on Conditions
description: About 350 guards at Bikers Island refused to take their posts yesterday for more than six hours in a protest against personnel cuts and inmate overcrowding, which they said had created exhausting and unsafe working conditions.

title: Public's Esteem for the F.B.I. Found Sharply Down in Survey
description: Public esteem for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, always high in earlier days, has declined considerably in the last decade and particularly since 1970, the Gallup organization reported in its latest poll, issued yesterday.

title: ... and of Peace
description: An interesting suggestion for a framework of discussion is contained in the forthcoming issue of Foreign Policy quarterly. Gidon Gottlieb, Professor of International Law and Jurisprudence at New York University, finds useful parallelsdespite obvious dissimilaritiesin the Evian agreement of 1962, between de Gaulle's France and the Algerian National Liberation Front (F.L.N.).

title: U.S. WOULD OPPOSE BRITISH TRADE BAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The United States has begun flashing strong official signals to Britain that it would strongly disapproveand might retaliate againstnew import controls being considered by the Government of Prime Minister Harold Wilson.

title: Friends in the Country
description: Despite the slim majority in the House vote to grant modest assistance to New York, and persisting opposition to similar legislation in the Senate, there is growing evidence in Congress that this city has friends and supporters throughout the country.

title: Oil Fee to Be Removed
description: The Ford Administration is preparing to announce soon the removal of the $2abarrel fee on imported crude oil. The action could reduce domestic crude oil prices and retail prices for heating oil and gasoline. Page 25.

title: 6 on Senate Panel Ask Full Inquiry on Stevens
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI)Six members of the Senate Judiciary Committee called for a full investigation into the health, tax returns, and former law practice of Judge John Paul Stevens, nominee to the Supreme Court.

title: Bad News for Columbus, Perhaps
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J.  Last February, a Smithsonian Institution team reported finding two Negro male skeletonsthe men died in their late 30'sin a grave in the United States Virgin Islands. This grave had been used and abandoned by native Indians long before the coming of Columbus. Soil from the earth layers in which the skeletons were found was dated to A.D. 1250.

title: White House, Ready to Lift Fee on Imported Oil; Domestic Price Drop Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Administration is preparing to announce soon the removal of the fee of $2 a barrel on imported crude oil that President Ford imposed earlier this year.

title: Archeology's Discovery of an African Presence in America
Editorial Article 1  No Title
description: BIDS

title: Books of The Times
description: In addition to creating impressive environments and beautiful objects, Gertrude Grace Sill writes, a major purpose of Christian art was to instruct, to inspire and solidify Christian faith. From its inception, this art was didactic. It appealed to a largely illiterate public through precise and literal visual images.

title: Contract Awards
description: Pullman Inc. announced yesterday that the Kellogg International Corporation, a London affiliate of its Pullman Kellogg division, had been awarded an $80 million contract by Azot Sanayii T.A.S. for the design, proourement and construction of a 1,000metrictonaday ammonia plant. The ammonia from the unit, to be built in Gemljk, Turkey, scheduled for completion in mid1978, is to be used for fertilizer manufacture.

title: Bailout: Did Ford Win or Lose?
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Did President Ford win or lose his battle of New Yorka battle that his political staff thought could set some basic themes of the national campaign next year? The win argument turns on the point that what some people see as the President's months of hardline bluffing forced New York City to toe his mark and recognizein remedies if not in rhetoricthat the city's financial woes were selfinflicted and must be paid for by New Yorkers.

title: Dutch Caution Madrid on Trade Bloc
description: MADRID, Dec. 3A delegation from the Dutch Labor Party ended a fiveday visit to Spain today with a warning that the Netherlands will oppose Spain's entry into the European Economic Community until democratic freedoms are fully established here.

title: BEN C. CONNALLY, 65, U.S. JUDGE IN TEXAS
description: FALFURRIAS, Tex., Dec. 3 (UPI)United States District Court Judge Ben C. Connally, who presided over Houston's school integration battles, died yesterday in Brooks County Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: Advertising
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 3The proposed campaign on economic education is shaping up to be the most massive communications effort in the 33year history of the advertising council. Every promotional tool and communications technique will be used in a threetofiveyear effort to make the American people aware of the workings of the freeenterprise system.

title: Insurgents Report Shelling Of Timor by Indonesians
description: DILI, Portuguese Timor, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Three Indonesian warships shelled positions held by the Revolutionary Front for an Independent East Timor 50 miles from Dili, the capital today, Rogerio Lobato, defense minister of the selfproclaimed East Timor Republic, said here.

title: Japanese Unions Yield and Halt Strike
description: TOKYO, Thursday, Dec. 4Japan's government workers' unions, capitulated to the Government's firm stance yesterday and called off an illegal strike that had lasted eight days and brought the nation to the brink of a political crisis.

title: October Inventories Drop, Paced by Durable Goods
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Manufacturer's inventories declined again in October but by the smallest amount since massive inventory liquidation began last March, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: China Pushing Drive to Mechanize Farms
description: YENAN, ChinaA quickening program of farm reconstruction is laying the foundation for the mechanization of China's ageold system of agriculture, and a propaganda campaign to rally support for the mechanization drive is under way across China.

title: Texaco Cuts Cost Of Gasoline 1 Cent At Wholesale Level
description: Texaco Inc., the largest marketer of gasoline in the United States, cut yesterday the wholesale price of gasoline by 1 cent a gallon. The distributor price was reduced by 0.7 cent a gallon. A spokesman for the company said the decrease in price was a result of competition. In other price actions, the ?? Chemical Company said it world raise its price on vinyl chloride monomer by 1.6 cents a pound, to 12.6 cents a pound.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Chase's Merger Plan Is Approved by State
description: The New York Banking Board approved yesterday merger of the Chase Manhattan Bank and eight subsidiary banks operating outside of New York City.

title: State Monitors Find City Is Lagging On Cutting PublicRelations Payroll
description: The state monitors charged with seeing that the city actually enacts all the announced cuts in its threeyear austerity plan reported yesterday that the city was already behind in its wellpublicized promise to cut the publicrelations payroll by about 65 slots.

title: Snags Hold Up City Pension Indemnification Bill
description: ALBANY, DEC. 3Lastminute snags delayed the expected passage today of legislation to enable the trustees of the five New York City employee pension funds to buy Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds, a purchase that must be partly completed by Friday morning if the city is to meet its payroll.

title: Act of Aggression, French Film, Opens
description: Act of Aggression, vie French a melodrama that opened yesterday at two theaters, is so bad that it makes a film as vicious as Death Wish look good.

title: MURTAGII HALTS NADJARI INQUIRY
description: Justice John M. Murtagh of State Supreme Court has ordered Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, to stop presenting evidence to a grand jury now investigating Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco's role in a controversial 1963 Shubert estate settlement, court papers disclosed yesterday.

title: 4th Nadjari Setback
description: Justice John M. Murtagh of the State Supreme Court has ordered Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, to stop presenting evidence to a grand jury now investigating Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco's role in a controversial 1963 estate settlement, court papers disclosed yesterday. Page 81.

title: People in Sports
description: Leroy Selmon, 256  pound Oklahoma defensive tackle, was named yesterday to receive the Outland Trophy as the outstanding lineman of the college football season. He also led a list of 26 players on the allAmerica team named by the Football Writers Association of America.

title: Moscow Indicates A Poor Grain Crop Of 137 Million Tons
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3The Soviet harvest, hit by severe drought conditions last summer, appears to have yielded as little as 137.2 million tons of grain, about a third less than planned, according to information in an official report delivered at the current session of [the Supreme Soviet, or Parliament.

title: An Evening of Musical Redicovery
description: America's musical past is getting attention today because of the forthcoming Bicentennial. Besides historians, however, a few performing musicians have had an interest in it for some time, and among them is Howard Shanet, chairman of Columbia University's music department and conductor of the school orchestra. In the 1950's he brought to light symphonic works from the preCivil War era that had been ignored for a century.

title: Nigeria's Glut of Cement Epitomizes Growing Pains of an Undeveloped Nation
description: LONDON, Dec. 3Nigeria, flush with the oil revenues that make it black Africa's richest state, announced a $100 billion development program this year. Goals include new public buildings, army barracks and 12,000 miles of roads.

title: Woman's Right to Keep Horses Is Attacked
description: DEMAREST, Dec. 3For the last year or so, Courtney Papatestas has owned and stabled a chestnut hunter named Merlin here at her home in this Northern Bergen County community.

title: Geneva Arms Talks Resume
description: GENEVA, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Soviet and American negotiators resumed talks today on the limitation of strategic arms after a twoweek recess. They met for two hours and 50 minutes, in three months, and agreed to meet again next Tuesday.

title: Lebanese Village in Ruins After Bombing by Israelis
description: NABATIYE, Lebanon, Dec. 3Assia Salame, 6 years old, lay today in a tidy hospital bed in Nabatiye with, a patch over her left eye. Her round face was scarred with charcoalcolored wounds.

title: Social Security in Africa
description: LOME, Togo, Dec. 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  African officials of the International Labor Organization met here this week to discuss ways of standardizing social security systems throughout the continent and to evaluate progress in the organization's activities in Africa.

title: Artis, Serving Life Term, Tells of Deal to Go Free
description: John Artis, who was convicted with Rubin (Hurricane) Carter of a triplemurder in New Jersey, said yesterday that a state legislator investigating the case had offered him a deal to free him from a life prison sentence, if he would admit that he had been an accomplice to the murder.

title: Garden LineUps
description: FIRST GAME, 7 P.M.

title: Bridge:
description: Thenegative double, introduced by Alvin Roth and Tobias Stone almost two decades ago, can now be considlered standard in tournament play.

title: 24 Protesters Arrested at Starrett City
description: Twenty four residents of Starrett City were arrested yesterday morning for blocking traffic on a newly opened street that runs through the Brooklyn housing development.

title: The Stage
description: THE WOOING OF LADY SUNDAY and APRIL FISH, by Ted Pezzulo. Christopher Cox directed April Fish, Beill Herndon directed The Wooing of Lady Sunday; setting by Cliff Simon; lighting by Francis Roefaro; costumes by A. Christina Giannini; stage managers, David Rosenberg, Karen E. Nothmann. Presented by the Joseph Jefferson Theater Company Inc. At the Little Church Around the Corner, 11 East 29th Street.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker superseded a second community school board for failing to comply with his earlier order to reduce pupil instructional time by 90 minutes a week.

title: Levi Says U.S. Has Not. Decided to Retry Gurney
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) Attorney General Edward H. Levi said today that no decision had been made on whether to retry former Senator Edward J. Gurney, Republican of Florida, on corruption charges, despite a department statement to the contrary two weeks ago.

title: Gordon Duff, 66, Producer Of TV Dramas of the '50's
description: Gordon Duff, a retired television producer, died Tuesday at Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 66 years old and a resident of Norwalk.

title: Bennington College Head Battles Academic Tenure
description: BENNINGTON, Vt., Dec. 3An effort by the young president of Bennington College to prod her institution toward steps she considers necessary, to insure its vitality has preciphated a crisis and clouded her oncebright future.

title: PRICES ARE LOWER ON COMMODITIES
description: Wheat, corn and soybeans drifted down a few cents a bushel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade despite optimistic news.

title: U.S. STUDIES DEAL FOR BRITISH PLANE
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 3Pentagon officials are working on a multibilliondollar BritishAmericanaircraft deal in which the United States would buy a Britishdeveloped fighter in return for a British purchase of some American radarsurveillance planes.

title: SHIP FINANCING IS WELL RECEIVED
description: The corporate bond market gave a favorable reception yesterday to a negotiated offering of $74 million in ship financing bonds as traders were awaiting the outcome today of a secondary offering by five New York City pension funds. The funds are expected to auction a total of 35 lots of con porate bonds from their portfolios with a face value of $155.6 million. Proceeds of the sale will be converted into Municipal Assistance Corporation debt to help meet the city's financial needs.

title: Cornucopia
description: Twentyfive years ago I started with $3,000 borrowed capital. Today I have health; I have all my faculties; I have a college education with a degree; I have a devoted wife; I have three marvelous children; I have legions of friends; I have a flourishing business; I have a XXXX rating in the Blue Book; I have a fourstar rating in the Red Book; I have a 30room home; I have servants to wait on me; I have birds that sing on my fiveacre lawn; I have trees that keep me cool in the summertime; I have gas heat that keeps me warm in the wintertime; I belong to two country clubs; I have riding horses; I have a Fleetwood Cadillac; I have a convertible Mustang; and I have money in the bank.

title: Levitt Terms a Default By Yonkers Not Likely
description: YONKERS, Dec. 3  State Comptroller Arthur Levitt, presiding over the first meeting of the Yonkers Emergency Financial Control Board, said today that the city was likely to avoid default Dec. 12.

title: Philip Cox, ExProfessor Of Education at N.Y.U., 92
description: Philip W. L. Cox, professor emeritus of education at New York University, died Friday in Clermont, Fla., where he lived. He was 92 years old.

title: South Bronx Renting Agent Indicted in Alleged Theft of Deposits
description: The renting agent at a failed $6 million housing development in the South Bronx that was built with Federal aid was indicted on larceny charges yesterday after an investigation into the loss of thousands of dollars in rent deposits paid by more than 100 poor and workingclass families.

title: CLARK WOULD CURB I.R.S. CRIME DRIVES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) Congress was told today that the use of the Internal Revenue Service's extraordinary legal powers against organized crime was very dangerous and might pose constitutional questions.

title: AMEX AND OTC OFF FOR 3D DAY
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell yesterday for the third consecutive session in heavier trading.

title: WOODSON WON'T RUN FOR SPEAKER AGAIN
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3 (UPI)As semblyman S. Howard Woodson Jr., Democat of Mercer County and the first black in the nation to become a speaker of a lower house, announced today that hewould not seek the post in the new legislative session.

title: HOUSE PANEL BACKS RENEGOTIATION SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) A bill to recapture more excess profits from defense, space and other Government contractors won 207 approval from the House Banking Committee today.

title: British Guarantee of Burmah Oil Loan Is Renewed
description: LONDON, Dec. 3 (Reuters)The Bank of England's 12month guarantee of $650 million borrowing by the Burmah Oil Company will be renewed for a further nine months from the end of 1975, Energy Secretary Tony Benn said in Parliament today.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Underwriters headed by myth Eastman Dillon & Company yesterday the Idaho Power Company's new one million common shares and reoffered them publicly at $26.75 a share.

title: Canarsie Sees Path To Court Playoffs
description: When a basketball team has three of five starters returning, all of them quality players, success and championships are almost expected. Despite such prospects. Coach Mark Reiner of Canarsie says he has a problem.

title: MURTAGH HALTS NADJARI INQUIRY
description: Justice John M. Murtagh of State Supreme Court has ordered Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, to stop presenting evidence to a grand juty that was investigating Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco's role in a controversial 1963 Shubert estate settlement, court papers disclosed yesterday.

title: DR. ORREN HORMELL OF BOWDOIN COLLEGE
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Dec. 3Dr. Orren Chalmer Hormell, a retired Bowdoin College professor and early proponent of the town manager form of government, died today in a Melrose, Mass., nursing home. He would have been 96 years old tomorrow.

title: Black College Enrollment Held Equal to Population Proportion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)Blacks are apparently entering college in numbers roughly equivalent to their representation in the total population, but their dropout rate is significantly higher than that of whites, a Census Bureau study reported today.

title: Revolution In Vientiane A Slow One
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 3The abolition today of the sixcenturyold Laotian monarchy and of the country's coalition Government represent the culmination of a trend that began last May when Communistled Pathet Lao forces moved into Vientiane, the capital, virtually without opposition and began installing their own officials.

title: Army Meets Objective
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 3 (AP) The Army reached 113 percent of its recruitment quota in October, the Pentagon said yesterday. Its monthly report showed that all of the armed services reached at least 100 per cent of their objectives in October for the first time since July.

title: BILL GAINS TO BRING YIELD ON U.S. FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) The House Banking Committee unanimously approved legislation today to get some income for the Government from billions of Federal tax dollars kept temporarily in interestfree bank accounts.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HIGH TIME The hour is 5 P.M, today for the traditional lighting of that giant, Christmas treethe 43d ceremonyin, Rockefeller Center overlooking the skating rink. Again entertainment will precede the event, starting at 4:30 o'clock.

title: Panel Clears Bailey On JaiAlai Funds
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Dec. 3The State Gaming Commission cleared the late John M. Bailey today of charges that he had accepted a $250,000 cash payment to help the developer of a Bridgeport jai alai fronton to get a state license.

title: Market Place
description: During December, investors should look over their portfolios to make sure that they have taken steps to minimize their taxes for the year and have done so in a manner consistent with sound investment strategy.

title: Permit Is Denied to Build 17 Oil Tanks Near Hudson
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3  Thet state's Natural Resource Council today unanimously denied a request for a riparian permit needed to construct 17 oil storage tanks on land bordering the Hudson River in a densely populated section of Hoboken and Weehawken.

title: BILL ON STRIP MINING FACING PANEL VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)Those seeking to revive the twicevetoed coal strip mining bill scored a victory today as the House Interior Committee voted 24 to 14 to bring the bill to another vote. Backers say, they have the votes to bring the bill out of committee and to the House floor in early 1976.

title: FIVE SUBPOENAED IN HOFFA INQUIRY
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3Five persons connected with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the underworld, including an associate of Anthony Provenzano, a former teamster official from New Jersey, have reportedly been subpoenaed to testify tomorrow before a grand jury here that has been investigating the disappearance of James R. Hoffa.

title: Senate Group Votes 200Mile U.S. Fishing Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Senate Armed Services Committee approved today a bill that would prohibit fishing by foreign fleets within 200 miles of the coasts of the United States.

title: CAREY MAPS PLAN FOR CONVENTION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Governor Carey said today that the New York Democratic organization, would run uncommitted slates of delegates to the Democratic National Conven tion in all 39 Congressional districts in the state's April 6 primary.

title: Ballet's Charms, Doctors Find, Mask Life of Pain
description: Ballet dancers who execute graceful leaps, lift partners through floating arcs and perform many other polished but strenuous maneuvers often accomplish them despite the searing pain of torn ligaments, infected callouses and fractured and broken bones.

title: German Shepherd Is a Status Symbol
description: Just as the poodle dominates in your country, said Blanca VorgBance de Jory, who for 25 years has been handling the registrations for the Venezuelan Kennel Club, in ours it is the German shepherd. Almost half of all the dogs we listed last year were shepherds. It is, perhaps, a status symbol for a Latin American to own one. After shepherds come boxers, smooth Chihuahuas there's only one long coat registered  poodles, Great Danes and cocker spaniels.

title: 4th Nadjari Setback
description: Justice John M. Murtagh of the State Supreme Court has ordered Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, to stop presenting evidence to a grand jury now investigating Surrogate S. Samuel DiFalco's role in a controversial 1963 estate settlement, court papers disclosed yesterday. Page 81.

title: Yankee Blank Check
description: In 1971, when Mayor Lindsay offered to buy and renovate Yankee Stadium in response to the threat of the baseball team's owners to leave New York, this newspaper commented: We remain utterly unconvinced that the Yankee Stadium proposal is sound at this time of fiscal crisis. One year later, when the city, in surrender to the New York Yankees' demands, committed itself the remodeling job at an estimated cost of $24 million, we objected to what seemed a blank check, signed by the city's taxpayers, with the amount later to be filled in by the Yankees. Before the end of that year, the estimate had grown to $50 million.

title: Nastase Downs Panatta, Keeps Title Hope Alive
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 3Me Nastase won a match of nerves tonight and must now rely on Arthur Ashe to help him into the semifinals of the $130,000 Grand Prix Masters tennis tournament.

title: TAXCUT MEASURE GAINING IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The House of Representatives took the first step today toward enactment of legislation modifying and continuing through next year an estimated total of $13.4 billion in individual and business tax reductions.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Boston Group Moves for Vote On Banning Pistol Possession
description: BOSTON, Dec. 3A citizens group here initiiated today legislation to ban the possession of pistols by anyone but the police.

title: Decision Due in Week On OddLot Proposal
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 3James J. Needham, chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, disclosed here today that the exchange would decide at a meeting ofits directors in Detroit next Thursday whether Marra Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith would be permitted to offer its customers small amounts of stoat without having to pay an oddlot commission.

title: In Muted Style, Chicago the Ritz
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3Chicago, overanthologized as the City of the Big Shoulders, has tossed a feather boa over those strapping clavicles and, as the song has it, is putting on the ritz.

title: New Zealand Premier Robert David Muldoon
description: When the rightofcenter National Party swept the Labort Party Government from power last week, its leader, who will become Prime Minister next week, remarked that the unexpetted landslide made him feel very humble. It sounded odd, for a streak of humility was one thing the pugnacious winner, Robert D. Muldoon, just did not seem to have in his nature.

title: The Opera
description: Some of the luster has gone out of the Metropolitan Opera's Carmen. The tension has slackened, the ensemble precision has faltered, the fight scenes look stagey now, the chorus (especially the soldiers') seems tired, even the urchins in the first act march along without any real enthusiasm.

title: Indictment of Blumenthal In Perjury Reported Near
description: The indictment of Albert H. Blumenthal, the Assembly majority leader, for perjury in the nursinghome investigation was reliably reported to be imminent last night.

title: F. B. I. IS ACCUSED OF POLITICAL ACTS FOR 6 PRESIDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Federal Bureau of Investigation supplied secret dossiers, conducted wiretaps and carried out physical surveillance for political purposes at the behest of all six Presidents from Franklin D. Roosevelt to Richard M. Nixon, the staff of a Senates committee charged today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1975

title: Judge Again Puts Off Railroad Strike on S.I.
description: A Federal judge's ruling late yesterday again put off a scheduled strike of Staten Island Rapid Transit conductors and trainmen. The ruling, by Judge Mark A. Costantino, delayed the strike pending final determination after a further court hearing Dec. 17.

title: 18 MORE HOSTAGES FLEE DUTCH TRAIN
description: BEILEN, the Netherlands, Thursday, Dec. 4  Eighteen more hostages escaped last night from a train held near here since Tuesday morning by five South Moluccan terrorists.

title: U.S. Mediators Say Rail Unions Agree To Delay Strike While Talks Progress
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, Dec. 4 (AP)Contract negotiations aimed at averting a nationwide rail strike continued early today as Federal mediators won promises by union leaders that they would not call a walkout as long as progress in the talks continued.

title: Business Briefs
description: A new consortium bank dominated by shareholders from the Middle East has received conditional approval for operations in New York State, according to John G. Heimann, State Superintendent of Banks.

title: State Honors Awarded To River Dell Teacher
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3 (AP)State Education Commissioner, Dr. Fred G. Burke, announced today that Dr. Richard A. Barrows 01 Paramus had been selected as New Jersey's teacher of the year.

title: A Gunman in Paris Is Killed by Police After Bank Siege
description: PARIS, Thursday, Dec. 4 (AP) A 14hour drama in which two gunmen held 30 hostages in a Paris bank for $2 million ransom ended in a fierce street gunbattle early today.

title: Mt. Vernon School Integration Ordered
description: In a school desegregation case that has been pending since 1968, the State Education Commissioner yesterday ordered the Mount Vernon Board of Education to implement its plan for a voluntary shift of black and white pupils to improve the racial balance of that city's schools.

title: Estrogen Is Linked To Uterine Cancer
description: The estrogen hormones taken by millions of American women to alleviate the symptoms and aftereffects of menopause have been linked in two studies to a substantially increased risk of cancer of the uterus.

title: Beirut Charges Defiance
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 3The Lebanese Government today condemned the Israeli, air attacks against Palestinian camps and Lebanese villages in the north and south of the country.

title: 2 RECEIVE 30 YEARS AS HEROIN DEALERS
description: Prison sentences of 30 years were imposed yesterday on two convicted heroin dealers, with sentences ranging from eight to 25 years for four other participants in a major narcotics conspiracy.

title: Social Security in Africa
description: LOME, Togo, Dec. 3 (Agence FrancePresse) African officials of the International Labor Organization met here this week to discuss ways of standardizing social security system throughout the continent and to evaluate progress in the ortanization's activities in Africa.

title: PAUL E. WELCH DIP; MAGAZINE OFFICIAL
description: Paul E. Welch, a magazine executive, died yesterday at the Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 51 years old and lived in Riverside. Conn.

title: North Jersey Milk Strike Ends As a Moratorium Is Accepted
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3A 30day moratorium was agreed to in a milk drivers' strike that had halted deliveries today to stores and supermarkets throughout northern New Jersey and threatened to affect 1.5 million households.

title: Backers of Protection Aid To City Vow Fight for Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Congressional backers of a bill vetoed by the President that would give Federal funds to New York and other cities to repay them for protecting visiting foreign dignitaries said today that attempts to resurrect the measure would have to await Mr. Ford's return from the Far East.

title: Issues in Carters' Strike
description: PARTICIPANTSLocal 813, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Bernard Adelstein, secretarytreasurer, with 1,700 members in the five boroughs. Negotiators representing 450 carting companiesAssociation of Trade Waste Removers of Greater New York, Salvatore Spinelli, counsel; Brooklyn Trade Waste Association, Patsy Davanzo; Queens County Trade Waste Association, Alfred F. Muscio; Carting Employers Group, Joseph Monica.

title: The Blowsoft
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3A blowsoft is a lowkey blowhard. He does not get all red in the face, or expostulate angrily, or wave his arms; he simply takes a wrongheaded position and stands there in dignity as the ground erodes under him.

title: Emma Stock, ExDirector Of Advertising at Forbes
description: Emma Weinstein Stock, for many years an advertising executive with Forbes magazine, died Monday, apparently of heart attack, in Queens General Hospital. She was 73 years old and lived at 17520 Wexford Terrace, Jamaica, Queens.

title: The Stage: Sweet Bird of Brooklyn
description: What do you talk about first Tennessee Williams or a new theater? Well, of course, Mr. Williams, because new theaters come around every month or so, but great playwrights come around only a dozen or so times every century. They are special people, and without, them we really wouldn't need too many new theaters.

title: Veeck Bid to Buy White Sox Delayed a Week by League
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 3 (AP) American League owners turned down Bill Veeck's proposal to buy the financially troubled Chicago White. Sox tonight, but save his group a week to raise an additional $1.2 million in cash equity to satisfy their counterproposal.

title: World Coffee Price Pact Is Approved
description: LONDON, Dec. 3 (AP)The 63nation International Coffee Organization approved today a world coffee pact that for the first time included concern about the price of a cup of coffee to the consumer in times of shortage and high prices.

title: Manhattan Transfer's Nostalgia. Is at Home in the Empire Room
description: Manhattan Transfer, the nostalgia quartet, is holding forth at the WaldorfAstoria through Dec. 13, and in the Empire Room the group would seem to have found its true home at last.

title: Virus Epidemic Threatens To Curtail Aqueduct Cards
description: Aqueduct's daily ninerace format is being threatened by a virus epidemic that has knocked hundreds of horses out of training. If it gets any worse, said a spokesman for the New York Racing Association, we might have to reduce the number of races to eight a day. The virus, a nonfatal but extremely contagious strain, can sideline a horse for as long as three weeks. High fever, followed by coughing, is the usual sequence. Stricken horses lose their appetites, grow listless and have to be confined to their stalls.

title: Dow Tumbles 17.71 As Volume Climbs
description: The stock market, in a decline that surprised even Wall Street's bears, fell sharply yesterday for the second day in a row. The Dow Jones industrial average, down 13.14 on Tuesday, sank 17.71 yesterdayits largest drop in seven monthsto close at 825.49. More than 1,400 stocks declined on the New York stock Exchange, the largest number of losses in a day since March.

title: 'Act of Aggression,' French Film, Opens
description: NO, "The Actors's Revenge" isn't about the murder of a drama critic. That might have been more interesting. It is an artistically arranged but extremely rambling exercise full of melodramic bumps and lumps, as a vengeful actor destroys three men who ruined his family years ago.The hitch, of course, is a pretty face, that of a pure-hearted daughter, caught up in the murderous coils. And Ayako Wakao is a beaut.It is the exquisite face of this girl and some artful color dcor that are the main interests. For the general effect of the story, obviously intended as an old-time tale of traditional gravity, is splintery stuff and often confusing. And Kon Ichikawa's direction is a curious mixture of stylish artifice and plain bombast.The strangest thing of all, perhaps, for a story of Old Japan is the subtly, sleeky Occidental musical score, slipping into cool and torchy jazz at the oddest moments. The acting is pretty good, with traditional grunts and growls held to a minimum.Even so, it's hard to fathom the supposed charisma of the wily hero, Kazuo Hasegawa, who easily magnetizes his victims. As a Kabuki female impersonator, he's also at it offstage, mincing and mewing with some abrupt, lightning sword work. Yes, there's plenty of chopping. But this time the sound and fury signify only so-so dividends out front, at least here."The Actor's Revenge" ("The Revenge of Ukeno-Jo") was shown at the 1971 Bijou Cinema's festival of Japanese imports. The following review was nese imports. The following review was written by Howard Thompson and was published in The New York Times on June 17, 1971. The film opens today at the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater, 425 Lafayette Street.

title: State Budget Cut Heavily In Drive for New Taxes
description: ALBANY, Dec. 3As his opening move in the taxation struggle with the Legislature, Governor Carey today had his aides prepare half a billion dollars worth of painful state budget cuts, including aid to localities.

title: Anniversaries
description: (AYAnlia, the first 14 years were love and laughter, the next 100 is downhill, All my love, your husband, Harold,

title: A Moderating of Business Gains Seen by Study
description: The business recovery that has been under way since the middle of 1975 will continue through 1976 but at a more moderate pace, according to E. F. Andrews, chairman of the business survey committee of the National Association of Purchasing Management Inc.

title: 2 Suspects Seized In Effort to Sell Jewels From Theft
description: The police arrested a man And a woman last night in connection with the theft of $1.8 million in jewels from the Park Avenue apartment of an investment banker and his wife.

title: BROKER VOTED HEAD OF SERVICE SOCIETY
description: Douglas Williams, vice president of the brokerage firm of Wood, Walker/First Regional Securities, was elected president of the Community Service Society yesterday at the agency's 127th annual meeting.

title: Anglicization of TV Stirs New Debates in Ireland
description: DUBLINAre the Irish in Ireland turning British? Such a question, which might read like black heresy in many quarters outside Ireland, has concerned some of the more thoughtful minds here recently.

title: FORD AND CHINESE OMIT COMMUNIQUE ON PEKING TALKS
