description: PEKING, Thursday, Dec. 4Chinese and American leaders have decided not to issue a joint communiqu when President Ford's visit to Peking ends tomorrow.

title: Times and News Say Pressmen Slow Down, and Give Warning
description: The New York Times and The Daily News warned the New York Pressmen's Union yesterday that the papers would take appropriate action if the union did not stop alleged work slowdowns that they said had delayed production and caused financial losses.

title: Nine Honored for Climbing Municipal. Ladders to Success
description: Nine superachievers in the municipal bureaucracy were honored yesterday for outstanding public service by the Fund for the City of New York.

title: The Stevens Nomination
description: When President Ford nominated Judge John Paul Stevens to the Supreme Court, there was a rush to pin a label on him. Conservative was the one widely used in the press, sometimes accompanied by moderate.

title: The Haywood Experiment at Center
description: When the New York Knicks obtained Spencer Haywood, he was asked if he were aware of his role as the team's savior.

title: Beauty Treatment at T.R. Birthplace
description: The Landmarks Preservation Commission began a demonstration project yesterday to beautifuy the setting of important, but isolated, landmarks by planting 19 willow oak trees on East 20th Street outside the Theodore Roosevelt birthplace

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dr. James P. Hennessy, 86, Obstetrician at St. Vincent's
description: Dr. James P. Hennessy, an obstetrician and gynecologist, died yesterday at New York Hospital. He was 86 years old and a resident of Manhattan.

title: Westinghouse Ends Uranium Contracts With Utility Clients
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 3  The Westinghouse Electric Corporation, which recently notified a group of utility customers that it would terminate their uranium supply contracts after 1978, has canceled them already because the utilities have refused to agree to a uraniumrationing program to cover the threeyear period.

title: BERNARD S. COOPER
description: Bernard S. Cooper, Eastern regional director of the accounting firm of Laventhol & Horwath, died Tuesday at his home, 35 Seacoast Terrace, Coney Island, Brooklyn. He was 46 years old.

title: PROF. WILLIAM FRYE OF TEXAS TECH DIES
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Dec. 3 (AP) Dr. William W. Frye, a specialist in tropical diseases, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 72 years old.

title: Scouts 6, Canadiens 5.
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 3 (AP) Wilt Paiement scored three goals, the first Kansas City Scout ever to do so, and led the Scouts to a 65 N.H.L. victory over the Montreal Canadiens tonight.

title: PublicTV Series Slated On Shakespeare's World
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) Camera crews will go StratfordonAvon next year to begin filming 10 halfhour programs about 16thcentury England called The World of William Shakespeare.

title: Australian Pleases Voters
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 3 (Reuters)An opinion poll shows an increasing swing to Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser's caretaker coalition government. The poll, published in The Sydney Daily Mirror, gives Mr. Fraser's LiberalCountry Party coalition 54 percent support compared with 46 percent for Labor.

title: COALITION REGIME IN LAOS ABOLISHED
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 3The Communistled Pathet Lao took full control over Laos today, announcing the end of the monarchy, abolition of the 19monthold coalition Government and establishment of a People's Democratic Republic.

title: IRISH AND BRITISH CLASH OVER I.R.A
description: LONDON, Dec. 3Irish and British authorities were locked in an angry dispute today over the case of Margaret McKearney, a 21yearold Northern Irish woman described by Scotland Yard as Britain's most wanted woman terrorist.

title: DoubleParked Ambulance Ticketed
description: Man with a heart attackit was not an unusual call in the life of a Brooklyn ambulance driver. Jeffrey Wilson climbed into his redandwhite ambulance of the Long Island College Hospital when the call was relayed to him from the police 911 emergency network.

title: Notes on People
description: Simon Wiesenthal, the Austrian Jew who hunts down former Nazis, has dropped his slandor suit against Chancellor Bruno Kreisky of Austria, and observers said that both men had backed down in their fiveyear feud. In October, the

title: BROKERS CHARGE BANKS ENCROACH
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 3Two leading Wall Street brokers sharply criticized banks today for attempting to attract brokerage business at discount rates.

title: FORD AND CHINESE OMIT COMMUNIQUE ON PEKING TALKS
description: PEKING, Thursday, Dec. 4Chinese and American leaders have decided not to issue a joint communiqu when President Ford's visit to Peking ends tomorrow.

title: U.S. Academy of Sciences Issues Plea for Sakharov
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The National Academy of Sciences said today it has urged Soviet officials to allow Andrei D. Sakharov to leave the country to accept the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, Norway.

title: Judge Asks Paper Not to Print Column on Dairy Antitrust Suit
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 3 (AP)United States District Judge John W. Oliver has asked a newspaper publisher voluntarily not to print a column rather man force the judge to deciae whether it should be published.

title: Sales of New U.S. Cars Rose 35% in November
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3United States new car sales were up 35 percent in November, the second straight month in the 1976 model year that deliveries topped the corresponding period last year, according to company reports.

title: Celtics Set Back By Bulls
description: BOSTON, Dec. 2 (AP)The Chicago Bulls survived the Boston Celtics' fourthperiod rally tonight and scored a 109106 National Basketball Association victory.

title: INSURANCE PLAN BACKED BY A.M.A.
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 3 (UPI)American Medical Association delegates have approved a progress report on the establishment of their own national insurance company to share with state medical societies the financial risk of writing malpractice insurance.

title: Open Interest
description: Wednesday. Dec. 3. 1975

title: Nine Honored for Climbing Municipal Ladders to Success
description: Nine superachievers in the municipal bureaucracy were honored yesterday for outstanding public service by the Fund for the City of New York.

title: Bill on City Loan Survives Senate Attempt to Kill It
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.3President Ford's proposed legislation to provide up to $2.3 billion in renewable Federal loans, over the next two and a half years to prevent a. New York City default won its first Senate test this morning.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outging

title: Portuguese Nationalize TV and Private Radio Stations
description: LISBON, Dec. 3Portugal's ruling High Council of the Revolution met today for the first time since last week's aborted leftwing coup, while the crackdown on leftists continued.

title: RAM Gives An Old Hall A New Look
description: The stage is eight inches higher than it used to be. One may not notice that. But the domelike structure that once hung over it is gone, and that is the most striking change in the $312,000 renovation that has just been completed in the Music Hall of the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Simon Leans to Ending Loopholes in Tax Code
description: Treasury Secretary William E. Simon said here last night that he was increasingly attracted to the idea of eliminating the myriad socalled loopholes which now litter our tax code.

title: Jets' Ward Sees 2Year Buildup
description: In one of the few objective statements Jet fans have heard this year, the club's general manager, Al Ward. admitted yesterday that it will still take a couple of years to build the Jets. I'm afraid so.

title: Ballet's Charms, Doctors Find, Mask Life of Pain
description: Ballet dancers who execute graceful leaps, lift partners through floating arcs and perform many other polished but strenuous maneuvers often accomplish them despite the searing pain of torn ligaments, infected callouses and fractured and broken bones.

title: FIVE SUBPOENAED IN HOFFA INQUIRY
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3Five persons connected with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the underworld, including air associate of Anthony Provenzano, a former teamster official from New Jersey have reportedly been subpoenaed to testify tomorrow before a grand jury here that has been investigating the disappearance of James R. Hoffa.

title: Air Jamaica Cancels Flights
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Dec. 3 (UPI)Air Jamaica canceled all flights today because of a strike by ground employees, stranding 600 United States tourists in the resort city of Montego Bay. The strike affected 17 scheduled flights to the United States and Canada.

title: Bailey Cleared in JaiAlai Fund Case
No Pacem in Angola
description: There was little talk of peace on earth at the Pacem in Terris convocation in Washington. Instead there was Daniel P. Moynihan, the United States ambassador to the United Nations, charging that Soviet aid for the Marxist Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) was part of a Kremlin drive to colonize all of Africa.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stockownership by leading stockholders, directors, and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not issue such a report this week.

title: Sales at Big Stores Here Up only 3.5% for Month
description: The adverse effect of last month's neardefault by the city and unseasonally warm, rainy weather were cited yesterday by merchants as reasons for a relatively small gain, 3.5 percent, in November sales of New York's largest department stores from yearearlier levels.

title: Egypt Asks U.N. Action
description: CAIRO, Dec. 3Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy of Egypt, in calling for an emergency meeting of the Security Council with Palestinian participation to deal with yesterday's Israeli air attack in Lebanon, urged the Council to take deterrent steps against Israel to prevent more attacks.

title: Chess
description: Is it better to play with or against an isolated pawn, with or against hanging pawns, with an exposed pawn center or against it in hypermodern style? After 500 years of recorded theory, there are still no definitive answers to these questions.

title: Museums Here to Get More State Aid
description: The New York State Council on the Arts voted yesterday to give $961,000 in additional grants to 12 cultural institutions in the state with pressing financial problems. Nine of the institutions are in New York City, including six major ones: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Natural History, the Brooklyn Museum, the Museum of Modem Art, the New York Botanical Garden and the New York Zoological Society.

title: Conflicts of Interests Cited For Interior Agency Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) More than 60 Interior Department officials own potentially conflicting security holdings, according to a General Accounting Office report.Representative John E. Moss, Democrat of California and Benjamin S. Rosenthal, Democrat of Queens, yesterday made public the report, which they said reflected a continuing pattern of conflicts of interest among Government workers and the failure of officials to require and review financial statements.

title: Houston Businessman to Head Ford 1976 FundRaising Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)Robert Mosbacher, a Houston businessman, was named today to heed fundraising operations for President Ford's campaign for the Presidency in 1976.

title: EDWARD N. MAYER, ADMAN, DIES AT 68
description: Edward Newton Mayer Jr., an authority on directmail marketing, died Monday evening at his home, 50 Sutton Place South. He was 68 years old.

title: Kingsmen's Team Gets Royal Borough Welcome
description: The Brooklyn College football team was cheered on the steps of Borough Hall in Brooklyn yesterday at a ceremony honoring its victory last Saturday night in the first Coco Bowl game played in San Juan, P.R.

title: EGYPTIANS EXULT AT SINAI OILFIELD
description: ABU RUDEIS, Sinai, Dec. 3 For the first time in eight years, an Egyptian tanker was loaded here today, and Ahmed, Hilal, the Egyptian Petroleum Minister, announced jubilantly that the first refined oil products from the Sinai will be on the market in Cairo in a few days.

title: Music: Ehrling Steps In and Leads the Stockholm
description: Gennadi Rozhdestvensky and New York just cannot seem to link up. Last July the Russian conductor was supposed to conduct the Bolshoi Opera at the Metropolitan but for reasons of their own the Soviet officials would not let him leave the country at that time.

title: Fordham Defeats Yale; Bucknell Upsets Penn
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 3 Kevin Brown made a layup with 5 seconds to play tonight, giving Fordham's basketball team a 4745 victory over Yale.

title: TWO GROUPS URGE AID FOR RETARDED
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3 (AP)More than 2,500 severely or profoundly retarded schoolage children in New Jersey receive little or no educational services despite statutory and constitutional requirements two organizations charged today.

title: Sad Finale Ends Well For Aged
description: A wheelchair expedition to Radio City Music Hall which was expected to be a depressing, final event in the life of the Hillside, Aged Program, became, a joyful celebration yesterday, barely 24 hours after Muhammad All pledged $100,000 to save the privately supported program for the handicapped elderly from being shut down.

title: CORRECTION
description: As a result of transmission errors a dispatch from Canada in The New York Times last Friday incorrectly related circumstances preceding the resignation of Yves Menard as a vice president of Air Canada. It said the airline had signed a $100 million contract with a company that sold a villa to him; the figure should have been $1 million. It also said that testimony indicated that the airline had provided a Lebanese official with a $500,000 expense account; the figure should have been $5,000.

title: Canadians Warned by Killanin
description: GENEVA, Dec. 3  Lord Killanin, president of the International Olympic Cornmittee, warned the embattled Canadian organizers of the Summer Games, schneduled to start July 17 in Montreal, that they are expected to he ready to host the event as promised.

title: Booming Houston Puts Its Faith in Unlimited Growth
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 3A young businessman here was asked recently to put Houston in perspective. He thought a while, then answered by recalling the first word that man uttered from another heavenly body. When Neil A. Armstrong set Apollo 11 on moon on July 20. 1969, the first word he said was Houston. Then came, Tranquility base here. The Eagle has landed.

title: ExFranklin Bank Officer Is Ready to Plead Guilty
description: Peter R. Shaddick, former executive vice chairman of the Franklin National Bank, told a Federal judge yesterday that he would plead guilty to participating in a scheme that involved the loss of $30 million in foreign currency speculation.

title: Swiss Woman Wins First Cup Downhill
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 3 (UPI)Bernadette Zurbriggen of Switzerland won a women's downhill race that opened the 19751976 World Cup and Olympic ski racing season today at Daille Mountain.

title: Sabres Are No. 1 In State
description: New York City may have an Albany on its back, but the Rangers and Islanders have a Buffalo. Defeating the Sabres, the second best team in the National Hockey League last season, has proved as difficult as squeezing a nickel out of the state capital.

title: Synecdoche Well Defined But Misused
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Even good Homer nods things are almost never what they seem, all that glitters is probably rhinestones at best, and to speak of disposing of someone is just a plain old euphemism, not a trendy synecdoche.

title: City Starts Emergency Pickup Of Refuse in Garbage Walkout
description: The city's Sanitation Department began the emergency removal last night of stacks of rubbish and garbage judged to be fire hazards in the worsening situation resulting from the threeday strike of private cartmen.

title: HELEN LOTOTSKI
description: Helen Folys Lototski, founder of the Ukrainian National Women's League of America, died Tuesday at the home of a son in West Sand Lake, N. Y. She was 81 years old.

title: Indictment of Blumenthal In Perjury Reported Near
description: The indictment of Albert H. Blumenthal, the Assembly majority leader, for perjury in the nursinghome investigation was reliably reported to be imminent last night.

title: SnowMaking Hopes of Ski Areas Depend at Cold Spell
description: The first important winter watch of the season Was on in upper New York State and New England last night. Skiarea operators were anticipating snowmaking weather that was expected to send the temperatures plummetting to near zero by the morning's early hours.

title: Wage and Price Controls Are Approved in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Canada's House of Commons today gave final approval to the Government's wage and price control legislation.

title: F.B.I. Yields Rosenberg Files in Bid by Sons to Prove Parents Were Innocent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3A quarter century after Julius and Ethel Rosenberg were arrested as atomic spies, the Federal Bureau of Investigation today released 29,000 pages of investigative reports and other files that the Rosenberg's sons hope may reveal that their parents were innocent.

title: Bill on City Loan Survives Senate Attempt to Kill It
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3President Ford's proposed legislation to provide up to $2.3 billion in renewable Federal loans over the next two and a half year's to prevent a New York City default won its first Senate test this morning.

title: Schlesinger Again Asks Caution In Pursuing Detente With Soviet,
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Former Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger again urged today that a wary approach be made toward the Soviet Union, which, he cautioned, views dtente as a continuation of confrontation in a different form.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1975

title: TV: Enter Grady and:Cop and Kid
description: On Fridays, NBCTV has had a very successful earlyevening lineup with Sanford and Son and Chico and the Man. On Thursdays, it has failed miserably with The Montefuscos and Fay. The daring solution for Thursdays? Grab the cooky cutter and punch out reasonable facsimiles of Sanford and Son and Chico and the Man. Enter (to the sound of cynical snickering) Grady and The Cop and the Kid.

title: Chief to Leave Election Unit
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3 (AP)The New Jersey Election Law Enforcement Commission said today that its executive director, David F. Norcross, would leave his job soon to return to private law practice. Mr. Norcross has served wtih the commission since it was created in May 1973 to monitor financial reports required of candidates and political organizations under the State Campaign Reform Law.

title: Nigeria Sets January 1977 As Date for Black Festival
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 3 (AP) New dates for the Second World Black and African Festival of Arts and Culture were announced yesterday.

title: Estrogen Is Linked To Uterine Cancer
description: The estrogen hormones taken by millions of American women to alleviate the symptoms and aftereffects of menopause have been linked in two studies to a substantially increased risk of cancer of the uterus.

title: F.B.I. IS ACCUSED OF POLITICAL ACTS FOR 6 PRESIDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Federal Bureau of Investigation supplied secret dossiers, conducted wiretaps and carried out physical surveillance for political purposes at the behest of all six Presidents from Franklin D. Roosevelt to Richard M. Nixon, the staff of a Senate committee charged today.

title: Canadian Mail GoAhead
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 3 (UPI)The Canadian Post Office today informed postal administrations around the world of the end to Canada's sixweek postal strike, and requested that surface mail destined for this country begin immediately. It asked that airmail dispatches and bulk thirdclass mail not be sent before Dec. 8.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Jonathan L. Goldstein, United States Attorney for New Jersey, was installed as president of the New Jersey Federal Bar Association, succeeding Judge Anthony T. Augelli of United States District Court. Addressing a luncheon meeting of the association at the Downtowner Motor Inn in Newark, Mr. Goldstein said he would ask the organization's ethics committee to initiate proceedings whereby attorneys who have been convicted of crimes in Federal Court shall be suspended from practice in that court. Mr. Goldstein also said that he planned to inaugurate publication of a Federal bar news for dissemination to association members on District Court decisions, policy statements and other matters relating to Federal practice.

title: Artis Tells of a Deal for Freedom in Murder Case
description: John Artis, who was convicted with Rubin (Hurricane) Carter of a triplemurder in New Jersey, said yesterday that a state legislator investigating the case had offered him a deal to free him from a life prison sentence if he would admit that he had been an accomplice to the murder.

title: Personal Finance: Tax Delinquency
description: What happens if you do not pay your Federal income tax when it is due?

title: COALITION REGIME IN LAOS ABOLISHED
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 3The Communistled Pathet Lao took full control over Laos today, announcing the end of the monarchy, abolition of the 19monthold coalition Government and establishment of a People's Democratic Republic.

title: Fashion Meets Fantasy
description: Rudi Gernreich came with two models wearing his basic bicycle dresshandlebars on the shoulders, bicycle seat as a loincloth, reflectors on the chest and practically nothing in between.

title: Dope, a Movie About Addicts, At the Whitney
description: Dope, the documentary on British and American denizens of the London drug scene, which had its local premiere yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art, was filmed in 1966 by Sheldon and Diane Rochlin, a peripatetic American husbandandwife team. If its moment in social history is unspecified in its expressionistic, color footage, this penetration, if occasionally disjointed, record of our disengaged youth still appears to be a strikingly contemporary, sad and awesome commentary.

title: Moscow Indicates A Poor Grain Crop Of 137 Million Tons
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3The Soviet harvest, hit by severe drought conditions last summer, appears to have yielded as little as 137.2 million tons of grain, about a third less than planned, according to information in an official report delivered at the current session of the Supreme Soviet, or Parliament.

title: Mt. Vernon School Integration Ordered After a 7Year Battle
description: In a school desegregation case that has been pending since 1968, the State Education Commissioner yesterday ordered the Mount Vernon Board of Education to implement its plan for a voluntary shift of black and white pupils to improve the racial balance of that city's schools.

title: 4 Bombs Explode in Miami
description: MIAMI, Dec. 3Four small bombs exploded here tonight outside buildings that house Federal offices.

title: The Cosmopolitan Club Cited On Open House for Roaches
description: The Cosmopolitan Club, an exclusive women's club, has been playing unhappy host to some very unwelcome guests recentlyroaches.

title: Walter Sullivan Gets Medal From Society of Engineers
description: The American Society of Mechanical Enginers presented its Ralph Coats Roe Medal yesterday to Walter Sullvian, science editor of The New York Times, at the society's annual winter meeting in Houston.

title: Sabres Salvage Tie With Capitals
description: LANDOVER, Md. Dec. 3 (UPI)Jerry Korab's goal at 5:53 of the third period tonight enabled the Buffalo Sabres to salvage a 44 tie with the Washington Capitals in a National Hockey League game.

title: Man Killed in Collapse Of Brooklyn Building
description: A threestory tenement collapsed into a pile of rubble in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn last night, killing an elderly resident who was alone in his apartment, the police reported.

title: Oil Fee to Be Removed
description: The Ford Administration is preparing to announce soon the removal of the $2abarrel fee on imported crude oil. The action could reduce domestic crude oil prices And retail prices for heating oil and gasoline, Page 25.

title: AUSTERITY EFFORT LOSES IN HARTFORD
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 3  An emergency program of spending cuts proposed by Gov. Ella T. Grasso to the Connecticut General Assembly was suddenly and surprisingly defeated today.

title: Moluccans: Lost Home, Lost Hopes
description: BEILEN, the Netherlands, Dec. 3In this flat farm region in the northeastern part of the Netherlands, militant youths dream of a homeland they have never seenthe South Molucca islands of Indonesia. Yesterday five of them seized a train near here and demanded independence for the islands.

title: Music: Idil Biret at Piano
description: Talent is what Idil Biret has in prodigious measure. The Turkish pianist made that clear from the start in her recital at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night, when she made light of the technical and musical difficulties in Beethoven's 32 Variations in C minor. She then proceeded to give a highly respectable account of Ravel's Gaspard de la Nuit, even unto the most murderous pages of its finale. Scarbo.

title: Beame, in Dismissing 500, Ousts Political Appointees
description: Mayor Beame announced the dismissals of 500 city workers yesterdaymany of them political appointees from Democratic clubhouses throughout the cityin what the Mayor called the $6.3 million first step in the city's overall effort to reduce $200 million from the existing budget.

title: Con Ed Plan For Penalty Is Opposed
description: Consumer spokesmen yesterday opposed a proposal by the Consolidated Edison Company that electricity customers whose service is disconnected for nonpayment of bills be assessed reconnection charges of $15 to $18 to reestablish service after the bills are paid.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: HOUSE VOTES BILL TO KEEP TAX CUT, BARS SPENDING LID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The House of Representatives approved today legislation modifying and continuing in effect through next year $13 billion in tax reductions for individuals and businesses that were enacted last spring as a temporary antirecession measure.

title: B.P. Profit Down 66.8%; Gulf and Western Net Up
description: The British Petroleum Company announced yesterday that its net income fell 66.8 percent in the third quarter to $77 million from $232 million in the comparable quarter last year.

title: Bridge:
description: The Greater New York Bridge Association, like its parent city, has been going through a major crisis, and been in danger of defaulting on its obligations. The scenario was a familiar one: a meeting of top executives searching for a solution in a race against time.

title: Gross Is Imprisoned And Then Released Pending a Hearing
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4Judge Lawrence A. Whipple of Federal District Court today denied a petition for a new trial for Nielson G. Gross, former state Republican chairman, who was convicted last year of obstructing justice, but soon afterward Mr. Gross was released after spending several hours at a Federal minimumsecurity prison in Allenwood, Pa.

title: Long Island City Gains Soccer Title
description: Long Island City won its fourth straight Public Schools Athletic League soccer championship yesterday with a 10 triumph over George Washington at Columbia University's Baker Field.

title: Bridge
description: The Greater New York Bridge Association, like its parent city, has been going through a major crisis, and been in danger of defaulting on its obligations. The scenario was a familiar one: a meeting of top executives searching for a solution in a race against time.

title: 3 Lines Unaffected
description: Bergenfield, Dec. 4While most New Jersey bus commuters will dig into their pockets for increased fares next week because of cutbacks in state subsidies, riders of the Red & Tan Lines, owned and operated by the Rockland Coach Company of Bergenfield, will pay the same fare.

title: Deaths
description: Death

title: Lawyer Revives Issue of 2d Gun In '68 Killing of Robert Kennedy
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (UPI) The question of whether a second gun was involved in the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy was raised I again today by a lawyer, Vincent Bugliosi, on the basis of information from a former restaurant employee at the Ambassador Hotel, where the New York Democrat was slain.

title: S.L.A. IMPOSES BAN ON TOTAL NUDITY
description: The State Liquor Authority yesterday announced a statewide ban on total nudity in places selling alcoholic beverages, and it canceled the liquor license of a popular Greenwich Village nightspot on the ground that its production of Let My People Come was lewd and indecent.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Hannah Arendt, 69, Political Scientist And Writer, Is Dead
description: Hannah Arendt, the noted author and political scientist, died last night in her apartment at 370 Riverside Drive. She was 69 years old.

title: British Conservatives Reelect Mrs. Thatcher
description: LONDON. Dec. 4 UPI) Margaret Thatcher won reelection today as leader of Britain's Conservative Party.

title: ENGRAVERS UNION AGREES ON A PACT
description: Photoengravers Union No. 1 P and The Daily News and The New York Times reached agreement yesterday on a new threeyear contract, Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, announced.

title: HOFFA ABDUCTORS REPORTED NAMED
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4A Federal investigator said in court today that a witness had identified three New Jersey men, connected to the Teamsters and the underworld, who, the investigator said, had participated in the abduction and murder of James R. Hoffa.

title: Risks of Estrogen
description: Interviews with gynecologists indicated that new reports linking estrogen therapy during and after menopause to an increased risk of uterine cancer were having little effect on doctors' attitudes toward the drug. Page 45.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Common Pleas Court judge in Philadelphia has dismissed charges against a Blackwood, N. J., man accused of trying to arrange a $100,000 payoff to Philadelphia officials to obtain a city contract. Judge Stanley Kubacki, acting on a defense attorney's motion for demurrer, ruled that the Commonwealth had failed to sustain its conspiracy case against. John Aleksiejczyk, also known as John Alek. He was accused of conspiring to extort $100,000 from his former boss, Rocco Molinari, in return for the $5 million, 10year city contract. Mr. Molinari is the former head of Q.T. Solid Waste Disposal Inc. of Salem, N.J.

title: Nation's Supply of Money Up $400 Million in Week
description: The nation's money supply resumed growing at a fairly substantial rate in the latest statement week, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: 3 Lebanon Churches Hit by Fire Bombs After Koran Burning
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 4Firebomb attacks were made today on three Christian churches in the northern Lebanese city of Tripoli in apparent retaliation for the burning of a truckload of copies of the holy book of Islam, the Koran.

title: Books of The Times
description: To find some outstanding new children's booksthe task seemed more urgent this year, what with the new evidence coming in every hour that television and other bandits are robbing our children of literacy. Yet looking for weapons against illiteracy among this year's children's books, I was struck that if the TV industry survives on half a dozen plot situations, the juvenileliterature industry now seems to he getting by on three. My only consolation was that if nothing new turned up to compete with television around our place, we could always fall back on last year's Our Animal Friends at Maple Hill Farm, by Alice and Martin Pronenson, which up until now has graboed about a hundred hours away from the box. Morriss's Disappearing Bag: A Christmas Story by Rosemary Wells (Dial, $4.95)Morris's Christmas gift of a Teddy Bear can't compete with Victor's hockey outfit, Rose's beauty kit and Betty's chemistry set, so Morris discovers a disappearing bag under the Christmas tree, which sends everyone literally outtasight! It isn't the whimsical story that gets you so much as the touchingly lugubrious illustrations, especially the one of the green gas Rose cooks up. Guaranteed to generate a hundred questions.

title: MOVEOUT OF CITY SET BY TIMELIFE BOOKS
description: TimeLife Books, a division of Time Inc., advised its 200 employes yesterday that it was seeking a new site for its operations and probably would move out of New York City in 1977.

title: Fathers and Infants: Getting Close
description: The nurse chuckled. A lot of the fathers, she said, are still afraid to touch their babies.

title: ...Get Back on Course
description: Now a series of judicial rebuffs has been administered to Mr. Nadjari by Justice Murtagh and the special prosecutor has publicly charged that his usefulness is being undermined by the judge's continuing hostility. It is clear that the investigation cannot continue on its present course.

title: ANNE M. STARR
description: Anne Moshinsky Starr, a leader in Jewish community affairs here, died Wednesday at Doctors Hospital. She was 78 years old, lived at 1095 Park Avenue and was the wife of Jacob Starr, founder of the Artkraft Strauss Sign Corporation.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 1.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 189.6 from 190.8 last week.

title: Election Agency Approves Plan For Cancellation of Some Debts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Federal Election Commission approved today a plan under which some political candidates may continue to run up large bills with corporations in a campaign and settle them for a few cents on the dollar after the election.

title: Ballet: A WellDanced Nutcracker
description: Where would our holidays be without The Nutcracker? The question is so inconceivable that only the extraordinarily brave might conceive an answer. It might have something to do with irrelevance and triviality, but that is not the point. The Nutcracker has been sold to us as a child's dream of Christmas and the perfect introduction to the mysteries of classic ballets. And why not? And, after that, why not?

title: 52 Arrested in Drug Raids
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 4 (UPI)About 100 law enforcement officers arrested at least 52 persons on charges of possession and delivery of heroin and other controlled substance in a series of raids carried out today. State Attorney General Robert Kane said that 24 police departments under the direction of the Justice Department had picked up suspects in Mongomery, Delaware, Bucks, Philadelphia and Chester counties.

title: Dinner for Seven
description: WASHINGTONThe moral climate in our great country, and our great Navy, is so eroded today that we are headed for national disaster.

title: Occidental Settles Dispute With Libya
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced yesterday that it had settled its dispute with the Government of Libya and that it would immeIdiately resume shipments of crude oil from ?? Zuetina Terminal in Libya.

title: New Ailey Echoes Gets Polished Look To Honor Ellington
description: Alvin Ailey is resolutely assembling the pieces that will make up his company's dance tribute to the late Duke Ellington during the Bicentennial year. These will include revivals, repertory dances such as his own The Mooche, given Wednesday evening, and new works like Milton Myers's Echoes in Blue, which had its first performance Tuesday with Alvin Ailey's City Center Dance Theater.

title: Market Place
description: A group of coal industry analysts met last week to discuss prospects for the industry. They concluded that the increase in coal stocks of early 1975 would be renewed in the latter part of 1976.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday, Dec. 4, 1975

title: SOVIET SUSPECTED OF ARMS VIOLATION
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 4American intelligence officials have reported to the Ford Administration that the Soviet Union recently constructed a largescale radar station on the Kamchatka Peninsula, raising new questions about possible violations of the 1972 treaty limiting strategic arms.

title: TV: Watergate CoverUp Trial Poses Question
description: Tonight WNET/13 opens another of its 10day ontheair membership drives, an event that places just above stale commercials in audienceenthusiasm surveys. But, between the pitches for money and devotion, the programming schedule is stocked nicely with some unusual items. On Monday, for instance, Channel 13 will present, unedited but not uninterrupted, The Sorrow and the Pity, the 4hour documentary by Marcel Ophuls. A week from today, the primetime offering will he Federico Fellini's La Dolce Vita.

title: Stocks Mixed as Dow Rises 3.62
description: The stock market's free fall braked yesterday after its big losses on Tuesday and Wednesday, but stock prices did not show much bounce.

title: Time of Decision
description: A time of decision is drawing near for Congress and President Ford. After months of controversy and protracted legislative negotiations between the White House and Capitol Hill, several major bills are about to become law or fall before a Presidential veto.

title: MONDALE SEEKS AREA PRIMARIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, who pulled lout of the Presidential race a year ago bec??use he was unwilling to undergo its rigors, introduced today a bill to create a regional primary system.

title: HOFFA ABDUCTORS REPORTED NAMED
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4A Federal investigator said in court today that a witness had identified three New Jersey men, connected to the Teamsters and the underworld, who, the investigator said, had participated in the abduction and murder of James R. Hoffa.

title: A Debate FIares in Israel Over Air Raids in Lebanon
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4An unusual public debate has erupted here over the timing, Wisdom and effectiveness of the Israeli air strikes against Lebanon on Tuesday.

title: Loch Ness Monster Again Makes Waves
description: LONDON, Dec. 4  Without even surfacing, so to speak, the Loch Ness monster has again shown that he, she or it can cause all sorts of commotion among the otherwise sensible people of Britain.

title: New Energy Chief Has Lots of Ideas, but Wishes He Had More Help
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)The State Energy Office under the new direction of Burt Ross, a former Mayor of Fort Lee, is dabbling in untapped areas while trying to shape a priority list for the coming year.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high fide at Asbury Park and Belmar, deduc. 34 min. from Sandy Hook time. For high fide at Atlantic City (Steel Pler), deduct 26 min. from Sandy Hook time. For high fide at Jones Inlet (Pt. Lookout), deduct 19 min. from Sandy Hook tine.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The National Basketball Association will hold a special draft Tuesday for the negotiating rights to five players now playing in the American Basketball Association, the league announced yesterday.

title: Advertising
description: Julian Koenig, 54 years old, and Norman H. Grulich, 49, who once took turns being president and chief executive of the old Papert, Koenig, Lois agency, are now back in business again at Julian Koenig Inc. which they, in semijest, call a middleaged agency for middle  aged clients.

title: 500 BEING LET GO BY CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 4After the unexpected defeat of her austerity program yesterday in the General Assembly, Gov. Ella T. Grasso said today that 500 state employees would be laid off as soon as possible, probably by the end of the year, to help Connecticut avert a budget deficit.

title: ROSENBERG FILES OF C.I.A RELEASED
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4An initial batch of 894 pages of Central Intelligence Agency files has been released on the 25yearold case that sent Julius and Ethel Rosenberg to their deaths for plotting atomic spying in behalf of the Soviet Union.

title: Louis C. Wills, a Civic Leader And Lawyer in Brooklyn, Dead
description: Louis Charles Wills, Brooklyn) lawyer, businessman, philanthropist and civic leader, died yesterday. He would have been 91 years aid next Friday.

title: ANACONDA RAISING SOME FOIL PRICES
description: The aluminum division of the Anaconda Company announced yesterday that it planned to raise prices of selected foil products from 3 to 7 percent as of Jan. 5. The company said the higher prices would be placed on foil for converter, capacitor, foil container and fin stock products heating exchange metals. Under the new price schedules, capacitor foil will go up 5 cents a pound, converter foil by 4 cents, but 1 cent a pound will now be allowed for combined items for a truckload. The container foil increase is 4 cents a pound, fin stock schedules will rise by 2 to 3 cents a pound depending on guages. The company said the new prices were needed to reflect increases in fabricating costs and that, with the exception of heavy guage fin stock, there have been no increases in prices since August 1974.

title: Repeated Vandalism Disables Escalators At Columbus Circle
description: Two parallel escalators put into service two months ago as part of a $1 million refurbishing of the Columbus Circle subway station, partly as a convenience for outpatients at nearby Roosevelt Hospital, have been shut down much of the time, largely because of what the Transit Authority calls mindless vandalism.

title: S.E.C. Report Backs StockFee Shifts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  In its first monitoring report, the Securities and Exchange Commission told Congress today that the switch to negotiated stock exchange commission rates last May had led to a sizable reduction in commission rates paid by institutional investors and a small reduction for individual investors.

title: Metcalfe in Bitter Fight To Hold Seat in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4Uu to now, the seats of the small but growing number of black members of the House of Representatives have been about as safe as those of Southern committee chairmen. Not one incumbent member of the Congressional Black Caucus has been defeated since its formation in 1969.

title: CITY AGENCY WINS AN ABORTION CASE
description: The right of the City Health Department to require physicians to report names and addresses of all women receiving abortions in the city was upheld yesterday by the State Court of Appeals

title: RAIL PACT AVERTS PENDING WALKOUT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The threat of a crippling national rail strike ended today with a tentative contract agreement between the railroads and four shopcraft unions representing 70,000 workers.

title: African Ecumenical Group Is Exerting Strong Social and Political Influence
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 4 An African ecumenical organization is emerging as an influence not only in the World Council of Churches but also in the political and social struggles of this continent.

title: FORD QUITS CHINA; SOME GAINS SEEN
description: PEKING, Friday, Dec. 5 President Ford and Chinese leaders ended their talks here today after reaching an apparent understanding that their mutual interest lay in countering any expansion of Soviet influence in Western Europe, Angola and the Pacific.

title: Missile Attack Reported in Angola
description: UIGE, Angola, Dec. 4 Ambriz, the major northern military stronghold of the National Front for the Liberation of Angola was reported to have been bombarded today by longrange missiles.

title: 2 New Bombs Explode in Miami, Hitting Police and Justice Officer
description: MIAMI, Dec. 4Two more bombs exploded here this afternoon in what law enforcement officials have described as a coordinated effort aimed at the entire justice system in the Miami area.

title: Catholic Bishops Plan Church's Role in Bicentennial
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4  Thirty, Roman Catholic Bishops, headed by John Cardinal Dearden of Detroit, heard testimony this afternoon at. the beginning of a threeday hearing on the social challenges facing the, church as the United States enters its third century.

title: HUGHES SINGS SONGS OF STAGE AND SKIING
description: Most of the songs that Dickson Hughes sings and plays on the piano at the Cafe Pierre in the Hotel Pierre are from Broadway musicals, old and new. He performs, them with the brighteyed eagerness that has replaced the once customary huskyvoiced, worldweary approach since Bobby Short became the dominant figure in this field.

title: Beame, in Dismissing 500, Ousts Political Appointees
description: Mayor Beame announced the dismissals of 500 city workers yesterdaymany of them political appointees from Democratic clubhouses throughout the cityin what the Mayor called The $6.3 million first step in the city's overall effort to reduce $200 million from the existing budget.

title: MUSKIE URGES CITIES TO LOBBY FOR FUNDS
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 4Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, told members of the National League of Cities today that they must do more effective lobbying or face the loss of billions of dollars of Federal revenuesharing aid.

title: HOUSE VOTES BILL TO KEEP TAX CUT, BARS SPENDING LID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The House of Representatives approved today legislation modifying and continuing in effect through next year $13 billion in tax reductions for individuals and businesses that were enacted last spring as a temporary antirecession measure.

title: Power and Corruption
description: No wonder the latest Gallup Poll shows a sharp decline in public esteem for the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agencyfrom 84 percent highly favorable to the F.B.I. in 1965, for example, to only 37 percent today. And only 14 percent of a sample of 1,515 adults were any longer highly favorable to the C.I.A.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence charged that the United States ended a 10year, $13.4 million effort to deny President Salvador Allende Gossens power in Chile by advocating and encouraging the overthrow of a democratically elected government. The Committee said, however, it had found no direct involvement by the Central Intelligence Agency or the United States diplomatic mission in the 1973 coup against the Allende Government. [Page 1, Col. 1.]

title: Excerpts From C. I. A. Study
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Following are excerpts from a report, Covert Action in Chile, 19631973, prepared by the staff of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence:

title: Retail Store Sales Rise
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.6 billion, up 18 percent from the yearearlier $1.36 billion. Total retail store sales were about $11.55 billion, up 14 percent from last year's, $10.15 billion.

title: The Connecticut Scandal
description: The scandal in Connecticut concerning the granting of a license for a jai alai arena has taken a new turn. David Friend, the Florida businessman who originally received the license and who allegedly asserted that he had paid a large sum to the late John M. Bailey, longtime Democratic state chairman, and smaller sums to lesser politicians for their help in getting the license, has now been named in arrest warrants accusing him of perjury and larceny.

title: Terrorists Seize Arsterdam Consulate
description: BEILEN, the Netherlands, Dec. 4  At least three East Asian terrorists seized the Indonesian Consulate in Amsterdam today, taking 30 hostages, 16 of them children.

title: The Pop Life
description: The Band has a new album out called Northern Lights Southern Cross, and in the press biography that Capitol Records has released for the occasion, the quintet is casually referred to as one of America's most prolific groups.

title: Complex of Restaurants Is Proposed for 2d Ave.
description: Plans for a $2 million group of restaurants, shops and theaters at the Manhattan entrance to the Queensboro Bridge were unveiled to the Board of Estimate in City Hall yesterday and immediately provoked a neighborhood controversy.

title: F.D.A. BARS SALES OF A SWEETENER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Food and Drug Administration ordered today the immediate stay of a regulation it issued more than a year ago that approved the sale of an artificial sweetener called Aspartame, manufactured by G. D. Searle and Company.

title: Where One Year Is Forever
description: Arbitration hearings were completed the other day on Andy Messersmith's and Dave McNally's pleas for legal separation from the Dodgers and Expos, and now Peter Seitz, the arbitrator, is reviewing a fat transcript of testimony that consumed three days. Sometime within the next several weeks he will decide whether the two pitchers have fulfilled their contractual obligations and should be free agents or are bound for life by a oneyear option clause in contracts they did not sign. It was Peter Seitz who cut Catfish Hunter loose from the Oakland A's, but on altogether different grounds. A year ago he found that Charley Finley, owner of the A's, had breached his contract with Hunter by reneging on a covenant regarding deferred compensation. The issue now is: What Is the meaning of Paragraph 10A in the standard player's contract?

title: PANEL CLEARS C.I.A. OF A DIRECT ROLE IN '73 CHILE COUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The staff of a Senate intelligence committee said today it had found that the United States had encouraged the overthrow of the democratically elected Chilean Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: City College Five Wins in Overtime
description: A jump shot by City College's Andy Morrison tied Wagner at 6464 with 7 seconds to play, sending the game into overtime, and City then scored a 7668 victory.

title: PROSECUTOR FIRM ON CARTER, ARTIS
description: Burrell I. Humphries, the Passaic County, N.J., Prosecutor, said yesterady he had no reason to believe that Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis had been wrongly convicted of a 1966 triple murder in Paterson.

title: JACK MOLLENKOPF OF PURDUE IS DEAD
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind. Dec. 4 (AP)Jack Mollenkopf, the stern, often gruff taskmaster who reluctantly left a successful highschool coaching job in Ohio to become Purdue University's most renowned football coach, died of cancer today at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn. He was 70 years old.

title: Rangers and Sabres Play to 66 Standoff; Islanders, Led by Harris, Top Penguins, 61
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 4 Billy Harris, who rooms with Bryan Trottier on the road, complains that the rookie is always singing.

title: Bank's Suit on Notes Seen Making Problems for City
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 4 A court challenge by the Flushing National Bank over the constitutionality of the state's moratorium on $1.6 billion of New York City notes will create serious financial problems for the city, regardless of what the court decides, a leading Wall Street executive asserted today.

title: Physicians' Views Unchanged On Use of Estrogen Therapy
description: Gynecologists around the country indicated in a spot check yesterday that the new reports linking estrogen therapy during and after menopause to an increased risk of uterine cancer have had little effect on the doctors' attitudes toward the drug or their treatment of patients who take it.

title: Mail to Canada Resumes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  The United States Postal Service announced today that it had lifted the sixweek embargo on mail from the United States to Canada. The action was taken after Canadian postal officials informed the Postal Service that because a strike by Canadian postal workers was over, Canada could accept mail from the United States.

title: PANEL CLEARS C.I.A. OF A DIRECT ROLE IN '73 CHILE COUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The staff of a Senate intelligence committee said today it had found that the United States had encouraged the overthrow of the democratically elected Chilean Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: FORD OUTPUT TO RISE 22,500 IN JANUARY
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4The Ford Motor Company announced today that it was adding 22,500 cars to its North American January production schedules, including 20,800 in the United States.

title: U.N. Council Invites P.L.O. To Debate on Israeli Raids
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4The Security Council invited the Palestine Liberation Organization tonight to participate in a debate on the Israelis air raids on Lebanese territory earlier this week.

title: VLADIMIR GAVRILOV
description: BUDAPEST, Dec. 4 (AP)Vladimir S. Gavrilov, Soviet deputy minister of railroads, died of a heart attack today while heading a Soviet delegation to the Communist bloc economic conference here, the Hungarian press agency M.T.I. reported. He was 63 years old.

title: Chemical Put Out To Chase Pigeons Is Killing Starlings
description: A cluster of birdlovers, some of them sobbing, gathered outside the Ethical Culture School at 33 Central Park West last night to mourn dozens of starlings, their feet mired in a chemical, that fell to their deaths from the school's roof.

title: The Human Comedy Of Copley Portraits
description: When portraits by John Singleton Copley first got to London, the English carried on as if an emu had somehow learned to play the bassoon.

title: Mandel and 5 Others Plead Not Guilty
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 4Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and five codefendants in a fraud and bribery case pleaded not guilty this afternoon.

title: Uncle Santa
description: We say that we are a world power today but we were a world power in December 1941 and nobody questioned it. There was no United Nations in those days because, after all, it must be remembered that we were the originators of that world body.

title: Legislative Compromise Paves Way for Action on Bill to Aid City
description: ALBANY, Friday, Dec. 5A lastminute compromise paved the way for legislative action this morning on a bill to enable the trustees of the New York City employee pension funds to channel enough money for the city to meet its payroll today.

title: Benching Pondered
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 4Roscoe Word found out he was benched. But, somehow, he expected it, he explained today, as a preseason meeting with Emerson Boozer was recalled.

title: TV Offers Battle of Losers And a Meeting of Winners
description: How much rooting interest remains among the local fans near the end of a losing season? A barometer might be the audience ratings here of Sunday's two television games. Tile loyalists among the Jet fans can watch their team play the Patriots at Foxboro, Mass., (Channel 4, 1 P.M.) while the nonloyalists may view the match between two teams tied for first place, the Cardinals and Cowboys, at St. Louis (Channel 2, also 1 P.M.).

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: NEPCO SUIT SEEKS MORE AID ON FUEL
description: The New England Petroleum Corporation has filed suit in Federal court here to compel the Federal Energy Administration to grant it at least an additional $10.6 million worth of entitlements for residual fuel imports.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1975

title: Massachusetts U. Students Planning Tuition Boycott
description: AMHERST, Mass., Dec. 4 (AP)  University of Massachusetts, students have begun organizing a tuition boycott in the wake of action by university trustees raising tuition for graduate and undergraduate, resident and nonresident students.

title: Ordinance on Horse Diapering Stirs Debate in Charleston, S.C.
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Dec. 4Joseph McGee wants the obituary writers to know that he does not wish to be remembered as the man who put diapers on the horses of Charleston. He has been wrongly accused. He was of the alderman who introduced an ordinance to require the city's carriage drivers to clean up after their horses. But his fellow aldermen, over his objection, amended the ordinance to require the horses to wear diapers.

title: WHOLESALE INDEX STEADY IN MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A decline in volatile agricultural prices enabled the Wholesale, Price Index for November to remain unchanged from October, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Head of Council's Transit Panel Calls New Subway Cars Unsafe
description: Carol Greitzer, who heads the City Council's Mass Transportation Committee, charged yesterday that the city's new subway cars were unsafe, impractical and overly costly to maintain.

title: 9BILLION RAIL AID PASSED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Senate passed today a $9.4 billion rail reorganization bill to aid the, bankrupt Northeast rail system and other troubled lines. The vote was 53 to 38.

title: Daytime Sedatives And Aids to Sleep Are Held Ineffective
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4None of the most common active ingredients in overthecounter sedatives and sleep aids can be classed as fully safe and effective for their advertised uses, a panel of experts has reported to the Food and Drug Administration.

title: An Emigre Waits For Scholarly Job
description: A little more than a year ago. Gabor Follinus, a 28yearold Ph.D. from the University of Budapest, was assistant editor of a scholarly magazine of literature and art at the Institute for Literary Studies of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences in Budapest.

title: N.I.T. Cuts Field For College Fives
description: The National Invitation Tournament, Madison Square Garden's premier college basketball presentation, will cut back its field for the 39th version of the event in March.

title: Hershey Foods is Ending Portion Control Operation
description: The Hershey Foods Corporation announced yesterday it was discontinuing operations at its Chicagobased subsidiary, Portion Control Industries Inc., makers of frozen prepared foods for the food service industry, such as airlines, hospitals and schools, which has ??een operating at a loss for the last three years.

title: Panel Eases Rule for Cyclists
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) A House subcommittee has endorsed repeal of a Federal demand that states require motorcyclists to wear helmets. Representative Stewart B. McKinney, Republican of Connecticut, said today that the House Public Works Subcommittee on Surface Transporation had approved inclusion of the repeal as an amendment to the Federal Highway Aid Act.

title: AFTRA and Screen Actors Vote to Strike Commercials
description: Two actors' unions have voted to strike against producers of radio and television commercials and advertising agencies at midnight this Sunday, unless a new agreement is reached to replace a threeyear contract that expired Nov. 16.

title: Notes on People
description: Ending 41 years on the board of directors of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, Buell G. Gallagher has resigned as its vice chairman and from the board itself, effective immediately. Yesterday's announcement expressed the regret of Roy Wilkins, N.A.A.C.P. executive director.

title: Conferees Agree on Aid For Public Broadcasting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  SenateHouse conferees agreed today on legislation authorizing $634 million in Federal aid for public broadcasting for the next five years.

title: Defense Dispute
description: Now that it is back in session, Congress should give close attention to the warnings issued last week by former Defense Secretary Schlesinger concerning the national defense.

title: SARNOFF PROJECT SCRAPPED BY RCA
description: The new management of the RCA Corporation has scrapped a pet project of Robert W. Sarnoff, who was forced to resign as chairman and chief executive officer at a board meeting on Nov. 5.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An apparently deranged man attacked Police Officer Richard Gorellick in an alley behind the Midtown South Precinct station, at 357 West 35th Street, and struck him at least eight times on the head with a hammer while attempting to steal his service revolver, the police said. Fellow policemen who heard Officer Gorellick's shouts subdued the assailant, Ernest Sivak, 22 years old, of Coaldale, Pa., a former mental patient at the Fairview State Hospital in Waynesport, Pa. He said he had bought the hammer to get a gun, according to the police. Officer Gorellick, 30, suffered a fractured skull, but was reported in fair condition at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Halston Finds Road to Chic Paved With a Single Seam
description: It's the story of a seam up at Halston's placea seam that slants or spirals around the body and makes everything look neat and slim.

title: Ashe Ousts Orantes; Nastase In
description: to feel that the crowd is enjoying your game, but it was not enjoying mine, the U. S. Open champion said. When you play you need a feeling of communications.

title: Jailed South African Writer To Appeal 9Year Sentence
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Dec. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)A controversial South African writer sentenced to nine years in prison up der the Terrorism Act, Breyten Breytenbach, announced in a statement published here today that he would appeal.

title: Clemson Has Bulk
description: Gary Alexander, Clemson's 6foot6inch tackle, weighs 250 pounds and plays beside a 252pound tight end, Bennie Cunningham, who is 65.

title: Default Legislation Wins Two Senate Victories
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 President Ford's proposed legislation to provide $2.3 billion in renewable loans to prevent a New York City default won two significant Senate victories today as supporters prepared for a cloture vote tomorrow morning and expected passage tomorrow evening.

title: New Round of Fare Rises Will Be Ordered by Feb. 1
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4 (AP)Another round of bus and train fare increases, as big as those taking effect this month, will be imposed on the state's commuters by February, Transportation Commissioner Alan Sagner said today.

title: Hang Glider Pilot Killed
description: WACO, Tex., Dec. 4 (UPI)A hang glider floating more than 150 feet above the Baylor University football stadium parking lot collapsed and crashed yesterday, killing its passenger. The victim was Rick Harvey, 22 years old of Tyler, a junior at Baylor. The police said that the glider was being pulled by an auto.

title: BAYH HOLDS LEAD IN COALITION POLL
description: Birch Bayh will carry an early lead into the Presidential, convention tomorrow of the New Democratic Coalition, whose choice has some claim, to be the official liberal on the New York ballot, counts by both Mr. Bayh and his chief challenger. Fred Harris, indicated yesterday.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the Thanksgiving holiday week totaled an estimated 12.8 billion ton miles 0.3 percent above the corre sponding week a year ago; which was affected by both the holiday and a coal strike. The A.A.R. also reported that carloadings in the latest week to taled 392,779 cars, 3.7 percent above last year. The American Trucking Associations Inc. reported intercity truck tonnage was 10.7 percent below lastyear.

title: Music
description: Liszt's 12 Transcendental Etudes would rate high among the most strenuously difficult music composed for the piano in the 19th century. A few familiar items such as Felix follets or Harmonies du soir turn up now and again on recital programs, but performances of the entire wristbreaking, knucklecracking dozen are rare.

title: After Years of Fighting City Hall, a Woman Will Take It Over
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec.2 Residents of this industrialcity who stayed up, late on election night last month were stunned to see a 71yearold widow in in outrageous hat ridearound the deserted downtown streets waving a broom from the back of an open car.

title: Futures of Grains Show Early Rises, But Then Fall a Bit
description: After an early morning buying rush, grain and soybean prices declined yesterday under heavy selling to only a few cents above Wednesday's levels.

title: Hawks Beat Blazers on Late Steals
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 4 (AP)Tommy Henderson made two lastminute steals and raced in for layups that led the Atlanta Hawks to a 9487 National Basketball Association victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight.

title: Networks Charge Manipulation of News by China on Ford Visit
description: News executives of the television networks, not altogether Teased with the results of their coverage of President Ford's visit to China this week, said they believed television was being manipulated by Chinese officials through their control over the President's agenda and their restrictions on the movements of journalists.

title: Music: A New Davidovsky Piece at Philharmonic
description: There was a world premiere in New York last night. Pierre Boulez conducted the New York Philharmonic in the first performance anywhere of the Synchronisms No. 7 by Mario Davidovsky, the 41yearold Argentineborn composer now resident here.

title: For Disney Loyalists, A Collectors' Paradise
description: If there Is a corner of the universe where fictional characters celebrate the birthdays of their creators, then somewhere today there is a huge, ornate cake alight with 75 candles, including one to grow on.

title: Swiss Gain 2d Victory On Slopes
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 4 (AP)Lise Marie Morerod gave Switzerland its second victory in two days today as she won the women's giant slalom of the Criterium of the First Snow ski races.

title: Giants Side line Mendenhall; Jets' Word Blames Himself
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y. Dec. 4In a sure sign that the New York Giants have given up salvaging anything this year and are looking forward to next year, Coach Bill Arnsparger announced today that John Mendenhall, his allpro defensive tackle, would probably miss the rest of the season.

title: Atlantic Richfield Gets Controversial Financing
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4The Atlantic Richfield Company concluded today a $420 million credit agreement to finance development of its Alaskan natural gas reserves, under terms that have aroused bitter controversy here.

title: City Planning to Charge Tuition For Foreign Pupils in Its Schools
description: The city's public schools will begin charging tuition in February to 3,000 youngsters from other countries who do not have immigration status, including the children, of foreign businessmen, working here.

title: Wendell Phillips, OilmanArcheologist
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 4 (UPI)Wendell Phillips, a poor archeologist who became one of the world's richest men on oil concessions granted by Arabian sheiks, died today at the age of 54.

title: Scott Announces His Retirement After Three Terms in the Senate
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 4Senator Hugh Scott, who went to Washington 35 years ago and rose to a position of prominence, prestige and power, announced today his retirement from politics.

title: Daytime Sedatives And Aids to Sleep Are Held Ineffective
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4None of the most common active ingredients in overthecounter sedatives and sleep aids can be classed as fully safe and effective for their advertised uses, a panel of experts has reported to the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Private Bus Fares to Rise
description: Eleven private bus lines in Brooklyn, Queens, the Bronx and Staten Island were authorized by the city yesterday to raise fares from 35 to 50 cents beginning Jan. 1. Fares on express buses generally will rise from $1.25 to $1.50.

title: 10Year Term Decreed In Nigeria for Bribery
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 4 (AP)Nigeria's military government issued a decree today imposing a 10year jail sentence or $16,400 fine on anyone found guilty of offering bribes to state officials. The sentence and fine also will apply to officials who solicit bribes.

title: PRICES OF BONDS SHOW A DECLINE
description: The credit markets eased yesterday in reaction to Federal Reserve moves to drain funds from the system. Prices in both the government and corporate sectors opened slightly higher but then began weakening at noon when the Fed entered the market with temporary reserve  absorbing transactions. The fourday and, sevenday reverse repurchase agreements were initiated when the rate of Federal funds, excess reserves commercial banks may lend one another, was quoted at 5 per cent.

title: Los Angeles, in a Building Boom, Debates Urban Revival
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4In the heart of this city that all but surrendered its soul to the automobile, there is a new vitality these days, the beginnings of big city skyline and an angry, introspective debate over what kind of future its citizens want for Los Angeles.

title: People in Sports
description: Neil Wheelwright, the head football coach at Colgate University the last eight seasons, resigned yesterday to take the coaching reins at Holy Cross College. Wheelwright becomes the 23d coach in the 80year football history of the Cruseders.

title: Cheer Up! Things Are Terrible
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The only happy thought around here these days is that so many things are going wrong that maybe something will finally be done about them. But only maybe.

title: About New York
description: New York has many cuisines, but few seem to delight the local palate as pervasively as the Chinese does. The city has more than a thousand Chinese restaurants, and they are found in neighborhoods that are rich, that are poor, that are inbetween, that are Italian or black or Jewish, or even Chinese.

title: White Motor Denies Report
description: A Rome dispatch in The New York Times on Tuesday reported that a plant of the Arbos Company, a subsidiary of the White Motor Corporation near Parma, Italy, was occupied by its workers. White Motor denied yesterday that the plant was occupied.

title: 20 BOOKS NOMINATED FOR CRITICS' AWARDS
description: Twenty books were nominated yesterday by the officers and advisory board of the National Book Critics Circle for consideration in the voting of the group's first annual awards for works by American authors published this year.

title: 64th Annual Drive For Neediest Cases To Open on Sunday
description: The 64th annual appeal for the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund will open on Sunday. Since 1912, when The Times published a report of conditions among destitute families in the city, the fund has helped thousands of unfortunate people in the metropolitan area.

title: About New York
description: New York has many cuisines, but few seem to delight the local palate as pervasively as the Chinese does. The city has more than a thousand Chinese restaurants, and they are found in neighborhoods that are rich, that are poor, that are inbetween, that are Italian or black or Jewish, or even Chinese.

title: Spain's Cold but Respected New Speaker
description: MADRID, Dec. 4A Falangist who does not wear a blue shirt, a Christian Democrat whom other Christian Democrats do not consider democraticsuch is Torcuato FernndezMiranda y Hevia, the new Speaker of Parliament and the Chairman of the Council of the Realm. The appointment of Mr. FernndezMiranda is the first to be made by King Juan Carlos I since his accession to the throne Nov. 22. It was awaited with interest as an indication of how far and how fast the King would go in introducing new faces and new policies.

title: City Schools Plan To Charge Tuition For Foreign Pupils
description: The city's public schools will begin charging tuition in February to 3,000 youngsters from other countries who are not permanent residents or who do not have immigration status, including the children of foreign businessmen working here.

title: President Ford's Stop Today: Indonesia, One of Asia's Richest Yet Poorest Countries
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 4 Moneyits shortages and surpluses, the abuses it has spawned and its strategic importanceis at the heart of both the problems and the successes of Indonesia, the next stop after China for President Ford.

title: Cartmen Continue Strike Here As Inspectors Check Hazards
description: The deadlock in the strike of private cartmen continued, here yesterday as accumulations of trash and garbage grew larger.

title: ANTIBUSING MEASURE ADOPTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) The House voted today to retaro the strong antibusing language added by the Senate to a big money bill financing the Federal departments of Labors and Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)The Federal Reserve announced today an interpretation that will permit investors in individual retirement accounts at commercial banks to obtain top interest rate returns on their accounts.

title: SEARS SALES UP 6.7% IN NOVEMBER
description: The nation's largest retail chains reported yesterday that their November sales topped last year's. Several, however. had advances that fell below the level of earlier months and the inflation rate.

title: Ashe Ousts Orantes; Nastase In
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 4Manuel Orantes said he didn't feel the crowd enjoyed hiS game, and when his night's endeavors were over, he didn't like his own work either or that of Arthur Ashe.

title: ROSELLE MAN WINS $250,000 IN LOTTERY
description: LIVINGSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)A factory worker from Rose??e won $250,000 in the Jersey Jackpot lottery drawing here today.

title: Black Journal Given Grant Of $200,000 by PepsiCola
description: The PepsiCola Company has donated $200,000 to WNET/ Channel 13 to underwrite production next year of Black Journal. This is the first time the black  oriented publicaffairs and entertainment series has been funded by a major corporation.

title: City Sells Pension Assets, But Holds Up Paychecks
description: Despite the successful liquidation of $135 million in city pensionfund assets to pay city bills through Dec. 12, City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin held up distribution yesterday of thousands of paychecks due city workers today until a legislative impasse could be overcome.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: A ChineseU.S. Table Set To Home on the Range
description: PEKING, Dec. 4 (UPI)President Ford gave a dinner tonight for his Chinese hosts and skillfully melded East and West.

title: U.N. Council Invites P.L.O. To Debate on Israeli Raids
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4The Security Council invited the Palestine Liberation Organization tonight to participate in a debate on the Israeli air raids on Lebanese territory earlier this week.

title: FundRaiser for Ford Will Begini Beating Drum to Get $9 Million
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4President Ford's chief campaign fundraiser said today that his operation had been running at a deficit recently and that he planned to start beating the drum louder to raise the nearly $9 million still needed to reach the $10million ceiling allowed for the President's primary campaign.

title: 2 Executives Plead Guilty In BuildingBribery Trial
description: The executive vice president of a large construction company pleaded guilty yesterday to attempted bribery in the latest court proceeding in a major constructiongraft scandal involving city employees and building and realestate executives.

title: MRS. PERON CALLS TALKS ON TERROR
description: BUENOS AIRES. Dec. 4A wave of political assassinations in Argentina caused President Isabel Martinez de Pern to hold an emergency meeting of the National Defense Council today.

title: CAREY CRITICIZED ON AGENCIES PLAN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 4The Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, charged today that Governor Carey had failed to produce a realistic plan to save the independent state agencies from default later this month.

title: Frank P. Tufaro, 69, Is Dead; Construction Industry Leader
description: Frank P. Tufaro, a construction industry executive who was prominent in Republican politics and community planning in the metropolitan area, died of heart failure Wednesday in St. Agnes Hospital, White Plains. He was 69 years old and lived at 35 Maplewood Road, Hartsdale, N. Y.

title: U.S. Golfers Gain Lead By 4 Shots
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 4 (AP)Johnny Miller, overcoming a dizzy spell in the heat, carded a sixunderpar 66 today, giving him a onestroke individual lead and the United States team a fourstroke lead in the first round of the 23d World Cup golf tournament.

title: BROAD COALITION ASKED IN LISBON
description: LISBON, Dec. 4Prime Minister Jos Pinheiro de Azevedo met with the leaders of the three main parties today in an attempt to resolve the political impasse.

title: Rutgers Beats Purdue, 8173; N. Carolina Tops Seton Hall
description: Madison Square Garden opened its 41st year of college basketball in grand fashion last night with local teams acquitting themselves splendidly before a crowd of 10,002 fans who greeted the return of the collegians with some lusty screaming.

title: ENGRAVERS UNION AGREES ON A PACT
description: Photoengravers Union No. 1 P and The Daily News and The New York Times reached agreement yesterday on a new threeyear contract, Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, announced.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Wichita State Reinstated
description: TULSA, Okla., Dec. 4 (AP)Wichita State University ended two years on probation with the Missouri Valley Conference today conference headquarters announced. The Shockers were placed on probation with sanctions in 1973 following charges of illegal recruiting practices and improper inducements.

title: Scott's Action Stirs Speculation Others Will Retire
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The announcement today by Senator Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania that he would not seek reelection set off increased speculation that the 95th Congress might open in January 1977 with a new set of Congressional leaders in both parties.

title: Surgery for McGlocklin
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 4 (AP) Jon McGlocklin of the Milwaukee Bucks, who injured his left eye during practice Nov. 3 and has not played since, underwent surgery today and should return to action in two or three weeks.

title: People and Business
description: A handful of giant dairy cooperatives dominate up to 90 percent of the milk supply in some regional markets and are using monopoly power to overcharge consumers by hundreds of millions of dollars a year, speakers at a milk marketing conference in Washington charged yesterday.

title: Strauss Party Denies Charge
