description: BONN, Dec, 4 (AP)Former Defense Minister FranzJosef Strauss's Christian Social Union Denied today the party received payoffs from the Lockheed aircraft corporation in the early 1960's in connection with West German purchases of F104 jet fighters.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Assembly Approves Measure for a Single Primary Next Year
description: ALBANY, Dec. 4The proposal for a single political primary next year was approved by the Assembly this evening after a debate marked by laughter in which proponents took umbrage at the charge that they actually hoped the bill would be killed by the Senate.

title: Wednesday's Fight
description: NEW YORKJose Fernandez, 131 pounds, Dominican Republic, outpointed John Watson, 129, Los Angeles, 10 rounds.

title: Swiss Exultant Over Heavy Snowfall And Cup Victories of Women Skiers
description: Bruno Baroni, the director of the Swiss National Tourist Office, was host yesterday at the Swiss Christmas Luncheon, held as usual, at the Chalet Suisse in midtown Manhattan. Baro ni said the timing for the annual gettogether this Skiing year had been perfect.

title: 5th Confirmation Hearing a Breeze for Richardson
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Elliot L. Richardson had an easy, clubby time today with the Senate Commerce Committee at his fifth confirmation hearing in less than six years.

title: Loch Ness Monster Again Makes Waves
description: LONDON, Dec. 4  Without even surfacing, so to speak, the Loch Ness monster has again shown that he, she or it can cause all sorts of commotion among the otherwise sensible people of Britain.

title: FORD QUITS CHINA; SOME GAINS SEEN
description: PEKING, Friday, Dec. 5 President Ford and Chinese leaders ended their talks here today after reaching an apparent understanding that their mutual interest lay in countering any expansion of Soviet influence in Western Europe, Angola and the Pacific.

title: Colt Extends Garlock Bid; 90% of Shares Tendered
description: Colt Industries said yesterday that it had extended its tender offer for the common stock of Garlock Inc. of Rochester until 5 P.M. today. The offer was for $35 a share in cash.

title: LEFTISTS IN SPAIN CALL FOR A STRIKE
description: MADRID, Dec. 4Clandestine labor unions in Barcelona called on workers in the Catalonian region today to stage a 24hour general strike next Thursday as the first major action by leftist forces against King Juan Carlos I.

title: Kean Moves to Strengthen Law on Suing of Polluters
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)Environmentalists who are disappointed over the weakness of a law giving private citizens the power to sue polluters are mounting a new drive to strengthen the legislation.

title: Kaufman Auditorium Making Comeback
description: One of the many stories about the late Sol Hurok concerned a violinist who was giving a premiere during a recital at the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium in the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The violinist was pacing up and down backstage before the recital, watched paternally by the impresario. I'm worried about the new piece, he moaned. Why, oh why, didn't I try it out of town? Mr. Hurok, whose world was bounded by Carnegie Hall on the south and Lincoln Center on the north, said soothingly: Why are you worried? This is out of town.

title: S.L.A. IMPOSES BAN ON TOTAL NUDITY
description: The State Liquor Authority yesterday announced a statewide ban on total nudity in places selling alcoholic beverages, and it canceled the liquor license of a popular Greenwich Village nightspot on the ground that its production of Let My People Come was lewd and indecent.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: STRING TIME Soothing harp sounds add to the ambiance of the King Cole Grille, a big, cheerfully lighted room with: a high ceiling and a long, standup bar. A loner, without a cocktail date at a table or banquette, can place a foot on the reassuring bar rail, sip a Vodka martini ($2.60) and study Maxfield Parrish's large mural of an enthroned, quizzical Cole and some blithe courtiers.

title: Wings Dismiss Barkley
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Detroit Red Wings' general manager, Alex Delvecchio, discharged Doug Barkley tonight and immediately took over as coach of the National Hockey League team.

title: McDonnell Offers to Pay $5 Million to Settle Claims
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 4 (Reuters)The McDonnell Douglas Corporation has said that under a proposed agreement submitted to United States District Court in New York, it would pay $5 million to settle all claims in lawsuits arising out of a 1966 offering of the Douglas Aircraft Company debentures and common stock.

title: Pro Soccer Votes 4Team Expansion
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)North American Soccer League owners voted today to expand to 24 clubs for the 1977 season.

title: CHANGES SOUGHT IN KEY F.P.C. UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4In an effort to strengthen the effectiveness and credibility of the Federal Power Commission, the new chairman, Richard Dunham, has decided to replace the men who head the agency's two key regulatory arms, the Bureaus of Natural Gas and Electric Power.

title: Industry's Conflict on Bribery Abroad Is Laid to Guidelines After the Fact
description: David James, a managing partner of Arthur. Young & Company, a major accounting firm, said yesterday that a lack of guidelines was a major reason why American businessmen had run into conflict over the question of bribing foreign government officials.

title: Homosexual Demonstration Disrupts Council Meeting
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 (AP) Dozens of members of a homosexual rights group clashed with security guards today at a Philadelphia City Council meeting.

title: 2,658 of 3,407 Who Applied Pass State's Examination for Admission to the Bar
description: ALBANY Dec. 4The State Board of Law Examiners announced today the names of 2,658 applicants who passed the examination for admission to the bar given last July 22 and 23.

title: AMEX PRICES GAIN; OTC IN A DECLINE
description: The American Stock Exchange broke its threesession losing streak yesterday and ended higher while prices in the overthecounter market declined for the fourth consecutive session.

title: Risks of Estrogen
description: Interviews with gynecologists indicated that new reports linking estrogen therapy during and after menopause to an increased risk of uterine cancer were having little effect on Doctors's attitudes toward the drug. Page 45.

title: Delay of Trial Voids Murder Indictment
description: Ruling that a defendant was denied his right to a speedy trial, the State Court of Appeals yesterday dismissed a murder indictment against a 28yearold man whose trial was postponed by the Bronx District Attorney's office more than a dozen times over an 18month period.

title: Arabs on West Bank In Clash With Israelis
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4Arabs and Israelis clashed today for the first time over an attempt by Jewish squatters to settle at biblical Sebastia in the occupied West Bank of Jordan.

title: Fritz Martin
description: J. Fred Martin, who had been a track coach and athletic director at Wesleyan University in Middletown, Conn., died Wednesday in a nursing home in Hartford. He was 80 years old.

title: Las Rojas, an OperaConcert, Seen
description: Which came first, the chicken of musical opportunism of the egg of ingenious promotional ballyhoo? It's hard to say, but the premiere Wednesday night of Las Rosas at Avery Fisher Hall had all the earmarks of a major snow job.

title: SOVIET SUSPECTED OF ARMS VIOLATION
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 4American intelligence officials have reported to the Ford Administration that the Soviet Union recently constructed a largescale radar station on the Kamchatka Peninsula, raising new questions about possible violations of the 1972 treaty limiting strategic arms.

title: Bruins Subdue Capitals
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)At Sims, a defenseman, pierced Washington's defensive for two goals in a threegoal third period tonight and led Boston Bruins to a 32 victory over the Capitals. The victory ran the Bruins' undefeated streak of 12 games in the National Hockey League.

title: Phillips Petroleum Pleads No Contest On Fixing Prices
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (AP) The Phillips Petroleum Company of Oklahoma and the Douglas Oil Company of California have pleaded no contest to Federal charges that they and four other companies fixed prices on more than $90 million worth of oil for five Western states.

title: 82Foot Shot Is Key to Rally by Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 4The New York Rangers and Buffalo Sabres played a National Hockey League game tonight that neither deserved to win and neither did. Following a shootout that had the goalies flapping their wings at both ends of the rink, the final score was 66.

title: Los Angeles, in a Building Boom, Debates Urban Revival
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4In the heart of this city that all but surrendered its soul to the automobile, there is a new vitality these days, the beginnings of a big city skyline and, an angry, introspective debate over what kind of future its citizens want for Los Angeles.

title: No Place for Conflict..
description: With public confidence in the competence and integrity of government at its nadir, New York can hardly afford the kind of backbiting that has developed in the statesponsored investigation aimed at eradicating corruption in the criminal justice system. Even less can it afford to abandon or curtail the cleanup effort. Restoring public trust in judges, prosecutors, police officers and court personnel is prerequisite to any restoration of community faith in the integrity of government generally.

title: Wholesale Prices Steady for Month, Up 3.7% in a Year
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 4A decline in volatile agricultural prices enabled the Wholesale Price Index for November to remain unchanged from October, the Labor. Department reported today.

title: 2 Rival Measures On Spanish Sahara Voted by U.N. Unit
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4A General Assembly committee approved two rival resolutions today, both affirming the right of inhabitants of the Spanish Sahara to decide their political future, but differing on how to assess their wishes.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: Remember the Colony? On 61st Street just east of Madison Avenue? Well, you wouldn't recognize the old place now. The premises have been taken over by a new Japanese restaurant, Robata.

title: Mural in Financial District Building Lobby Recreates New York's Past
description: We wanted to make this building a more pleasant place for the thousands of people who walk in and out of here six times a day, and bring new life into what was previously a very sterile area, said David Warham of the 99 John Street Corporation.

title: Effect off Proposed Cats On Families' Tax Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The following tables, based on data from the Congressional Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation, show the Federal income tax that will be paid by families of different size with typical deductions under present law and under the bill passed by the House of Representatives:

title: Payoffs for Dutch And West Germans By Lockheed Alleged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  Senate investigators are looking into allegations that the Lockheed Aircraft Company arranged payoffs to Dutch and West German leaders to promote sales of its F104 Starfighter, Government sources said today.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rate for Thursday.

title: Sanasardo Troupe Opens A Season With Consort
description: As a poet, the late Anne Sexton made her detractors uncomfortable. Marinated in misfortune, the confessional style of poetry that makes private sorrows public has never been unembarrassing to those who like to keep up appearances.

title: About Real Estate
description: Every so often  perhaps twice a year nowadays someone builds a new home in Forest Hills Gardens, that exclusive private enclave of mostly Tudor and Georgian conformity in central Queens.

title: Conferees Provisionally Agree On a Federal Spending Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5SenateHouse conferees tentatively agreed today to impose a ceiling of $374.9 billion on Federal spending in the current fiscal year, leaving a deficit of $74.1 billion.

title: Improvements Found
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)Amtrak is doing a good job of upgrading rail passenger service, and further improvements can he expected within the next year or two, an Interstate Commerce Commission judge ruled today.

title: A 2D NEARCRASH BY JETS REPORTED
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (AP)A Trans World Airlines passenger jet and a United Air Lines plane narrowly avoided colliding today near Chicago.

title: Provenzano Comeback Reported
description: UNION CITY, N. J., Dec. 5Anthony Provenzano, a former vice president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and a key figure in the Federal investigation into the disappearance of James R. Hoffa, is reported to be again exerting direct control over Teamster Local 560, the turbulent union local he headed until he was sent to prison in 1966.

title: Arts and Letters Names 3
description: The American Academy of Arts and Letters, the nation's highest; honor society in the arts, has elected three members, John Hersey, its secretary announced yesterday. This brings the membership to its full complement of 50. To be inducted next May 19 are the writer Ralph Ellison, the architect I. M. Pei and the sculptor Naum Gabo.

title: Porter Plans Tender Offer
description: The H. K. Porter Company of Pittsburgh, a manufacturer of industrial products, said yesterday that it intended to present a new tender offer for 500,000 shares of the Missouri Portland Cement Company for $26 a share in cash.

title: Jobs Declined in 134 of 162 Major Industries in the City
description: Among the city's industries from 1969 to 1974, securities and commodities trading suffered the worst drop in employment, while health service led the relatively few fields in which the number of jobs increased, according to a new study of the city economy issued yesterday by Herbert Bienstock, head of the New York office of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: SPANISH PREMIER RETAINED BY KING
description: MADRID, Dec. 5King Juan Carlos I decided today to retain Carlos Arias Navarro as Prime Minister, a move that seemed to satisfy rightists and to disturb liberals and leftists.

title: Rumsfeld Fights Lynn On Arms Budget Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The size and shape of next year's defense budget, in the opinion of Pentagon officials, now depend in large measure on a political chess game being played between two young and ambitious officialsDonald H. Rumsfeld, the new Secretary of Defense, and James T. Lynh, the director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Godfrey Cambridge Has the Last Laugh
description: Godfrey Cambridge thought $120,000 would buy him a livable house when he moved to Ridgefield, Conn., last year.

title: FANNIE SIMONOFF
description: Fannie Bereson Simonoff, who had been active in raising funds for the children's ward of Beth David Hospital, died Thursday in Roosevelt Hospital. She was 84 years old and lived at 245 East 63d Street.

title: A Superlative Restaurant, With an Extra Touch of Class. In Paris? No, Brussels
description: BRUSSELSYou will rarely find a country where the populace more ardently pursues the pleasures of the table than Belgium. Their enthusiasm equals if not exceeds drat of the French. The country is blessed with the bounty of both sea and countryside, and the specialties include mussels prepared in scores of ways, marvelous oysters, fine sweetfleshed fish, and an abundance of game.

title: Births
description: Dr. And M Howard Smith proudly announce the birth of their daughter Samantha Jessica, November 23, 1975

title: JURY SAID TO STUDY 2 EXC.A.B. CHIEFS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) Discrepancies m the sworn testimony of two former Civil Aeronautics Board chairmen about an investigation into illegal airline political contributions are being studied by a Federal grand jury, The Washington Star reported today.

title: Terrorists in Netherlands Release Some Hostages
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Dec. 5East Asian terrorists released seven children from the Indonesian consulate today but stepped up their pressure on the Dutch Government and threatened to shoot other hostages in the compound.

title: The Cast
description: THE MAN IN THE TRUNK, directed by Georges Lautner; screenplay (French with English subtitles) by Francis Veber; director of photography, Maurice Fellous; music by Philippe Sarde; released by Gaumont International Films. Running time: 100 minutes; this film has been classified PG. At the Symphony and Waverly Theaters.

title: Hannah Arendt, Political Scientist Dead
description: Hannah Arendt, the political philosopher who escaped Hitler's Germany and later scrutinized its morality in Eichmaim in Jerusalem and other books, died Thursday night in her apartment at 370 Riverside Drive. She was 69 years old.

title: Chinese to Return Ashes Of 2 Shot Down in 60's
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 5 (UPI) The Chinese are returning the ashes of two United States Navy men shot down during the Vietnam war and have confirmed for the first time the deaths of two Americans during an aerial espionage mission in 1952, it was announced today.

title: Lisbon Plans Reorganization of Press
description: LISBON, Dec. 5The Portuguese Government announced today that it drafted a program to reorganize the stateowned press, which has been closed since last week's unsuccessful military coup.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Friday, Dec. 5. 23d day. Weather clear, track fast. 1975, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Dally Racing Form)

title: H.E.W. Forms Unit To Look for Fraud In Use of Its Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)F. David Mathews, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, announced today the formation of a new criminal investigtaion unit to ferret out farud and abuse in H.E.W.'s $120 billion budget.

title: Jakarta's Homeless: Bridge for a Roof
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 5There is a phrase in the Indonesian language for the grinding, cruel poverty under which Warnia Sayan and a million like her must live.

title: AMTRAK TO RAISE FARES BY 5 TO 10%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) Passenger train fares will rise 5 to 10 percent on most routes over the next two months, Amtrak announced today.

title: RUSSUANS DEMAND LOWER U.S. RATES ON GRAIN SHIPPING
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5The complex arrangement under which American grain is transported to the Soviet Union appears to have been jeopardized by, a new dispute over freight rates.

title: Bus Shelters Here Lauded
description: City bus riders accustomed to waiting in rain, snow, swirling wind and gloom of night are hailing the next best thing to a ceiling on fares: a roof over their heads and safety glass windscreens in the form of attractive new bus stop shelters springing up around town.

title: Books of The Times
description: There is a corner of the English consciousnessit belonged to the lettered genteel, among others: and still shows up in the letters columns, of The Times of Londonwhere addresses are more real than houses.

title: Linda Ronstadt Gives Concert, Not One of Her Best, at Beacon
description: Those of us who love Linda Ronstadt can take comfort in our increasing numbers. Her records sell in the millions, she is giving four concerts this week in the New York area (the final two tonight at the Capitol Theater in Passaic, N.J., and tomorrow night at St. John's University in Queens) and she provokes rhapsodic analytical essays by other cultists than this infatuated critic.

title: Nyquist Orders Newburgh to Use His Integration Plan
description: The State Commissioner of Education yesterday ordered the Newburgh school board to reassign 1,100 minoritygroup and 700 white students, about 14 percent of the enrollment, to other schools next September, in a school desegregation case that has been bitterly fought by local school officials for half a dozen years.

title: Dance: Cunningham Blessed Events
description: A year ago, a member of the selfstyled art avantgarde was heard holding forth on how academic Merce Cunningham was. Well, Merce Cunningham is so academic that most of the world at large has yet to absorb half of what he has been doing for two decades.

title: 3 FOUND SHOT DEAD IN ARGENTINA STRIFE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 5 (UPI) Three persons were found Shot and killed today, victims of what appeared to be another execution by rightwing terrorists.

title: McGinnis Basket Beats Knicks; Rangers Set Back Scouts by 32
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 5The billboards in and around this city read, By George, We've Got It, and Let George Do It, and tonight George McGinnis did it.

title: Thief in a TV Role Seized as Genuine
description: A New Yorker who played the role of a thief on the television show To Tell the Truth was arrested and charged with being a real thief after a Dutchess County policeman recognized him on his home screen.

title: Black College Game Postponed for Year
description: The Black College AllAmerican Football Classic, which was scheduled to be played here Jan. 3, has been postponed until next December. The Edwin Gould Services for Children, which sponsors the game, announced the change yesterday.

title: FUTURES IN GRAINS AND SOYBEANS OFF
description: Prices for grains and soybeans dropped yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. One of the main reasons was a threat by Thomas Gleason, president of the International Longshoremen's Union, of another boycott against loading of grain for the Soviet Union.

title: Miss Haynie Leads
description: MELBOURNE, Dec. 5 (AP) Sandra Haynie shook off a stomach disorder and shot a twounderpar 70 for the lead after the first round of the Far East women's open golf championship.

title: Steingut Backs His Majority Leader
description: The Democratic Assembly Speaker, Stanley Steingut, yesterday defended his indicted majority leader, Albert H. Blumenthal, as one of the most honorable men I have ever met. and said Mr. Blumenthal would continue in has leadership post.

title: Bus Shelters Here Lauded
description: City bus riders accustomed to waiting in rain, snow, swirling wind and gloom of night are hailing the next best thing to a ceiling on fares: a roof over their heads and safety glass windscreens in the form of attractive new bus stop shelters springing up around town.

title: Temple Tops Fordham Five, 6357
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 5Tim Claxton scored 28 points tonight to lead Temple to a 6357 basketball victory over Fordham at the Palestra.

title: U.S. Describes Evidence in Hearst Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5The Federal prosecutor said today that the Government had a written record, some of it probably in Patricia Hearst's handwriting, of Miss Hearst's apparent kidnapping and the bank robbery of which she is accused.

title: Report in Rosenberg Files Held Harry Gold Neurotic
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Harry Gold was described as a neurotic and hostile personality with traits adding up to imbalance in a courtordered psychiatric report six months before his testimony in the trial of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg.

title: GROUND AIDES STRIKE AT UNITED AIRLINES
description: WASHINGTON, Saturday, Dec. 6 (AP)  Ground service workers struck United Airlines at midnight Friday as negotiations were continuing on a new, contract. United is the nation's largest domestic airline.

title: Rumsfeld Fights Lynn On Arms Budget Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The size and shape of next year's defense budget, in the opinion of Pentagon officials, now, depend in large measure on a political chess game being played between two young and ambitious officialsDonald H. Rumsfeld, the new Secretary of Defense, and James T. Lynn, the director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Opera: A Kind of Magic
description: Humperdinck's Hansel and Gretel is a problem for many people. Its Wagnerianstyle score seems all, out of proportion to the slight fairy tale it tells. It requires grownup singers to play the children of the titlecasting that can be ludicrous. And some of the game songs that Hansel and Gretel sing are tiresome.

title: 25 Charged Here In a Case Involving Heroin Shipments
description: Twentyfive defendants were charged here yesterday with conspiring to distribute 200 pounds of Mexican heroin in the last six months.

title: 2,000 at Hill's Funeral
description: ST. ALBANS. England, Dec. 5 (AP)A black crash helmet rested on Graham Hill's coffin as the former world motor racing champion was mourned at his funeral in ancient St. Albans Abbey today, the day on which he was to have been honored as a driving champion. More than 2,000 racing colleagues, friends and admirers gathered to pay tribute to the 46yearold Englishman with the pencilthin mustache. He was killed a week ago when the light plane he was piloting crashed and burned on a fogblanketed golf course north of London.

title: ABRAHAM BRASLOW
description: Abraham Braslow, a lawyer in practice in Mount Vernon, N.Y., since 1933, died Thursday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N.Y. He was 69 years old and lived at 313 Collins Avenue, Mount Vernon.

title: New Hampshire Sues U.S.
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 5 ,(AP) The New Hampshire Department of Employment Security filed suit today against the United States Labor Department for release of $180,000 in Federal funds impounded for more than a year. The suit was filed in Federal District Court at Concord.

title: Jehovah's Witnesses Complain They're Persecuted in Malawi
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 5 (AP) Jehovah's Witnesses in the southern African nation of Malawi say they are being harassed, sometimes beaten, by street gangs and denied housing and work.

title: Knicks Bow On Shot by McGinnis
Church Council Approves A Plan to Combat Racism
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 5 (UPI)  The World Council of Churches approved a plan today to support liberation efforts around the world and to fight sex discrimination and racism.

title: Citibank Holds Prime at 7%
description: The First National City Bank said yesterday it was holding its floating prime rate unchanged at 7 percent. Other major money center banks have held their prime rate at 7 percent.

title: Ocean Grove's Blue Laws Assessed
description: FREEHOLD, Dec. 5A newspaper dealer has been permitted to continue making Sunday deliveries by truck to Ocean Grove in Monmouth County while the New Jersey Supreme Court debates the constitutionality of the community's blue laws.

title: Many Dismissed by City Seek Jobs Across Nation
description: DENVER, Dec. 5  This week Edward K. Doherty, formerly a police officer assigned to the East 51st Street stationhouse in Manhattan, pinned on a new badgethat of the Arvada Police Department in a bedroom suburb bordering Denver.

title: Plant Lovers Venture Beyond the Aspidistra
description: As the plant boom continues, buyers are becoming more Knowledgeable  and more adventuresome. They have learned to ??ture the plants they have b?? and They want to have more. And they are no longer afraid to buy more challenging varieties.

title: Leftist Bias Charged
description: NAIROBI, Dec. 5 (Reuters)The World Council of Churches came under fire from a Church of England delegate today, who accused the council staff of stifling free debate and having a leftwing bias.

title: Art: The Radiance in Diebenkorn Paintings
description: Richard Diebenkorn is one of the very best painters around, but not quite everyone knows it. For this reason some visitors to his show of new paintings at the Marlborough Gallery, 40 West 57th Street, may be taken aback by the power, the beauty, the complexity and the assurance of Mr. Diebenkorn's Ocean Park series. He has been at work on this series since 1967, and any day now it's going to get into three figures. The paintings have in common a compositional scheme that is made up of rectangular color areas traversed here and there by diagonals. But within that first formulation Mr. Diebenkorn secretes a vast variety of touch, tone and formal resource. Each painting in the series is a new statement.

title: NURSINGHOME UNION THREATENING STRIKE
description: Representatives of private nursing homes in the city and of Local 144 of the Hotel, Hospital and Nursing Home Union, which is threatening a strike next Thursday, have been called to a mediation session next Monday at the offices of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Services.

title: ISRAELI JET CAUSES ALARM IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 5An Israeli jet flew over Lebanon from south to north today on what was believed to be a photographic mission.

title: The Women's Agenda
description: In a quiet but determined way, a coalition of 94 women's organizations signaled the other day that despite a diminution of enthusiasm for the Equal Rights Amendment, the women's movement is neither enfeebled nor weary. Representatives of these organizations began a renewed drive to draw attention of Congress and the Governors and legislatures of the fifty states to the 11point programcalled the National Women's Agenda on which they have all agreed to work.

title: People in Sports
description: Tulane dismissed its football coach, Bennie Ellender, who had eight years left on his contract, confirming yesterday what had been an open secret for three weeks. Reports that he would be dismissed were first published a week before the final game of the year, a 426 loss to Tulane's arch rival, Louisiana State. The loss left Tulane with a 47 wonlost record for the year.

title: Foundry in Ohio Struck
description: DEFIANCE, Ohio, Dec. 5 (UPI)Local 211 of the United Auto Workers union struck the Central Foundry Division of General Motors Corporation today, idling 3,680 workers. The strike was called in a dispute over production standards.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Market Place
description: When the news came out Thursday that the Copper Range Company and Amax Inc. had been enjoined from completing their proposed merger, it was too late in the day for most investors to react.

title: Meir Yoeli, Expert In Tropical Disease At N.Y.U., Dies at 63
description: Meir Yoeli, professor of preventive medicine at the New York University School of Medicine and an International authority on tropical diseases, died yesterday at his home, 215 West 88th Street. He was 63 years old.

title: Amex Prices Down As Volume Drops; Counter Also Falls
description: Stocks on the American Stock Exchange and those traded over the counter continued to reflect investors' doubts about economic recovery.

title: Levitt Tells Yonkers to Trim $7 Million More From Budget
description: YONKERS, Dec. 5The new state board overseeing Yonkers's municipal spending said today that the city had overestimated its revenues by $7 million and ordered it to cut that total from its budget over the next 18 months.

title: A Critic's View Of the Warren Commission Report
description: Twelve years after the assassination of President John F. Kennedy in Dallas, the Warren Commission report, which concluded that the killing was the work of one man, Lee Harvey Oswald, is once again hotly debated.

title: Ticketing Ambulance Is Voided as Improper
description: Dismissed.

title: Yen at Lowin Japan's Economic Gloom
description: TOKYO, Dec, 5The Japanese yen dropped today to its lowest value since its new official rate of exchange was set in December 1971.

title: GTE Layoffs Set Upstate
description: BATAVIA, N.Y., Dec. 5 (AP) GTE Sylvania Inc, announced today it was temporarily lay off about 1,000 production workers at its Batavia and Seneca Falls. N.Y., plants later this month. The company has been curtailing production at the plants over the Christmas holiday period the last several years. A company spokesman said the cutbacks this year were to adjust production schedules to dispose of excess inventories.

title: EMERSON P. HEMPSTEAD
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 5 Emerson Pease Hempstead, retired vice president of the Firemen's Mutual Insurance Company, died Wednesday at Presbyterian Hospital in New York City. He was 65 years old and lived here.

title: Mrs. Neri Married To Ezra L. Dolan
description: M. Christine Donoghue Ned of CrotononHudson, a financial analyst at General Foods in White Plains, was married yesterday afternoon to Ezra L. Dolan of Rye, N. Y.. vice president and public relations director of Parade Publications.

title: EASTERN AIRLINES WINS DEBT DELAY
description: Eastern Airlines has reached informal agreement with most of its creditors to delay payment by one year of $7.4 million due on Jan. 3, the airline said yesterday.

title: F.P.C. STAFF FINDS NO HIDING OF GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5A staff report in the Federal Power Commission's biggest investigation of natural gas shortages has found no effort or conspiracy by producers to withhold or conceal gas that could be delivered to the Transcontinental Pipeline Company.

title: .. and Energy Policy
description: That common future demands a common energy program for the Nine right now, within the framework of the 18nation International Energy Agency. The way to that common program has effectively been opened by three E.E.C. decisions at the Rome summit.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MET MART Personal souvenirs from some of the Metropolitan Opera's bestknown performers, as well as costumes and sketches that made Met history, along with other memorabilia will be up for bidding tomorrow afternoon when the 91yearold opera company holds its first public auction.

title: Thoeni Wins Giant Slalom; Stenmark 2d
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 5 (UPI)Gustavo Thoeni of Italy launched his bid for a fifth World Cup today by winning the first race, a giant slalom, in a tense skiing duel with Ingemar Stenmark of Sweden.

title: 3 Counties Begin Plan to Winterproof Homes for the Aged and Poor Families
description: NEWARKA threecounty program to winterproof 1,000 homes occupied by the elderly and lowincome families was started here last week.

title: Yogi Will Communicate Very Well
description: With rings on his fingers and patent leather on his toes, Yogi Berra waddled through the Versailles Room of the Americana Hotel where the New York Yankees made peace with him yesterday. Back in 1964 the Yankees, with Dan Topping making the big decisions, abruptly discharged the folk hero and former catcher whose team had won the American League pennant as a rookie manager. Yogi couldn't communicate with the players, management explained. Not that a folk hero ever has to file for unemployment benefits. But for the next 11 seasons he had to drive across the Triborough Bridge to work with the New York Mets as a coach and as the manager (winning the pennant in 1973) until August 6 when he was abruptly discharged. Yogi couldn't communicate with the players, management explained. Within a few weeks, Billy Martin, whom the new Yankee owners had abruptly appointed as manager, invited his Yankee teammate of two decades ago to join his coaching staff immediately. But at the time Yogi was more concerned with his opportunity to break 80 in golf for the first time. He also had another reason.

title: Stock Index Off 10.31
description: The stock market declined sharply yesterday in a continuation of the weakness experienced earlier in the week. The Dow Jones industrial average fell 10.31 points to 818.80 at the close. The decline in the indicator for the week amounted to 41.87 points, the largest weekly drop since September 1974. Details on Page 41.

title: An Elephant in the Bed
description: BRASILIA, BrazilBrazil is the world's fifth largest country, contains about 105 million people and borders every South American land except Ecuador and Chile. It is envied by some neighbors, respected by most and feared by all. Like their attitude toward the United States, says one of the ruling group of generals. The smaller nations feel as if they were in bed with an elephant.

title: CHURCH REJECTS NIXON TESTIMONY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) Senator Frank Church, chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, said today that he found former President Richard M. Nixon's conditions for giving testimony unacceptable and would recommend that the panel reject them.

title: A Rigid Mirror Helps Turn Sunlight Into Electricity
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5A collector of solar energy, invented by a University of Chicago faculty member, is being produced for industrial heating, airconditioning and the direct convey sion of sunlight to electricity. Patent 3,923,381 was granted this week to Ronald Winston, associate professor of physics at the university's Enrico Fermi Institute. Licenses are being granted through University Patents Inc., Stamford, Conn.

title: Bridal Held for Barbara McCarty
description: Barbara R. McCarty, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold J. McCarty Jr. of Lawrence, L.I., and Glen, Ireland, was married at noon yesterday to Robert J. Bluestone, a stockbroker with Rand & Company. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. George C. Bluestone of Montclair. N.J.

title: The Fords, in Jakarta: A Feast, Then Gold Gifts
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 5 (UPI)President Ford partook today of galantine of duckling and tournedos of beef with imported French wines and champagnes in crystal goblets.

title: Three More Bodies Are Found; South Carolina Toll Up to Six
description: LAKE CITY, S.C., Dec. 5 (AP) The police found three bodies, today in a shallow burial site where three other bodies had been unearthed the day before.

title: Ailey's Carmina Burana
description: Every dance company has a certain level of energy to it. It is unmistakablealmost like a fingerprint. When a company and a ballet come together at that particular point something almost like a chemical reaction takes place. There is smoke and there are bubbles.

title: Richard C. Bunkel, Founded Football, Basketball Index
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 5 (AP)Richard C. Dunkel, founder of the nationally syndicated Dunkel Football and Basketball Index, died yesterday after a lengthy illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The Hispanic theater is flowering in New York City, where five major companies and 10 smaller ones are serving a diverse community that is growing each year.

title: Surinam Admitted to U.N. As 144th Member Country
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 5The General Assembly admitted the former Dutch colony of Surinam to the United Nations yesterday, making it the 144th member country.

title: Cowens Hits 34; Celtics Top Jazz
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 (AP)Dave Cowens scored 34 points and dominated the boards tonight as the Boston Celtics defeated the New Orleans Jazz, 10493, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Queens Man Gets 2 Years In StolenAirTicket Case
description: Lawrence Alfano, described by lawenforcement officials as a member of a ring that stole more than $2 million worth of airline tickets and then sold them at discounts, was sentenced to two years in jail and fined $1,000 following his conviction on charges of possessing stolen tickets.

title: 3 DIE AS FIRE ENGINE HURTLES INTO CROWD
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. (AP)A hookandladder fire truck hurtled into pedestrians at a crowded downtown intersection today, killing three persons and critically injuring three others, the police said.

title: Blumenthal Calls Charge Outrageous, Unfounded
description: Albert H. Blumenthal, the Assembly majority leader, was arraigned here yesterday on an indictment charging that he had lied under oath about his intercession for Bernard Bergman, the nursinghome promoter.

title: When Building for Future Means a Step Backward.
description: Out of a pleasant but nondescript office at 2 Penn Plaza is run what is probably the largest commercial realestate operation in the State of New York. It belongs not to any realestate corporation or developer, but to the New York Telephone Company, which uses more space than anyone else in the state, including the state governmentmore than 25 million square feet, or the equivalent of almost a dozen Pan Am Buildings.

title: Text of Mideast Resolution
description: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Following is the text of the resolution on the Middle East adopted by the General Assembly today.

title: Anniversaries
description: KAYAnita. We made the first 14 with laughter and love. The remaining hundred Is a pushover.

title: Conciliatory Statement by Dr. Burke Expected to Kill Plan to Censure Him
description: TRENTON, Dec. 5A move by local school boards in New Jersey to censure Commissioner Fred G. Burke of the State Department of Education is expected to founder at a meeting tomorrow, following conciliatory remarks made by Dr. Burke on his view of strikes by teachers.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 73day strike against the Woodland Nursing Home New Rochelle, N.Y., ended after 120 employees ratified a twoyear contract providing wage increases of $27 a week by next Sept. 1, bringing the minimum to $181, and increased health benefits. Charges of disorderly conduct are pending against 50 members of the employees union, District 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Workets, for taking part in demonstrations supporting the strikers.

title: Jazz to Pick Malone in N.B.A. Draft
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 5 (AP)The New Orleans Jazz of the National Basketball Association will take Moses Malone, the American Basketball Association star, in Tuesday's special N.B.A. draft, a team spokesman said today.

title: Job Losses and Gains Of Industries in City
description: Industries in New York City with the largest losses and gains in employment from 1969 to 1974:

title: BILL TO LEND CITY $23 BRAN VOTED BY SENATE, 5730
description: WASHINGTON, Saturday, Dec. 6The Senate overcame an attempted filibuster and shortly after midnight voted 57 to 30 to authorize $2.3 billion in shortterm Federal loans over two and a half years that New York City and State officials say will enable the city to avert default.

title: PAUL ANKA IN SONGS AT URIS THEATER
description: Mayor Beanie stepped out on a Broadway stage on Thursday as more or less the closing part of the singer Paul Anka's show. Mr. Anka is performing for 10 days at the Uris Theater and is donating his proceeds to New York charities.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
description: Week ended Dec. 5, 1975

title: Gunman With Toy Badge Hijacks $14,000 in Toys
description: Stealing Christmas toys is something even Scrooge wouldn't have countenanced, but it happened yesterday whet a gunman pretending to be a detective, hijacked a truck carrying $14,000 worth of dolls, games and other toys on the Long Island Expressway in Queens.

title: French Petition Moscow
description: PARIS, Dec. 5 (Reuters)About 119 intellectuals and scientists here, including Simone de Beauvoir and Eugene Ionesco, called on Soviet authorities yesterday to permit Yeniamin Levich, a leading scientist, to leave the Soviet Union for Israel.

title: Detroit Trucking Terminal Is Focus of Hoffa Inquiry
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5The Federal grand jury that is investigating the disappearance of James R. Hoffa is looking into the possibility that his body was stuffed into a 55gallon steel drum in a trucking terminal here and taken from Detroit.

title: GEORGE S. FRENCH
description: George S. French, a member of the 1927 Columbia University championship crew and a center on the Columbia football team in the mid1920's, died Thursday in San Diego.He was 69 years old.

title: Chris Palmer, Model, Wed to Alan Snyder
description: Christine Hope Palmer, a professional model with the Wilhelmina Agency, was married yesterday afternoon to Alan M. Snyder, an assistant district attorney for Queens. State Supreme Court Justice Moses M. Weinstein performed the ceremony in his chambers in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Card of Thanks
description: FREUDENTHALLilly. Frank Freudenthal wishes to thank his friends for their expressions of sympathy.

title: Murder Is Charged to 20 In Trenton Prison Attack
description: TRENTON, Dec. 5 (UPI)The Mercer County grand jury today indicted 20 men on murder charges growing out of a bloody attack Oct. 16 by orthodox Black Muslims on a rival faction.

title: 3 British Vessels in Action Against Gunboat off Iceland
description: LONDON, Dec. 5 (Reuters)A British Navy frigate and two fisheryprotection vessels today went into spirited action against the Icelandic gunboat Thor, the Ministry of Defense said here.

title: CITY PAYROLL MET WITH PENSION CASH
description: At 4:15 A.M. yesterday, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin ordered the release of $100 million in payroll checks for 200,000 city employees, in time to get them to the workers by the time they were due.

title: Rushing Man Favored Today In a Field of 8 for Discovery
description: Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt, whose cerise and white silks have been one of the most famous sets of colors for decades, was in focus at Aqueduct yesterday from several directions. For openers, his Quasi Queen, a 3yearold daughter Tracks of Kauai King, was the $12.40for$2 winner of the first race with Robyn Smith aboard. The triumph followed by a few hours the announcement of entries for today's 31st running of the Discovery Handicap. That fixture is named after Vanderbilt's superb thoroughbred of the 1930's.

title: Oxymorons and Similar Games
description: If you harbor an affection for the magic of words, you cannot help delighting in the prestidigitations of Willard R. Espy, a man who pulls words out of the air the way a magician plucks pigeons from his pocket. Over the years Mr. Espy has been a diligent collector and perpetrator of etymological oddities, nonsense verse, light poetry and stories about words and their meanings, heavenly and profane.

title: Multiple Company Funds In Campaigns Suggested
description: Joan D. Aikens, a member of the Federal Election Cornmission, indicated yesterday that individual corporations might establish more than one committee to raise funds to be channeled to political candidates.

title: Punishing the Offenders
description: WASHINGTONViolent crime is spreading like a national plague. Since 1968, the national crime rate has risen 57 percent; this year it is up an additional 13 percent. Grim statistics cry out for government action, yet little that government does seems to work. Why can't we make our streets and neighborhoods safe?

title: Taiwan Golf Duo Ties U. S.
description: BANGKOK, Dec. 5 (AP)Hsieh Minnam and Kuo Chiehsiung scored fourunderpar 68's today and lifted Taiwan into a tie with the United States for the team lead at the halfway mark of the 23d World Cup golf championship.

title: Hills Says S.E.C. Plans More Research
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 5Roderick M. Hills, new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, disclosed today that the surveillanceoriented agency would shortly strengthen its capacity for serious economic research.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The crime index in New Jersey for the first nine months of 1975 was 8.5 percent higher than for the same period last year, the state police said. A report for JanuarySeptember shows that murder, rape, robbery and atrocious assault rose 6.2 percent and nonviolent crimes such as larceny, breaking and entering and auto theft went up 8.8 percent.

title: Theater: Dear Mr. G.
description: In bear Mr. G., Donna de Matteo turns The Godfather into a family situation comedy. The play, which opened Thursday night at Roundabout Stage Two, is true to stereotype.

title: VENEZUELA SENDING 2 TO HEAR HAMMER
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  Venezuelan Congressmen investigating allegations that the Occidental Petroleum corporation paid $3 million in bribes to Venezuelan politicians twill hear evidence in California next week from the company's chairman, Armand Hammer, it was announced here today.

title: Dow Stock Index Drops 10.31; Its Loss for the Week Is 41.87
description: The stock market declined sharply again yesterday under the weight of yearend tax selling, negative attitudes on the part of chartwatchers and continuing anxieties over the impact of New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Bridge:
description: Even players of the highest rank are often surprisingly ignorant about the laws of the game. In the final session of the Reisinger team championship in New Orleans last Sunday, two members of the team that finished second had a considerable legal shock. They sat EastWest on the diagramed deal, and were given some help by their opponents who landed in the wrong contract.

title: WHITE MOTOR BID FOR TIE RENEWED
description: The White Motor Corporation and White Consolidated Industries, whose proposed merger in 1971 was thwarted by Government antitrust action, announced yesterday that they were going to try again. The

title: People and Business
description: The Ford Administration indicated yesterday afternoon its intention of elevating two Government officials to become board members of the Interstate Commerce Commission and the Federal Reserve Board.

title: PhoneRate Hearing Slated
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5 (AP)The state's Board of Public Utility Commissioners has scheduled a hearing for Jan. 26 on a request by the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company for a $174.6 million rate increase, the largest ever sought by the company.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on job projects in The New York Times of Sept. 26, it was erroneously reported that the Community Action Program in Evansville, Ind., had been dropped. The agency is still in existence.

title: U.S. HINTS A VETO IN U.N. TO THWART CENSURE OF ISRAEL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 5The United States, in a statement to the Security Council today, said that while it would neither condone nor excuse Israel's air attacks against targets in Lebanon last Tuesday, it wanted any resolution of condemnation to denounce all acts of violence in the Middle East.

title: DOROTHY S. PARKE
description: Dorothy S. Parke, the widow of John S. Parke Sr., who played a leading role in the construction of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, died Thursday evening at the hospital's Harkness Pavilion. She was 69 years old and lived in Pelham Manor, N.Y.

title: Ford Assures Indonesia of Commitment
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Saturday, Dec. 6Working his way around the southern rim of the Pacific basin, President Ford sought to reassure the Government of Indonesia today that the United States continued to be committed to the peace and security of Southeast Asia.

title: Church Leader Who Is Calm Amid Conflict
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 5While Dr. Philip A. Potter was reading a prayer into a microphone at opening ceremonies of the World Council of Churches' fifth assembly here, a noisy intruder came up behind him shouting insults.

title: An ArtDeco Gem in the Dross
description: In 1925 the editor of The American Architect called the BarclayVesey Building, as the New York Telephone headquarters at 140 West Street was known, the finest modern building in America. And if history has not borne him out literally, the structure has surely earned a place on that short list of seminal New York skyscrapers, along with such structures as the old McGrawHill Building and The Daily News Building, both on 42d Street.

title: Paul Defends Yanks' Role In Stadium Building Costs
description: The formal announcement of the return of Yogi Berra to the New York Yankees as a coach yesterday became an occasion for Gabe Paul, the club's president, to answer questions raised recently about the rebuilding of Yankee Stadium. His re marks were made at a news conference at the Americana Hotel, where he also revealed that the New York Jets would play three exhibition football games at the Stadium next summer.

title: 12% Allstate Rise Set on Cars, Homes
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (AP)Insurance rates for home owners and car owners will be increased an average of 12 percent next year by the Allstate Insurance Company, a spokesman for the company said today. Allstate, one of the nation's largest auto insurance and home insurance companies, will raise rates in all lines of liability coverage. The increase comes on top of a 20 percent rise since 1974.

title: Trimming the Fat
description: We are beginning to get into the bone, Mayor Beame announced the other day as he undertook a new round of municipal layoffs in response to pressure from state monitors for speedier compliance with austerity budget requirements.

title: Foundry in Ohio Struck
description: DEFIANCE, Ohio, Dec. 5 (UPI)Local 211 of the United Auto Workers union struck the Central Foundry Division of General Motors Corporation today, idling 3,680 workers. The strike was called in a dispute over production standards.

title: Stock Index Off 10.31
description: The stock market declined sharply yesterday in a continuation of the weakness experienced earlier in the week. The Dow Jones industrial average fell 10.31 points to 818.80 at the close. The decline in the indicator for the week amounted to 41.87 points, the largest weekly drop since September 1974. Details on Page 41.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Twentyfive defendants were charged with a major narcotics conspiracy to distribute 200 pounds of Mexican heroin here in the last six months. State and Federal officials said the Mexican heroin was brought in regular shipments from Los Angeles, where its wholesale value was more than $2 million, to New York City, where its street value was estimated at $50 million. Eleven defendants, including eight Mexicans, were in custody here.

title: Charleston Defers HorseDiaper Law In Favor of Radios
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Dec. 5 A temporary settlement will allow the operators of Charleston's carriage tours to leave their horses undiapered, at least for 30 days.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: The Hispanic theater is flowering in New York City, where five major companies and 10 smaller ones are serving a diverse community that is growing each year.

title: Consumer Credit Lagged in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) The growth in consumer debt slowed 30 percent from September to October, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: That New Toy May Harm a Child
description: Dangerous toys and decorations are still on the market despite a Federal safety commission's recent statement that called most toys much safer now, the city's Consumer Affairs Commissioner, Elinor C. Guggenheimer, warned Christmas shoppers yesterday.

title: Jobless Rate for 6 Months Stays on Virtual Plateau
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The nation's unemployment rate declined a bit in November, after a rise in October, and thus appears to have remained on a virtual plateau for the last six months, the Labor Department said today.

title: CBS Unable to Get Word on Newsmen Arrested in Angola
description: The president of CBS News said yesterday that the network had been unable to get information about two of its newsmen seized two weeks ago in Angola.

title: ,Jersey Bell Wins A Battle Against Contrived Listings
description: PATERSON, Dec. 5The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company yesterday won the right to eliminate telephone directory listings of subscribers with naives having fewer than three characters, after Superior Court Judge ruled against a firm that had sued to remain listed in the directory under the name A.

title: Detroit Trucking Terminal Is Focus of Haffa Inquiry
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5The Federal grand jury that is investigating the disappearance of James R. Hoffa is looking into the possibility that his body was stuffed into a 55gallon steel drum in a trucking terminal here and taken from Detroit.

title: Pennsy to Use Its Funds For Retroactive Wages
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 5The trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company bowed today to Federal demands that the bankrupt railroad use its existing funds to pay employees $36 million in retroactive wages. The company said it intended to make the payments as promptly as possible and certainly before the end a this month.

title: To Rescue C.U.N.Y.
description: The call by State Education Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist for immediate emergency state aid for the City University assumes extraordinary significance because it brushes aside the political issues that have obscured the true nature of C.U.N.Y.'s embattled position. The fact is, as Mr. Nyquist said, that imposition by the city of another $55 million cut on C.U.N.Y.'s already drastically reduced budget would cause irreparable harm to the institution's academic programs and quality.

title: Business Briefs
description: FRESNO, Calif., Dec. 5 (AP)The New York Stock Exchange will be asked to arbitrate a charge that Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis Inc. raided another stock brokerage firm's entire Fresno staff.

title: TV Newsmen Believed Favored on Visit to China
description: Although the first Presidential visit to China in 1972 by Richard M. Nixon was an event of greater historic importance than President Ford's summit meeting last week, the television networks sent more producers, reporters, technicians, executives and equipment to cover Mr. Ford.

title: Cattle Disease Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) Six new outbreaks of a cattle disease, scabies, were found during the last half of November, the Agriculture Department says. The outbreaks were found in Kearney County, Neb.; Cimarron County, Okla.; Texas County, Okla., Gaines County, Tex.; Swisher County, Tex., and Logan County, Colo.

title: Albany Votes Protection for Pension Funds' Trustees
description: ALBANY, Dec. 5A bill offering enhanced legal protection for the trustees of the New York City employee pension funds passed the Legislature shortly before 4 o'clock this morning and was immediately signed into law by Governor Carey, who declared that the massive, complex fiscal iackage to save New York City from default and bankruptcy is now in place.

title: U.S ENDS CHARGES ON GRAIN COMPANY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Agriculture Department, accepting a surveillance plan to guard against corruption, has dropped a complaint seeking to revoke the warehouse license of one of the grain companies under investigation in the Port of New Orleans.

title: Many Dismissed by City Seek Jobs Across Nation
description: DENVER, Dec. 5  This week Edward K. Doherty, formerly a police officer assigned to the East 51st Street stationhouse in Manhattan, pinned on a new badgethat of the Arvada Police Department in a bedroom suburb bordering Denver.

title: High Court Asks Data on Press Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Supreme Court took a tentative step late today into the increasingly controversial and tangled proceedings over a strict gag order that was imposed on the press by a judge in a Nebraska murder case.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on job projects in The New York Times of Sept. 26, it was erroneously reported that the Community Action Program in Evansville, Ind., had been dropped. The agency is still in existence.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, DECEMBER 6, 1975

title: 4 National Security Authorities Say Covert Actions Hurt U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) Covert action aimed against foreign governments has damaged the reputation of the United States and should be severely curbed, four authorities on issues of national security said today.

title: Movie: Man in Trunk
description: Although The Man in the Trunk, which was opened at local theaters yesterday, traverses wat appears to be most of the North African littoral, it doesn't seem to get anywhere in particular. Though it is nominally a French farce, tit rarely generates a guffaw. And as an extenuatea chase involving an Israeli secret agent fleeing from irate Arabs (through that trunk mostly) in the unlikely company of a French intelligence officer, an Egyptian naval lieutenant and a leggy blond, Gallic charmer they ailadore, it is a labored trip that isn't quite necessary.

title: Slalom Is Captured By Thoeni
description: down into a gully and fall. The rock was at the side of the trail. The witness saw no more because he was on a chairlift and was out of sight almost at once. The other French skiers were already at the bottom of the trail.

title: American String Quartet Performs at Mannes
description: The Mannes College of Music was founded by a violinist and later ruled by pianists. Now it is headed by a singer, Rise Stevens, and there is a faint irony in the fact that for, the first time the school has a string quartet in residence. Actually, Mannes is going along with the recent admirable trend in which such ensembles are active on a great many college and university grounds as performers and teachers.

title: Notes on People
description: Rescued from his professional Siberia by a letter from the United States Attorney General, Lieut. David Durk went on a year's leave from the Police Department last night and will go to work Monday in the United Nations Secretariat's crime prevention, and criminal justice section.

title: EMMET J. KELLEY, 74, OF NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: BERLIN, N.H., Dec. 5 (AFB)Emmet J. Kelley, a former Democratic National Committeeman and founder of thoroughbred racing in New Hampshire, died this morning at the age of 74.

title: U.S. Jury in Newark Is Studying Alleged Helstoski Fund Abuses
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5 (UPI)Jonathan L. Goldstein, the United States Attorney here, said in Federal District court today that a Federal grand jury was investigating whether Representative. Henry Helstoski, Democrat of New Jersey, used legislative and campaign funds for his personal expenses.

title: ARTHUR GARDINER, FORMER U.S. AIDE
description: Arthur Z. Gardiner, who was director of this country's operating mission in Vietnam from 1958 to 1962, died Thursday in Sibley Hospital, Washington. He was 74 years old and lived in McLean, Va.

title: Thin Hope in Rhodesia
description: Almost every element in the Rhodesian situation indicates failure for the projected new round of constitutional negotiations between Prime Minister Ian Smith and the African nationalist leader, Joshua Nkomo. In fact, the only hopeful sign is that the talks have been denounced in advance as a sellout by the most extreme forces in both black and white camps.

title: RADIO STATION FINED FOR OBSCENE SHOW
description: The Federal Communications Commission has fined the University of Pennsylvania radio station, WXPNFM, $2,000 for broadcasting obscene and indecent matter during two programs last January.

title: Jews of 27 Countries Pledge Support for Zionism
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 5Representatives of Jewish communities in 27 countries signed a declaration today pledging help for Israel to fulflill its historic mission in the return to Zion.

title: EDWARD T. ROCHE
description: Edward T. Roche, former secretary of the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, died yesterday at. Central Suffolk Hospital. Riverhead, L. I. He was 76 years old and a resident of West Hampton, L. I.

title: Failure to Communicate Is Laid To Business at N. A. M. Parley
description: Wherever a visitor went at the annual meeting of the National Association of Manufacturers this week, the conversation seemed to turn to the problems businessmen area, having communicating with the rest of the country.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gurney Seeks Dismissal
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 5 (AP) Former Senator Edward J. Gurney is seeking dismissal of Federal conspiracy and prejury charges against him on the grounds that the Government is not prepared to prosecute the case. In a motion filed yesterday in United States District Court, Mr. Gurney's attorney, Harris Dittmar, said the Government had failed to comply with an order by District Judge George C. Young to provide the defense with the names of the prosecution team by Nov. 28.

title: Great American Ailments
description: We have all heard that America is a sick society, but nobody has been very specific about what precisely ails us. To fill this gap in the medical sciences, I have completed six hours of research by sitting in front of a television set, as a result of which I can now offer the following Complete Encyclopedia of Leading American Ailments.

title: Antiques: Fabulous Clutter of the Adams Mansion
description: Most visitors to the Adams National Historic site in Quincy, Mass., apparently find it difficult to imagine a home beter suited to the personalities and possessions of John Adams and his descendants.

title: Air Passengers Advised
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board's Office of Consumer Affairs today urged airline passengers who have holiday reservations on strikeclosed National Airlines to check into the possibility of reservations on another airline. The office said that National was still taking holiday reservations although its operations are closed because of striking flight attendants.

title: RENEE R. FALK
description: Renee R. Falk, who had been a publicity aide for WABCTV in 196263 and a reporter for Television magazine and RadioTV Daily, died yesterday in Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx. She was 37 years old.

title: Connecticut Starts Laying Off 500 Employees on Thursday
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 5Gov. Ella T. Grasso scolded the Connecticut General Assembly today for adjourning last night without providing legislation for the austerity measures she wanted, and then announced that she would begin laying off state employees next Thursday.

title: A Party in Jeopardy
description: The indictment of Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthalcoupled with an earlier indictment of another Democratic ??ative leader, Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingutwill adversely affect the Democratic Party in next year's elections for the Legislature, particularly if one or both indictments resu?? in convictions, in the view, of both Democratic and Republican politicians.

title: Detention Without Trial Ended in Ulster
description: LONDON, Dec. 5Britain today announced the end of its controversial policy of detaining terrorist suspects in North ern Ireland without trial.

title: Thief in a TV Role Seized as Genuine
SCIENTISTS MAKE AN ANIMAL'S GENE
description: For the first time, scientists have synthesized a gene of an animal, opening up simplified ways of studying the workings of that gene, a chemical unit of heredity.

title: NEW LAOS RULERS ARE INTRODUCED
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 5The new Communist Prime Minister of Laos appeared at an official reception in Vientiane) tonight to introduce the new. Laotian Government, formed two days ago. He had not been seen in public since 1958.

title: U.S. HINTS A VETO IN U.N. TO THWART CENSURE OF ISRAEL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 5The limited States, in a statement to the Security Council today, said that while it would neither condone nor excuse Israel's air attacks against targets in Lebanon last Tuesday, it wanted any resolution of condemnation to denounce all acts of violence in the Middle East. The statement was made by Daniel P. Moynihan, after five thirdworld countries had in

title: MEROLA SEES NEED FOR PROSECUTORS
description: District Attorney Mario Merola of the Bronx warned yesterday that hundreds of indicted murderers will have to be treed on the streets of New York unless prompt action was taken by the city and state to provide added funds for the criminaljustice system so that speedy trials could be provided.

title: PACKAGE IN PLACE
description: WASHINGTON, Saturday, Dec. 6The Senate overcame an attempted filibuster and shortly after midnight voted 57 to 30 to authorize $2.3 billion in shortterm Federal loans over two and a half years that New York City and State officials say will enable the city to avert default.

title: Notes on People
description: Rescued from his professional Siberia by a letter from the United States Attorney General, Lieut. David Durk went on a year's leave from the Police Department last night and will go to work Monday in the United Nations Secretariat's crime prevention and criminal justice section.

title: Russians Purchasing More American Rice
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 5 (UPI)The Soviet Union has placed a 15,000ton rice order in the United States, its second purchase of the 197576 marketing year.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Garbage Talks Set For Today
description: Negotiators for the striking waste and garbage cartmen are scheduled to meet employer representatives at 1 P.M. today in a new effort to resolve their dispute.

title: Blumenthal Calls Charge Outrageous, Unfounded
description: Albert H. Blumenthal, the Assembly majority leader, was arraigned here yesterday on an indictment charging that he had lied under oath about his intercession for Bernard Bergman, the nursinghome promoter.

title: Art: Patterns of Collecting an Absorbing Show at Met
description: The wideranging exhibition called Patterns of Collecting: Selected Acquisitions 19651975, which opens today at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is at once extremely handsome and utterly absorbinga feast for the casual eye, and an adventure for the connoisseur. Seldom do we see temporary exhibitions of this sizeapproximately 350 objectsthat are so encyclopedic in scope and yet so consistently high in esthetic quality.

title: Zanzibar: An Improbable Island Emerging From a Violent Past
description: ZANZIBAR  This vividly beautiful and unpredictable island, whose history has teetered for centuries between the sinister and the somnolent, is recovering from its latest reign of the sinister. But it remains puzzling and contradictory.

title: Bereavement Focus of Westchester Program
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., Dec. 5When Joyce Phipps's husband died after a heart attack, her 6yearold son refused to talk about it. Weeks went by and not a word, she recalled, then I guess I'd given him one spanking too many. He screamed at me: I wish you were dead. I want my daddy.

title: ConnorsChris Evert in Match Today
description: LAS VEGAS, Dec. 5Jimmy Connors and Chris Evert are the topranked singles players in the world but in this haunt of highrollers Marty Riessen and Billie Jean King are 7to5 favorites to win a mixed doubles shootout tomorrow at Caesars Palace. The match can be viewed in New York at 3 P.M. on Channel 2.

title: MARSHAL A. DISKIN
description: Marshal A. Diskin, a former ABC television director, died yesterday at a hospital in Pompano Beach, Fla. He was 62 years old and lived in Lauderhill, Fla.

title: CONFLICT STUDIED IN JOB EXCHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5A House subcommittee invests. gating a Governmentbusiness program for the exchange of executives asked Federal officials today whether the temporary Government service of several private businessmen might have constituted conflicts of interest.

title: DISTILLATE OUTPUT INCREASED IN WEEK
description: Production of distillate products rose in the latest week, according to statistics released yesterday by the American Petroleum Institute, but stocks declined as the nation's weather began to turn colder.

title: Sacharuk Goal Is Decisive
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 5Though they ran their modest unbeaten streak to three games with a 32 victory over the Kansas City Scouts tonight, the New York Rangers lost another player for the second straight night.

title: RUSSIANS DEMAND LOWER U.S. RATES ON GRAIN SHIPPING
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5The complex arrangement under which American grain is transported to the Soviet Union appears to have been jeopardized by a new dispute over freight rates.

title: Uniting Europe . . .
description: The decisions by the chiefs of government of the nine Common Market states on a uniform passport and direct elections to the European Parliament in 1978 are a dramatic recommitment to the ultimate objective of a United States of Europe.

title: Detention Without Trial Ended in Ulster
description: LONDON, Dec. 5Britain today announced the end of its controversial policy of detaining terrorist suspects in Northern Ireland without trial.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Back to basics is the slogan of the mosttalkedabout movement in elementary and secondary education today, a fascination with the Idea that the schools have slipped in their teaching of the fundamentals and must reorder priorities to stress the three R'sreading, riting and rithmetic.

title: SPANISH PREMIER RETAINED BY KING
description: MADRID, Dec. 5King Juan Carlos I decided today to retain Carlos Arias Navarro as Prime Minister, a more that seemed to satisfy rightists and to disturb liberals and leftists.

title: Jobless Rate for 6 Months Stays on Virtual Plateau
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The nation's unemployment rate declined a bit in November, after a rise in October, and thus appears to have remained on a virtual plateau for the last six months, the Labor Department said today.

title: Food Price Harm Assayed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) Urban school children may have suffered considerably less from rising food prices than their elders in the year that ended last March, an Agriculture Department survey indicated today. The survey showed that for the second straight year, the national average price of school lunches in urban areas rose more slowly than national average food prices.

title: Antique Bottle Show In Yardville Today
description: YARDVILLEThe second annual Antique Bottle Show, an exhibit and sale sponsored by the Jersey Devil Bottle Diggers Club, will be held here today.

title: East End Study Unit Is Revised by State
description: EAST HAMPTONInsisting that he wanted a task force that is truly responsive to what the towns want, Raymond T. Schuler, State Transportation Commissionere stepped into the growing controversy over the committee he created to explore access alternatives to the East End and last week re??amped the unit.

title: Butterflies
description: In an economy geared to perpetual growth, there may soon be no room for butterfliesand a good many other things. Already many habitats have disappeared in this country and elsewhereeven the Amazon forests, home of over 4,000 species of butterfliesare giving way to farms to feed a burgeoning population. Yet perhaps

title: Urey Disclosed as Key Selector of Nobel Winners
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 6At 82 years of age, Dr. Harold Clayton they is palsied and suffers from a misbehaving heart and other health problems that keep him from traveling. Consequently, he will sit out an unusual intellectual event next week  an allexpenses paid pilgrimage to Sweden by most of the planet's living Nobel Laureates for the 75th anniversary of the Nobel Prize.

title: Grace Margaret Uhlein Plans Marriage to William F. Bergius
description: Mr. and Mrs. J. Wyatt Uhlein of New Canaan, Conn., and Grenadier Island, N. Y., one of the Thousand Islands, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Grace Margaret Uhlein, to William F. Bergius, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter A. Bergius of Helensburgh, Scotland.

title: The ghost of Delmore Schwartz
description: Reviews have pointed out that the character Humboldt in Saul Bellow's new novel is based on the life of the poet Delmore Schwartz. Like Humboldt, Schwartz had paranoid fantasies that involved him in farcical, humiliating situations. Schwartz's career started brilliantly; at the end he could no longer write; he drank heavily and quarreled with his friends. The end came in a seedy hotel in midManhattana heart attack in the middle of the night while taking out the garbage. For days the body of the poet lay unclaimed.

title: LYNN V. DE BEER
description: Lynn Valucheck de Beer, vice president of Creative Educational Resource Associates Inc., producer of educational filmstrips, in Ossining, N. Y., died Friday of a cerebral hemorrhage in Phelps Memorial Hospital in North Tarrytown, N. Y. She was 34 years old and lived in Briarcliff Manor, N. Y.

title: Cards, Cowboys To Battle for Lead
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 6The St. Louis Cardinals are favored by a couple of points over the Dallas Cowboys here tomorrow, a distinction of little importance which more than anything else reflects the debatable home field advantage applied by those who set the wagering lines. Essentially this game is a tossup. It is for a temporary hold on first place in the Eastern Division of the National Conference now shared by the Cardinals and Cowboys and it will be televised in many places, including New York (Channel 2, 1 P.M., E.S.T.).

title: A Caveat on Caves: A Trig Through Gyprock With Dixie Scarlett
description: TOURING the South, I finally tealize what the North is lackinga sulk of pride. New York has the Empire State Building, the Statue of Liberty, Central Parkbut who ever hears about them? When it comes to selfpromotion, New York (Madison Avenue take note) has much to learn from the folks who operate the hundreds of caverns, big and little, that burrow under Virginia, Kentucky and Missour.

title: Beware, It's Cold Outside
description: Winter boating may be jut good fun to some people, but it can be dangerous because of the cold.

title: Bangladesh Recovers Calm After Political Upheaval
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Dec. 6 One month after the latest political convulsion in this critically poor country, calm has returned to its daily life as the ruling military junta moves toward relaxing its strict control.

title: State Delegates Pressed Army
description: WASHINGTON  The Army's decision last week to expand the Picatinny Arsenal marked the culmination of an intensive and successful lobbying campaign by members of Congress from New Jersey.

title: Matawan Tops Colonia on Weber Score
description: Gary Weber, Matawan High School's 215pound fullback, crashed 1 yard for a touchdown yesterday the first time his team had possession, and the score held up for a 70 victory over Colonia in the Central Jersey, Group 4, championship football game.

title: 100,000 Filipinos Welcome President
description: MANILA, Sunday, Dec. 7President Ford was to head homeward from the Pacific today, having agreed with President Ferdinand E. Marcos of the Philippines to discuss new terms for the use of important American air and naval bases here.

title: Lawyer Wads Miss Paxton In the Capital
description: Katharine Seaman Paxton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Philips Paxton of Alexandria, Va., was married yesterday afternoon to Christopher Stuart Moffitt of Washington, a lawyer with the Department of Transportation.

title: 5 Die in Truck Crash
description: WHITE RIVER JUNCTION, Vt., Dec. 6(AP)Five persons were killed today when a trailer truck carrying a load of lumber crashed on Interstate 91 north of here, the state police said. The victims were not immediately indentified.

title: Fourfold Nassau Tax Rise Seen Unless County Plans Economy
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 6Unless Nassau County attracts new residents of prime taxpaying age and takes other measures to foster economic growth and cut costs, property taxes in the county may quadruple in the next decade, Nassau taxpayers were warned last week.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1DON PETERSON

title: CHESS
