description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Republican National Committee, caught in an unusual campaign crossfire, has refused to give the President Ford Committee access to its mailing list of major political contributors.

title: R.D. Tunick Weds Carole Silverman
description: Carole Lee Silverman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Silverman of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Richard D. Tunick, son or Mr. and Mrs. Stanley B. Tunick of Palm Beach, Fla., and Rock vine Centre, L.I.

title: Islanders End Jinx, Subdue Sabres, 30
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 7Glenn Resch beamed with pride and pleasure tonight, after his goaltending had helped the New York Islanders finally beat the Buffalo Sabres.

title: '55 Montgomery Bus Boycott Marked
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 7 The Struggle Continues was the theme of the weekend commemoration here of the 20th anniversary of the Montgomery bus boycott as thousands of black Americans gathered to reminisce and to put together a primer for survival.

title: OHIO BOMBS DAMAGE HOMES,CARSAND BAR
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio, Dec. 7 (AP)Six bombs went off in the Youngstown area in less than 24 hours, the authorities said.

title: Dons Take 2d N.C.A.A. Soccer Title
description: EDWARDSVILLE, III., Dec. 7Outsmarting its opponent and often executing plays perfectly, the University of San Francisco captured the National Collegiate soccer title today by routing Southern Illinois University at Edwardsville, 40.

title: 24HOUR CURFEW DECREED IN BEIRUT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 7 As kidnappings and executions continued in Beirut, the Government announced tonight that a 24hour curfew would be enforced tomorrow to check a spasm of violence that has taken at least 103 lives in two days.

title: United Flights Canceled Through Tomorrow Night
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)  Negotiators for United Airlines and 16,700 mechanics and other ground personnel recessed after five hours of talks today, and the nation's largest air carrier said it was canceling all scheduled flights through midnight Tuesday.

title: Theater: Ayckbourn's Farce Trilogy, The Norman Conquests'
Greenwich Villagers Make Most of Garbage
description: What is it? the welldressed woman asked her companion yesterday as she gazed at the uncharacteristic, makeshift decorations that made 30 or so bags of garbage a sort of ersatz Christmas tree.

title: EXCESSES TRACED IN SHIP SUBSIDIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Federal auditors have found that excessive shipping subsidies totaling millions of dollars for shipments of grain in the Food for Peace program have been authorized routinely for many years by administrators at the Department of Agriculture.

title: FORD PROCLAIMS PACIFIC DOCTRINE OF PEACE WITH ALL
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 7President Ford proclaimed a new Pacific Doctrine here today, declaring that the stability of the world and the security of the United States depend upon our Asian commitments.

title: U.S. Is Concerned
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A Cuban expeditionary force equipped with Soviet armored vehicles and rocket launchers is turning the tide of civil war in favor of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola, according to American officials.

title: Neglecting the Latins
description: SAO PAULO, BrazilDuring a recent visit to this city I posed a question to the local press officer of United States Information Service: When was the last time that a United States President had visited Brazil?

title: State Aides Form a Lobby For the SpanishSpeaking
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Dec. 7 (AP) A group of state officials voted today to form a national organization to lobby the Federal Government on behalf of Spanishspeaking citizens.

title: Miss Ginsberg Wed To Jeffrey Traub
description: Doris Ginsberg, assistant director of the Dance Theater Workshop here, was married yesterday to Jeffrey Traub of New York, a lawyer with the Legal Aid Society. Rabbi Aaron Pearlstein, assisted by Cantor Joseph Price, performed the ceremony at Temple Beth El in New London, Conn.

title: Borg Routed By Nastase In Final
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 7Ilie Nastase, better known here than most of the Nobel Prize winners gathering in town, put on an awardwinning show today and gained his fourth Grand Prix Masters tennis title in five years.

title: Presidents and the F.B.I.
description: The Senate Intelligence Committee has provided lurid confirmation of longstanding suspicions about the Federal Bureau of Investigation: Successive Presidents of the United States made use of the F.B.I. as a political police force, and the bureau under J. Edgar Hoover reveled the assignment. The record of the past four decades speaks volumes about the seductiveness of power.

title: INDIANS DIVIDED ON BICENTENNIAL
description: American Indians are divided over whether to ignore the nation's 200th birthday, oppose celebrations or use the Bicentennial to help preserve what is left of their own culture.

title: Gwendolyn Grace Is Married Here
description: Gwendolyn Grace, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Oliver R. Grace of New York and Oyster Bay, L.I., was married here yesterday afternoon to Paul Rodzianko 4th, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rodzianko of Scarborough, N.Y.

title: It Was a Day for Jolly Ideas
description: WHITE HORSE, Pa. Christmas in the country is different, especially if the country happens to be the territory at the end of Philadelphia's Maine Line.

title: Furs, Despite Cost, Enjoy Biggest Sales in 25 Years
description: Diamonds, it is said, are a girl's best friend. She is also quite friendly with furs, and the fur business is booming.

title: Dr. Herbert R. Edwards, Longtime Tuberculosis Foe
description: Dr. Herbert R. Edwards, a physician long active in the campaign against tuberculosis, died Saturday at the Veterans Administration Hospital in West Haven, Conn. He was 85 years old and lived in New Haven.

title: Rangers Top Capitals, 52, on 3 in 3d
description: The Rangers played 40 minutes of humdrum hockey at Madison Square Garden last night, 50 seconds of rotten hockey, and 2 minutes that seemed inspired. Those 2 minutes were enough, and New York skated off with a 52 victory over the worst team in the National Hockey League, the Washington Capitals.

title: Tension at Rikers Island
description: Echoes of last month's rebellion at the House of Detention for Men are still reverberating on Rikers Island; the conditions underlying the explosion persist.

title: The Spirit of Education Present
description: A manageddecline state of affairs exists today in higher education, partly the result of severe economic recession and inflation and a general disillusionment with the educational Establishment. It is also the result of great demographic changes.

title: Mariana Slowdown
description: Two Senate committees have fortunately applied the brakes to the Administration's drive to extend United States sovereignty and citizenship to the Northern Mariana island chain, far across the Pacific Ocean. Skeptical members of the Foreign Relations and Armed Services committees were successful last week in delaying further consideration of this littleunderstood measure until late in January.

title: Dolphins, Led by Strock, Top Bills, 3121
description: Don't worry about the Miami Dolphins running out of quality quarterbacks. Although they have lost Bob Griese and Earl Morrall to injuries, the Dolphins showed no weakness at the signalcalling position yesterday in a 3121 victory over the Buffalo Bills in Miami.

title: Innovative Building Victim of a Dispute
description: An innovative city building has been lying empty on Wards Island, caught in the middle of a battle of bureaucracies involving the Fire Department, the State Urban Development Corporation and the office of the architect.

title: Warriors Top Sonics By 115106
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 7 (AP)Gus Williams led a lastquarter rally that lifted the Golden State Warriors to a 115106 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics in a National Basketball Association game today.

title: Colleagues Pay Tribute
description: Thornton Wilder, the novelist and playwright who died last night at the age of 78, was mourned by friends and associates as a man whose life reflected the simple joy and wonder of being alive that formed an underlying theme of so much of his work.

title: Orchestrating Outrage
description: WASHINGTONWe are all now permitted to recognize as truth one central point that Richard Nixon's defenders have been making for two years: that the use of the F.B.I. for political purposes in the Nixon Administration was mild compared to the misuse of that agency in the Johnson and Kennedy years.

title: Mine Kills 2 in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec 7 (Reuters)Two men were killed early today when a mine they were apparently planting near the customs post at Killeen on the border with the Irish Republic exploded. The police said the two had links with the Irish Republican Army Provisionals.

title: Jets Stop Losing, Beat Patriots, 3028
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 7In their fashions, Joe Namath and John Riggins fought the icy winds and frozen ground today and the New York Jets' losing streak, longest in the team's history, stopped at eight games.

title: Unreal real Calm Found Where 5 Met Death
description: TEANECK, N.J., Dec. 7There was nosign of forcible, entry, no indication of anything removed from the house, no motivation yet turned up by investigators today for how Jean Diggs and her foud children, a highly regarded family, were shot to death in their brick and stucco home here late. Friday or early Saturday.

title: ArmourDial Is Shifting 4 Brands
description: Foote, Cone & Belding has gotten some additional business from a longtime client, ArmourDial: its new Tone complexion soap, Manpower men's deodorant, Barley after shave lotion and Appian Way pizza mix.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising
description: There are two sides to the grasshopper story.James J. Jordan Jr., president of Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, gave one last week when he condemned job hoppers, saying they have a philosophy that is damaging to business.

title: DUTCH SEEK TALKS WITH TERRORISTS
description: AMSTERDAM, The Netherlands, Dec. 7The Dutch Government, trying to cope with two East Asian terrorist sieges, pressed for negotiations today in hopes that at least 50 hostages would be freed without bloodshed.

title: Early Tax Forms in Colorado
description: DENVER, Dec. 7 (AP)Colorado taxpayers will receive their 1976 state income tax forms early this year so the state can save money on mailing costs. Jim Wren, spokesma nfor the Department of Revenue, says the forms will be delivered to the Post Office for mailing by Dec. 26, two days before the price of bulk rate postage is scheduled to increase to 7.7 cents from 6.1 cents.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: FORD PROCLAIMS PACIFIC DOCTRINE OF PEACE WITH ALL
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 7President Ford proclaimed a new Pacific Doctrine here today, declaring that the stability of the world and the security of the United States depend upon our Asian commitments.

title: KISSINGER BRIEFS JAPANESE ON TRIP
description: TOKYO, Monday, Dec. 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger told Prime Minister Takeo Miki and Foreign Minister Kiichi Miyazawa of Japan today that there are some discrepancies in United States relations with China, but that this is not a confrontation.

title: Six in Family Die in Blaze
description: MANCHESTER, Tenn., Dec. 7  Six members of a rural family were killed early today when fire swept through their twostory, frame home. Charles Waldrop, 39 years old, and his wife, Wilda Waldrop, 36, were injured attempting to rescue the victims. The victims were identified as Galand Nevins, 63, Mrs. Waldrop's father; Tammy Jones, 8, Mrs. Waldrop's niece; Jimmy, 11, and Anthony, 15, the Waldrops' sons; Mrs. Ellen Brown, 19, the Waldrop's daughter; and Richard Brown, 1, Mrs. Brown's son.

title: Union Women Hold Mainstream Course
description: DETROIT, Dec. 7the Coalition of Labor Union Women, at its second national convention, decisively defeated efforts led by women from the far left to change its basic structure and thrust and, instead, recommitted the organization to work for progress for women through the mainstream of the trade union movement.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Saltrising bread is another of those regional American dishes for which some people have a passion and which inspire in others something short of aversion. The bread is made by a natural fermentation, and for a period it is a bit malodorous. The finished product is a bit tangy with a flavor that is at times described as cheeselike.

title: Family of Historians
description: Constance Green's approach to history was simple: Understanding today's problems, she believed, would be easier if one understood how the difficulties came about.

title: 5 Murders Make Violence a Teaneck Reality
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 7The murder of a mother and her four children plunged this suburban Bergen County township and the communities that surround it into deep and incredulous shock today.

title: 4 Agencies Challenge Ford On Private Nuclear Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Officials in four Federal agencies either opposed or raised critical questions about a controversial nuclear energy plan that President Ford later recommended to Congress, according to documents obtained by the Congressional Joint Atomic Energy Committee.

title: 200 London Policemen Besiege Four I. R. A. Bombing Suspects
description: LONDON, Monday, Dec. 8Four men who barricaded themselves in a London apartment Saturday were continuing to hold two people hostage last night. Police authorities suggested that the gunmen might be members of a group of Irish Republican Army terrorists who have been bombing targets in the city's West End for two months.

title: CEREMONY HONORS EXYESHIVA HEAD
description: Dr. Samuel Belkin, who retired as president of Yeshiva University recently because of illness, was invested last night as the first chancellor in the 90year history of the institution.

title: Rock Stars Give Concert At State Prison in Clinton
description: CLINTON, Dec. 7  A busload of folkrock musicians pulled into this northwest corner of New Jersey today to entertain the women and men at the Clinton Institution for Women.

title: Oil Companies Seek Better Terms in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran  The group of Western oil companies that buys more than 80 percent of Iran's oil has proposed fundamental changes in the terms under which it does business with Iran through the National Iranian Oil Company, informants reported last week.

title: European Vision of America Vivid Display
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 For the cultivated European mind, America was a myth long before it had acquired much in the way of history or institutions, and it continued to be a myth long after its history had flowered and its institutions been firmly established. Even today, as we approach the 200th anniversary of national independence, there is a sense in which it can still be said that it is the myth of America, rather than its historical actuality, that dominates the European image of our civilization.

title: 4 WORKERS MISSING IN FLORIDA ARE DEAD
description: SUNRISE, Fla., Dec. 7 (AP) The bodies of four persons apparently abducted during a restaurant robbery last week were found today lying under a clump of trees in a swamp, the police said.

title: FolkRock Stars Give a Concert at Jersey Prison
description: CLINTON, N.J., Dec. 7Bob Dylan, Joan Baez, Roberta Flack and the rest of the Rolling Thunder traveling music show came to this isolated part of northwestern New Jersey tonight to perform for 300 inmates of the Clinton Institution for Women, and to draw attention to the imprisonment of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter.

title: U.S. Regulators Confirm Meetings With Regulated
description: WASHINGTONA longheld criticism of Federal regulatory agencies can now be confirmed: The regulators do, in fact, meet quite regularly behind closed doors with those they regulate.

title: Queens Fire Kills 6
description: A mother, her three children and two adults were killed in a fire that swept a row of houses in Richmond Hill, Queens. Neighbors charged that the tragedy might have been averted if a neighborhood fire company had not been disbanded by the city. The Fire Department denied this. Page 35.

title: FundRaiser for Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Robert A. Mosbacher, President Ford's new campaign fundraiser, describes himself with pride and pleasure as an oil and gas wildcatter, a sailor and an admirer of Mr. Ford and with reluctance as a millionaire. The 48yearold Texanbyadoption took on a job that his predecessor. David W. Packard left after three rather lean and unproductive months. Mr. Mosbacher has resigned himself to several months of exile from Houston, from his business and from his wife, four children and two stepchildren. He has also abandoned plans to buy a new boat and try out for the next sailing Olympics.

title: Going, Going, Gone: It's a New Aria at Met
description: Placido Domingo, Metropolitan Opera tenor, bid $3,000 for a costume worn by Caruso, and a breathless young woman bid $575 to have dinner with Mr. Domingo.

title: Striking Pressmen Reject Washington Post's Offer
description: LANHAM, Md., Dec. 7 (UPI) Striking pressmen at The Washington Post overwhelmingly rejected the newspaper's final contract offer today by a 250to5 vote.

title: Glass Industry's Leaders See Peril In Costs of Fuel and State Air Rules
description: MILLVILLE, Dec. 5New Jersey's oldest major industry, the manufacture of glass containers, is in trouble. Though the state's glass industry still leads the nation, it is losing ground to competitors in other states.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times on Saturday incorrectly stated that radio station WBAIFM was fined by the Federal Communications Commission in a March 1974 decision for broadcasting allegedly indecent material. WBAI was not fined but only warned against repetition of such broadcasts. The F.C.C. is being sued by the Pacifica Foundation, parent body of WBAI, in an effort to overturn this decision.

title: Stage: Franken's Another Language
description: Another Language, Rose Franken's warm and tender 1932 play, is remembered by everyone who saw it then for its nuanced and delicate account of the fate of an esthetic sensibility in the land of the philistines. It is a young person's play in that it pits the young ardent, romantic, aching for beauty against the straitlaced materialism of the fixed older generation, for whom nothing can be said, at least nothing good. It is a play that depends on the most subtle expression, the least emphasis. the slightest action. The writing is full of filigree work that lies over the skeleton of the plot, a gossamer that can easily he destroyed by the heavy hand of actor or director.

title: Heroin Profits Multiply
description: How much money is there in New York's illegal heroin business?From purchases of illegal drugs and intelligence gleaned through undercover investigations, analysts in the Police Department's narcotics division have devised a formula for estimating the profit in narcotics.

title: Battle for Custody of Vietnamese Children Is Stalled
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 7A court determination on who will become the parents of many of the 2,000 Vietnamese children brought to the United States eight months ago has bogged down over a disagree?? on a plan to trace the parents of the children in Vietnam.

title: BRITAIN WEIGHING NEW DEFENSE CUTS
description: LONDON  The British Cabinet is debating further cuts in defense spending, arousing concern within the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Carey BusinessTax Plan: Increases and Incentives
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that increased business taxes and a system of offsets  tax credits and incentives for job development would be included in the package of new state taxes and budget cuts that he will announce tomorrow.

title: DEMOCRATS OFFERED NEW DELEGATE PLAN
description: One of every four New York delegates to the National Democratic Convention would be chosen at large, under a plan expected to be approved by the party's state committee Dec. 16.

title: POLICE IN CHICAGO SUED OVER SPYING
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7  Three Federal court suits, stemming from alleged spying by the Chicago police department on community groups, have been filed in United States District Court here.

title: Church Parley in Nairobi: Duty and Diversions
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 7Safaris are nearing their peak season here, but they are out of reach for those involved in the current fifth assembly of the World Council of Churches.

title: INDONESIANS HOLD PORTUGUESE TIMOR AFTER INCURSION
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Monday, Dec. 8Indonesian troops moved today to consolidate their hold over Portuguese Timor after having seized control of Dili, the capital, early yesterday.

title: Flyers Defeat Stars, 61
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7 (AP)The Philadelphia Flyers scored three times in the first 11 minutes and skated to a 61 National Hockey League victory over the Minnesota North Stars tonight.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: John J. O'Connor, Proctor At Dartmouth, Navy Aide
description: John J. O'Connor, proctor at Dartmouth College for 11 years, died Saturday night in a Hanover, N.H., hospital. He was 54 years old.

title: PRISONER SLIPS OUT OF QUEENS HOSPITAL
description: A 19yearold wounded suspect in a robbery case escaped from custody at Jamaica Hospital last night by slipping unnoticed from a hallway bathroom while the police officer ??arding him was standing about 20 feet away, the police said.

title: U.S. Is Concerned
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A Cuban expeditionary force equipped with Soviet armored vehicles and rocket launchers is turning the tide of civil war in favor of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola, according to American officials.

title: Nessen Discusses Visit
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 7Ron Nessen, the White House press, secretary, said here today that President Suharto had raised in very general terms the problem in Timor when Mr. Ford was in Jakarta. Mr. Nessen said that Mr. Suharto did not inform the President of any pecific action Indonesia planned to take.

title: U. S. Wins Cup Golf by 10; Individual Title to Miller

description: An article in The New York Times on Saturday incorrectly stated that radio station WBAIFM was fined by the Federal Communications Commission in a March 1974 decision for broadcasting allegedly indecent material. WBAI was not fined but only warned against repetition of such broadcasts. The F.C.C. is being sued by the Pacifica Foundation, parent body of WBAI, in an effort to overturn this decision.

title: Soviet Gymnasts Keep Garden Crowd in a Whirl
description: Somewhere in the Soviet Union, there must be clumsy girls who can't even jump rope without tripping.

description: The Major Events of the Day

title: TURKISH CYPRIOTS WARN ON U.N. UNIT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7  Turkish Cypriot authorities have threatened to refuse to allow the United Nations Peace Force to continue operating in Turkishcontrolled areas of the island.

title: Feeling Comfortable for Less
description: Fashion as a dictatorship of the lite is dead.Caterine Milinaire and Carol Troy.

title: Log Derails 5 Rail Cars
description: KELLOGG, Minn., Dec. 7 (AP)  An eightfootlong log lying between the tracks caused the last five cars of a passenger train to derail today at Kellogg, in southeastern Minnesota, said an Amtrak spokesman. Three of the 127 passengers on the 11car Empire Builder were hospitalized at St. Elizabeth's HosDital in Wabasha.

title: Queens Residents Salute Private Slain in Vietnam
description: Residents of a Queens community yesterday honored a neighbor who was killed seven years ago in Vietnam when he went to help a wounded colleague.

title: Books of The Times
description: LAROUSSE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF THE ANIMAL WORLD. Edited by PierrePaul Grass. Translated from the French under the editorship of A. R. Waterston. Introduction by Desmond Morris. Illustrated. 640 pages. Larousse. $39.95 until 12/31/75; $50 thereafter.

title: 24HOUR CURFEW DECREED IN BEIRUT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 7 As kidnappings and executions continued in Beirut, the Government announced tonight that a 24hour curfew would be enforced tomorrow to check a spasm of violence that has taken at least 103 lives in two days.

title: Excerpts From Ford Speech Declaring New Pacific Doctrine
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 7 (AP) Following are excerpts from a speech delivered by President Ford today at the EastWest Center here:

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: The American Society of Travel Agents has suggested ways of choosing reputable travel agents in the wake of a recent incident in which a Newark travel agency allegedly swindled scores of Hispanic customers planning Christmas trips to their LatinAmerican homelands.

title: Roxana Johnson Is Wed on Coast
description: Roxana Johnson, daughter of Nunnally Johnson, the screenwriter, producer and director, and Mrs. Johnson of Beverly Hills, Calif., was married Saturday evening to Michael Guthrie Lonergan, assistant manager of the Mark Taper Forum in Los Angeles.

title: Selecting the Delegates
description: As part of the democratization of the Democratic Party, various Presidential candidates will hold open meetings throughout the state early next month ostensibly to allow interested Democrats the opportunity of becoming candidates for national convention delegate in the state's Congressional districts. A total of 219 delegates will be elected in the state's 39 Congressional districtsfour to seven in each district.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Colts Down Giants, 210, for 7th in Row
description: The message on the Shea Stadium scoreboard late in the game read, Fans are requested to remain off the field at the end of the game. Perhaps next Sunday the sign should read, The Giants are requested to remain off the field during the game.

title: Machine Age Is Squeezing Jersey Oystermen
description: PORT NORRIS, N. J.When Bobby Morgan and the boys gather over breakfast these days in Jelly Bean's Oyster Cove Cafe, a cozy hangout a few hundred yards inland from the wharves where the men's families have been unloading oysters since the Civil War, the talk is less of shellfish than of machines.

title: Thornton Wilder Is. Dead at 78; Won 3 Pulitzers for His Work
description: Thornton Wilder, who won three Pulitzer Prizes for his writing, died yesterday in his sleep at his home in Hamden, Conn. He was 78 years old.

title: ISRAEL ORDERS MOVE AGAINST SQUATTERS
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 7 (AP) The Israeli Cabinet, after sharp debate, directed the Defense Ministry today to move against some 500 Jewish squatters seeking to establish a settlement in the Jordanian West Bank.

title: Fish and the Seas
description: The Senate is soon to act on a bill that would arbitrarily extend United States fisheries jurisdiction to 200 miles.

title: Continued Tax Reduction Urged by Research Group
description: A group within the Committee for Economic Development called yesterday for a temporary continuation of the personal income tax reduction that had been approved by Congress earlier this year. In report entitled The New Congressional Budget Process and the Economy, the program committee of the Committee for Economic Development also urged a permanent extension for the 10 per cent investmenttax credit.

title: 6 Die in Suspicious Blaze in Queens; Residents Decry Fire Company Cuts
description: Three young children, their mother and two other adults died early yesterday in a fire that swept through a row of threestory frame houses in the Richmond Hill section of Queens. Fire officials have termed the blaze suspicious.

title: Screen: Special Section by CostaGavras Arrives
description: CostaGavras's Special Section (Section Speciale), which shared the bestdirection award at this year's Cannes Film Festival, is the most severe, least hokedup movie yet made by a director whose terrific flair for melodrama has occasionally seemed to obscure and exploit genuine political issues in State of Siege, The Confession and, especially, in Z.

title: ARTHUR N. PACKDIES; NATURE GROUP HEAD
description: Arthur Newton Pack, president of the American Nature Association from 1926 to 1946 and editor from 1932 to 1942 of Nature magazine, died Saturday at his home, Ghost Ranch Lodge, in Tucson, Ariz. He was 82 years old.

title: Arab Reds Charge Interference in Nazareth Voting
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 7Arab Communists in Nazareth are complaining that three Israeli Cabinet ministers have intimidated local voters by insinuating that the city will suffer if it elects a Communist as mayor.

title: Liberal Democratic Split
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Dec. 7  From the start of the preliminary maneuvering in the 1976 Presidential campaign, the liberal Democratic candidates have been searching for some way of separating themselves from the pack. By the same token, liberal activists have benn searching for a means of uniting behind one or two of them, lest the en ergies of the left be dissipated.

title: Music: By Sine Nomine
description: The excellent Sine Nomine Singers, conducted by Harry Saltzman, became the first musicians to perform in the newly refurbished Kaufman Concert Hall when they opened their 197576 season of three concerts there on Saturday night.

title: 11 of 24 AutoRepair Shops Pass a Test on Honesty
description: Of 24 repair shops asked to fix a car with a minor and easily detectable mechanical fault, 13 either completely misdiagnosed the problem or performed or recommended expensive and unnecessary work, according to an investigation by The New York Times in conjunction with the Suffolk County Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Dissident Spanish Labor Leader, Freed a Week Ago, Is Rearrested
description: MADRID, Dec. 7Marcelino Camacho Abad, Spain's bestknown dissident labor leader, was arrested today, a week after he had been released from prison.

title: Rosalind Spector Wed To Herbert Spooner
description: The marriage of Rosalind Spector, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Spector of Coral Gables, Fla., to Herbert Spooner, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Spooner of New York, look place yesterday afternoon in the garden at the Spector residence.

title: Read Gives Canada Cup Ski Victory
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Ken Read became the first Canadian man to win a World Cup ski event when he scored a major upset in the first downhill of this Olympic season. Four of the favorites fell in the race, surprisingly dominated by Canada, which had three other skiers place in the too 10 today.

title: Thornton Wilder Is Dead at 78; Won 3 Pulitzers for His Work,
description: Thornton Wilder, who won three Pulitzer Prizes for his writing, died yesterday in his sleep at his home in Hamden, Conn. He was 78 years old.

title: Le Figaro to Move
description: PARIS, Dec. 7 (Reuters)The French daily newspaper Le Figaro is to leave the elegant premises it has occupied on the ChampsElysees for over 40 years, a Figaro spokesman said yesterday. It will move into central Paris next summer, alongside the newspaper's printing plant, to save money, he said.

title: Democratic Coalition Assesses Its Failure to Unite on Candidate
description: Almost everyone involved lost Ia little when the New Democratic Coalition failed by a hair's breadth to endorse a candidate in New York's Presidential primary, politicians agreed yesterday.

title: Democratic Chiefs Cool to Hopefuls
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Democratic Presidential candidates, doing their standup routines like a vaudeville troupe for the assembled Democratic Governors here last week, got almost uniformly cool, disbelieving reviews from their audience. To Gov. Richard D. Lamm of Colorado, it looked like 10 guys tied for last, counting Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, who declined to participate. I didn't hear any governor say, Gee, that guy really turned me around,  commented Gov. Patrick J. Lucey of Wisconsin.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HER PLACE Willa Cather, one of America's major novelists, like many other literary notables, once lived in Greenwich Village. She would have been 102 years old today, and at 5:15 P.M. a bronze plaque marking the site of Miss Cather's first Village home will be dedicated on the sidewalk in front of 1 Bank Street (near the corner of Greenwich Avenue). Miss Cather actually lived at 5 Bank from 1913 until 1927, when the building was demolished: on Bank Street she wrote My Antonia (1918) and Death Comes for the Archbishop (1927). The principal speaker at the dedication ceremony will be Alfred A. Knopf, the writer's publisher and friend.

title: Luanda's Armies Gain
description: HUAMBO, Angola, Dec. 4As seen from here, the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola, aided by vast quantities of Soviet arms and by Cuban fighting men, has made sharp military advances on, three fronts in recent days.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: 5 Murders Make Violence a Teaneck Reality
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 7The murder of a mother and her four children plunged this suburban Bergen County township and the communities that surround it into deep and incredulous shock today.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: TATUAAEdward Lawrie. A memorial service for Prof. Edward Lawris Tatum will be held in Caspary Auditorium of the Rockefeller University, York Ave, and 66th St., on Thursday, Dec. 11 at 11 A.t... Friends are invited.

title: Blast Kills 4 U.S. Marines
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Four American marines were killed and seven were injured seriously yesterday in an explosion at a Marine Corps shooting range on Okinawa, a United States military spokesman said today. The cause of the explosion is being investigated.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP BY 5.1% IN WEEK
description: The steel industry rebounded from its Thanksgiving week lull and posted a gain of 5.1. per cent in production, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The trade association placed output for the week ended Dec. 6 at 2,086,000 tons and a production index level of 85.5. This cornpared with 1,985,000 tons], poured in the Nov. 29 week when the index stood at 81.4.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: John B. Waddington, director of the State Division of Motor Vehicles, said he was pleased with the service station reinspection program for cars that flunked inspection. He said that allowing motorists to have their cars reinspected at approved service stations helped keep waiting times down last month, averting a large increase in waiting times because of stiffer emission standards. The new emission standards, which went into effect Nov. 1 at the same time as the reinspection program, resulted in 8 percent more inspection failures, Mr. Waddington said. However, a division survey showed that by the end of November 58 percent of motorists whose cars had flunked inspection were taking them to service stations for reinspection. New Jersey will get a new set of standards this week to check weights and measures. The state has been working with the same set for 139 years, according to William J. Wolfe, State Superintendent of Weights and Measures, and now the Federal Government is giving the state a new set.

title: New Delhi Acts to Extend Hold Over Nation's Censored Press
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 8 (AP)The Government of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi tightened its controls over the already heavily censored Indian press today, barring publication of anything that the authorities consider objectionable.

title: Chess:
description: United States players monopolized the top prizes in the international tourney in Portimao, Portugal, the first time in many years for such a success.

title: GENE ZION, 62, WROTE BOOKS FOR CHILDREN
description: Eugene Zion, a graphics designer who as Gene Zion wrote many books for children, died Friday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 34 East 64th Street.

title: Prices of Grains and Soybeans Decline Sharply in Rush to Sell
description: Prices of grain and soybean futures plunged yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Disappointed holders of long positions, who had seen profits vanish in less than a week, rushed to sell.

title: MRS. JUDAH WATTENBERG
description: Rachel Guttman Wattenberg, the wife of Judah Wattenberg, a lawyer and former executive director of the American Technion Society, died Sunday at Roosevelt hospital. She was 79 years old and lived at 30 West 60th Street.

title: Oysters in Delaware Bay Found Proliferating Again
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 8 (AP)  Rutgers University scientists, who have been working for 20 years to restore the oyster crop in Delaware Bay, say their program is succeeding.

title: AutoRepair Problems: Causes and Some Safeguards
description: Auto repair problems have consistently been one of the primary causes of consumer complaints. Investigations by government agencies and news organizations have shown repeatedly that the industry is plagued by dishonest and incompetent mechanics and shops.

title: Senate Foes of Aid for City Call Off Effort to Stall Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Senate conservatives conceded today that efforts to stall implementation of the $2.3 billion loan legislation for New York City would be futile, and called off a threatened filibuster, assuring swift final action by Congress.

title: People and Business
description: For the fourth time in six weeks, John J. Riccardo, the Chrysler Corporation's chairman, left London yesterday without having obtained help for his beleaguered British subsidiary.

title: MRS. SAUL FROMKES
description: Amelia Blanch Fromkes, wife of Saul Fromkes, president of the City Title Insurance Company and vice chairman of the board of St. John's University, died Saturday at Lenox Hill Hospital at the age of 68. She lived at 1130 Park Avenue.

title: 83% of Chain Stock Tendered To Babcock as Bid Is Extended
description: Babcock International Inc. announced yesterday that, as. of last Friday, about two milZen shares representing 83 percent of total outstanding stock of the American Chain and Cable Company had been tendered in response to Babcock's amended offer of $29 a share. To purchase

title: The Right Democrat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The early signs point toward the nomination by the Democrats next year of a Presidential candidate with a centrist image.

title: U.S. Vetoes a U.N. Move Condemning Israel Alone
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 8The United States cast a veto in the Security Council tonight to block a resolution that would have condemned Israel for last week's air raids on Palestinian targets in Lebanon without also mentioning Arab violence against Israel.

title: Ford Again Pledges Veto If Only a Tax Cut Is Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8President Ford met with his top economic advisers today barely 12 hours after returning from his 10day trip to China and the Pacific, and reiterated his determination to veto any taxcut legislation that does not include a ceiling on Federal spending.

title: CoolRay Is Switching From Foote to Y.&R.
description: Young & Rubicam has been named the ad agency for CoolRay Inc., the sunglassmaking subsidiary of WarnerLambert. The account, which bills between $2 million and $3 million, has been at Foote, Cone & Belding, New York.

title: IVAN BASILEVSKY
description: Ivan Basilevsky, a pianist, accompanist and operatic coach, died Friday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 84 years old and had been living in a nursing home.

title: Motor Homes Recalled
description: DETROIT, Dec. 8 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation said today that it was recalling 2,884 motor homes that may be equipped with improperly installed mufflers. The units involved, Chrysler said; are 1975 models and are built on Dodge M400 and M500 chassis equipped with 440 V8 engines.

title: TOP DRUG DEALERS NAMED BY POLICE
description: Thirteen drug traffickersfour whites, five blacks and four Hispanic personsare now believed by narcotics investigators to be the dominant figures in the city's heroin and cocaine underworlds.

title: REGENTS SEEKING LARGER STATE AID TO CITY UNIVERSITY
description: The State Board of Regents] is reported to be preparing a plan for greatly increased state aid to the City University in exchange for giving the state a greater role in running the university system, including modifications of the City University's freetuition and openadmissions policies.

title: Ethyl Alcohol Price Raised 15c a Gallon By Distillers Corp.
description: The National Distillers and Chemical Corporation announced yesterday a 15centagallon increase in the price of ethyl alcohol effective Jan. 1. In other pricing actions, the Reynolds Metals Company said it would increase the cost of converter industrial oil and capacitator a lu minum foil products by a range of 4 to 5 cents a pound. The action by Reynolds follows the announcement of an increase by Anaconda for similar products.

title: J.P. Donleavy Puts Spice in Etiquette
description: After six novels, four plays, one collection of short stories and one anomaly, J. P. Donleavy is mystified.

title: Mexico to Free U.S. Boats
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 8 (AP)Mexico is preparing to release with only a warning, and no fines, three of four Texas shrimp boats seized last week while allegedly fishing illegally in Mexican waters, a United States Embassy spokesman said today. He said the fourth boat would not be freed because the Mexicans say it apparently resisted when they tried to detain it.

title: Only 5 Players Are Drafted As Baseball Meetings Begin
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 8Professional baseball opened its 75th business convention today with the second smallest draft of talent in history and growing doubt over the teams' legal ability to own players under the traditional reserve system.

title: Market Place
description: During the next three weeks, holders of New York City bonds falling due on Thursday will have to decide whether to swap them for 10year Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds earning 8 percent interest.

title: Beame Pares Jobs in PublicRelations
description: The elimination of 70 municipal publicrelations positions that carry salaries and fringe benefits of $1.2 million were ordered yesterday by Mayor Beame, but the city's Civil Service bureaucracy will limit the impact to 55 positions and savings of $800,000.

title: Heinz Profit Rises by 11% in Quarter; Other Companies Report
description: The H. J. Heinz Company, a major producer of food products, reported yesterday profit increases of 11 percent for the second fiscal quarter and 10.7 percent for the six months ended Oct. 29. Sales, however, were up only 2.9 and 6.8 percent for the respective periods.

title: Cancer Control, a Fight on 100 Disease
description: Hardly a week goes by with out a new report that some previously unsuspected substance has been found to cause cancer. Thus far the scientists have pinpointed more than 1,000 agents as definite, or suspected causes of cancer in man. In recent years, such agents  called carcinogens have been discovered in the air we breathe, the water we drink, the food we eat, the clothes we wear, the drugs we take, the jobs we hold, the habits we pursue.

title: Recovery Leftouts
description: Recovery from the worst economic downturn in four decades theoretically began a full halfyear ago, but it has not yet made any perceptible dent in the ranks the unemployed. One American worker in every twelve is still looking for a job. This official count does not include more than a million workers so discouraged that they have dropped out of the job market and another 3.3 million on involuntary shorttime.

title: Memorial Services
description: TATUMEdward Lawrie. A memorial service for Prof. Edward Lawris Tatum will be held in Caspary Auditorium of the Rockefeller University, York Ave. and 66th St., on Thursday, Dec. 11 at 11 A.M. Friends are invited.

title: FIREMAN IN COMA FOR 19 DAYS DIES
description: The vigil outside the Queens Hospital room where 32yearold John J. Flanagan lay in a coma for 19 days ended at 3 A.M. yesterday, when the First Grade Fireman became the sixth member of the department this year to die in the line of duty.

title: Poets in the Schools An Exciting Project To Educators Here
description: Are we going to have a chance to write poetry again? Please? Myra Klahr was asked. The hand tugging at her sleeve belonged not to an eager child, but to one of the nearly 100 school administrators who attended a daylong seminar yesterday on the Poets in the Schools program in New York State, of which Miss Klahr is the director.

title: MOYNIHAN ACCUSES MOSCOW ON AFRICA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8  Daniel P. Moynihan charged in the General Assembly today that the Soviet Union was engaged in colonial expansion in Africa.

title: Divided Democrats
description: It is no cause for astonishment that the liberal New Democratic Coalition here and a similar group of liberal Democrats in Massachusetts failed over the weekend to reach agreement on endorsing any of the several Presidential candidates seeking their approval. Since as liberals they were presumably judging on the basis of issues and principles rather than personalities or political expediency, they must have found it difficult to discover a rational basis for choosing among the various contenders so early in the Presidential campaign.

title: Pacific Doctrine
description: The principal, and laudable, aim of President Ford's socalled  Pacific Doctrine  seems to be to forestall a swing in the United States toward isolationism and withdrawal from Asia following the defeat in Indochina.

title: Riders Find Only Travail In Travels
description: A lost weekend in the Caribbean was the lament yesterday of Jorge Velasquez, Angel Santiago and Angel Cordero Jr. as they arrived at Aqueduct just before the start of the fourth race.

title: After Three Months of Busing, Louisville Schools Still Tense
description: LOUISVILLE, Dec. 7  In some of her classes at Pleasure Ridge Park High School, Pamela Walker is the only black student, and this frightens her to the point that she does not participate in class discussions and she never raises her hand, even when she knows the answers to questions asked by teachers.

title: 2 ACKNOWLEDGE MEDICAID FRAUDS
description: The owner and the controller of the Dumont Nursing Home in New Rochelle, N.Y., pleaded guilty yesterday to Medicaid frauds estimated at nearly $200,000.

title: GUILTY PLEAS AID FRANKLIN CLAIMS
description: Guilty pleas entered by defendants indicted in the collapse of the Franklin National Bank have improved the chances for insurance recoveries on the $30 million in losses allegedly incurred on unauthorized currency speculations at the bank.

title: 13,000 ARE LAID OFF BY UNITED AIRLINES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) United Airlines, its planes grounded by striking machinists, said today that it would lay off 13.000 other employees.

title: CBS Cancels Joe and Sons
description: CBSTV canceled yesterday the situation comedy Joe and Sons and selected another halfhour comedy, Popi, to replace it Jan. 20. Popi concerns a Puerto Rican widower who holds three parttime jobs to support his two sons. The star of the new series will be Hector Elizondo, who won an Obie for his performance in Steambath off Broadway.

title: PREVIEW OF CASES IN COURT HAILED
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8After a modest beginning and several precarious years, an attempt by the legal profession to create a better understanding of the United States Supreme Court in the mass circulation press has become a thriving and apparently permanent project.

title: Helping New York
description: Maria Redo stopped in midsentence and became angry.

title: New Solzhenitsyn Novel Analyzes Lenin
description: Halfway through World War I, in December, 1916, with heavy Russian losses on the Eastern front and no sign of a predicted civil war, Vladimir Ilyich Lenin despaired in his Swiss exile of ever leading a revolution in Russia.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 9, 1975

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Ford's Asian Trip: Trappings and Hopes Outweighed Substance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8President Ford is back from China and the Pacific with nothing more tangible to show for a journey of 27,000 miles in 10 days than his own modest declaration: There were no minuses and a lot of pluses.

title: TAXI INDUSTRY ASKS 7.5% RATE INCREASE
description: The city's taxi industry yesterday urged that fares be increased 7.5 percent and that half the cost of any gasoline increases be passed along to riders.

title: Commuting by Car to Gotham
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J.I am antisocial and selfish, I cause needless air pollution, I withhold needed revenue from public transit, my car squats obscenely in parking space intended for a brisk turnover of shoppers this is how highminded environmentalists, city planners and editorial writers view my habit of commuting into Manhattan by automobile.

title: BRIGHT NEW FACES SPARK NUTCRACKER
description: One of our earliest presents arrived 18 days before Christmas this year. It was on Sunday at the New York State Theater, to be precise, where the New York City Ballet has been stoking the annual Nutcracker performances with varieties of bright new faces, among them Muriel Aasen and Daniel Duell.

Thus far the scientists have pinpointed more than 1,000 agents as definite or suspected causes of cancer in man. In recent years, such agents called carcinogenshave been discovered in the air we breathe, the water we drink, the food we eat, the clothes we wear, the drugs we take, the jobs we hold, the habits we pursue.

description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Amex Stocks Prop by 0.6.1 Point As Counter Issues Show Gains
description: Stock prices on the American Stock Exchange dropped again yesterday in light trading. The index dosed at 81.79, off 0.61 from Friday.

description: Selected world gold prices Monday. London: Morning fixing $137.90, down $0.10; afternoon fixing $137.25, down $0.75.

description: About Pro Basketball

title: Byrne Starts to Let The Sun Shine In State Government
description: TRENTON, Dec. 8 (AP)Governor Byrne said today he hopes a new state law opening up public meetings would give voters a better understanding of government officials.

title: Judge Stevens Questions Equal Rights Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Judge John Paul Stevens, President Ford's nominee to the Supreme Court, questioned the value of the proposed Equal Rights Amendment today and suggested it might have only symbolic rather than legal importance.

title: Fed Confirms Cut In Interest Target At October Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee confirmed today that it reduced its target for the key Federal fund's interest rate to as low as 5 percent at its meeting of Oct. 21.

title: South St. Seaport Museum Can Set Your Mind Swimming for Christmas
description: In the midst of Christmas shopping, there comes a time when even the warmest of hearts and the most sentimental of spirits fall victim to the urge to get away from it all.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: COACHES' POLL

title: State Aide Urges San Francisco To Purge Rolls of Illegal Voters
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8California's chief elections officer demanded today that San Francisco identify and purge from its registration rolls possibly thousands of outoftown residents who vote here.

title: Chapin Appeal Denied
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) The Supreme Court let stand today the conviction of Dwight L. Chapin, who was President Nixon's appointments secretary, for lying to a grand jury about his dealings with Donald H. Segretti.

title: Henry V. Larom, ExDean At Rockland, Wrote Books
description: Henry V. Lamm, a founder and first dean of Rockland Community College, died Sunday at Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern, N.Y. He was 72 years old and lived in Monsey, N.Y.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: RUTH LANSCHE GIVES VARIED SONG RECIT AL
description: Ruth Lansch, a member of the Metropolitan Opera chorus, gaves a song recital on Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall that left one wondering if she were singing through a cold or suffering from more serious vocal problems. Her program was not designed to cover up deficiencies: three Handel arias, a Brahms group, a cantata by Alessandro Scarlatti (Su le sponde del Tebro), three selections from Berlioz's Les Nuits d'Et, three songs of Lee Hoiby, a Kurt Weill aria and a concluding Spanish group.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: High Court Weighs HairLength Issue For Suffolk Police
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) The Supreme Court, moving into legal territory it has never trodden before, today took up the question of whether superiors can dictate the length of a policeman's hair.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DOCKSIDE ART One of the few museums of in town that are available daily is also in a picturesque historical area. The South Street Seaport Museum (7669020), open from noon until 6 P.M. at 16 Fulton Street, is also gaining popularity for its collection of Old Port memorabilia.

title: Mr. Ford's Woes
description: Nothing could be more eloquent testimony to the deep political troubles of Gerald Ford than the decision of the Republican National Committee not to make its fundraising lists available to him in the coming election year.

description: AT GARDEN GAME TIME7:30 P.M.

title: Father of Murdered Family Is Praised
description: Wesley Diggs is a Pisces and there is a little astrological plaque in the office in one of the bars he owns in Harlem that friends say describes him perfectly.

title: White Sox Sale Is Key Topic
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 8  The disposition of the Chicago White Sox franchise in the American League and the San Francisco Giants of the National League, and the possible consequences for all major league baseball, were the most important issues to be faced by the owners of the 24 clubs here during the next two days.

title: Hannah Arendt's Funeral Held; Many Moving Tributes Paid
description: Things looked different after she had looked at them, Dr. Hans Jonas, a professor at the New School, said yesterday in eulogizing Dr. Hannah Arendt, the political philosopher who died last Thursday at the age of 69.

title: Schizophrenia Held Useful for Evolution
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8Schizophrenia is a fundamental human condition that may through the ages have helped individuals and cultures adapt to stress and rapid social change, a medical anthropologist contends.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: A Royal Food
description: Now that lobster is so dear that the average household can afford it only once or twice a year, it is perhaps comforting to know that it was once the darling of princes and emperors.

title: PLINIO SALGADO, LED BRAZILIAN FASCISTS
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Dec. (Reuters)  Plinio Salgado, founder and leader of a Brazilian fascist movement in the 1930's that almost toppled the dictator Government of Getulio Vargas, died here today. He was 80 years old.

title: ELECTION RESULTS CERTIFIED BY STATE
description: TRENTON, Dec. 8 (AP)The Board of State Canvassers today certified as official the results of the Nov. 4 general election. The Democratic majority in the Assembly was trimmed from 66 to 14 to 49 Democrats and 31 Republicans.

title: KISSINGER URGES ISRAEL FACE P.L.O.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has asked Israel to drop its boycott and agree to debate Middle East issues in the United Nations Security Council with the Palestine Liberation Organization next month.

title: Football Records Of College Teams
description: ARKANSAS

title: Senate Foes of Aid for City Call Off Effort to Stall Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Senate conservatives conceded today that efforts to stall implementation of the $2.3 billion loan legislation for New York City would be futile, and called off a threatened filibuster, assuring swift final action by Conaress.

title: BYRNE ANNOUNCES COURT NOMINATIONS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 8 (AP)Governor Byrne today announced that he would nominate two new judges and nominate for promotion five other judges who sat in Middlesex and Bergen Counties.

title: Canadian Pipeline Shift
description: The Canada Development Corporation has withdrawn its participating membership in the Canadian Arctic Gas Pipeline Limited Consortium and has decided instead to become an associate member with the option of terminating its membership at anytime, Canadian Arctic Gas has told a hearing of the Federal Court of Appeal in Ottawa.

title: Singer Calls Closing Of Italy Unit Probable
description: A spokesman for the Singer Company confirmed here last night that it would probably close down a factory in Leini, Italy, near Turin, in late December or January. He confirmed that roughly 2,000 jobs would be involved.

title: Stocks Are Mixed in Moderate Trading
description: Prices turned mixed in moderate trading on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday as the list took a breather from last week's sinking spell that clipped 41.87 points from the Dow Jones industrial average.

title: Raiders Subdue Broncos
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 8 (AP)  Oakland's swarming defense gave Ken Stabler the ball and his passing set up short touchdown runs by Harold Hart and Pete Banazak that carried the playoffbound Raiders to a 1710 victory over the Denver Broncos, tonight.

title: Beame Pares Jobs in Public Relations
description: The elimination of 70 municipal publicrelations positions that carry salaries and fringe benefits of $1.2 million were ordered yesterday by Mayor Beame, but the city's Civil Service bureaucracy will limit the impact to 55 positions and savings of $800,000.

title: Maryland Catholic Order Reported to Spend Heavily
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 8 (AP)From their base in a Baltimore warehouse, the Pallottines, a Roman Catholic order, spent more than $1.9 million last year mailing 106 million computerized fundraising letters, according to a report published today in The Baltimore Sun.

title: A Treat for 1,000 City Students
description: Christmastime came early yesterday for 11 thgrader Gisele Holloman of Norman Thomas Vocational High School as she and 1,000 other Manhattan students were treated to a day of free fun and food, compliments of Mayor Beanie's second annual holiday program.

title: Football Ratings
description: COACHES' POLL By United Press International

title: Riot Squad Puts Down Rebellion Among 134 at Onondaga Prison
description: A riot squad yesterday quelled a disturbance that began Sunday night among 134 inmates at the Onondoga Penitentiary near Syracuse.

title: Morton to Give Boycott List to Panel In Accord That Avoids Contempt Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Secretary of Commerce Rogers C. B. Morton and a House subcommittee reached an agreement today that avoided a vote by the panel to cite Mr. Morton for contempt of Congress for refusing to turn over the name of companies that said they had been asked to participate in the Arab boycott against Israel.

title: Terrorists Release Four Children in Dutch Siege
description: BEILEN, the Netherlands, Dec. 8East Asian terrorists released four children but continued to hold 21 persons at the Indonesian Consulate in Amsterdam tonight after an Indonesian diplomat promised to talk with a representative of the South Moluccan independence movement.

title: Washington Post Weighing Hiring of Nonunion Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP)  With rejection of its final offer, The Washington Post said today it may hire nonunion workers to replace striking pressmen.

title: CHARLES LANDER
description: Charles Lander, president of Namco Sales, Inc., paper merchants, died Sunday at Hill Home, Hawthorne, N.Y. He was 72 years old and lived in Scarsdale, N.Y. Mr. Lander is survived by his wife, the former Gladys Kleinman; three sons, Stephen, David and Daniel, and a brother, Herbert Landers.

title: COMMUNIST CHIEFS GATHER IN POLAND
description: WARSAW, Dec. 8Leaders of the countries in the Soviet bloc gathered here today for the opening of the first Polish Communist congress in four years.

title: Kissinger Meets Dobrynin On Possible Moscow Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger met with the Soviet Ambassador, Anatoly F. Dobrynin, tonight to discuss a possible visit to Moscow later this month by Mr. Kissinger.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Philadelphia Police Seek Newspaper Heir's Killers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8The police of this city scoured areas frequented by homosexuals today in search of the killers of John S. Knight 3d, heir to the country's largest newspaper chain.

title: CREDIT PLAN SOUGHT BY FIRST MORTGAGE
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 8 (Reuters)First Mortgage Investors said today it was seeking to have its bank group creditors execute a revised $400 million credit agreement.

title: Cantica Hebraica, at Y, Gives Concert of Diversity and Verve
description: Cantica Hebraica, the consort founded five years ago to provide a concert showcase for Jewish liturgical music, can always be counted upon to provide a program of interesting diversity. It did so again Sunday, beginning a threeconcert series at the newly refurbished Kaufmann Auditorium of the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A.

title: Fire Ruins Hotel in Utah
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 8 (AP)A generalalarm fire destroyed the old Congress Hotel and more than a dozen businesses on its ground floor early today, sending about 90 residents of the building into the streets.

title: Couple Sue Marriage Counselor for $5.3 Million
description: A Manhattan couple seeking psychological counseling to save their marriage says they received advice that led to their estrangement because the therapy allegedly included extramarital sexual relations.

title: MADRID SMASHES A LEFTIST RALLY
description: MADRID, Dec. 8The Spanish Government cracked down for the second day today on the leftist opposition with a strong display of police force to bar a Socialist gathering.

title: Have Gun, Need Help
description: Dear Old Friend: As you have doubtless observed, it has been many a week now since I last stepped out of the shadows, put the barrel to your ribs and divested you of cash, trousers and credit cards. You have probably asked yourself, Where is my faithful old stickup man, John Doesn't he like to mug me any more?

title: DR. LEO WADE, 66 OF CANCER CENTER
description: Dr. Leo Wade, a retired executive of the SloanKettering Institute for Cancer Research, died Sunday at Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived in New Canaan, Conn.

title: Helstoski ExAide Draws Six Years In Immigration Case
description: NEWARK, Dec. 8 (UPI)Representative Henry Helstioski's former administrative aide was sentenced today to six years for shaking, down illegal aliens in return for promises of permanent residency in the United States.

title: Woman Sees Bias in Bid to Be Fireman
description: MIDDLEOWN, Conn., Dec. 8A woman has been turned down in her bid to become a volunteer member of a fire department here and the State Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities has begun an inquiry to determine if the rejection was based on sex discrimination.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article on the Senate leadership in The New York Times last Friday, Senator Mike Mansfield's age was given incorrectly as 78 years. The Senator is 72.

title: GEORGE HANSBURG, POGO STICKINVENTOR
description: George B. Hansburg, who invented the pogo stick in 1919, died Wednesday at Parkway General Hospital in Miami. He was 88 years old and lived in Hallandale, Fla.

title: Heating Oil Shortage Stems Unlikely
description: A shortage of home heating oil appears highly unlikely in the United States this winter despite growing concern over Federal actions that are inhibiting purchases of distillate oil by dealers.

title: ATTRITION IS HIGH, CITY REPORT SAYS
description: City officials reported to the State Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday that the attrition rate among city workers was proving significantly higher than anticipated.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193. Church Street Station. New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Special Ornament Celebrates a $115 Gift to Neediest
description: A Christmas tree in the Chanin Building at 122 East 42d Street has a special ornament because of a donation of $115 sent by members of the IBM Chanin Club to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Carli Warns of Deficit Growth
description: ROMEIn the six months since Guido Carli retired as Governor of the Bank of Italy, he has had the opportunity to say some things that he could not afford to say as a central banker.

title: PARIS SAID TO JOIN ARMSSALES GROUP
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 8France has agreed to join a group aimed at increasing European arms sales to the United States, authoritative sources said tonight.

title: The White Maybe and the Graduate
description: Ever since the 1972 Olympics in Munich, he has been spoken of fondly by boxing promoters as a white hope. But on his record, Duane Bobick is at best a white maybe. He wasn't even the Olympic heavyweight champion. He was detached from his equilibrium by Teofilo Stevenson, the Cuban who has remained an amateur at the firm suggestion of Fidel Castro, the boxing commissioner there. Duane Bobick, meanwhile, turned pro and auditioned in such bus stops as St. Cloud, Bristol, Little Falls and Weston against a variety of lost souls who couldn't fight, or wouldn't. Not that any fixes were involved. His opponents' absence of talent assured his development as a trainee. But now, after 32 of those recitals that included 29 knockouts, Duane Bobick will come into focus Friday night at Madison Square Garden in a scheduled 10round bout against a white curio, Randy Neumann, an intellectual by boxing standards as s Fairleigh Dickinson University alumnus and an author between fights. And if Duane Bobick is to graduate, he must get by the graduate.

title: JUSTICES TO WEIGH IMPACT OF RESORTS
description: WASHINGTON, DEC. 8 (AP) The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether the Federal housing authorities must publicly assess the environmental effects of perhaps thousands of resort and suburban housing projects.

title: NURSINGHOME UNION AND MEDIATOR MEET
description: A Federal mediator met with union and employer representatives yesterday in an effort to avoid a strike threatened for Thursday morning that Would affect services to 16,000 people in 91 private nursing homes in the city.

title: U.S. Vetoes a U.N. Move Condemning Israel Alone
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 8The United States cast a veto in the Security Council tonight to block a resolution that would have condemned Israel for last week's air raids on Palestinian targets in Lebanon without also mentioning Arab violence against Israel.

title: The Program
description: MARTHA GRAHAM DANCE COMPANY, Martha Graham, artistic director and choreographer; associate artistic directors. Ross Parkes and Robert Powell. At the Mark Hellinger Theater.

title: Laos Says It Wants Good Relationship With U. S. but Fears Plots
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 8A senior official of the new Communist Government of Laos said today that Laos wanted good relations with the United States but was worried that Washington was plottinng with exiled Laotian rightists in Thailand to invade the country.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Miss Navratilova Is Happy Here
description: They learn fast, these teen age defectors from Communist countries. Here is Martina Navratilova, a 19yearold capitalist who drops trade names as comfortably as Jack Nicklaus or Arnold Palmer and who stands to earn more than half a million dollars next year.

title: ExSenator Conducts a Ministry at Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8It is not uncommon for former Congressmen to haunt the cloakrooms and dining rooms on Capitol Hill. Sometimes they are there in a new incarnation as lobbyists; generally they are simply seeking to recapture a glimmer of the recognition and perquisites they enjoyed before their constituents terminated their political careers.

title: AutoRepair Problems:
description: Auto repair problems have consistently been one of the primary causes of consumer complaints. Investigations by government agencies and news organizations have shown repeatedly that the industry is plagued by dishonest and incompetent mechanics and shops.

title: Inching Forward
description: Senate approval yesterday of an Administrationbacked bill, appropriately named S. 100 and designed speed the adoption of the metric system, constitutes an important step toward more rational measurements. The bill will not have the effect of instantly centimetering old yardsticks; but it will clear the way for the appointment of a 17member commission to coordinate the transition.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: tors of heroin and cocaine, and a powerful figure in black organized crime.

title: Dylan Returns to Garden With Rolling Thunder Revue in Benefit for Carter
description: Late on Jan. 31, 1974, at the end of his last show at Madison Square Garden during his tour with the Band, Bob Dylan made a promise. Dressed in a blue and white Toronto Maple Leafs jersey, he leaned into the microphone just before he dashed offstage and said, See ya next year.

title: Venezuela Iron Company To Run Former U.S. Mines
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 8 (Reuters)  Venezuela's President, Carlos Andres Prez, said today that his government would set up an iron mining company this week to run mines formerly owned by the United States Steel Corporation and the Bethlehem Steel Corporation.

title: EFFORT TO JAIL GROSS RENEWED
description: NEWARK, Dec. 8Jonathan L. Goldstein, the United States Attorney for New Jersey, today renewed his efforts to have Nelson G. Gross imprisoned pending further appeals by the former state Republican chairman to get a new trial.

title: Advertising
description: If you heard a new advertising theme that went It's hard to be down when you're up what would you think the product was? A mood pill? Booze? Platform shoes?

title: State's Businesses Would Get a Break In Carey Tax Plan
description: ALBANY, Dec. 8Governor Carey is expected to propose tomorrow a restructuring of the corporate income tax that will, in effect, penalize outofstate companies that sell their products here, while giving a tax break to companies with heavy investments of property and personnel in the state.

title: Big Lie in Angola
description: The civil war in Angola confronts the United Nations with one more moment of truth. Cuban troops and Soviet arms, brought in by a largescale Russian air and sealift, appear to be turning the tide in favor of the Communistled Popular Movement for the Liberation Angola (MPLA). This blatant military intervention by white powers from distant continents in the internal affairs of a black African country is the kind of aggression that the United Nations was created to oppose.

title: U.S. ASKS GAG ORDER IN THE HEARST CASE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8 (UPI)  Government attorneys asked United States District Judge Oliver J. Carter today to issue a gag order on publicity in the Patricia Hearst case.

title: Notes on People
description: The Defense Department got news of some familiar faces in new places yesterday. President Ford announced his nomination of Thomas C. Reed, a highranking civilian in the Pentagon since 1973, to be Secretary of the Air Force. The 41yearold Californian would succeed John L. McLucas, named head of the Federal Aviation Administration last month.

title: Yanks Name Ferraro
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 8 (AP)Mike Ferraro, an infielder who played with the New York Yankees and Milwaukee Brewers, was named manager of the Yanks' Class A Fort Lauderdale farm club today.

title: Gene Experiments Panel Urges Stiffer Guidelines
description: After months of controversy a committee of scientists advising the United States Government has completed a set of guidelines for lessening possible risks from newly developed techniques of manipulating genetic chemicals that could foreshadow what has been called genetic engineering.

title: INTEREST RATES BROADLY HIGHER
description: Interest rates moved upward throughout the credit markets yesterday as Wall Street grew uneasy over Federal Reserve policy and this week's heavy supply of notes and bonds for sale. In the money market, Treasury bills were sold yesterday at an average rate of 5.66 percent, upfrom 5.55 percent last week and the highest level since Oct. 24.

title: B. Robert Swartburg, 80, Designed Center in Miami
description: MIAMI, Dec. 8 (UPI)B. Robert Swartburg, a New York architect who designed the Miami Beach Convention Center, died yesterday. He was 80 years old.

title: Bill Collector Sentenced
description: Jack Nathan, head of a billcollection agency, was sentenced to nine months in prison and fined $40,000 for evading more than $30,000 in Federal income taxes from 1967 to 1970. His sentence was imposed by Judge Dudley B. Bonsai in Federal District Court here. Mr. Nathan, who is 64 years old and lives in Forest Hills, Queens, operates Nathan, Nathan and Nathan Ltd. at 167 Third Ave.

title: Indiana Trounces Fla. State, 8359
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 8 (UPI)  Topranked Indiana crushed Florida State, 8359, tonight behind 24 points from Scott May and 22 from Kent Benson.

title: Nigeria Urges Direct Deals
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 8.A Nigerian Government statement issued today urged foreign companies operating in the country to deal directly with Government ministries and departments instead of through middlemen and commission agents. The Government said any cases of middlemen trying to extort money from foreign businessmen on behalf of public officers should promptly be reported to the military authorities.

title: N.F.L. Opens Study Of Bets in Boutique; Tannen an Owner
description: The National Football League began investigating yesterday the arrest for bookmaking of the owner of a Florida boutique in which Steve Tannen of the New York Jets has a minority interest. The operation was said to involve betting on both college and professional football games.

title: Billion Iran Deficit Seen Despite OilPrice Rise
description: TEHERAN, IranThe linlingering worldwide slump in demand for oil has been compounding the problems that beset Iran's burgeoning economy.

title: DOLLAR ENDS MIXED; GOLD PRICES DECLINE
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 8 (UPI)The dollar moved up and down on European money markets today, but still held on to some of the gains it scored in early trading.

title: SHRIVER BREEZES THROUGH THE CITY
description: Happy that the New Democratic Coalition had been unable to winnow the liberal candidates for New York's Presidential delegates, Sargent Shriver hustled through the city yesterday to assess his own chances of running here.

title: INVESTMENT PLAN OF BANKS UPHELD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A Federal judge here has ruled that banks can continue to offer stockinvestment plans to theif customers without violating the boundaries between banking and securities investment established by the 40yearold GlassSteagall Act.

title: HouseSenate Accord Is Reached on Works Bill
description: A HouseSenate conference committee in Washington reported agreement yesterday on a $4.75 billion package meant to aid states and cities, especially those with high unemployment, through public works and other economic support programs.

title: RollsRoyce Stockholders To Get 100 a Share Feb. 26
description: RollsRoyce Ltd., which went into receivership in 1971, will pay shareholders 10 cents a share on Feb. 26, Rupert Nicholson, the company's receiver told shareholders yesterday at the company's annual meeting held in London.

title: Judge Stevens Questions Equal Rights Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Judge John Paul Stevens, President Ford's nominee to the Supreme Court, questioned the value of the proposed Equal Rights Amendment today and suggested it might have only symbolic rather than legal importance.

title: Inquiry Hears Businessmen in Government Were Sought for Nixon Political Duty
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A House subcommittee was told today that political advance men for President Nixon's 1972 re  election campaign were sought out from the ranks of business executives who were then employed by the Federal Government under a governmentbusiness exchange program.

title: Utility to Buy Uranium At a Quadrupled Price
description: A big Middle Western electric utility whose contract for uranium was canceled by the Westinghouse Electric Corporation because it refused to agree to a Westinghouse rationing program, has contracted with another supplier for uranium at more than four times the price quoted in the Westinghouse contract.

title: BRITISH FOOTBALL
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Cable TV Is Leased for GermanLanguage Shows
description: An American company, German Telecommunications Inc., has leased four hours a week on the two Manhattan cable companies as part of a venture to offer German opera, movie classics and Germanlanguage programs to cableTV viewers.

title: Senate Votes $45 Billion Funds With Busing Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) The Senate approved and sent to the White House today a bill giving the Departments of Health, Education and Welfare and Labor $45 billion for operating expenses through next Sept. 30, but banning the H.E.W. Departments from busing children to integrate public schools racially.

title: Bridge:
description: The 1976 world team championships in Monte Carlo in May will be a long, hard grind. For the first time, and probably the last, the Bermuda Bowl, in which representatives of continental zones compete, will be played backtoback with the Olympiad, to which more than 40 countries will send teams.

title: Tennis Sets Fines for Misconduct
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 8The International Professional Tennis Council issued today a code of conduct with fines for wrongdoings ranging from $50 for throwing a ball out of the court in anger and $10,000 for conduct detrimental to the game.

title: Conviction of Reinecke On Perjury Overturned
description: Reinecke Wins Appeal

title: FOES OF RIGHTISTS ATTACK IN BEIRUT ON A BROAD FRONT
