description: OTTAWA, Dec. 10 (AP)Time magazine will stop publishing its Canadian edition late this month or early next year, the Time Canada president, Stephen LaRue, said today. The decision to close Time's main editorial offices in Montreal and news bureaus across the country follows a Parliament committee's refusal to delay legislation affecting the magazine's tax status, Mr. LaRue said.

title: Brezhnev Ends Polish Visit
description: WARSAW, Dec. 10 (Reuters) Leonid I. Brezhnev, the So viet leader, left for home today after having attended the seventh Polish Communist Party congress.

title: Magical, Happy San Francisco Also Has Problems, and Tears
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10 The Indian summer this year, clinging on even toward mid  December, has created a languor and sense of magic that make it seem that this lovely place could have no longterm problems.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: State Crisis: the Same, Only Different
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11Beleaguered state residents watching the events in the Capitol this week must have had a distinct sense of djvu, of being transported back 11 months to last January, when Governor Carey was urging the immediate passage of new state taxes totaling $800 million and Senator Warren M. Anderson was just as forcibly resisting any taxes at all.

title: Icelandic Gunboat, Rammed, Fires On 2 British Vessels
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Dec. 11 (AP)An Icelandic gunboat that had been rammed opened fire on British vessels during a snowstorm today in the first shooting incident of the current fishing dispute between Iceland and Britain.

title: New Guardian for Miss Quinlan Will Talk With Kin and Doctors
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Thomas R. Curtin, the newly appointed guardian for Karen Anne Quinlan, said today he would meet next week with the coma victim's parents, their lawyer and Miss Quinlan's attending physicians to discuss his new responsibilities.

title: Barrie to Pilot Arrows
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 11 (UPI)Don Barrie, a Canadian lacrosse coach, was named today the Maryland Arrows' coach for the 1976 season. Barrie coached the Arrows on an interim basis the final 13 games of last season and lifted the club to within 1 point of the National Lacrosse League playoffs.

title: BATTERY SITE URGED FOR CONVENTION HUB
description: A proposal to revive the dormant New York City Convention Center project by shifting its location to the Battery Park City landfill has been discussed among high city and state officials.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 12, 1975

title: TV: Soundstage Offers Music of John Hammond
description: One or the more consistently impressive facts about public TV's Soundslage,. a music series produced by Kenneth J. Ehrlich and originating at Chicago Station WTTW, is that the focus is kept on music, not on distracting production values. The camera is not afraid to linger on the musician struggling and triumphantly succeeding with his art. The audience, the sets, the fanmagazine gestaltall the extraneous elements are nudged toward the background.

title: KIDNAPPERS FREE UNION CITY GIRL 9
description: A 9yearold Union City, N.J., girl was kidnapped and held for about 13 hours yesterday before her abductors released her unharmed after her father paid a ransom, the Federal Bureau of Investigation disclosed.

title: Money Supply Up 2.4 Billion in Week
description: Another sharp increase in the nation's money supply was reported yesterday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New, York, providing further evidence of a relaxation in monetary policy.

title: Census Aid Shift Backed
description: WASHINGTON, (Dec. 1 (UPI)  A Senate committee approved today legislation to change the census formula for distributing Federal aid, a bill supporters estimate could mean $1 billion a year more to the South.

title: British Continue Ban on Death Penalty
description: LONDON, Dec. 11  The House of Commons tonight defeated a motion to bring back the death penalty for acts, of terrorism causing loss of life.

title: Notes on People
description: For 217 days the dispute over who had won New Hampshire's 1974 Senatorial election was before the Senate Rules Committee, but yesterday the. Senate made it all economically worthwhile for the two contestants by voting a total of $293,000 for Senator John A. Durkin and his Republican opponent, Louis C. Wyman.

title: CONTROL OF CITY U. BY STATE IS URGED IN REGENTS' PLAN; Power Would Be Exchanged for Full Albany Financing of Nonspecial Programs; TUITION IS ASKED NOW; Mayor Sets Dec. 19 Deadlin?? for Education Board to Give Him ExpenseCut Draft
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The State Board of Regents, declaring that the city could no longer afford to finance the City University, called on the state today to assume full responsibility for financing it in exchange for assuming a majority voice on an expanded Board of Higher Education.

title: Frederick Hilles Dies; Yale English Scholar, 75
description: Frederick W. Hilles, an authority on 18thcentury English literature, the age of Dr. Samuel Johnson, died Wednesday at St. Luke's Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived in Old Lyme, Conn.

title: Beirut Orders 15th Truce
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Friday, Dec. 12To the sound of machinegun fire and explosions, Beirut's 15th ceasefire in two months was declared shortly before midnight last night.

title: A Gift for the Neediest, in Honor of the Bicentemial
description: A moonface sprite beaming from notepaper bearing the salutation Have a Happy Day accompanied a check to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday. The note, from Julius Lampert of Wantagh, L. I., said:

title: United Airlines' Strike Snarling Holiday Travel
description: Eighty thousand pounds of ski boots, the New York City Opera Company, the Seattle Supersonics and Jenny Logan shared a common fate this last week.

title: MOROCCAN TROOPS IN SAHARA CAPITAL
description: RABAT, Morocco, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Moroccan troops marched into the capital of the Spanish Sahara today and proclaimed the annexation of the former Spanish territory.

title: Museum Adds a Mollusks Hall
description: Few who relish oysters, clams or mussels realize the complexity of the organism they consume at one gulp. Nor are they aware of the remarkable lineage of such creaturestheir relationship, for example, to the 50foot giant squid of the Atlantic.

title: BOY CHARLTON DIES; OLYMPIC SWIM STAR
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 11 (UPI)Andrew (Boy) Charlton; one of Australia's bestknown swimmers during the 1920's and 1930's, died at his home today, his family said. He was 68 years old.

title: Music: Duo by Da Capo
description: The Da Capo Chamber Players opened their 197576 season at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night with a program that had two particularly interesting items in it. The first was Hanns Eislers Duo for Violin and Cello.

title: 500 to Receive Layoff Slips In Cutback by Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 11Five hundred Connecticut state employees were sent notices today informing them that they were being laid off in an effort to help the state eliminate a projected $80.1 million imbalance in its current budget.

title: KISSINGER CRITICAL OF SOVIET POLICIES
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 11  Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger told the foreign ministers of the North Atlantic alliance today that the balance of world power had been impaired by massive Soviet armaments and by Moscow's interventionist policies, notably in Angola.

title: RECORDS TIE GULF TO ILLEGAL FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) After the Watergate burglary, the Gulf Oil Corporation apparently tried to cover up a $5 million slush fund used for illegal contributions to Presidential and Congressional campaigns, Federal court records showed today.

title: A Test Drill Rig Is Expected Off Jersey Coast
description: A large, oddlooking vessel is expected to arrive this afternoon in the Atlantic Ocean, about 80 miles east of Atlantic City.

title: People and Business
description: Julius Shiskin, Commissioner of Labor Statistics, said yesterday that two ways of looking at the labor situation had validity, and both must he studied to get a fix on proper policy.

title: CUTS SAID TO SLOW MURDER INQUIRY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Joseph C. Woodcock Jr., the Bergen County Prosecutor, said today that New York City's budget crisis had prevented its police force from giving the usual assistance in an investigation of the murder of five members of a Teaneck family.

title: POWERTO PREVENT DOMESTIC THREATS SOUGHT FOR F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Department of Justice proposed today that the Federal Bureau of Investigation be permitted to obstruct or prevent groups that were plotting to use force or violence that might pose a threat to life or interfere substantially with the essential functioning of government.

title: CANCER PERIL SEEN DECLINING IN BACON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The concentration of a suspected cancer causing agent found in bacon appears to be declining, a top Agriculture Department official says.

title: DEMOCRAT LEADS IN SAN FRANCISCO
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11George Moscone, 45yearold state Senator and liberal Democrat, had a narrow lead with more than half the vote counted tonight in the race for Mayor of San Francisco.

title: LOAN GUARANTEES CUT IN ENERGY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A rebellious House of Representatives handed the Democratic leadership and the Administration a defeat tonight by rejecting legislation that would have authorized for the first time Federal guarantees of loans to build energyproduction faciliities.

title: Braves Hire Cannizzaro
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 11 (UPI) The Atlanta Braves appointed today Chris Cannizzaro as bull pen coach for the 1976 season. Cannizzaro joins Vern Benson, Herm Starette and Eddie Haas on the Braves coaching staff.

title: Bricklin Canada Assets Sold to Ohio Company
description: SAINT JOHN, New Brunswick, Dec. 11 (AP)Continental Automotive Inc., of Columbus, Ohio, has purchased almost all the assets of the bankrupt Bricklin Canada Ltd., which has plants in Saint John and Minto in New Brunswick.

title: Vatican Observer Keeps a Close Watch on the U. N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11During a recent lateevening debate in the Security Council, a slender Roman Catholic priest slipped into the chamber, took seat in a section reserved for delegates not directly, concerned with the issue under discussion and listened intently to arguments about Spanish Sahara.

title: Bridge:
description: Officials of the Greater New York Bridge Association are due for a nervous day today. They will be looking hard for certain peopleand hoping not to find them.

title: Santa's Skyward Travels, They All Started Right Here
description: The North Pole? Bah, humbug. The jolly, pinkcheeked man who brings Christmas gifts to the wellmannered children of the world was born right here in New York.

title: MICHAEL MARRIOTT
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Michael Marriott, chairman of the London Stock Exchange, died today after having suffered a heart attack at his home, it was announced by the Stock Exchange Council. He was 49 years old.

title: Advertising
description: Like Dr. Pepper, American business feels that it is terribly misunderstood, and businessmen seem to give frequent speeches proclaiming the need to educate the masses on the beauties of our system and the importance of profits. There are lots of speeches but not too much action.

title: Housing Scandals Slowing Programs
description: Not too long ago, after Detroit citizens expressed anger and frustration over hundreds of empty, dilapidated, federally owned houses, Mayor Coleman A. Young threatened to bulldoze some of the properties.

title: Tack Rosenthal to Head The Times's Magazine
description: Jack Rosenthal, the assistant Sunday editor of The New York Times, was appointed yesterday as editor of The New York Times Magazine.

title: Estaba to Defend Title
description: NAHA, Japan, Dec. 11 (AP) Luis (Lumumba) Estaba of Venezuela and Takenobu Shimabukuro, the Japanese challenger, signed contracts today for their 15round World Boxing Council junior flyweight title bout in Naha next Wednesday. It will be Estaba's first title defense.

title: Museum Adds a Mollusks Hall
description: Few who relish oysters, clams or mussels realize the complexity of the organism they consume at one gulp. Nor are they aware of the remarkable lineage of such creaturestheir relationship, for example, to the 50foot giant squid of the Atlantic.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)United States District Court Judge Barrington D. Parker dismissed on a technicality the Government's contempt action against four gypsum companies accused of pricefixing in violation of a Federal court order.

title: Vatican Observer Keeps a Close Watch on the U. N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11During a recent lateevening debate in the Security Council, a slender Roman Catholic priest slipped into the chamber, took seat in a section reserved for delegates not directly, concerned with the issue under discussion and listened intently to arguments about Spanish Sahara.

title: Angola Reported Getting $50 Million in U.S Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The United States has sent $25 million in arms and support funds to Angola over the last three months, a highranking Government official said today, and plans to send another $25 million in supplies to counter the largescale military intervention there by the Soviet Union and Cuba.

title: About Real Estate
description: For those who think of New York City as a place of highrise highdensity housing and the suburbs as the place for lowrise lowdensity housing, the 1970 housing census drew forth some interesting information.

title: DECISION RESERVED IN RAILASSET SUIT
description: A special threejudge court reserved decision here yesterday on a proposed injunction to bar the Penn Central and other bankrupt lines from selling assets before they could be transferred to a new Federally sponsored railroad system.

title: Spanish Cabinet Is Named; Cautious Reform Expected
description: MADRID, Dec. 11A Cabinet liberal by the standards of Spain, a country that has known 40 years of dictatorship, was appointed tonight.

title: British Columbians Go to Polls In an EmotionStirring Election
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Dec. 11The people of this mineralrich province voted today in an election that has generated unusual emotion for a Canadian campaign.

title: Murphy Expects 20% Rise In '76 Car Sales Industry
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11Thomas A. Murphy, chairman of the General Motors Corporation, predicted today that auto sales in the United States next year would increase almost 20 percent, making 1976 the third best year in automotive history.

title: Carey and Byrne Are Said to Agree On Leone for Port Authority Director
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11Gower nor Byrne and Governor Carey were reported tonight to have agreed upon Richard C. Leone, New Jersey State Treasurer, to become executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Camden Sheriff Indicted in Sex Case
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 11 (UPI)Camden County Sheriff Joseph W. Coyle was indicted today on charges that he had sexual relations with the girlfriend of a county jail inmate who later escaped from the jail.

title: Hospital Agency Eases Stand on Dental Clinics
description: The city's Health and Hospitals Corporation is trying to find ways of backing off from the drastic decision it made in October to close down all 11 dental clinics in the municipal hospitals by the end of the year.

title: Injured Athlete Gets $5.3 Million
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11 (UPI)A Federal court jury ordered a helmet manufacturer today to pay $5.3 million to Greg Stead, who was paralyzed from a broken neck he suffered while making a tackle in a high school football game four years ago.

title: F.T.C. Judge Rules Ads for Eggs False; Cites Peril to Heart
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) A Federal Trade Commission judge ruled today that the egg industry had engaged in false, misleading and deceptive advertising by contending that the possibility of having a heart attack is not increased by eating eggs.

title: Stars S. Scouts 3
description: KANSAS CITY (AP)The Minnesota North Stars got only eight shots in the last two periods, but they hit three of them and scored a 53 N.H.L. victory.

title: Rangers Trounce Bruins, 51
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11  The fans of the Boston Bruins made a big event of Phil Esposito's homecoming tonight, but they hardly expected the welcome to go as far as it went.

title: Woman, 73, Found Slain In Her Elmhurst Home
description: A 73yearold woman whom police described as a recluse was found dead yesterday in her Elmhurst, Queens, home. She had been tied hand and foot and, police said, was apparently the victim of strangulation caused by a gag.

title: Richardson Confirmed For 4th Cabinet Post
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The Senate approved today the nomination of Elliot L. Richardson to be Secretary of Commerce, his fourth Cabinet office.

title: ARTHUR COLES SIAS
description: Arthur Coles Sias, president of Arthur C. Sias, a ceramic decaltransfer concern in Wilton, Conn., died Tuesday at Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived on Highway Drive in Wilton.

title: Hawks 122, Braves 99
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 11 (AP)John Drew entered the game in the second period and exploded for 13 points to spark the Atlanta Hawks in a 12299 victory over the slumping Buffalo Braves tonight in an N.B.A. game.

title: 85% of Rise in Population Found in South and West
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The gradual but massive shift of the American population away from the industrialized North and toward the South and West, documented by the 1970 census, has accelerated greatly in the last five years, according to a middecade estimate of state populations released today by the Census Bureau.

title: Reactors and Risks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The cost of producing nuclear power in great amounts is now known to be much higher than early estimates suggested, and substantial debate has arisen about the possible hazards of the reactors that would produce the power.

title: Phil Mahre Triumphs
description: COLLE ISARCO, Italy, Dec. 11 (AP)  United States skiers captured the two first places today in the men's giant slalom of the Freund Cup international ski competition.

title: French Give Mayflower As Musical for 2 Capitals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A French musical based, in theory, on the voyage of the Mayflower set some sort of record for theatrical outoftown tryouts last night: After a loudly ballyhooed onenight stand in Washington, it will open in Paris tomorrow.

title: MRS. SAMUEL A. GIFFORD
description: Hortense M. Gifford, the wife of Samuel A. Gifford, president of the Milton Paper Company, died Wednesday at North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L.I.

title: Spanish Cabinet Is Named; Cautious Reform Expected
description: MADRID, Dec. 11A Cabinet liberal by the standards of Spain, a country that has known 40 years of dictatorship, was appointed tonight.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: The best thing about Dzaley, a new Swiss restaurant at 54 East 58th Street, is the foodwhich is the way things should be in a restaurant, but aren't always. When you wait nearly 40 minutes for your appetizer of oyster Villeroi (three of them for $2.50) beneath hot and crusty mounds of minced mushrooms and then find them worth not only the wait but also the pricethat's good food.

title: Yanks Send Bonds to Angels for Pair And Medich to Pirates for 3 Players
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 11The New York Yankees dropped a couple of blockbusters onto the baseball scene today when they traded Bobby Bonds to the California Angels and Doe Medich to the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Senate Votes Banking Bill; Widest Reform Since' 30's
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The Senate approved today by an overwhelming margin the most sweeping reform bill coyering the nation's banks, savings banks and savings and loan associations in 40 years. The main features of the bill are likely to pass the House and become law some time next year.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 12, 1975

title: People in Sports
description: Duane Bobick has let it be known that he's not interested in the $2,500 bonus that will be voted by the boxing writers for the best fighter on tonight's fivebout card at Madison Square Garden, starting at 8 P.M. Bobick, the former Olympian, who is undefeated in his 32 pro fights, just wants to winand look his bestin the 10rounder against Randy Neumann. Neumann, a former New Jersey state heavyweight, champion, has lost 5 of 36 bouts but has fought tougher opponents than Bobick.

title: Deaths
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 420 P.M. MONDAY. FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 339001 WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES 1914) WHITE PLAINS 9.5300; NASSAU CO. (516) ??00; SUFFOLK CO. (516),6691800; CONNECTICUT (203). 2487767.

title: Warriors 101, Blazers 89
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 11 (AP)The Golden State Warriors pulled away in the second (half, paced by the shooting of Jamaal Wilkes and Charles Dudley, to a 10189 N.B.A. victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight. The Warriors, the league champions remained unbeaten at home through 10 games.

title: Books of The Times
description: I can see advantages and disadvantages in having C. P. Snow write a biography of Anthony Trollope. A public servant himself, Lord Snow understands how important to him was Trollope's career in the post office. He senses, too, a parallel between the bureaucracy in the post office and the politics of the church in The Warden and Barchester Towers. A formal, rather anachronistic sort of man, C. P. Snow finds it easy to empathize with Victorian society and write about it without either prejudice or excessive modern nostalgia.

title: Police Cuts Said to Hamper Diggs Murder Inquiry
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Joseph C. Woodcock Jr., the Bergen County Prosecutor, said today that New York City's budget crisis had prevented its police force from giving the usual assistance in an investigation of the murder of five members of a Teaneck family.

title: Dow Is Off 1.26 in Mixed Market
description: Stock prices turned mixed again yesterday, in moderate trading as investors awaited further developments on such economic matters as tax rates and energy policy.

title: CourtTennis Duos Advance in Tourney
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11William Vogt Jr. and Tom Welsh of Philadelphia defeated Robert W. Millen and Tom Greevy of New York, 78, 87, 86, today and gained the semifinals of the United States open court tennis doubles championship at the Racquet Club.

title: Panel to Explore A Race by Church For the Presidency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) A Presidential campaign committee on behalf of Senator Frank Church, Democrat of Idaho, will be organized and registered tomorrow with his endorsement.

title: ETHYL AND DUPONT TO INCREASE PRICES
description: Both the Ethyl Corporation and E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company said yesterday they would increase the price of lead antiknock compounds effective Jan. 16. Du Pont's increase will average 5.7 percent while Ethyl's will be 4.6 percent. Ethyl said the increases resulted from rising manufacturing costs.

title: About the Giants...
description: John Hicks worked out yesterday for the first time this week and showed that his sprained ankle was much better than expected. Chances are that he'll be ready to start against New Orleans Sunday....George Martin, a rookie, will start at defensive end and Dave Gallagher move inside to tackle, replacing Jim Pietrzak, who originally took John Mendenhall's place....Jack Gregory and Brad Van Pelt returned to practice yesterday. Gregory had been in Jackson, Miss., where his 2yearold son was suffering from a respiratory problem but was able to avoid surgery. Van Pelt had been in Owosso, Mich., where his father remained in intensive care following a heart attack.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: ??1975, by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up 4%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 14.7 billion tonmiles, 4.1 percent above the corresponding week a year ago, which was affected by a coal strike. Carloadings in the same week totaled 452,531 cars, 7.2 percent above last yearalso the biggest percentage increase of the year. The American Trucking Associations Inc. reported intercity truck tonnage was 4.5 percent above last year.

title: Reagan Gallups Past Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11In the last six weeks, former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has leaped ahead of President Ford as the top Presidential choice of Republican voters in a nationwide Gallup poll. This has not surprised Washington, but the margin of his lead has startled the White House.

title: Philadelphia Police Charge 3 With Knight Murder
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 (AP) Three Philadelphia men were charged tonight with the murder of John S. Knight 3d, grandson of the board chairman of the KnightRidder newspaper chain, but the police said they did not know their whereabouts.

title: ANGOLANS RELEASE TWO CBS NEWSMEN
description: CBS said tonight that a correspondent and cameraman detained in Angola on Nov. 22 had been released and were in Lisbon.

title: Turks Seek to Restrain U.N. Force in Northern Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Dec. 11Turkish authorities have severely restricted the operations of United Nations troops in northern Cyprus, even though ago to increase the months the Turks agreed four freedom of those forces.

title: 1976 Social Register Is on Way, At Higher Cost, to Subscribers
description: Society's bible, the Social Register, has, like everything else, been hit by inflation. Subscription rates for the blackandorange compendium of important names in society have risen sharply, as much as 150 percent.

title: Impact of Gulf Report Minimized by Dorsey
description: PITTSBURGH Dec. 11 (UPI)The chairman of the Gulf Oil Corporation said today that the full story of Gulf's $10.3 million political slush fund would not be known until a report on the fund was filed in the United States District Court in Washington.

title: Big Board Rebuffs Merrill On Expansion in Odd Lots
description: The New York Stock Exchange's board of directors rejected yesterday as unnecessary at this time proposals of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith to expand its newly created nosurcharge oddlot business.

title: Tragic Theater of Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham's idea of tragedy Is almost Ibsenlike is its view of timeits sense of the retribution of time past over time future. It is an uncluttered concept that manages to embrace destiny and justice, historic necessity and free will. Her choreography is equally uncluttered, and yet also equally eclectic in its philosophic roots. It is no accident that Peter Brook admires Miss Graham so muchthey are bOth synergistic artists in the theater working specifically with dirruse elements to bring about one very defined view of theatrical reality.

title: Dollar's Value Is Irregular On Most Markets in Europe
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 11 (UPI)The dollar was mixed today on European money markets as activity tapered off ahead of the Christmas holiday.

title: INVESTORS REDEEM CITY'S SECURITIES
description: Hundreds of people  some young but most of them middleaged or elderly, some working and others retired, some healthy and others ailing, some angry and others resigned lined up in the Municipal Building yesterday to collect interest on their investments in city notes, the first securities to be affected by the legislated moratorium.

title: CivilRights Split Over Busing
description: LOUISVILLE  A meeting bere last week to find alternatives to busing came up with nothing new, but it dramatically illustrated the deep split between blacks and some of their former allies in the civil rights movement.

title: The Pop Life
description: Back at the height of the earlymid1960's folk craze, when the movement's impetus had been polished into Simon and Garfunkelisms, the Chad Mitchell Trio was one of the most popular groups in the land.

title: Bus Driver Slain After Aiding Girl In Queens Attack
description: A 53yearold city bus driver was beaten to death in a Queens parking lot last night, according to the police, after he had stopped his car and rescued a 12yearold girl from an attack by two older girls on Union Turnpike near 249th Street.

title: ANDERSON RESISTS CAREY'S TAX PLAN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11Warren M. Anderson, the Senate majority leader, countered Governor Carey's demand for more taxes today by proposing that up to $6.5 billion in state pension funds be offered as loan collateral to meet the pending default of state construction agencies as well as the state's huge credit needs next spring.

title: Grant Said to Be Leaving Times Square Early in '76
description: The insolvent W. T. Grant Company, which four years ago became the major tenant at I Astor Plaza in the Times Square area in one of the largest corporate relocations of the period, will leave the building that carries its name for smaller quarters in Manhattan early next year, reliable sources indicated yesterday.

title: Guild Unit at Washington Post To Reassess Its Stand on Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Members of the Newspaper Guild at The Washington Post will meet next Monday to reassess their decision to continue working during a strike by pressmen, the president of the guild unit said today.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A dispatch from the United Nations in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly identified SouthWest Africa as being among the African countries and regions charged with having Cuban troops stationed on their soil. The seven countries named were Angola, Congo, Equatorial Guinea, Guinea Bissau. Guinea, Tanzania and Somalia,

title: About New York
description: Business lunches are nothing new to New York life, but when Jules Stein merely went out for a sandwich on Tuesday, his lunch turned into a house call.

title: In Memoriam
description: OBERMANMollie. In remembrance or our dearly beloved mother and grandmother.

title: Off St. Peter's, Hushed but Hectic Diplomacy
description: ROME, Dec. 11The Vatican's foreign policy, which has grown Increasingly complex, is shaped amid mirrors, frescoes and layers of gilt in thirdfloor offices of the Secretariat of State, whose great windows look down on St. Peter's Square and a forest of columns.

title: For U.S. and P.L.O. Talks
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  The sooner the United States begins exploratory talks with Palestinians of all views the better it will be for us, for Israel, and for peace in the Middle East. The logic for opening a dialogue with those Palestinians in the Palestine Liberation Organization who are willing to talk with us is compelling:

title: Crude Oil Imports Increase in Week, Big Gain Over '74
description: Crude oil imports into the United States climbed to 4.9 million barrels a day last Week from 4.6 million barrels a day a week earlier, the American Petroleum Institute said yesterday. A year ago at this time the nation imported 3.8million barrels a day of crude oil.

title: Leis Sign Nastase; W.T.T. Sees Profit
description: World Team Tennis, calling itself happy and ready to make a profit, corraled another topranked player yesterday. Ilie Nastase, the recent winner of the Grand Prix Masters tournament in Stockholm, signed with the Hawaii Leis for an undisclosed sixfigure contract.

title: Maple and Martin Combine Winning Ways at Aqueduct
description: Frank Martin likes his Urges to go to the lead early, and that's the way Eddie Maple is riding them at Aqueduct.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A dispatch from the United Nations in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly identified SouthWest Africa as being among the African countries and regions charged with having Cuban troops stationed on their soil. The seven countries named were Angola, Congo, Equatorial Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Guinea, Tanzania and Somalia.

title: SenateHouse Panel Backs Aid for City
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11SenateHouse conferees today approved a $2.3 billion appropriation for seasonal loans for New York, but insisted on periodic Congressional hearings to determine whether the city and state were living up to their fiscal pledges.

title: Convicted Jockey Found Wounded
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 11 (UPI) A top Maryland jockey sentenced to six months in prison and fined $1,000 for his part in a fixed Valentine's Day race at Bowie Race Course was found shot in his Laurel home hoday, the police said.

title: 76ers 110, Suns 106
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 11 (AP)  George McGinnis, saddled with four personal fouls, came back for the last 10 minutes of the game and scored 14 points as the Philadelphia 76ers recorded a 110106 N.B.A. victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: FORD AND SENATORS DISAGREE ON TAX CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  President ord and Congressional leaders failed to reach a compromise today in their battle over whether to attach a spending ceiling, to an extension of this year's tax cuts. Both sides prepared for a veto battle.

title: Angola Reported Getting $50 Million in U.S. Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The United States has sent $25 million in arms and support funds to Angola over the last three months, a highranking Government official said today, and plans to send another $25 million in supplies to counter the largescale military intervention there by the Soviet Union and Cuba.

title: Knicks Loge to Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 11The Cleveland Cavaliers, who had experienced their share of problems during the early stages: of the National Basketball Association season, solved them momentarily tonight by compounding the woes of the New York Knicks with a 10995 triumph at, the Coliseum.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10242 or to these agencies:

title: Garbage Negotiators Approach A Settlement of 11Day Strike
description: A major breakthrough was reported early today in the 11sayold strike of drivers for private carting companies.

title: SAKHAROV URGES SOVIET REFORMS
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Andrei D. Sakharov, barred by Soviet authorities from coming to Norway to receive the Nobel Peace Prize, appealed tonight for an open society with the freedom to, travel and to write.

title: WALLACE IS FACING A SUBSIDY PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama has raised more money than any other Presidential candidate, but he is having trouble proving that it has come in from enough states to entitle him to a Federal campaign subsidy next month.

title: India Beats Japan In Davis Cup Play
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11 (AP)India advanced to the 1976 Eastern Zone Davis Cup tennis quarterfinals today, beating Japan, 32.

title: LOAN GUARANTEES CUT IN ENERGY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A rebellious House of Representatives handed the Democratic leadership and the Administration a defeat tonight by rejectling legislation that would have authorized for the first time Federal, guarantees of loans to build energyproduction facilities.

title: POWER TO PREVENT DOMESTIC THREATS SOUGHT FOR F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The Department of Justice proposed today that the Federal Bureau of Investigation be permitted to obstruct or prevent groups that were plotting to use force or violence that might pose a threat to life or interfere substantially with the essential functioning of government.

title: Resorts Stock Up On Snow
description: Skiarea operators, unhappy over the lack of cooperation the skies have been offering so far this season, were expecting a snowstorm to develop today. Nevertheless, snowmaking machines were in operation last night at at least two dozen resorts. This is the time of year to build up the stockpile, said Orvil Slutzky, head of the Catskills' Hunter Mountain. Our machines have been producing those flakes since yesterday [Wednesday] afternoon and it looks as if they'll be able to run for a 60hour stretch. Wow!

title: Roger Hooker Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The Senat confirmed today President Ford's nomination of Roger W. Hooker to be Assistant Secretary of Transportation. Mr. Hooker, a New York lawyer, will handle Congressional and intergovernmental relations. He was Vice President Rockefeller's administrative assistant for Congressional affairs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Iraqi Offer to Let Jews Return Fails to Stir Much Enthusiasm
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Iraq has invited all Jews who left the country after Israel's independence in 1945 to return with full rights restored. But the offer was scoffed at by Israelis, and American Jewish organizations as a propaganda move.

title: Long Silence Ended By I.R.A. Gunmen Besieged in London
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (UPI)Besieged Irish Republican Army gunmen broke a 36hour silence today and shouted Yes to police offers of fresh water and a new portable toilet. But they refused to talk about the health of their two middleaged hostages and one official suggested the fivedayold siege could last a long time.

title: Hearst Defense Will Be Fear of Death
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11For Patricia Hearst, it will be a simple defenseSomebody put a gun to my head, and I did what they told me, her lawyer said today.

title: AUSTRALIAN VOTE HINGES ON MONEY
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 11Australians, facing their third election in three years On Saturday, are preoccupied with one big issuemoneyaccording: to polls of public opinion.

title: S.E.C. Is Examining Occidental's Funds On Political Bribes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission said today it was investigating the Occidental Petroleum Corporation to determine if the Californiabased company had used corporate funds for illegal political contributions, bribes and kickbacks.

title: RISE CONTINUES IN BOND MARKET
description: The credit markets changed their attitude toward large in creases in the money supply yesterday afternoon, and they accepted a $2.4 billion expansion in the nation's stock of money without becoming excited. Prices of notes and bonds, which had made substantial gains during the day before the latest Federal Reserve figures were published at 4 P.M., continued to rise laterin contrast to recent weeks when increases in the money supply would push bond prices down and decreases would push them up.

title: Oliphant Will Quit Brokerage Business; Cites Recent Losses
description: Jas. H. Oliphant & Company, a publicly held New York Stock Exchange firm, said yesterday it intended to withdraw immediately from the institutional brokerage business.

title: HENRY M. SCHARF, 72, EISENHOWER FRIEND
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Dec. 11 (AP)Henry M. Scharf, president of the Times and News Publishing Company here, died today at his home after a long illness. He was 72 years old.

title: FUNERAL IS HELD FOR HERO FIREMAN
description: Nearly 2,000 firemen, the Mayor and other city officials joined friends and family at a requiem mass in the Bronx for John J. Flanagan, a 32yearold fireman who died following injuries suffered in a suspicious fire.

title: S.E.C. ASKED TO SET RULES ON PAYOFFS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) Church and activitist groups have petitioned the Securities and Exchange Commission to adopt rules to require public disclosure of corporate bribes, political contributions, large sales commissions and other questionable payments.

title: James Waring Memorial
description: A memorial celebration for James Waring, the choreographer who died Dec. 2, will be held Sunday at 4 P.M. at the Judson Memorial Church on Washington Square. The dancers Elizabeth Walton, Ze'eva Cohen, Raymond Johnson and his company, as well as Al Carmines and David Vaughan will be among those participating.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: A couple of years ago Joan Goldman Levine, a children's book author, was approached by a 7yearold named Christine who whispered to her that she'd just found out there was no Santa Claus.

title: A Gift for the Neediest in Honor of the Bicentennial
description: A moonface sprite beaming from notepaper bearing the salutation. Have a Happy Day accompanied a check to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday. The note, from Julius Lampert, of Wantagh, L. I., said:

title: 2 EXECUTIVE POSTS FILLED AT SINGER CO.
description: The 14man board of directors of the Singer Company apparently took no action yesterday with respect to its ?? nancially troubled business machines division. However George R. Cogar, president of the division, was elected ?? corporate vice president of the parent company.

title: . . . and Its Roots
description: While urging greater honesty as to the purposes and the limited potential of the juvenile justice system, the project on Standards also advocates highly desirable procedural reforms: that judges state the reasons for their decisions in writing; that all parties have a right to counsel; that proceedings be more open and that decisions be subject to judicial review.

title: REAGAN TOPS FORD AS GALLUP FINDS A SHARP REVERSAL
description: Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has overtaken President Ford among both Republicans and independents, according to a Gallup poll.

title: Societe Imetal Has Acquired 67% of Copperweld Corp.
description: Socit Imetal, the giant metal and mining complex owned by the Rothschild family If Paris, announced yesterday that it had acquired 67 percent of the Copperweld Corporation of Pittsburgn at the expiration of its tender offer Wednesday. Imetal said that the exact number of shares and 5 percent convertible subordinated debentures purchased would be made known in the next few days. It would appear that on the basis of 2,650,000 Copperweld common shares outstanding, lineal will acquire about 1,775,000 shares. On the basis of the amended tender offer of $40.48 a share, this will mean an expenditure by Imetal of $71.87 million.

title: ESMARK NET GAINS 25.6% IN QUARTER
description: Record revenues and profits were achieved by Esmark Inc. in the final quarter and fiscal year ended Oct. 25 with earnings up 25.6 and 17 percent, respectively, the giant meatpacking company reported yesterday.

title: House Approves Construction Picketing Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The House of Representatives gave its final approval today to legislation that would expand the picketing rights of construction workers, but there were increased indications that President Ford was prepared to veto the measure.

title: Tax Politics
description: In threatening to veto a bill that would extend the tax cut enacted earlier this year, President Ford is again playing politics with a difficult economic issue. In an economy so huge, no one can say with precise certainty what adverse effect an increase in personal and corporate taxes in 1976 of more than $15 billion would have. But there is no doubt that it would be a drag on the economy when the pace of the recovery is already so unsure.

title: Japanese Census Figures
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11 (AP)Japan's population totaled 111,933,818 as of Oct. 1 and has doubled in 55 years, the Prime Minister's office announced today after an official census.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: Rabbit Hunting
description: NORTH NEWPORT, N. H. In November, when the days grow short and the gaunt skeletons of broadleaved trees are stark on the hillsides of the north country, the coat of the snowshoe rabbit, or varying hare, begins to turn from brown to white.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WHOLE SHELL The American Museum of Natural History, Central Park West at 79th Street, hopes to have something for everyone gourmets, shell collectors, art and archeology enthusiasts, naturalists and others  in Mollusks and Mankind, a major show today opening the museum's first new hall since 1971 and reportedly the first such exhibition on the subject in the country. In the new, permanent section, on the first floor off the 77th Street entrance, will be an extensive display covering the many uses, past and present, of mollusks, one of the most advanced groups of invertebrates, and their shells. There will be found mollusks we eat and wear, mollusks as art and religious symbols and mollusks used for money and utensils, with an examination of the animals as living species that are outnumbered only by insects. Shells and shellmotif gifts have also been added to the items for Christmas shoppers in the enlarged museum shop near the mollusk exhibition.

title: Suspect in Hoffa Case Jailed for Contempt of Court
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11Stephen Andretta, a New Jersey teamster, was handcuffed and led, away to jail today for contempt, of court after he refused to tell a Federal grand jury here where he was on July 30, the day James R. Hoffa disappeared.

title: Senate Approves a Budget With $374.9 Billion Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The Senate approved today a budget measure imposing a $374.9 billion spending ceiling on Congress for the fiscal year Lending June 30, leaving a $74.1 billion deficit. The vote was 74 to 19 on the measure, which still faces consideration by the House of Representatives.

title: Title Is Tackled
description: WESTBROOK, Conn., Dec. 11  Morgan High School of Clinton has won a battle but lost a war.

title: The Program
description: CITY PASTURE, a series of six short. films: City Pasture, by Rudy Burckhardt; Evidence, by Alfred Guzzetti; Playgrounds, by Allen Moore; Trio, by Laszlo Papp and Istvan Ventilla; Yaknetuma, by Jacob Burckhardt; Postcards, by Andrew Lugg. Running time: 89 minutes. At the Film Forum, 15 Vandam Street.

title: REAGAN TOPS FORD AS GALLUP FINDS A SHARP REVERSAL
description: Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has overtaken President Ford among both Republicans and independents, according to a Gallup poll.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The state announced yesterday that the maximum weekly unemployment benefit check was increasing from $90 to $96, effective Jan. 1. The same sixdollar increase and new rate will become effective for maximum weekly payments for temporary disability, the Department of Labor and Industry said. The new weekly maximum compensation rate for temporary total disability, permanent total disability and in cases of a worker's jobrelated death is $128, a $9 increase, it said.

title: Unveilings
description: EBINS. Deborah Ebin. Unveiling on Sunday, December 14, at 12 noon, at Mt. Judah Cemetery, Queens, Block 22, Sertion 2. In case or rain the following Sunday.

title: Oman Announces End Of the War in Dhofar
description: MUSCAT, Oman, Dec. 11 (Reuters)The end of the war in Oman was announced today.

title: Moynihan Attacks Colonialism Report Of U.N. Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11Daniel P. Moynihan, the chief American delegate, here, charged tonight in the General Assembly that the Assembly was becoming a theater of the absurd and attacked its adoption of reports riddled with untruths.

title: CITY U. PRODDED ON BUDGET CUTS
description: Mayor Beame, in what was characterized by his office as an ultimatum, directed the Board of Higher Education yesterday to prepare and present to me for the Emergency Financial Control Board no later than a week from today a plan for reducing City University expenses.

title: The Many Voices of Israeli Policy
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 11If the policy pronouncements from Jerusalem in the last week have seemed confusing and contradictory, there is good reason. Rarely in recent memory have

title: Economic Woes and Draught Peril Tanzania's Gains
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania Tanzania's path to development has been closely watched by many African nations as a possible model to be followed, admired by many in the West and strongly underwritten by aid donors in the Communist and nonCommunist blocs. Now it is imperiled.

title: 2 Arrested Here In Killing of Brother Of City Councilman
description: Two Brooklyn men were ar rested yesterday and charged with the slaying last months of a younger brother of City Councilman Samuel D. Wright.

title: Plush Beirut Hotel Is Victim of Strife
description: The St. Georges Hotel in Beirut, which was heavily damaged by fire Wednesday in fighting between Christian and Moslem factions, was one of the most distinguished hotels in the Middle East.

title: Fisher Hall Eliminating Its Pipe Organ
description: Thee customdesigned pipe organ installed in Lincoln Center's Avery Fisher Hall in 1962 and in use since then will be removed as part of the plan to improve the hall's acoustics. Instead of a pipe organ, the rebuilt hall will have an electronic imitation the design and make of which are yet to be determined. Fisher Hall, formerly Philharmonic Hall, will be closed May 15 through Oct. 15 next year for the rebuilding. The cost will exceed $3 million.

title: NBC Study Finds No Tie Of Drug Ads to Illicit Use
description: A threeyear study of teenage boys by the National Broadcasting Company has concluded that there is no correlation between their exposure to advertising of proprietary drug products on television and their use of illicit drugs.

title: The Opera: Ruddigore
description: Ruddigore may not be the most satisfying of the Gilbert and Sullivan works, but its full complement of eccentric characters gives it a fine theatrical vitality. It has some gracious tunes, particularly a sweetly silly ballad about the little flower who loved a great oak tree; a lively hornpipe; a tonguetwisting patter trio; a sardonic song by two reformed villains. But its strength lies in the strange behavior and talk of its people. Where else but in Gilbert and Sullivan can one find such lines as I once made an affidavitbut it died or They sing choruses in public. That's mad enough, I think!

title: On National Planning
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Calls for national planningthe coordinated effort to anticipate and forestall national problemsare once again abroad in the land.

title: TESSIE ANKER
description: Tessie Anker, mother of Irving Anker, chancellor of the city's public schools, and of Harold Anker, administrative manager of the Board of Education's. Bureau of Child Guidance, died Wednesday evening in the Jewish Institute for Geriatric Care of the Long Island Jewish Hospital in New Hyde Park, L.I. She was 87 years old.

title: U.S. SEES THREATS IN OFFSHORE RIGS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)Offshore and gas production alone the central United States East Coast will damage some coastal areas and pose a threat of ocean poli??on from oil spills, the Interior Department said today.

title: Off St. Peter's, Hushed but Hectic Diplomacy
description: ROME, Dec. 11The Vatican's foreign policy, which has grown increasingly complex, is shaped amid mirrors, frescoes and Jayers of gilt in thirdfloor offices, of the Secretariat of Slate, whose great, windows look down on St. Peter's Square and a forest of columns.

title: Engineers Strike Staten Island Trains For Raise Given National Rail Unions
description: The Staten Island Rapid Transit system was halted at 12:01 A.M. yesterday by a strike of 28 members of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers in a dispute over whether national railroad wage increases should be applied to the 14.5mile electric commuter line.

title: Keiser Memorial Tuesday
description: A memorial tribute to David M. Keiser, chairman of the board of trustees of the Juilliard School, who died Nov. 26. will he held in the Juilliard Theater on Tuesday at 5 P.M. Taking part will be Peter Mennin, president of Juilliard; Pierre Boulez, music director of the New York Philharmonic, of which Mr. Keiser was honorary chairman, and the Juilliard String Quartet.

title: BYRNE READS STUDY ON THE CARTER CASE
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11 (AP)Governor Byrne said today he had read a special report that would help shape his decision in the case of Rubin Hurricane Carter, the former boxer.

title: Film: The Oddments of City Pasture
description: Rudy Burckhardt films New York as a man might pick up shells and sea drift on the beach: Some bits because they're pretty or odd some because they may come in handy and some because he happens to be stooped over anyway.

title: Nuggets 111, Squires 100
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 11 (AP) Bobby Jones stole the ball and scored on a stuff shot to give Denver a 7978 lead with 11:12 remaining and the firstplace Nuggets went on to a 111100 victory over Virginia tonight

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 9yearold Union City, N. J. girl, Jacqueline Guirado, was kidnapped and held for about 13 hours yesterday before her abductors released her unharmed after a ransom believed to be $50,000 was paid. The girl was apparently forced into a car as she walked from her home to school at 8:30 A.M. She was freed shortly after 9 P.M. at 44th Street and Park Avenue in Union City, after her father, Virgilo, a furniture store owner, paid the ransom. Her abductors were being sought late last night.

title: Governor's Aides Move To Bar Yonkers Default
description: ALBANY. Dec. 11Aides to Governor Carey joined with local officials today to try to rescue Yonkers and a small school district in Orange County from default tomorrow and prevent eventual default in several other school districts that Mr. Carey said had been unable to borrow because of contamination from the state's fiscal problems.

title: JULIA A, DUSHKIN
description: Julia Aronson Dushkin, long prominent in Jewish philanthropic affairs here and in Israel, died Wednesday at her home in Jerusalem, Israel. She was 80 years old.

title: Legal Assistance Program Challenged in A.C.L.U. Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) The American Civil Liberties Union filed in United States District Court today the first challenge to the latest legal assistance program for the poor.

title: Hearst Defense Will Be Fear of Death
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 11For Patricia Hearst, it will be a simple defenseSomebody put a gun to my head, and I did what they told me, her lawyer said today.

title: The Party's Real Stars Were Yesterday's Women of Style
description: Are there enough dresses? Will people understand why these women were chosen? Will they know what they are looking at?

title: Air, Water and Jobs
description: Russell W. Peterson, chairman of the Council on Environmental Quality, has pointed out on several occasions (as have we) that pollutioncontrol measures generate jobs. In repeating this truthnow a truisma few days ago for the benefit of some manufacturers of environmental equipment, he added something new by citing two Wall Street analysts to the effect that environmental controlrelated employment has been one of the relatively few areas of job strength during the recent recession.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Beirut Orders 15th CeaseFire Amid Gunfire and Explosions
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Friday, Dec. 12To the sound of machinegun fire and explosions, Beirut's 15th ceasefire in two months was declared shortly, before midnight last night.

title: Swiss Wins Cup Slalom For Women
description: APRICA, Italy, Dec. 11 (AP) Use Marie Morerod of Switzerland won a women's World Cup special ski slalom today and moved into first place in the overall standing.

title: Terrorists Release 2 Elderly Hostages Aboard Dutch Train
description: AMSTERDAM, Dec. 11Terrorists holding a train near the Dutch town of Bellen released two elderly hostages today after talks aboard the train with four mediators. This left at least 27 prisoners on the train, which was hijacked nine days ago.

title: Nets Top Pacers in Overtime
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 11 (AP)Brian Taylor hit a winning jump shot with 1 second left in the overtime period to give the New York Nets a 124123 victory over the Indiana Pacers in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Levantine Dangers
description: The tragedy that is Lebanon is taking an ominous new turn. A power struggle among Palestinian refugees encamped in Lebanon appears to be emerging as a critical driving element in an anarchic conflict between the country's Christian and Moslem sects.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
LEE WILEY DEAD JAZZ SINGER, 60
description: Lee Wiley, whose gently husky voice and sensuous phrasing made her one of the outstanding jazz singers of the 1930's and 40's, died yesterday of cancer at SloanKettering Memorial Hospital. She was 60 years old. Her last public performance was at the Newport Jazz Festival in July 1972.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Thursday, December 11, 1975

title: Juvenile Crime . . .
description: The recent recommendations of the national Commission on Juvenile Justice Standards and Governor Carey's outline of his juvenile justice proposalssimilar in important respectsreflect the growing public anxiety about increased crime among youth. F.B.I. figures show that in 1974 the arrests of youngsters between the ages of 10 and 17 accounted for almost half of all arrests for violent crimes.

title: Baseball Meetings End With Problems Unsettled
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 11Leaving unresolved their two big franchise problems in San Francisco and Seattle, baseball's major league club owners adjourned their annual winter meetings today with business turmoil virtually assured for 1976.

title: ANDERSON RESISTS CAREY'S TAX PLAN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11Warren M. Anderson, the Senate majority leader, countered Governor Carey's demand for more taxes today by proposing that up to $6.5 billion in state pension funds be offered as loan collateral to meet the pending default of state construction agencies as well as the state's huge credit needs next spring.

title: Indiana Tops Notre Dame Five, 6360
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 11Shortly after the Indiana basketball team had barely held on to beat Notre Dame, 6360, tonight, Coach Bobby Knight said, The game was kind of struggle for both teams and we Sort of outstruggled em.

title: Market Place
description: Last March the General Cable Corporation, mindful of a buyout trend and fearful that the company might become a target, took steps to make such an attempt difficult to carry out.

title: PRICES OF STOCKS MIXED ON AMEX
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday while those in the overthecounter market declined.

title: HOOT TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10242 or to these agencies:

title: STEVENS IS BACKED BY A SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11With a quick show of hands and no debate, the Senate Judiciary Committee unanimously confirmed today the nomination of Judge John Paul Stevens to the Supreme Court.

title: Dump to Be Searched
description: NEWARK, Dec. 11Federal agents are hoping to find the body of Armand Faugno in a Jersey City dump within the next 10 days, believing that the solution of his murder might provide the key to unlock the mystery of James R. Hoffa's disappearance.

title: Display of 19thCentury Drawings Fills Gap at Morgan
description: People just love the Pierpont Morgan Library. That they should feel so strongly has nothing to do with old Mr. Morgan. It has nothing to do with the location of the library, Madison Avenue and 36th Street, which is somewhat apart from the city's main centers of exalted enjoyment. It has nothing to do with aggressive public relations, since the library does not go in for that kind of thing. It is a matter of tone, scale and ambition. People feel that the Morgan Library is run by one or two human beings for one or two other human beings, and that when they themeslves cross the threshold they are the one or two people in question.

title: Panel Charges State Lags On Willowbrook Reforms
description: A courtdesignated panel accused the state yesterday of not providing adequate staffing or sufficient medical services, and of not carrying out other courtordered reforms, at the Willowbrook Developmental Center for the retarded on Staten Island.

title: Senate Votes Banking Bill; Widest Reform Since '30's,
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The Senate approved today by an overwhelming margin the most sweeping reform bill covering the nation's banks, savings banks and savings and loan associations in 40 years. The main features of the bill are likely to pass the House and become law some time next year.

title: 3 Major Candidates in '76 File For New Hampshire's Primary;
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 11 (AP) Campaign workers for three major Presidential hopefulstwo Democrats and a Republicansubmitted candidate petitions today as filing officially opened for New Hampshire's primary next Feb. 24, the nation's first.

title: Al Brosch, the First Golfer To Shoot 60 on P.G.A. Tour
description: MINEOLA, LI., Dec. 11 (AP) Al (Red) Brosch, the first man ever to shoot a 60 on the Professional Golfers Association tour, died yesterday at Nassau Hospital of cancer. He was 64 years old and lived in Garden City. L.I.

title: Deputies in Ford's White House Have Power and Good Prospects
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11If the White House were a television series, there would surely be a spinoff called The Deputies.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP) Money rates for Thursday.

title: Total Less Than 3d of Predicted Realization
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11In the first offshore lease sale of the Ford Administration's accelerated program to find new domestic oil reserves, the oil industry offered $438.2 million today for rights to hunt for petroleum deep off the southern California coast.

title: JOSEPH BARKER, 84, DEAN AT COLUMBIA
description: Joseph Warren Barker, dean of engineering at Columbia University from 1930 to 1946, died Wednesday at New Rochelle (N.Y.) Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived in New Rochelle.

title: Court Extends Stay Of Ban on Dumping By Outof Staters
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The State Supreme Court today extended until Dec. 31 a stay of its order banning outofstate garbage dumping in New Jersey.

title: CONTROL OF CITY U. BY STATE IS URGED IN REGENTS' PLAN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 11The State Board of Regents, declaring that the city could no longer afford to finance the City University, called on the state today to assume full responsibility for financing it in exchange for assuming a majority voice on an expanded Board of Higher Education.

title: 2 N.F.L. Games Slated Tomorrow
description: Three big games and a lot of little ones make up the weekend pro football schedule. The big ones among playoff contenders will be seen here on television beginning tomorrow with Cincinnati at Pittsburgh, Channel 4, 12:30 P.M., and Washington at Dallas, Channel 2, 3:30 P.M: On Sunday it is Miami at Baltimore, Channel 4, 2 P.M., with a fourth game being Minnesota at Detroit, Channel 2, 4 P.M. Both New York teams are favored for a change, the Giants against New Orleans at Shea Stadium on Sunday without local television, and the Jets over the Chargers in San Diego on Monday night, Channel 7, 9 P.M. A preview of all games follows with wonlost records in parentheses.

title: 85% of Rise in Population Found in South and West
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 The gradual but massive shift of the American nopulation away from the industrialized North and toward the South and West, documented by the 1970 census, has accelerated greatly in the last five years, according to a middecade estimate of state populations released today by the Census Bureau.

title: Rutgers and Manhattan Beat Two of Philadelphia Big Five
description: Undefeated Rutgers went on a scoring rampage in the final 10 minutes in posting a 9580 college basketball victory over Pennsylvania last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Bullets 117, Jazz 109
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 11

title: Cotton Futures Prices Rise As Crop Estimates Shrink
description: The lowerthanexpected cotton crop estimate issued Wedpesday by, the Government influenced sharply higher cotton futures prices yesterday. On the New York Cotton Exchange the March delivery jumped the 2centapound limit during the session and then fell back to close at 59.60 cents a pound, up from 58 cents the previous day.

title: Rhodesia Names a Member Of Cabinet as President
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  Deputy Prime Minister John Wrathall, a Britishborn former Rhodesian income tax official, has been named as the country's second President, to succeed Clifford Dupont.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.3 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 189.9 from 189.6 last week.

title: Societe Imetal Has Acquired 67% of Copperweld Corp.
description: Socit Imetal, the giant metal and mining complex owned by the Rothschild family of Paris, announced yesterday that it had acquired 67 percent al the Copperweld Corporation of Pittsburgh at the expiration of its tender offer Wednesday. Imetal said that the exact number of shares and 5 percent convertible subordinated debentures Purchased would be made known in the next few days. It would appear that on the basis of 2,650,000 Copperweld common shares outstanding, Imetal will acquire about 1,775,000 shares. On the basis Of the amended tender offer of $40.48 a share, this will mean an expenditure by Imetal of $71.87 million.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, Dec. 11, 1975

title: Two Confess Tax Evasion
description: Two former stockbrokers pleaded guilty yesterday in Federal District Court here to conspiracy to evade taxes on more than $4 million in personal and corporate income. The two defendants, who had previously been convicted of stock fraud, are Bernard Deutsch of 163 Whitman Drive, Brooklyn, and Stanley Duboff of 123 West Lake Shore Drive, Rockaway, N. J. They could each face up to five years in prison for conspiracy and additional penalties for other tax violations.

title: JUDGE ORDERS HOME EXILED PERON AIDE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 11A federal judge today ordered that Jos Lpez Rega, the former strongman behind President Isabel Martinez de Pern, testify on charges of corruption in the administration.

title: W. T. Grant Said to Be Leaving Times Square Site Early in '76
description: The insolvent W. T. Grant Company, which four years ago became the major tenant at 1 Astor Plaza in the Times Square area in one of the largest corporate relocations of the period, will leave the building next year, reliable sources indicated yesterday.

title: STATE CRITICIZES ARTIFICIAL FOODS
description: The State Agricultural Department sought a permanent injunction in State Supreme Court in Albany yesterday to bar what it described as artificially made food products from posing as equal to natural products like eggs, bacon, ham and potato chips.

title: Jersey's Supreme Court Finds Rent Controls Constitutional
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11The New Jersey Supreme Court unanimously affirmed in three separate opinions today the constitutionality of rentcontrol ordinances in four towns, and also protected tenants from absorbing all increased costs sustained by landlords.

title: Keeping Promises, 10 Votes to 2
description: Fans traditionally keep an eye on baseball's annual winter convention, says a handout from the commissioner's office, because they know it is likely to whet the hot stove league fires with trades which kindle the hopes for a new season. Biggest thing to come out of the current conclave is that metaphor. It belongs in the Hall of Fame.

title: MRS. SAUL BIRNS
description: Sarah Firstenberg Birns, mother of Justice Harold Birns of the State Supreme Court, died Wednesday at St. Vincent's Hospital. She was 88 years old and lived at 20 Fifth Avenue.

title: Blacks and Whites In Rhodesia Begin Parley on Monday
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and the nationalist leader Joshua Nkomo agreed today to seek a Rhodesian settlement in constitutional talks beginning here Monday.

title: Governors Said to Favor Leone for Port Agency Job
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11Governor Byrne and Governor Carey were reported tonight to have agreed upon Richard C. Leone, New Jersey State Treasurer, to become executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: London Siege Ends
description: Four gunmen described as Irish Republican Army terrorists surendered to the police in London after a sixday siege in a secondfloor apartment living room. The couple living there, who had been held as hostages, were unharmed. Page 3.

title: OTB Slump: Surcharge Is Blamed
description: Despite more shops, the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation is handling less business now than it did during the last two fiscal years. Paul R. Screvane, president of OTB, conceded yesterday that the slump would mean a decline in parimutuel tax revenue for the city.

title: Congress Succeeding In Curbs on Spending
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12To the surprise of some of its own members, Congress in less than a year's time has taken the first cautious but so far successful steps toward gaining control of the Federal Government's nurse strings.

title: Alaska Native Deal
description: In the largest acquisition ever made by an Alaska native corporation, the Peter Pan Seafoods Company of Seattle has been bought for more than $8 million. Page 38.

title: U.S. ARMSCUT IDEA IS BACKED BY NATO
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 12The North Atlantic alliance today adopted a United States proposal to withdraw 1,000 American tactical nuclear weapons from Western Europe in return for the retirement from Central Europe of a Soviet army of about 1,700 tanks and 65,000 men.

title: Ford Said to Be Undisturbed by Poll Data
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12President Ford is undisturbed by the new Gallup. Poll that shows him trailing former Gov. Ronald Reagan and remains confident he will win the Republican nomination and the Presidential election next year, White House aides said today.

title: Hijackers of Dutch Train Release Another Hostage
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Dec. 12 (Reuters)Six East Asian terrorists who have been holding a train in the northern Netherlands for 10 days released one of their 27 hostages today, a Government spokesman said.

title: Court Forbids All Talk About Helstoski Inquiry
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12 (AP)After months of public bickering over a grand jury investigation, Representative Henry Helstoski, Democrat of, Bergen County, and Federal prosecutors were ordered by a Federal judge today to stop talking about the case.

title: Electorate in British Columbia Restores Rule by Conservatives
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Dec. 12Voters in this essentially conservative Canadian province have restored the conservative Social Credit Party to power with a commanding margin, ending more than three years of Socialist rule.

title: ALLAN J. M'INTOSH
description: Allan J. McIntosh, Who retired some years ago as a limited partner in Fahnestock and Company, member of the New York and other stock exchanges, died Thursday in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 75 years old and lived in Palm Beach and had formerly lived here.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: Portland, MeLarry Butler, 147 pounds, Portland, Me., knocked nut Walter Riley, 147, New York City, 9 rounds.

title: Bridge
description: There are two unusual features about the Greater New York Bridge Association's Swiss teams being played today and tomorrow.

title: STEWART SCHACKNE, PUBLICIST FOR EXXON
description: Stewart Schackne, who retired in 1964 as director of public relations for the Exxon Corporation, died yesterday in LakeConn., where he lived. He was 70 years old.

title: A New Aggrieved Minority: Police
description: Two Nassau County police officers, Donald Kain and John Cleary, went out to dinner last Monday evening at Truman's Restaurant in Roslyn, L.I., and made a startling discovery. Their attire, in the restaurant owner's judgment, was all wrong.

title: HONDA INCREASING 1976 AUTO PRICES
description: The Honda Motor Company of Tokyo announced yesterday that its United States subsidiary, the American Honda Motor Company, had raised suggested retail prices of passenger cars by an average of 3 percent on 1976 model vehicles. The price increase was prompted by an improvement in the new models' drivabillty, the company said. The price of the 1,500cubiccentimeter, twodoor Civic passenger model is. $2,979, up from $2,879, according to the announcement.

title: Card Of Thanks
description: FORT  PHILLIPS. To the students and friends of Syvilla Fort Phillips. The family of Syvilla Fort Phillpis will hold in gratefull remembrance your love, spirituality, bouquets and kind expressions of sympathy.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Court Criticizes D.A.
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 12 (UPI)Justice Joseph Mattina of State Supreme Court today denied a request to prevent enforcement of the state's Sunday blue laws, but he criticized District Attorney Edward Cosgrove of Erie County for his methods of enforcement. The judge said he personally felt the blue laws were arbitrary and unreasonable, but that it was for the Legislature, not the courts, to change them.

title: AGENT TELLS FATE OF OSWALD NOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) An agent who investigated the assassination of President Kennedy testified today that he flushed down the drain a note that Lee Harvey Oswald had delivered to the Dallas office of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: . . . Practical Imperatives
description: The current fiscal crisis does not stop with the endangered state agencies, however. As banker Ellmore C. Patterson warned in Albany the other day, the credit standings of the state, its agencies and all its local subdivisions are inextricably intertwined. If one falls, all could fall. Saving the agencies from default, therefore, has become not only a moral obligation but a practical imperative.

title: Dollar Surges on Most Markets Abroad as Price of Gold Slips
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 12 (UPI}The dollar hit a 10week high on some Continental money markets today, while the price of gold fell. The Dollar's advance resulted in a record closing low for the British pound.

title: A Referendum on Abortion Sanctioned by Italian Court
description: ROME, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Italy's constitutional court gave its approval today for a referendum on legalizing abortion.

title: A GAC UNIT FILES FOR BANKRUPTCY
description: GAC Properties Credit Inc., a subsidiary of the GAC Corporation, filed yesterday a petition under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act in the United States District Court in Miami.

title: FAIR TRADE LAWS COMING TO AN END
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Legislation repealing the socalled fair trade laws, which for nearly 40 years have permitted pricefixing on many consumer products, was signed today by President Ford.

title: Frontier Is Narrowing For Brookhaven Town
description: PATCHOGUE, L.I.It is a frontier. It has farm (midi and forests, rivers and ponds and saltwater harborseven a steep ridge where a settler can feel like Daniel Boone crossing the Cumberland Gap.

title: BASIL B. ROWE
description: Basil B. Rowe, former cable editor of. The New York Herald Tribune, died yesterday at the Albany Medical Center. He was 72 years old and lived in East Chatham, N.Y.

title: Market Place
description: Many investors who have f?? the securities markets in search of havens in these troubled times have placed substantial sums in savings accounts, secure in the belief that their capital will be protected even if the bank fails.

title: Soviet Sentences Dissident To 7 Years in Labor Camp
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 12A close colleague of Andrei D. Sakharov in the Soviet human rights movement was sentenced today to seven years in a labor camp, to be followed by three years in exile, on charges of antiSoviet activity.

title: Extra Buses Serve Commuters on S.I. In Transit Strike
description: Staten Island commuters relied on buses yesterday as the strike over wages by 28 members of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers entered its second day.

title: Art: A Pennsylvania Landmark
description: No art school that once had Thomas Eakins as its director can be anything but proud of itself, and the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts takes rank for that and other reasons as one of the prime ornaments of Philadelphia. As for the present building (by Frank Furness and George W. Hewitt, completed 100 years ago next year), it's terrific.

title: MAN CITED IN RAPE IN BROOKLYN HEIGHTS
description: An alleged rapist was arrested by a police stakeout squad last night as he looked into the lobby doorway of a Brooklyn Heights apartment where, since Oct. 9, two women had been raped, the police reported.

title: Klammer Wins Downhill Claims He's Unbeatable
description: MADONNA DI CAMPIGLIO, Italy, Dec. 12 (UPI)Franz Klammer, atoning for his fall last week at Val d'Isre, won the second men's World Cup downhill race by almost a second today and then predicted no one would beat him in another downhill event this Olympic season.

title: Rezoning for S.I. High Schools Is Argued at Hearing by Board
description: The question of whether the present zoning for high schools on Staten Island should be maintained was argued at a preliminary hearing yesterday.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Boats & Accessories 3800

title: 11 ESTATE THEFTS LAID TO A LAWYER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 12District Attorney Carl A. Vergari said today that a Tuckahoe lawyer, who has admitted stealing more than $220,000 from the estate of his priest, was similarly involved in 10 other estates.

title: News Summary and Index.
description: SATURDAY, DECEMBER 13, 1975

title: Miss Moore Calls on Court To Accept Her Guilty Plea
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12I did indeed willfully and knowingly attempt to murder Gerald R. Ford, the President of the United States, by use of a handgun and would now like to enter a plea of guilty, Sara Jane Moore declared in Federal court today.

title: 2D SUIT FILED HERE ON PLAN FOR NOTES
description: A professor of constitutional law in Wilmington, Del., filed a lawsuit here yesterday in United States District Court, challenging the constitutionality of the stateimposed momtorium on maturing New York City notes.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Appellate Division of Superior Court ruled that a Woman has no legal recourse against a Man who backs out of a marriage proposal.
