The ruling came in the case of Elayne Wigler of Essex County, who filed suit against Gordon Miles, whom she believed was a single man when he asked her to marry him.

title: G.O.P., IN REVERSAL, AGREES TO DISCUSS TAXES WITH CAREY
description: The Republican leaders of the State Legislature, in the first sign of movement away from their public position that tax increases are not a subject for negotiaton, agreed yesterday to discuss the issue with representatives of the Governor's office and the legislative Democrats.

title: CAROLINA OFFICIALS SEEK JOAN LITTLE
description: WASHINGTON, N. C., Dec. 12 (UPI)  The Beaufort County authorities today issued an allpoints bulletin for Joan Little and suggested that Miss Little's failure to appear and sign for a bond was a publicity ploy.

title: Union City Girl, 9, Is Safe and Ransom Is Found as 4 Are Held in Kidnapping
description: UNION CITY, Dec. 12Four persons, including a juvenile, were arrested and charged with kidnapping here today after a 9yearold girl who had been seized on her way to school yesterday morning was released unharmed near her home last night after the payment of a $40,000 ransom.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: Stage: Horse Dreamer
description: Sam Shepard's Geography of a Horse Dreamer, which was first staged in 1974 at the Yale Repertory Theater, is now playing at the Manhattan Theater Club. The production is entirely different, but the point of the play is basically the same. The theme is the corruption of innocence by civilization, the perversion of an American dream.

title: Budget Hearing Broadcasts
description: WNYCTV (Channel 31) and WNYCAM radio will broadcast live next week the capital budget before the City Planning Commission. The public hearings are scheduled Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday beginning at 10 A.M. in the auitorium of Police Headquarters in Manhattan.

title: Zionism Examined
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Three confusions hive been present in the debate over the United Nations General Assembly resolution equating Zionism and racism. One is the confusion between Zionism and the religion of Judaism; the second, confusion between Zionism and Israel; the third, confusion between Zionisin and Jews.

title: As Hot Dog Battle Rages: A Close Look at the Meat That's Caught in the Middle
description: Both hot dogs and bargains are dear to the hearts of true New Yorkers. Small wonder then, that when the two are combined in a hot dog price war, crowds begin to gather.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Union City Girl, 9, Is Safe and Ransom Is Found as Are Held in Kidnapping
description: UNION CITY, Dec. 12Four persons, including a juvenile, were arrested and charged with kidnapping here today after a 9yearold girl who had been seized on her way to school yesterday morning was released unharmed near her home last night after the payment of a $40,000 ransom.

title: SCHOOL BOYCOTTED IN SOUTH BOSTON
description: BOSTON, Dec. 12  South Boston High School was struck by a near total white boycott today protesting Federal District Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr.'s order placing the school under court receivership and transferring the headmaster.

title: POLICE IN NEWARK GET LAYOFF NOTICE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12Dismissal notices were reported in today's mail to 226 policemen and 150 firemen all of whom are to be laid off in an effort to keep the city's property tax rate from rising above $9.94 per $100 of assessed evaluation, the highest in the state.

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Friday, December 12, 1975

title: Neediest Cases Fund Drive Passes the $400,000 Mark
description: The 64th annual appeal of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund passed the $400,000 mark yesterday with the receipt of $6,203 from 100 contributors. The overall figure for the campaign, which ended its first week, now stands at $401.090.02.

title: For Woman Mayor, It's Another First
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.Almost 20 years ago Janet Gray Hayes, the housewife, fought ari unsuccessful civic battle to have a school crossing guard assigned to a corner near her home here.

title: 11 ESTATE THEFTS LAID TO A LAWYER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 12District Attorney Carl A. Vergari said today that a Tuckahoe lawyer, who has admitted stealing more than $220,000 from the, estate of his priest, was similarly involved in 10 other estates.

title: Cepeda Charged in Drug Case
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 12 (AP)Orlando Cepeda, the former major league baseball player, was taken in handcuffs to the Federal Court building in old San Juan today, the police said, after he was arrested on a drug charge.

title: Suspect Gives Up, 2d Is Found Killed In Knight Slaying
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12 (UPI) A suspect in the knife slaying of John S. Knight 3d, of the newspaper family, was found shot to death today and another surrendered to the police.

title: U.S. Investigating Exchanges of Cash
description: Federal investigators are looking into the exchange of hundreds of thousands of dollars in small bills for large bills at branches of the Chemical Bank of New York in Harlem and the Bronx to determine whetner violations of Federal law occurred.

title: Lori Leonidoff Wed to Robert L. Angelo
description: Lori June Leonidoff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leon Leonidoff of New York and North Palm Beach, Fla., was married yesterday in Hamden, Conn., to Robert Lewis Angelo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Angelo of Hamden. The Rev. John Cotter performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Ascension.

title: LISBON MILITARY MOVES TO GET OUT OF PARTY POLITICS
description: LISBON, Dec. 12Portugal's ruling military council announced a major reorganization of the armed forces today with emphasis on military discipline and the exclusion of soldiers from party politics.

title: Dart Settles Land Suits
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (UPI)  Dart Industries Inc. has agreed to settle for $2 million two class action suits alleging unfair sales practices at two of its land development projects. The settlement includes $485,000 in legal costs. The projects are Valley Springs near Tehachapi. Calif., and Valley Hi, near Victorville, Calif.

title: Concert
description: Rapture was in the air Thursday night as the Guarneri String Quartet and Friends opened a fiveconcert, longsincesoldout series at Alice Tully Hall. So much rapture, in factchambermusic audiences are the most audibly selfcongratulatory in musicthat one fears for one's life if one wishes to raise objections.

title: Britain Reported to Plan $400 Million Chrysler Aid
description: LONDON, Dec. 12The British Government has apparently decided to spend almost $400 million in the next four years to assure the continued operation of the Chrysler Corporation's British factories.

title: Harrises Rebuffed in Fight On Courtroom Precautions
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (AP) A judge refused today to move the trial of William and Emily Harris from a highsecurity courtroom.

title: BUSINESS RECORDS
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Music to Jets' Hosts: The Click of Turnstiles
description: The Jets left yesterday for San Diego, and that made the Chargers very happy. In fact, most teams smile a bit more when they know the New Yorkers are coming to town.

title: Magicians Term Israeli Psychie a Fraud
description: Magicians, long irked by Uri Geller's alleged ability to bend spoons repair watches and read minds through paranormal powers, have taken off their white gloves and branded the Israeli psychic an outright fraud who uses conventional magician's tricks to mislead the public.

title: GEORGE D. PRATT JR.
description: George D. Pratt Jr., a retired Connecticut farmer and former member of that state's boards of education and milk control, died of cancer Thursday at his home in Bridgewater, Conn. He was 77 years old.

title: 12 Perish in Fire In San Francisco; Arson Clue Hinted
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (AP)A fire that was apparently set while residents of a fivestory apartment building slept killed at least 12 persons and injured several others today, the authorities said.

title: KISSINGER HINTING AT ANGOLA ACTION
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 12Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that the United States would try to prevent one party from dominating Angola through heavy shipments of arms if the proposed American solution a settlement negotiated exclusively by Angolans  should fail.

title: Congress Succeeding In Curbs on Spending
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12To the surprise of some of its own Members, Congress in less than a year's time has taken the first cautious but so far successful steps toward gaining control of the Federal Government's purse strings.

title: JULIAN V. WERA
description: ROCHESTER, Minn., Dec. 12 (AP)Julian V. Wera, a former member of the New York Yankees, died today at his home of a heart attack. He was 73 years old.

title: Unresolved Problems of Housing the Poor
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12Successfully housing the nation's poor has proved to be elusive for the Federal Government, and the failure raises the question of why s it so difficult, Unfortunately, there is no quick oracular answer. When the question is posed to Federal housing officials, private housing consultants, private lenders and Congressional aides involved in housing legislation, a flood of reasons is givenalternately simple, complex, conflicting, convincing, selfserving, philosophical and political.

title: The Cast
description: GEOGRAPHY OF A HORSE DREAMER, by Sam Shepard. Directed by Jacques Levy; settings by T. Winberry; costumes by Kenneth M. Yount; lighting by Frank R. Kelly; sound design by Carol Waaser; stage manager, Sari Weisman. Presented by the Manhattan Theater Club, Lynne Meadow, artistic director. At 321 East 73d Street.

title: Panel Rejects Nixon's Offer to Testify
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence decided today to reject former President Richard M. Nixon's offer to testify before the committee on the ground that he imposed too many conditions.

title: ExFranklin Bank Aide Pleads Guilty
description: Peter R. Shaddick, who was one of the top executives of the Franklin National Bank, pleaded guilty yesterday to having participated in a foreign currency speculation scheme that cost the bank more than $30 million.

title: TV: Body Speaks,' on Acting on Camera Three
description: Camera Three, the venarable and always laudable CBS series that is slipped into the schedule on Sundays at 11 A.M., is devoting its next two half hours to Ryszard Cieslak and a physical demonstration called The Body Speaks. Mr. Cieslak is a member of the Polish Laboratory, Theater. In addition to being the company's leading actor, he is the closest collaborator of Jerzy Grotowski, director of the highly experimental, avant garde group.

title: Controller Cites a Distraction In NearCollision of 2 Jetliners
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 12In his first public explanation of the nearcollision of two jetliners near Detroit on Thanksgiving a flight controller said today that he had been distracted because he was trying to handle a third plane unexpectedly routed into his traffic area.

title: Floating Wings Generate Power High Above Earth
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12A nuclear engineer has invented wings to float several hundred feet above the ground and generate electric power. They are designed to take advantage of the higher wind velocity atsubstantial elevation. Lambros Lois of Bethesda, Md., was granted Patent 3,924,827 this week for the apparatus. He is discussing its manufacture with several companies.

title: NEW STATE UNITS MAY STAY VACANT
description: A number of newly completed state buildings will likely stand unstaf fed because of the new austerity measures being forced on Albany, Peter C. Goldmark Jr., the State Budget Director, said yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: Vaslav Nijinsky choreographed four ballets, three of which dealt with sex. L'AprsMidi d'un Faune ended with a gesture of masturbation. Jeux was conceived as a ballet about three male homosexuals and ended up euphemistically as an ambivalent triangle of two women and a man. Le Sacre du Printemps (The Rite of Spring) treated sexuality on a metaphorical plane through a fertility ritual that saw the coming of spring as a terrifying act of nature.

title: Australians Cast Votes After a Bitter Campaign
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Saturday, Dec. 13After four weeks of a bitter and divisive campaign, eight million Australians voted this morning in what could be the most crucial election in this country's 75 years as a federation.

title: LOBBYISTS IN IRAN PAID BY GRUMMAN
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Dec. 12The Grumman Corporation, the nation's fifth largest defense contractor, has acknowledged that it arranged to pay Iranian lobbyists more than $20 million in commissions as part of a $2 billion deal to sell Iran 80 F14 Tomcat fighter planes.

title: RENTON M'KAYE, LED WILDERNESS SOCIETY
description: SHMLEW, Mass., Dec. 12 (Ap)  Benton MacKaye, first president of the Wilderness Society, who was credited with founding the Appalachian Trail, died last night at his home. He was 96 years old.

title: SPRAY CAN GASES DOUBLED SINCE '68
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (UPI)The type of spray can gases that scientists fear may be endangering the earth's ozone radiation shield have more than doubled in the stratosphere over New Mexico since 1968, a researcher at the University of Denver reported today.

title: Marcona in a Pact On Peru Property; Ore Shipments Set
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 12 (UPI)Peru and the United States announced today a provisional agreement in their negotiations over compensation for the nationalized iron ore properties of the Marcona Mining Company.

title: CONVENTION HALL IS WEIGHED AGAIN
description: A proposal to revive the shelved New York City Convention Center by moving its waterfront location from midManhattan to the Battery Park City landfill was advanced yesterday by officials of the city, the state and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: City to Undertake Sale Of Canarsie Cemetery
description: Plans were announced yesterday for auctioning one of five municipal cemeteries, the 12acre Canarsie Cemetery in Brooklyn, with the proceeds to be credited to the city's general fund.

title: Stubborn Executive
description: The confrontations in which House subcommittees were threatening the Secretaries of Commerce and State with contempt of Congress citations were aborted this week after eleventhhour agreements with the executive branch. First, Commerce Secretary Morton yielded on the request to furnish subpoenaed information concerning Arab pressure on American firms to boycott Israel. The next day, the Administration agreed to what the House Intelligence Committee accepted as substantial compliance with its subpoena seeking a record of all State Department recommendations to the White House for covert action between 1961 and 1974.

title: Notes on People
description: Will Bella and Martin Abzug celebrate New Year's together in China? Representative Abzug is one of 12 women members of the House from both parties who will leave for China Dec. 27 on a State Department plane, returning Jan. 10. The five other women Representatives could not accept the Chinese invitation, which was extended to all 17 women Representatives, because of personal or family plans, a spokesman for Representative Margaret M. Heckler of Massachusetts said yesterday. Mrs. Heckler suggested the invitation in August, when she was the first woman Representative to visit there.

title: Pepsico Signs Accord For 2d Plant in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  Pepsico Inc., said today it had signed an agreement with the Soviet Union to double the production of PepsiCola in the Soviet Union with a second plant to be built by next summer on the Black Sea coast.

title: General Cable Suit Seeks Curb on Microdot Moves
description: The General Cable Corporation filed a suit yesterday in the United States District Court in New Haven seeking to bar Microdot Inc. of Greenwich, Conn., from alleged violations of the Federal securities laws in connection with General Cable's proposed tender offer for Microdot.

title: MERGER IS URGED FOR HEALTH PLANS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12 (AP)State Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran recommended today that the New Jersey Blue Cross and Blue Shield programs be merged as a means of reducing administrative costs and improving services.

title: Maslow Dancers Revive 1942 Tolksay
description: Dances about common folk were common in the 1940's moderndance world, and Sophie Maslow's Folksay immediately made the history books as one of the best of the genre.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold Prices Friday.

title: Congo Politburo Resigns
description: BRAZZAVILLE., Congo Dec 12 (Agence FrancePresse) The politburo of Congo's ruling Labor Party resigned today. The party's central committee, which accepted the rseignation, called on President Marien Ngouabi to continue to take charge of the leadership of the party and the revolution.

title: Moral Obligations . . .
description: Governor Carey's frantic effort to avert default Monday by the Housing Finance Agency is only the first step the painful process of digging this state out of a fiscal morass which, like New York City's, results from years of profligacy.

title: E.P.A. Is Advised to Drop Proposed Pesticide Ban
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) A judge for the Environmental Protection Agency ruled today that the agency should drop its attempt to ban most uses of two widely sold pesticides, heptachlor and chlordane, on the ground that their cancercausing potential had not been proved.

title: Queens Man Rescues Girl, 12, From Attackers at Cost of Life
description: Frederick C. Pirone saved a 12yearold girl from a crowd of angry older girls Thursday night in Glen Oaks, Queens, but it cost him his life.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP) Money rates for Friday:

title: Indonesian Marines Used In Portuguese Timor Fall
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 12 (Reuters)  Indonesia declared today that it had sent marines to Portuguese Timor when the capital, Dili, fell to proIndonesian forces on Sunday.

title: Knicks Trounced By Braves, 123110
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 12Not even the luxury of a 15point lead in the waning minutes of the first half was enough to save the New York Knicks from another National Basketball Association trouncing tonight.

title: LISBON MILITARY MOVES TO GET OUT OF PARTY POLITICS
description: LISBON, Dec. 12Portugal's ruling military council announced a major reorganization of the armed forces today with emphasis on military discipline and the exclusion of soldiers from party politics.

title: Store Owner Held in Slaying Of Man Who Beat Customers
description: CAMDEN, Dec. 12 (UPI) A delicatessen owner here has been charged with the murder of a man who ran naked into his store yesterday, beat four customers end then assaulted store owner the police said.

title: Willie, 10, Finally Finds a Real Home
description: Hey, I'm going home, Willie Logan said over and over again yesterday. The 10yearold boy whom nobody had wanted, and who lived for two years at Bellevue Hospital because he had no other home was leaving with his new mother, Florence Logan.

title: Estonia Prepares for 1980 Olympics
description: TALLINN, U.S.S.R.Downstream from the stark ruins of the 14th century convent of St. Brigitta, a floating dredge breaks the stillness of the short winter days as it sucks sand from the mouth of the icecrusted Pirita River.

title: 4 Gunmen Yield in London Siege and Free Hostages
description: LONDON, Dec. 12  Four gunmen, described by the police as Irish Republican Army terrorists, quietly surrendered today after a sixday siege here and released their two hostages unharmed.

title: Frontier Is Narrowing For Brookhaven Town
description: PATCHOGUE, L.I.It is a frontier. It has farm lands and forests, rivers and ponds and saltwater harborseven a steep ridge where a settler can feel like Daniel Boone crossing the Cumberland Gap.

title: Man, 52, Rescues a 12YearOld Girl From Attackers at the Cost of His Life
description: Frederick C. Pirone saved a 12yearold girl from a crowd of angry older girls Thursday night in Glen Oaks, Queens, but it cost him his life.

title: Britain's Doctors Endorse Pay Plan To End Slowdown
description: LONDON, Dec. 12 (AP)Leaders of Britain's junior hospital doctors and the Labor Government agreed early today on a wage formula that may result in resumption of normal hospital operations after a twoweek slowdown.

title: Malpractice Surgery Plan
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (AP)  Doctors have been urged to refuse to pay expected increases in malpractice insurance premiums an dto bring pressure on the legislature to change the adversary system of malpractice trials. The advice came from Dr. Sanford A. Marcus, president of the Union of American Physicians, at a meeting last night.

title: ARTHUR W. BUTTENHEIM
description: Arthur W. Buttenheim, former president and chairman of the Frederick Snare Corporation, an engineering and contracting concern involved in building the Rip Van Winkle Bridge over the Hudson River and the Chesapeake Bay Bridge, died of a heart seizure Thursday at the Morristown (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 97 years old and lived at 12 Crescent Road, Madison, N.J.

title: State Mental Health Chief Vows Action at Once on Willowbrook
description: The state's Commissioner of Mental Hygiene, Dr. Lawrence C. Kolb, told a Federal judge yesterday that the state would move at once to restore Willowbrook residents dropped from an educational program, to increase the housekeeping staff at Willowbrook and to make other improvements agreed to in a consent order signed seven monthgs ago.

title: No Title
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 11 The enduring problem of religious persecution, the cause of inestimable human misery through the centuries, became the most nettlesome issue of the fifth assembly of the World Council of Churches, which closed here yesterday.

title: Strike Over, Carters Attack Garbage Pile
description: Trucks of the city's private carting companies began rolling early yesterday in a push to remove the rotting garbage and messy trash that accumulated during the 11day walkout of drivers and helpers.

title: In a Changing Britain, Class Holds the Line
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Consider yourself, if only for a speculative moment, as a sales clerk in Britain. Or a railway guard.

title: Dow Slips 0.08 to 832.81 As Trading Is Lackluster
description: The stock market maintained Its present holding patters yesterday in lackluster tra?? Prices opened lower and drifted in a narrow range throughout the day.

title: Byrne Signs a Ban on Crossover Voting
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12Governor Byrne signed into law today a bill to require voters desiring to switch parties to give 50 days notice before voting in a primary election.

title: House to Drop Bid To Use New Library For Office Space
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Leaders of the House of Representatives agreed today to drop any further effort to take over a nearly completed Library of Congress building for use as a fourth House office building

title: U.C.L.A. Women Gain in Volleyball
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 12The University of California, Los Angeles, the defending champion, and California State at Long Beach reached the semifinals of the National Intercollegiate women's volleyball championships today at Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: FAIR TRADE LAWS COMING TO AN END
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 Legislation repealing the socalled fair trade laws, which for nearly 40 years have permitted pricefixing on many consumer products, was signed today by President Ford.

title: Shell Will Build SkyscraperSized Oil Rig
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 12An offshore oil rig about the size of the Empire State Building will be built to produce oil and natural gas from a major new undersea discovery near the mouth of the Mississippi River, the Shell Oil Company announced today.

title: POLISH COMMUNISTS AGAIN PICK GIEREK
description: WARSAW, Dec. 12Edward Gierek, a 62yearold onetime coal miner, was again named first secretary of the Polish Communist Party today, presumably for another five years.

title: BONN BANK PLANS BENZ STOCK SALE
description: BONN, Dec. 12 (UPI)The Deutsche Bank, West Germany's largest commercial bank, announced today the formation of the Mercedes Automobile Holding Company to manage and sell a 25.23 percent share of the bank's holding in DaimlerBenz, producer of the Mercedes automobile.

title: U.S. Gets Favorable Hint
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12A highranking Ford Administration official said today that the United States had received informal hints from diplomats that the Soviet Union would favorably receive the NATO proposal to withdraw about 1,000 tactical nuclear weapons from Western Europe.

title: ALLEY DANCERS GIVE ACCORDING TO EVE
description: John Butler's According to Eve is an impossible tangle of emotional crosscurrents whose confusion can be redeemed only by performing excellence. Tina Yuan, Michihiko Oka and Masazumi Chaya redeemed as much as they could Thursday evening at the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater presentation but still left confusion as to who was feeling what about whom.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10242 or to these agencies:

title: New Group Is Planning Broadcasts on Religion
description: Fed up with crime and violence on primetime television and radio and dishethened at the relegation of religious broadcasting to other than primetime hours, a group of churches, religious organizations and individuals in the metropolitan area have banded together to try to remedy the situation.

title: U.S. ARMSCUT IDEA IS BACKED BY NATO
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 12The North Atlantic alliance today adopted a United States proposal to withdraw 1,000 American tactical nuclear weapons from Western Europe in return for the retirement from Central Europe of a Soviet army of about 1,700 tanks and 65,000 men.

title: 5th Avenue Bows to the Season And Becomes a Mall Tomorrow
description: Fifth Avenue between 34th and 57th Streets will be closed to vehicular traffic tomorrow from 11 A.M. to p P.M. and will become a pedestrian mall in the observance of the annual holiday festival on the avenue.

title: Administration Is Said to Press For Concorde Landings in U.S
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) The Ford Administration has put pressure on Transportation Secretary William T. Coleman Jr. to let the Concorde supersonic transport land in the United States despite the apparent Threats the plane poses to the environment a House subcommittee chairman said today.

title: Willie, 10, Will Finally Have a Real Home
description: Hey, I'm going home, Willie Logan said over and over again yesterday. The 10yearold boy whom nobody had wanted, and who lived for two years at Bellevue Hospital because he had no other home, was leaving with his new mother, Florence Logan.

title: Most Brilliant XRay Source Identified
description: Observations made on the ApolloSoyuz mission last July have revealed an object whose Xray emissions, sweeping the sky 84 times a minute like a highspeed airport beacon, are a million times more powerful than the energy radiated at all wave lengths by the sun.

title: GRAIN CONTRACTS PLUNGE IN PRICE
description: Grain futures dropped sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade following a statement by a Russian official that the Soviet Union did not plan to buy more grain this season.

title: Religious Persecution Is Still a World Issue
description: Religious Persecution Is Still a World Issue

title: Miss Moore Calls on Court To Accept Her Guilty Plea
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12I did indeed willfully and knowingly attempt to murder Gerald R. Ford, the President of the United States, by use of a handgun and would now like to enter a plea of guilty, Sara Jane Moore declared in Federal court today.

title: 2 HELD IN SLAYING OF A QUEENS WOMAN
description: The owner of a Manhattar moving company and one of his workers were arrested last night on charges of killing a 73yearold Queens woman dur ing a robbery at her home ear. lier this month.

title: In a Changing Britain, Class Holds the Line
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Consider yourself, if only for a speculative moment, as a sales clerk in Britain. Or a railway guard.

title: Music: Ornate Traviata
description: Verdi's La Traviata is so much with us in performances by the Metropolitan and New York City Opera companies that it is easy to forget how difficult it is to perform. On Thursday night the Juilliard American Opera Center presented it in its beautiful Juilliard Theater. It was a worthy production, but allowances had constantly to be made for the fact that the singers were young, not thoroughly seasoned and still learning their craft. Traviata isn't served as easily by youth as, say, Puccini's La Bohme, which the opera center has staged successfully.

title: Biggest Single Deal Made By Alaskan Native Group
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 12  In what is termed the largest single acquisition ever made by any of the 12 Alaska native corporations, officials of of the Bristol Bay Native Corporation completed today the purchase of the Peter Pan Seafoods Company, Seattle, for a price of more than $8 million.

title: FLOATING RATES BURDEN BUSINESS
description: Floating exchange rates have made international business much more difficult, according to a majority of executives surveyed by the Conference Board. Their consensus was that the current uncertainty in the foreignexchange markets had made corporate planning, pricing and purchasing all the more risky and timeconsuming.

title: Magicians Term Israeli Psychic a Fraud
description: Magicians, long irked by Uri Geller's alleged ability to bend spoons, repairwatches and read minds through paranormal powers, have taken off their white gloves and branded the Israeli psychic an outright fraud who uses conventional magicians' tricks to mislead the public.

title: NEWARK POLICEMAN FOUND NOT GUILTY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 12 (AP) John G. Morello, a Newark mounted patrolman, has been acquitted of a murder charge in the death of a Hispanic man during the city's 1974 Labor Day disturbances.

title: CONVENTION HALL IS WEIGHED AGAIN
description: A proposal to revive the shelved New York City Convention Center by moving its waterfront location from midManhattan to the Battery Park City landfill was advanced yesterday by officials of the city, the state and the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Rangers' Upswing Gets High Marks
description: Now that the new kids on the block are beginning to mesh better with the oldtimers, the New York Rangers are beginning to look more like a hockey team. With their 51 defeat of the Boston Bruins Thursday night, the Rangers have a modest unbeaten streak of six games, consisting of four victories and two ties.

title: Mets Trade Staub to Tigers for Lolich
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 12 The New York Mets traded Rusty Staub to the Detroit Tigers for Mickey Lolich tonight, but only after they had persuaded Lolich to abandon the seniority veto he had been invoking to block the deal.

title: Congressmen Tell of Irritation Over Covert U.S. Angola Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Several members of Congress said today that they were irritated over covert. United States assistance in the Angolan civil war. There appears to be dissent in the Ford Administration, too, over the $50 million program.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: HORSES & EQUIPMENT

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: OLIPHANT SHIFTING ITS RETAIL BUSINESS
description: James H. Oliphant & Company said yesterday that it was transferring its retail brokerage business to Philips Appel & Waddel Inc. and would be out of the public brokerage business entirely, effective Monday.

title: Gunmen in Beirut Besiege Christians
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Saturday, Dec. 13  Moslem and leftist gunmen poured heavy fire through the day yesterday into a burning luxury hotel that was the last major position of Christian gunmen in downtown Beirut.

title: The Roads To Are the Roads From
description: CAMBRIDGE, England  Since the rise of the modern citynot the walled city of the Middle Ages or the Renaissance but the dynamic metropolis of industrial societythe problem of seeing it in perspective has been especially acute.

title: Guild Sets Next Thursday As Strike Deadline at Post
description: The negotiating committee of the Newspaper Guild last night set it strike deadline at The New York Post for 6 A.M. next Thursday, according to Harry Fisdell, the union's executive vice president.

title: Defenders Reach Court Tennis Final
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 12Sam Sammis and Roger Tuckerman of the New York Racquet and Tennis Club gained tomorrow's final of the United States open court tennis doubles tournament with a 26, 64. 64, 65 victory today over Bill Shettle and Romer Holleran of Philadelphia.

title: Head of Governing Board Of City U. Wants to Leave
description: Alfred A. Giardino, the chairman of the Board of Higher Education, has told Mayor Beame that he will not be available for reappointment to the board when his current term expires on Dec. 31.

title: Annette Simpton, 83, Dies; Innovative Dress Designer
description: Annette Simpson, a dress designer responsible over the, years for a number of fashion innovations, died Thursday at BeekmanDowntown Hospital. She was 83 years old and formerly had lived at 10 Park Avenue.

title: A List of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Mexico Tells U.S. Jews It Does Not Link Zionism With Racism
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 12 President Luis Echeverra Alvarez assured representatives of major American Jewish organizations today that his Government in no way identified Zionism with racism despite its vote to that effect at the United Nations last month.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Byrne yesterday signed a new law that will require New Jersey voters who ?? to change their party affiliation to give notice of their intention at least 50 days before a primary election. The law changes a practice, in force since 1972, that gave voters open access to the polls on primary day and allowed them to cross party lines.

title: Public Works Fund Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) The House and Senate passed and sent to the White House today a $9.5 billion money bill for public works projects, including a multibilliondollar appropriation for energy programs. The House approved the measure 339 to 31 and the Senate on a voice vote.

title: MOSCONE ELECTED IN SAN FRANCISCO
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12State Senator George R. Moscone was elected Mayor of San Francisco yesterday in a close runoff race, winning by only 4,315 votes out of 200,000, final tallies showed today.

title: MacNeil Will Go National
description: The Robert MacNeil Report, WNET's nightly program of news analysis, which began locally in October, will be offered nationally by the Public Broadcasting Service beginning Jan. 5. The halfhour program will be distributed by PBS to its 250 member stations weekday evenings at 11:30. It is televised here at 7:30 P.M. and repeated at 11:30.

title: Minnesota Concedes Violations
description: ST. PAUL, Dec. 12 (UPI)University of Minnesota alumni and other outside sources gave $2,500 to $3,000 in cash and various other illegal gifts to Minnesota basketball players from 1971 to early 1975, a university vice president said today.

title: U.4.A.'S 1976 GOAL TO BE $600 MILLION
description: Leaders of the United Jewish Appeal yesterday called on American Jewish communities to raise a minimum of $600 million in 1976 to carry out humanitarian programs in Israel, the United States and 25 other countries.

title: Paris Dispute Over Army Starts a Major Political War
description: PARIS, Dec. 8A simmering dispute about the army has suddenly erupted into a sharp political confrontation between President Valry Giscard d'Estaing's Government and its opposition.

title: Occidental's Hammer Told to Stand Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Armand Hammer, the chairman of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, was ordered today to stand trial on charges of violating Federal campaign law after a United States District Court Judge nullified his guilty plea.

title: A Blind Judge Is Sworn By State Supreme Court
description: Eighteen years ago, when Gilberto Ramirez was setting up his legal practice in Brooklyn, he had assistance not usually associated with fledgling young, lawyersa seeingeye dog.

title: MayorElect of San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 If I were a coach, I'd run up the score every time, said George Moscone, San Francisco's new Mayor, in an interview earlier this year. Last night, though, he wasn't the concerned about running up the score. The liberal State Senator won a cliff hanger over his conservative opponent, John Barbagelata, in the mayoral runoff contest, and he cried tears of joy as he stood net to his wife Gina and three of his four children at a victory celebration in the San Franciscan Hotel.

title: In Britain a Move Is Afoot To Update Laws on Rape
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Rape and the ordeal that faces a victim who wishes to press charges against her attacker has emerged as a highly charged legal problem in Britain.

title: Justices Refuse to Cancel Murder Case Gag Order
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12A divided Supreme Court, refused today to lift the controversial courtimposed gag order that is sharply restricting pretrial press coverage of a lurid Nebraska murder case. It also refused to give speedy emergency review to a press challenge to the gag order.

title: YONKERS DEFAULT IS AVERTED AGAIN
description: YONKERS, Dec. 12Yonkers was saved today from default for the second time in a month when State Comptroller Arthur Levitt stepped in with funds that the major banks had declined to provide.

title: Kissinger Now Sees Reopening Of U.S. Bases in Turkey Soon
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 12Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger and Foreign Minister Ihsan Sabri Caglayangil of Turkey reached an agreement in principle today that could permit reopening of the American bases in Turkey, shut following the United States embargo on arms to Ankara after the Turkish invasion of Cyprus.

title: G.O.P., IN REVERSAL, AGREES TO DISCUSS TAXES WITH CAREY
description: The Republican leaders of the State Legislature, in the first sign of movement away from their public position that tax increases are not a subject for negotiaton, agreed yesterday to discuss the issue with representatives of the Governor's office and the legislative Democrats.

title: L. M'GREGOR DEMAREST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12L. McGregor Demarest, an industrial engineer who headed L. M. Demarest and Associates in New York from 1930 to 1960, died Wednesday at the Carriage Hill extended care facility in Silver Spring, Md. He was 85 years old and a former resident of Darien, Conn.

title: Excerpts From the Nobel Lecture by Andrei Sakharov on Human Rights Issues
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 12 (AP)Following, in translation from the Russian, are excerpts from the Nobel lecture by Andrei D. Sakharov, the 1975 Nobel Peace Prize winner, as read here yesterday by his wife, Yelena Bonner:

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, DECEMBER 13, 1975

title: GOING OUT
description: ON THE AVENUE Choral and jazz groups, ethnic dancers, puppet shows and operatic singing will be the entertainment bill, as the annual Fifth Avenue Holiday Festival takes over the street tomorrow and next Sunday, with no traffic from 11 A.M. to 3 P.M. (The rain date for both Sundays is Dec. 28).

title: Senate Votes Bill to Aid Antitrust Prosecution
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)  The Senate approved by voice vote today a multimilliondollar program, opposed by the Ford Administration as unnecessary, to help both the Federal Government and the state's crack down on violation of antitrust laws. The bill now goes to the House.

title: 12 States Seek to Bar Postal Rate Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)Twelve states asked the Federal District Court today to block the $2.4 billion postal rate increase scheduled to take effect Dec. 28.

title: A $4.5 Million Ransom Frees Child in France
description: LYONS, France, Dec. 12 (AP)  Kidnappers released the 9yearold son of a French pharmaceutical millionaire unharmed today after a ransom of 20 million francs, or about $4.5 million, was paid, the police announced.

title: Nets Defeat Spirits by 10698
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Dec. 12 These are the kind of games you have to win, said Kevin Loughery, the coach of the New York Nets, after tonight's 10698 victory over the Spirits of St. Louis.

title: Contract Awards
description: The MorrisonKnudsen Company has announced receipt of a $68million contract for construction of a water intake and discharge system for a nuclear power station to be built near Seabrook, N.H. The contract was awarded by United Engineers and Constructors Inc., Philadelphia designers and construction managers of the plant

title: Ottawa Overrules Board, Allows Postal Wage Rise
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 12 (Reuters) The Canadian Government has overruled its own antiinflation board and let stand a wage settlement that ended a sixweek nationwide postal strike last week.

title: Black Hat for Uncle Sam
description: FOR politicians and other Washington careerists, there was some hairraising writing the other night on the parlor wall, or at least on that part of it occupied by the television set.

title: People in Sports
description: John Mendenhall, who earned allpro honors with the New York Giants last season, says he doesn't want to play for the National Football League team next year. According to an Associated Press story, Mendenhallon the injured reserve list and thus ineligible for the final two games this seasonwas asked what his plans were for 1976 season and replied: I would not want to be in New York. I really wouldn't want to.

title: JAY E. BOTTOMLEY
description: Jay E. Bottomley, who retired in 1958 as a senior vice president of ,the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, died, apparently of a heart attack, Thursday in a nursing home. He was. 82 years old and lived in Jackson, N. J.

title: Aggression in Timor
description: By any definition, Indonesia is guilty of naked aggression in its military seizure of Portuguese Timor. Jakarta's excusesthat its own security was jeopardized by civil war in the territory and that it intervened only at the request of proIndonesian political partieshave the stamp of alibis prepared long ago when Portugal first began to explore how best to disengage from the land it had ruled for nearly four centuries.

title: RCA's Satcom I in Canaveral Liftoff
description: A fullscale bid to compete with some of the nation's major telecommunications companies was launched last night by the RCA Corporation with the liftoff of its Satcom I communications satellite.

title: Transcript of Miss Moore's Statement
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 Following is the court stenographer's transcript of Sara Jane Moore's statement in Federal District Court today:

title: Convicted Jockey In Fair Condition
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 12 (AP) Eric S. Walsh, one of four Maryland jockeys convicted in a racefixing scheme at Bowie Race Course, was listed in fair condition today at the Shock Trauma Unit here with a self  inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Nat L. Solomon, Invented RubberTipped Bobby Pin
description: Nat L. Solomon, who held more than 100 haircare patents, died Thursday in Palm Beach, Fla., where he lived. He was 78 years old and had been a longtime resident of Englewood. N. J.

title: Notes on People
description: Will Bella and Martin Abzug celebrate New Year's together in China? Representative Abzug is one of 12 women Members of the House from both parties who will leave for China Dec. 27 on a State Department plane; returning Jan. 10. The five other women Representatives could not accept the Chinese invitation, which was extended to all 17 women Representatives, because of personal or family plans, a spokesman for Representative Margaret M. Heckler of Massachusetts said yesterday. Mrs. Heckler suggested the invitation in August, when she was the first woman Representative to visit there.

title: RANGEL DENOUNCES MOYNIHAN'S ACTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI) Representative Charles B. Rangel, Democrat of New York, said today that Ambassador Daniel P. Moynihan had insulted thirdworld countries in speeches to the United Nations and that the appointment of Pearl Bailey, the singer, to the United Nations delegation was an insult to betterqualified blacks.

title: Islanders, Flames Tie, 33
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 12Eric Vail, playing for the first time in a month, pushed in a goal with 23 seconds left to gain a 33 tie for the Atlanta Flames against the New York Islanders tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Britain Reported to Plan $400 Million Chrysler Aid
description: LONDON, Dec. 12The British Government has apparently decided to spend almost $400 million in the next four years to assure the continued operation of the Chrysler Corporation's British factories.

title: ZOOT SIMS SALUTE DRAWS JAZZ STARS
description: Zoot Sims, whose saxophone playing has been a consistently swinging and enlivening element in the countless jazz groups that he has played with during the last 30 years, managed to work his usual musical magic Wednesday evening, simply by bein gthe focus of a salute at Jack Kleinsinger's monthly Highlights of Jazz concert in New York University's Loeb Auditorium.

title: SALLY WETZLER
description: Sally Wetzler, who with her sister, Margaret Putterman, for many years operated Marsal Gowns, at 508 Park Avenue, died Tuesday at her home, 975 Park Avenue. She was 61 years old.

title: Rome Opera Starts Season With Ballet, Jarring Many
description: ROME, Dec. 12Last night, for the first time in its history, the Rome Opera opened the season with a ballet. To many Italians this was about the equivalent of starting the soccer season with rugby.

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, Dec. 12 (AP)The United States French compromise agreement on currencyexchange rates reached at last month's sixnation summit meeting at Rambouillet, France, was approved today by other major industrialized nations. Officials taking part at the twoday meeting of deputies of the Gronp of 10 richest nations, however, called for a number of clarifications and more precise definitions of some of the terms of the accord.

title: Suit by S.E.C. Lays Fraud to Bergman
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has accused Bernard Bergman of defrauding a chain of nursing homes and of filing false reports to stock holders.

title: Spain Frees a Labor Dissident Arrested After Earlier Release
description: MADRID, Dec. 12A dissident labor leader arrested Sunday, a week after his release from prison, was unconditionally freed today in what appeared! to be a gesture toward the Spanish left on the eve of the swearingin of a new Cabinet.

title: CORRECTION
description: A United Press International dispatch printed in The Times last Saturday reported incorrectly that President and Mrs. Ford had presented Mrs. Suharto, wife of the Indonesian President, with a porcelain sculpture by the late American designer Edward Marshal Boehm. It should have said that the gift, a porcelain piece named Windflower, was by Cybis Studio.

title: Photography Show By Women at Janis
description: Women have occupied a place in the first rank of photographic masters from the time the medium was invented in the 19th century, and their importance in this burgeoning artistic field endeavor continues unabated to the present day.

title: Former Grain Aide Pleads Guilty in a Weighing Plot
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 12A former assistant vice president of the Bunge Corporation pleaded guilty today to charges of conspiring to weigh grain improperly for the company  a conspiracy that originated at a higher level, according to testimony by an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Amex Prices Are Mixed 2d Day In Row as OTC Issues Decline
description: For the second session in a row prices on the American Stock Exchange ended mixed while those in the overthecounter market closed lower.

title: Antiques: H2O + Heat
description: Today's children might consider steam engines as far removed from their world as, say, dinosaurs. But their parents or grandparents may possess vivid memories of steam rollers flattening roads, of steam tractors powering threshers or of Lilliputian steam machines in miniature factories  toys that made young boys dream of becoming industrialists.

title: Of State and Church
description: RIO DE JANEIRO HROUGHOUT the Iberian world, whose greatest area is Latin America, the Roman. Catholic Church has experienced profound change in the years since its Ecumenical Council, Vatican II, which ended in 1962. With exceptions, especially in Portugal, the episcopal hierarchy has tended to move from what was a conservative stance to an increasingly liberal political attitude.

title: Party's Chiefs and Byrne Agree on Senate Leader
description: PRINCETON, Dec. 12Governor Byrne and some of New Jersey's top Democratic leaders, both from the state party and the Legislature, reached final agreement here tonight on the makeup of the Democratic leadership of the State Senate next year.

title: UNIT WILL STUDY GRANDJURY LEAKS
description: The State Commission of Investigation will hold hearings next month to examine the disturbing and controversial issue of grandjury leaks, the commission's chairman, David W. Brown, said yesterday.

title: Music: Kolb Soundings
description: Does it matter what a corn poser says his music is about? Does it matter if he says it is about nothing at all? Aaron Copland enjoys telling how his Appalachian Spring was named by Martha Graham, without consulting him, after he composed the ballet score for her. For all one knows, Appalachian Spring actually depicts the changing moods of street life in Mr. Copland's native Brooklyn.

title: Pro Transactions BASEBALL
description: ATLANTA (NL)Obtained Roger Morel, lefthanded pitcher, from Boston for Tom House, lefthanded relief pitcher.

title: Fire Drill
description: If the snafu over the city's new Firemen's Training Center is a reliable indicator, official business is proceeding as usual in New York. Completed, controversial, and to date unoccupied, the new complex on Ward's Island seems to be a standard case, of city operating procedure: a battle of bureaucracies, a of communication, and the inability to cope with anything that breaks the mold of familiar practice.

title: Bobick Thrashes Neumann With 3 Knockdowns in 4th
description: Duane Bobick came into the Madison Square Garden ring last night wearing shockingpink trunks. He left it in the fourth round as a notsoshocking knockout victor.

title: Lifted Load
description: A blunt warning by Chief State Mediator McDonnell that Mayor Beame was ready to send a certificate of emergency to the State Legislature, demanding compulsory arbitration, has produced a settlement in the elevenday strike that was fast turning New York City into a mammoth garbage dump.

title: Ruling Is Reserved In Suit by Knight
description: BEDFORD, Ind., Dec. 12 (AP)Judge H. Wayne Baker of the Lawrence Circuit Court said today that he would rule at the earliest possible time, possibly Monday morning, on a suit against the National Collegiate Athletic Association's limitation on basketball traveling squads.

title: Dave Anderson
description: About halfway through the Washington Redskins' season, their rookie running back, Mike Thomas, was startled to hear Chris Hanburger, the 34yearold linebacker, falking to him.

title: Through Italy on the Trail of the Enigmatic Leonardo
description: ARMED with information gleaned from the Madrid Codices, Leonardo da Vinci's long lost notebooks which were rediscovered in 1967 in Madrid's National Library after three centuries of neglect, I embarked on a quest for Leonardo, that enigmatic, Renaissance man, inventor, designer and observer of natural phenomenaa quest that had its beginnings in the sunny Tuscan village of Vinci, proceeded la Florence and Milan and ended in Amboise in the Loire Valley of France.

title: Casa Is Seeking the Support of Democratic Legislators for SalesTax Increase
description: MINEOLARalph G. Caso, the Nassau County Executive, tried to get support last week from the county's Democratic members of the Legislature for his proposal for a 1cent increase in the county sales tax, warning that there would be a drastic increase in the property tax if it was not approved.

title: New Rumanian Embassy
description: BUCHAREST, Dec. 13 (Reuters)Rumania will open an embassy in Phnom Penh, it was anounced here today at the end of a threeday state visit by Prince Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia.

title: Letters
description: The Nov. 16 issue of your Magazine contained a blatant example of cause and effect. Ted Morgan's Little ladies of the night describes the degradation of young prostitutes. Interestingly, when a girl gets punished she doesn't complain; she's a willing participant to the punishment. I was not surprised to read that these women react to humiliation in a placid fashion. After all, one picture accompanying A new Model T to the rescue [another article in the same issue] illustrates that feminine degradation is a common and accepted facet of everyday life. A halfclothed woman, complete with measurements and lascivious expression, is used to promote Chevrolets. A society which employs a woman's body to generate sales should not be shocked by the fact that some of its daughters choose to survive by selling themselves. I see little difference between the creator of that ad and the pimps described by Mr. Morganboth debase female anatomy for their own profitable purposes.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Friday's new production of Puccini's Il Trittico at the Metropolitan Opera is particularly apposite, for in a way the Metropolitan owns the three operas that form the triptych. That is because the world premiere was given at the Metropolitan, on Dec. 14, 1918. Puccini's relations with New York's big opera house had always been friendly. He had come here in 1907 to supervise the Butterfly production, and in 1910 he was on hand for the world premiere of La Fanciulla del West. Puccini liked New York, and New York liked him.

title: She's an Artist at Getting Money for the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, D. C. Last week a joint committee of Congress approved an appropriation of $82 million for the National Endowment for the Arts for the current fiscal yearexactly what President Ford requested last January. As Federal outlays go, $82 million is a quick sneezethe Pentagon spends as much every six hours, yet the appropriation represents another victory for Nancy Hanks, the sweettongued yet formidable chairman of the Endowment, who has been battling to retain the full amount ever since the House cut $2.5 million from her budget earlier this year.

title: Louise Gibbs Cushman Is Married
description: Louise Gibbs Cushman and Peter Charles Paquette who expect to receive master's degrees in June from the Amos Tuck School of Business Administration at Dartmouth College, were married yesterday afternoon.

title: The New Corporate Presence in Politics
description: The Sun Oil Company is putting up S100,000 for political purposesnot for contributions, let it be hastily noted, but rather as expense money for its responsible citizenship program an inhouse committee set up to solicit contributions from Sun's employees and shareholders.

title: Correction
description: The price of Dateline: White House by Helen Thomas, reviewed Nov. 30, should have read $9.95.

title: 22% Population Increase Forecast in Canada by '86
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 13 (Reuters)  The population of Canada will rise to 26.2 million by 1986, up to 22 percent from 1971, the Government predicts.

title: Sheepherders
description: Men Alone. By Michael Mothers. Illustrated. 118 pp. Boston: Houghton Mifflin. $9.95.

title: A Measure of Joy for Firemen's Widows
description: It was a damp, chilly day yesterday in Union Square, but inside the Franklin D. Roosevelt Auditorium at 111 East 15th Street Christmas had come to about 80 widows and children of firemen killed in the line of duty, and the room was full of warmth.

title: Washington Post Faces Climax in Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The 10week strike by pressmen at The Washington Post neared a climax today as a result of the newspaper's announced hard decision to replace its 200 pressmen with nonunion workers beginning tomorrow.

title: American Art on Display
description: PRINCETONAs part of its Bicentennial celebration the Princeton University Art Museum has put on display its collection of American art. The collection, which has been in storage for some time, is one of this country's most distinguished selections of Americana.

title: Food
description: We wish it were possible for the squid of this world to sue Jules Verne for defamation of character. We admire the man and are grateful to him for his beautiful scifi stories. which have enchanted generations, young and old alike. But in TwentyThousand Leagues Under the Sea, Verne created a giant squid scary enough to keep those same generations from ever approaching the giant's cousin, the small edible squid. Hoping to redress some of the damage, we would like to reintroduce squid in a more appetizing guise.

title: Rieses Expand Brew Burger Chain
description: Among the most successful restaurant operators here in recent years are the Riese brothers, Murray and Irving, who own National Restaurants, Inc., the largest privately held chain in the city. Their latest creation is the Brew Burger chain.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Bill Veeck, asked what percentage of the Chicago White Sox he owns: That's nobody's business, if you forgive me for saying so. And if you won't forgive me, it's still nobody's business.

title: Letters: Headline Under Fire
description: To the Editor:

title: Headliners
description: The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, following the recommendation of its chairman, Senator Frank Church, has voted to reject former President Richard M. Nixon's offer to testify before it. Committee members felt that the restrictions Mr. Nixon wanted to impose on his testimony were unacceptable. Mr. Nixon's lawyers had stipulated that he not be asked to testify under oath, that he only testify before the ranking members of the committee, and that he reserve the right to assert executive privilege. The committee had wanted to question Mr. Nixon about covert intelligence operations during his administration, specifically in Chile. Though negotiations with Mr. Nixon's lawyers are continuing, Senator Church said there was little chance Mi. Nixon would ever appear before the committee.

title: Colts' Unknowns Offer Key to Success
description: The Colts, who play Miami at Baltimore today (Channel 4, 2 P.M.) and can tie the ??phins for first place with a victory, represent the biggest improvement and surprise in the National Football League this year. won 2 Football and lost 12 last season which left them in a tie with the ?? for last place in the N.F.L. Their record in the American Conference Eastern Division today, is 84, and if they can beat Miami, and New England next Sunday, they will be in the playoffs by means of the greatest singleseason imrovement in N.F.L. history.

title: A Holiday Guide for Children
description: The city is filled with entertainments for children and their families during the holiday season. The following is a select list of some of the more noteworthy offerings around town.

title: Music in Review
description: Musica Semper Nova means Music Always New, or possibly Always New Music, both translations being accepted with equal cheer by Esther Lamneck, clarinetist, and Gary Steigerwalt, pianist. The young artists are prime movers in the consort designed to showcase chamber music that is new either chronologically, or by dint of earlier performance neglect, and in what was essentially a clarinet recital with expanded textures, Musica Semper Nova made its auspicious debut Thursday evening at Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Sarah L. Neale Plans Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas D. Neale of Virginia Beach, Va., and Sag Harbor, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sarah Louise Neale, to Henry A. Proesel James V. Proesel of Lincolnwood, Ill.

title: City College Five Beats Brooklyn
description: City College's basketball team survived occasional lapses of concentration and defeated Brooklyn College, 7774, yesterday at Mahoney Gymnasium.

title: 3 Seminary Pioneers Go ut Into Field
description: ORADELLThree seminarians are taking part in a pioneering program that will be used for the training of all priests in the Archdiocese of Newark. The men are serving a year in the field attached to parishes with the aim of having the ordained priest more rounded upon receiving holy orders, with practical and pastoral as well as theological experience.

title: In brief
description: Kenneth Griffith makes nc hones about it: the real cause of the Second Boer War was gold. The Transvaal Republic had it, Britain's imperial big business wanted it, and Boer farmers and British Tommies, the

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Introducing O. T. C.A New Dimension in LowCost Travel
description: A DRAMATIC development in air travel is opening new vacation vistas for Americans. It goes by the name of O.T.C., for onestop inclusive tour charter. Essentially, it offers the individual, a bargain heretofore available only to socalled affinity groupslodges, professional societies and the like. Namely, the chance to fly on chartered aircraft at greatly reduced rates, with a minimum of fuss, to dozens of vacation destinations in the United States and abroad.

title: Sea Cliff: A Touch of the Past
description: SEA CLIFFThis village is unique. Turreted Victorian houses with gingerbread trim perch alongside its hilly streets overlooking Hempstead Harbor. The main avenue is lined with boutiques offering everything from fine antique furniture, glass, china and pedigreed junk to clothing, crafts, cakes and casseroles.

title: The World
description: The United States cast a veto in the United Nations Security Council last week to prevent a condemnation of Israel for its air raids on Lebanon, but there are continuing signs that Washington is pressuring Israel to abandon its opposition to dealing with the Palestinian Liberation Organization.

title: Mayor Calls for a Moratorium On Los Angeles Redevelopment
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13Mayor Thomas Bradley said this week that work on a massive plan to redevelop downtown Los Angeles should be halted, at least for now, because of mounting opposition. The City Council is expected to go along with his proposal.

title: Courses in College Offered to Elderly
description: TOMS RIVER  Ocean County residents who are at least 62 years old and retired may enroll for up to six credits next Wednesday in free courses in an experimental program at Ocean County College for the spring semester.

title: Human Needs Burgeon in Fiscal Crisis
description: The crisis in our city government and the prospect of fiscal collapse drastically affect the ability of the voluntary philanthropic organizations to serve the human needs of New Yorkers at a time when those needs have escalated enormously. This can mean tragedy for millions of aged, poor, sick, disturbed and dependent who look to our community's organizations for lifesustaining services.

title: New National Guard Tanks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) The Army is starting to deliver the first improved M48 tanks to the National Guard, it said Thursday. The improved tan khas a 105 millimeter gun instead of the 90 millimeter in the original model. It also has a diesel engine and new fire control systems.

title: The Region
description: New York's Governor Carey has proposed harsher penalties for youths who commit violent crimes and lighter penalties for persons caught with small amounts of marijuana.

title: ChristmasTree Buyers Seeking Fresh Farm Look
description: EAST BRUNSWICKThe chooseandcut method of selecting Christmas trees at nurseries and farms has become an increasinlgy popular avocation throughout, the state this time of the year.

title: Evangelical Protestants Engage In a 3Day Dialogue With Jews
description: Two religious groups that have traditionally remained aloof from one another met together for three days last week in a friendly examination of some of their differences.

title: Additional Projects Are Cut
description: Community boards in Brooklyn and Queens; already disappointed by widespread cutbacks in the city's building program, received further discouraging news from City Hall last week.

title: State's P.T.A. Opens Membership Drive
description: While New Jersey boards of education fight to keep local control, and teachers struggle against an austerity wave in contract negotiations, the New Jersey Congress of Parents and Teachers wages its own battle to build up its lagging membership.

title: BirthCurb Drive Fights Dacca's No. 1 Problem
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Dec. 9  A 20yearold woman, carrying one barefoot child and leading two others by the hand, peeked out shyly ffrom behind a fold of her faded blue sari and whispered to the nurse:

title: Indian Is Fighting School Over Rights
description: HAUPPAUGEAn issue of American Indian pride is at stake here this week as a trial begins in Family Court that mild result in separating a mother and her daughter.

title: The Future of Detente
description: The proposal by the North Atlantic Treaty Organization to withdraw 1,000 American tactical nuclear warheads and 29,000 American troops from Central Europe if the Soviet Union initially will pull out a tank army of 68,000 men and 1,700 tanks, is less important in itself than as a gesture to get negotiations going in the longstalemated Vienna talks. With efforts at dtente running into trouble on other fronts, including the strategic arms limitation talks (SALT II), Secretary of State Kissinger's view evidently is that progress toward mutual force reductions in Europe might encourage a more conciliatory Soviet attitude on other issues.

title: Christmas Spending Is Up, But Not on Credit
description: With just nine days of shopping left until Christmas, retail sales are running well ahead of last year's neardisastrous pace and, in fact, may even exceed the very healthy level of 1973.

title: SIKKIM'S EXKING VIRTUAL PRISONER
description: GANGTOK, Sikkim, (AP)The royal flag of Sikkim still flies from the palace of Palden Thondup Namgyal.

title: Marriage Announcement 9  No Title
description: Teacher to Wed Eleuthera Smith

title: Who's Starring in Stockholm Strindberg
description: STOCKHOLM A major source of excitement on the Stockholm theater scene this season was the work of August Strindberg. This may not sound all that surprising, in view of Strindberg's position as the national genius of Sweden; after all, his plays constitute a substantial part of every season's repertory.

title: FREE SPEECH ISSUE IN NUCLEAR FIGHT
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13The controversy over atomic power development in California has taken on a new, dimension: a conflict over freedom of speech.

title: TV VIEW
description: In a negative sort of way, a word of defense will be offered here for the commercial networks. Late last year, all three had passed up the privilege of carrying further specials in the longrunning National Geographic series. The National Geographic Society then turned to public television, specifically station WQED in Pittsburgh. With a grant from Gulf Oil, an agreement was reached to present 12 specials over the next three years. The first four, produced by the Wolper Organization, were already in the can; the others would be made by WQED personnel.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayMiddle Island, Middle Island Arena, Rocky Point, Road, Middle Island, L.I. Special working hunters, special jumpers, equitation. 9 A.M.

title: International Center Party
description: A theater party to Habeas Corpus at the Martin Beck Theater Wednesday evening will benefit the International Center in New York. Tickets at $40 and $30 may be obtained from the beneficiary at 745 Seventh Avenue. Pretheater dinner at the Scandia Restaurant an additional $11.

title: McCauley Sturdy In Piano Recital
description: John McCauley, a pianist who teaches at three schools in the area, chose an interesting program for his formal debut last Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. But he didn't play it with complete persuasiveness.

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTONEver since the Legislature approved one of the nation's toughest election campaign  reporting laws, hundreds of candidates in New Jersey for just about every conceivable office have complained about the red tape and confusion involved in fulfilling the statute's requirements.

title: Monument Growing Out of Coincidence
description: In years to come, when they tell the story of the Freedom Monument the major project of the Brooklyn Bicentennial Celebration it will likely center on three men, a fire, and the long arm of coincidence.

title: STATE IS PRESSING FOODSTAMP PLAN
description: A new state effort to encourage more eligible persons to use food stamps was announced yesterday, with a report that the program was already pumping more than $240 million a year in Federal funds into the state's economy.

title: Figure in Art Is on Display
description: EAST HAMPTONNo one would question the, fact that Long Island is a center for artists and fortunately many of the museums there take advantage of their local talent to produce exciting exhibitions. Guild Hall, which

title: U.S. to Receive Fliers' Bodies
description: PEKING, Dec. 13 (Reuters)The remains of two American pilots shot down over or near China during the Vietnam war will be turned over to a United States Red Cross official tomorrow, according to a United States spokesman here.

title: Pope Writes Prayer to Mary Asking World Reconciliation
description: ROME, Dec. 13 (AP)Pope Paul VI has written a prayer to the Virgin Mary calling for reconciliation among people and nationsthe theme of the Holy Yearin this critical hour for the spiritual and civil fate of the world.

title: Films Pay for Couple's 8 World Cruises
description: JAMESBURG  Eight roundtheworld voyages to make and show travel movies would more than satisfy most amateur cinematographers, but not Aaron L. Binenkorb. He is looking forward to more such trips, although he has not circled anything definite on his calendar.

title: Notes: The Backlash Of the Zionism Vote
description: THE American Jewish Congress and B'nai Brith have canceled dozens of tours to Mexico and Rio de Janeiro. Professional organizations are rescheduling conventions and many travel agentsif not their national associationare taking a hard line. At issue: the Nov. 10 vote in the United Nations General Assembly on a resolution calling Zionism a form of racism.

title: PLEASING CONCERT BY YOUTH SYMPHONY
description: Despite several unavoidable failings and one very avoidable one, the Youth Symphony Orchestra of New York mustered a generally pleasing concert yesterday afternoon at Carnegie Hall.

title: PICASSO'S ESTATE PUT AT $1.1 BILLION
description: PARIS, Dec. 13 (Reuters)Pablo Picasso's estate today was unofficially valued at $1.1 billion, and his six heirsincluding three illegitimate children  may soon receive large shares of the fortune.

title: C. M. Norris Jr. Plans Wedding To Gwen Parry
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Malcolm Parry of Cos Cob, Conn., and Nantucket, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gwen Parry, to Charles Morgan Norris Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Norris of Philadelphia

title: The Effects of Ice on Scotch
description: In countries where Scotch has been consumed for centuries, ice and whisky rarely mingle. But on this side of the Atlantic, the picture is quite different. While a small percentage of American Scotch drinkers take it neat, better than 35% drink it on the rocks. The rest of us add varying amounts of water club soda, etcetera. And ice. Always plenty of ice  the great American drink requisite.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  What most worries Arthur F. Burns, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board? Is it the level of interest rates?. The rate of growth of the nation's money supply?.The continued troublesome pace of inflation?

title: Pollution Tests at a Montana Power Plant Raise Questions About the Enforcement of CleanAir Laws
description: BILLINGS, Mont.  Recent tests here on air pollution from an electric power plant owned by one of the West's major utility companies have raised serious questions about the ability of state and. Federal governments to enforce cleanair laws.

title: City's Official Volunteer Head Becomes a Volunteer Himself
description: Two months ago, when Dwayne Schoner's job of funneling volunteers to areas affected by city budget cuts was itself eliminate,d by a new round of layoffs, officials of the Mayor's Office of Volunteer Action searched for ways of keeping him at work by his task, which was becoming increasingly necessary as the budget crisis deepened.

title: Dance: Martha Graham's Appalachian Spring
description: Martha Graham's Appalachian Spring is a simple message to the Frontier  a statement of not just Americana, but also Americanism. It is a picture of life pressing Westward, of life extendinn the American dream.

title: SOVIET TIGHTENS GRASP IN AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 13 (AP) Soviet penetration of black Africa, most visible In Angola, has now reached its highest mark since Western powers began the decolonization of the continent nearly two decades ago, according to intelligence sources here.

title: Carey Is Standing Tall On a Shaky Foundation
description: In his first 11 months as Governor, one of the most troubled periods in the history of New York City and State, Hugh L. Carey has demonstrated that one man's crisis can be another man's opportunity. Politicians of virtually all persuasions agree that the Governor will receive high marks for his handling of New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Mexico Court's Drug Ruling May Free Some Americans
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 13 (AP)  A ruling by the Mexican Supreme Court could lead to lesser sentences or freedom for many of the 765 Americans serving long jail terms here on drug charges.

title: Ideas & Trends
description: WASHINGTON  Cyrano. Pagliacciand now, the Commission on Federal Paperwork joins that sad group whose exteriors obscure the serious, indeed, the tragic, soul.

title: Opera: Mother of Us All
description: Virgil Thomson's The Mother of Us All, a 28yearold American opera classic that has never been produced by either of New York's major opera companies, was performed Wednesday through yesterday by Queens College's departments of drama and music in an ambitious production staged at the College Theater.

title: THE NIGHTMARE SPAIN DOESN'T WANT
description: MADRID. Spain isn't Portugal. The Spaniards are nothing like the Portuguese. Their dictator was different; their ways, their history, their political experience their military are different. Even their Communists are different. Whatever happens next, now that Franco is gone. Madrid is not going to be another Lisbon. But it could be worse.

title: For Peddie, Sunday Skating
description: HIGHTSTOWN  A new Sunday night skating program that continues through February has town and gown skating around in circles under the stars at the Peddie School here.

title: Residents Protesting Sewage Plant Site
description: HAMPTON BAYSIf the residents of this eastern Suffolk community have their way, the sewerage treatment plant that Southampton must build to handle scavenger wastes will not be constructed in their part of the town.

title: Loch Ness Expert Thinks Photos Show Movie Dummy
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, Dec. 13 (AP)The latest theory on the Loch Ness monster: photographs taken by an American team may show nothing more than an old movie model of it, which sank in the lake in the late 1960's. The theory was advanced yesterday by a retired Scottish librarian, Roy Muir, who has been seeking the elusive monster for 15 years and claims to have seen it four times.

title: New School Plan Would Ease Taxes
description: MINEOLAA bill to eliminate the property tax as the basis for financing public schools in the state, for many years a cause of deep concern to taxpayers, school administrators and political figures, has received substantial support from state residents, a Nassau County Assemblyman said last week.

title: LETTER; Kalstone vs. Barnes (Cont'd.)
description: To the Editor:

title: Columbia Bars Plan to Admit Women
description: Trustees of Columbia Univrsity have dismissed as impractical and shortsighted a resolution to admit women the Columbia College faculty passed last month.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 14, 1975

title: Battle Rages Over Ft. Monmouth Pullout
description: Now that the New Jersey Congressional delegation has successfully managed to preserve Fort Dix and Picatinny Arsenal for its home state, it is setting its sights on the battle of Fort Monmouth.

title: Suzanne Johnson Is Married To Henry Howard 2d, Broker
description: The Huguenot Memorial Presbyterian Church in Pelham Manor, N. Y., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Suzanne Johnson, daughter of Mrs. E. Franklin Hatch of Greenwich, Conn., and Lost Tree Village, Fla., and the late Robert Sheldon Johnson, to Henry Howard 2d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Eliot W. Howard of Larchmont. N. Y.

title: LILCO Hearings on Tuesday
description: ALBANYThe Public Service Commission will open hearings on Tuesday on a Long Island Lighting Company proposal to adjust the cost of electricity to the time of day it is being used. The proposal may result in almost doubling the electric bills of some customers, particularly large retail stores, during the summer months.

title: U.S. IS PREPARING FOR PARIS PARLEY
description: The United States delegation to the Conference on International Economic Cooperation is planning no new policy initiatives at the meeting. The hope is that the conference will confirm the broad guidelines to be followed by the principal commissions when they begin gheir work in January.

title: West Pointers Hear of Holocaust From a Survivor
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Dec. 11The lecture last Tuesday night was entitled The Impact of World War II on European Jews, and it was offered in vivid personal terms.

title: Late TV Listings
