description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: 100 Killed in Lebanon as War Goes On
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 13More than 100 people were reported killed last night and through the day today as armed band of Moslems and Christians intensified their fighting in Beirut and several other areas of Lebanon in defiance of ceasefire orders from their factional leaders.

title: Communism and the War in Angola
description: The conflict of opposing political movements for control of an independent Angola is rapidly escalating into an international confrontation reminiscent of Vietnam, and United States spokesmen are grossly distorting the real issues involved.

title: Victory First at Toronto
description: TORONTO, Dec. 13For the first time in their four years in the National Hockey League, the New York Islanders beat Toronto tonight in Maple Leaf Garden.

title: Alabama Official Given 3 Years in Bribery Case
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 13 The president of the Alabama Public Service Commission has been convicted, sentenced to three years in prison, and removed from office on a charge of soliciting a bribe to get vending machines placed in telephone company service buildings.

title: L.I. Union Fighting To Avoid Takeover
description: AMITYVILLE  The Civil Service Employees Association (C.S.E.A.) here, after 26 years of neutrality is aggressively coordinating plans to participate in the political arena during the 1976 election year.

title: With Failure of Leftist Coup, Portugal's Right Revives
description: LISBON, Dec. 13Since the unsuccessful leftist uprising two weeks ago, there has been a swift and strong revival of the Portuguese right.

title: Headman
description: You got to have gangs. You got to run....The way the street is you got to have gangs. You by yourself. man, you got no chance. On the streets, it's the gangs what do the talking....How else you going to go about your business without being cut or stomped out? The speaker is Justin Dye. headman of the Nomads, a black street gang in Kin Platt's taut and very tough novel about growing up dead in the white, black and Chicano ghettos of Los Angeles. Platt's book isn't about Justin; it's about Owen Kirby, a young white slumdweller who knows that Justin's way is the only way.

title: Rockets Fall To Celtics By 137120
description: Braves 103, Bulls 101

title: The Nasty Side of Nastase: True Artist Becomes Almost Pathetic
description: Ilie Nastase served another ace on the leaders of organized tennis with his victory last Sunday in the Grand Prix Masters at Stockholm. Yet, when the final point is played in Nastase's weekly theatrical show, the real loser will not be organized tennis, bigtime promoters or a confused public, but Nastase himself.

title: Bah, Humbug! To All Yule TV Kiddie Shows
description: Ah, December is an unsettling month for those of us who structure our otherwise chaotic and formless lives around the TV schedule. For example, with a bowl of Pringles and a sixpack of Lite beer at my side, I settle happily into my LaZBoy lounger on a Wednesday evening at 8 o'clock, click my 24 Quasar colorTV set to Channel 2 and sit back to enjoy an uplifting hour of Tony Orlando and Dawn. But what do I get instead? Rudolph the RedNosed. Reindeer, the hourlong cartoon, narrated by Burl Ives and being shown on CBS for the 12th consecutive year. Or I'm all set on Thursday evening at 8 o'clock to watch The Waltons, to have a warmheart ed chuckle or two and perhaps even to brush aside a beery tear, but instead I get a backtoback pair of halfhour cartoonsFrosty the Snowman, with Jackie Vernon as the voice of the film's eponymous hero, and  Twas the Night Before Christmas, as recited by Joel Grey.

title: Further intimations of immortality
description: Ernest Becker died, at 49, of cancer not long after the publication of his stunning work The Denial of Death. He was awarded the 1974 Pulitzer Prize for the book, justly and posthumously.

title: Four Gold Medals. Won by Thailand
description: BANGKOK (AP)Thailand continued it's sweep of the gold medals today in the Southeast Asia Peninsular Games by winning the first four events.

title: Humphrey, at 30% in Poll, Widens Democratic Lead
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota has significantly widened his lead as the first choice of Democratic voters for the Presidential nomination next year, a Gallup poll reported today.

title: Events Today
description: Fifth Avenue Holiday Festival: choral groups, jazz, dancers and puppets on Fifth Avenue, Which will be closed to traffic from 34th to 57th Streets; 11 A.M. to 3 P.M.

title: One Out of Four in the Total City Labor Force Is Reported Living in Queens
description: Herbert Bienstock, in a review of the economic scene in Queens at the annual luncheon meeting of the Queensboro Council for Social Welfare in Jamaica, reported that one out of every tour persons in New York City's resident labor force was living in the county.

title: Martha Tiernan To Be Married
description: Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Coxe Stokes of Bryn Mawr, Pa., East Hampton, L. I., and Delray Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of Mrs. Stokes's daughter, Martha Knight Tiernan, to John A. Muldoon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis H. Muldoon of Lafayette Hill, Pa.

title: Rhode Island Boy Victor in Run
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)John Murphy, of Warren, R.I., sprinted past Robert Lopez of Glendale, Ariz., in the last 50 yards of the senior boys' threemile event for a narrow victory today in the national Amateur Athletic Union Junior. Olympic crosscountry championships. Murphy is 16 years old, Lopez 17.

title: Most of GarbageStrike Mess Cleared
description: About 1,700 drivers and helpers for private carting concerns, working overtime, had succeeded by late yesterday in collecting most of the 70,000 tons of garbage and trash that accumulated during their 11day strike, which ended early Friday.

title: British Capture MostWanted Terrorist
description: LONDON, Dec. 13 (AP)Scotland Yard said today that Michael Wilson, the most wanted terrorist in Britain, had been captured after a sixday siege ended yesterday with the surrender of four gunmen of the Irish Republican Army and the release of their two hostages.

title: For a Mansion To Make It, Good Looks Aren't Enough
description: There was a time, a decade or more ago, when the period splendor or illustrious history of a mansion virtually guaranteed its preservation as a housemuseum if it couldn't be sold as a place to live.

title: Lawyer Fiance Of Jane E. Eger; January Bridal
description: Dr. and Mrs. Sherman Alfred Eger of BalaCynwyd, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Jane Elizabeth Eger, to Charles Bingham Penrose Van Pelt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Van Pelt of Radnor, Pa., Newport, R. I. and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Delgado, Pianist, Heard in Debut
description: Eduardo Delgado, an Argentine pianist who made his New York debut in Alice Tully Hall last Mondaynight, has studied in this country with Dora Zaslaysky, Rosina Lhevinne and Daniel Pollack, and he has won many awards. He is an impressive artist in many ways, frus trating in some.

title: Tax Expert Offers Plan for Stimulating Jersey City Renewal
description: A plan for restructuring Jersey City's property tax could be a model to stimulate development and renewal in other major cities of the state and in most of the older urban areas of the Northeast, according to the author of the proposal.

title: Occupation: househusband
description: The sexual revolution in this country started when the first Beatniks questioned the intrinsic value of putting on a clean Arrow shirt every day and going to work. HaightAshbury combined this questioning with music and dope, and Charles Reich wrote about a new Consciousness that had begun to spread among middleclass youth. These kids had grown up watching their mothers and fathers act out predetermined roles: the menhusbands and providers; the womenwives and helpmates.

title: He Doesn't Have To Play Kennedy Any More
description: William Devane has reached the point in his career at which he is being asked for his autograph by admirers who do not know his name. Hey, that's the guy who played Kennedy, they say, remembering him in the television special The Missiles of October. The Kennedy magic seems to have rubbed off on him. He presently inhabits the Camelot of actors, a land where parts fall in your lap and famous directors want you badly. He knows he will never have to carry a spear again, or drive a taxi, or work nights as a janitor, or do any of the odd jobs that kept him going when he was marking time in the herd of hopefuls.

title: Those Big Trades
description: Yankee Stadium is the shrine of the home run, not the stolen base. The monuments and plaques in center field honoring Babe Ruth, Lou Gehrig, Joe DiMaggio and Mickey Mantle are tributes to power, not speed. Through five decades those big hitters carried the Yankees to pennants and World Series championships. Carried is precisely the word. As good as the: pitchers and the glovemen and the base stealers were, the big hitters carried them. Bobby Bonda has the look of a big hitter who might carry, the Yankees to another pennant. He had carried them into contention last season until he hurt his knee. But new he has been sacrificed as the catalyst in two big trades designed to provide more speed and more double plays. The Yankees needed more speed and more double plays. But now they need a big hitter to them.

title: SEOUL SENTENCES OPPOSITION CHIEF
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 13South Korea's opposition leader, Kim Dee Jung, was sentenced to a year's confinement today on a charge of having violated the country's election laws.

title: O my generation
description: O my generation

title: Socialist Assails Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 13 (AP)The Presidential candidate of the Socialist Workers Party has accused the city of Atlanta of harassment after his acquittal of charges of disorderly conduct and criminal trespass. The charges against Peter Camejo were lodged after he was arrested Feb. 3 outside a downtown hotel where President Ford was speaking. City Solicitor Mary. Welcome asked that the charges be dropped Thursday, offering no explanation.

title: SWEDES' U.N. VOTE UPSETS ISRAELIS
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 13Relations between Sweden and Israel, two nations that have maintained strong diplomatic and ideological links, have been jolted by, Sweden's crucial vote last week in the United Nations Security Council.

title: Sunday Observer
description: When will press and television heave themselves out of the antique mire and start making distinctions between news and media events? The editor's traditional answer to criticsI just print what happensis no longer good enough. Nowadays, when even psychotics intuitively understand the technology of publicity, a great deal of what happens is made to happen only because somebody knows the editor will print it or broadcast it.

title: Many Top Military Ranks Earn More Than Civilian Superiors
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP) Many generals and admirals now make more money each year than do the civilian secretaries of the armed forces to whom they are responsible, the latest Defense Department calculations of regular military compensation show.

title: Power Captures Medley
description: Maurice Weaver ran his anchor mile in 4 minutes 16.8 seconds yesterday as Power Memorial won the distance medley in the meet record time of 10 minutes 28.9 seconds at the Catholic High Schools Relay Carnival in the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Charismatics Alive and Well on L.I.
description: MASSAPEQUA  A few years ago, Long Island's traditionally conservative churches were confronted by a spiritual renaissance that forced many clergymen to reevaluate their own roles.

title: Mine Road: Fact or Fancy?
description: MONTAGUE  A modest, twolane blacktop road runs along the bank of the Delaware River in the northwest corner of the state, passing through woods and bordering fields on its way to Port Jervis, N.Y., where it joins U.S. 209 and herds of trucks heading for Kingston.

title: SOVIET CHALLENGED ON A PRISON FILM
description: PARIS, Dec. 13 (AP)The French Communist party, in an apparent new assertion of independence from Moscow, urged the Soviet Union yesterday to, speak out on the accuracy of a film said to have been shot clandestinely in a Soviet prison camp and said to show intolerable conditions.

title: The End of 2 Years of New Oil Leasing Program Is Marked by Smaller Bids on Fewer Tracts Off California
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The sale of oil leases off Southern California last Thursday, the first in the socalled frontier areasthose areas never before exploredmarked the end of the second year of the accelerated leasing program on the outer continental shelf.

title: 2,800 Still Unpaid For Summer Work In U.S. Program
description: An estimated 2,800 youths, some of whom worked as much as four weeks in the city's federally financed sevenweek summer jobs program, have yet to receive their checks.

title: New Terminal Will Display Old Steamship Posters
description: A dash of nostalgic glamour will be added to the new Passenger Steamship Terminal between West 48th and 52d Streets on Wednesday.

title: EMANUEL KRASOVSKY IS IMPOSING AT PIANO
description: Seemingly effortless pianism and admirable musicianship made Emanue Krasovsky's debut recital at the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Saturday afternoon a success of a sort.

title: Hall of Science Shows Space Stamp
description: This Sunday marks the third anniversary of the Flight of Apollo 17, the last manned mission to the moon.

title: LifeorDeath Hospital Sentry
description: MONTCLAIR Nick Molinaro is not a doctor or a nurse, but his job at Mountainside Hospital here can mean the difference between life and death.

title: Celebrating The Mollusk
description: The American Museum of Natural History has opened an exhibition that is, in essence, a celebration of the mollusk in its diverse roles in nature and human activity. Most members of this basic division, or phylum, of the animal kingdom are enclosed in shells; they include oysters, clams and mussels. According to the museum, mollusks are exceeded only by the insects in the number and diversity of their species. Shown here are examples of ornaments and figures made from mollusk shells.

title: Area in Massapequa in Dispute
description: MASSAPEQUA  While both the local merchants and the Massapequa Chamber of Commerce agree that the aging downtown shopping area extending along Broadway from the railroad station here needs revitalization, there seems to be little coon mon ground between the two factions on how to achieve the change.

title: Kisinger to Meet Bonn Aide
description: BONN, Dec. 13 (Reuters)Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger will meet Foreign Min ister HansDietrich Genscher of West Germany on Monday in Mr. Kissinger's native town, Frth, for talks on the world energy conference, opening in Paris the following day.

title: Irish Rout St.Francis Of Loretto
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 13 (UPI)  Adrian Dantley scored 37 points today as Notre Dame routed St. Francis of Pennsylvania; 10373, for Digger Phelps's 100th career victory as a major college basketball coach.

title: U.J.A. HEAD URGES SHIFT IN GIFT VIEW
description: The head of the United Jewish Appeal called on American Jews last night to cease tying their gifts to the threat to life in Israel but to regard their contributions, instead, as a Jewish form of taxationa moral obligation.

title: 2 Resign City Fund Posts Over Hiring of Cavanagh
description: Two directors of the Fund for the City of New York resigned yesterday to protest its decision to hire James A. Cavanagh after the loss of his job as First Deputy Mayor.

title: South Korea Restoring Ancient Capital as Reminder of Nation's Heritage and as a Tourist Attraction
description: KYONGJU, South Korea A young Korean artist put the finishing touches on the gilded statue of Buddha at the Pulguksa Temple, then knelt in prayer with his head touching the lacquered base under the seated Buddha's feet.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Dec. 19  Greater Rockaway Auto Sports Society meeting at Piedmont Restaurant, 78 Barbour Street, Haledon, N.J., 8:30 P.M: Interested persons welcome.

title: TV VIEW
description: The most intriguing moments on television this season come during football games on the weekends. They are commercials. A presentable middleaged man introduces himself on camera; declares that women are getting out of hand, taking over; suggests that men strike back by carrying sardines with them wherever they go, on the bus, to the theater, at night in bed. This message, we are advised, is brought to us by the Norway Sardine Industry. What does it tell us about surprising and inscrutable Scandinavia?

title: LABORITES ROUTED BY CONSERVATIVES IN AUSTRALIA VOTE
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Sunday, Dec. 14In an apparently overwhelming swing to the right, Australian voters have swept the Liberal Party of Malcolm Fraser, the caretaker Prime Minister, into office with the biggest coalition majority in the history of the Australian federation.

title: Rich and Poor Lands Set for Paris Talks
description: PARIS, Dec. 13A major conference of rich and poor nations opens next week in Paris in an effort to get work under way in commissions on energy, commodities, thirdworld development and finance in an effort to spread economic activity more equally around the world.

title: Election Board Faces Key Test Over Putting Rules Into Effect
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The Federal Election Commission, unable thus far to win Congressional approval for any of its reform regulations, faces a critical confrontation next week with its chief critics in the House.

title: R. F. Graham Weds Miss Lancina
description: Virginia Adams Lancina and Russell Frost Graham, who are with the United States Embassy in San Jos, Costa Rica, were married yesterday noon in San Jos. The Rev. Howard McClintock performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd.

title: Lynne Dryzga Plans August Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Dryzga of Bogota, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lynne Marie Dryzga, to J. Nigel Anderson, son of Dr. and Mrs. Keith Anderson of Littleborough, Lancashire, England.

title: The Year in Sports Books: Ali, Moe Berg and Others
description: A False Spring, by Pat Jordan, 277 pages, Dodd, Mead, $7.95. A literate, introspective memoir of a bonus baby who failed.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Holiday travelers who are interested in numismatics and will be visiting Washington, D.C., should make an extra effort to spend some time at the National Museum of History and Technology of the Smithsonian Institutionspecifically, the Division of Numismatics. The substance and quality of its exhibits, have always made this a fascinating place for anyone who is interested in more than just the present market value and growth potential of his collection of coins and paper money, but currently the Division of Numismatics is offering something extraa major Bicentennial exhibit entitled The History of Banking in America. It tells the story of America's involvement in money and banking, from colonial barter systems to the sophisticated electronic money handling of todaya numismatic story that serious collectors never tire of delving into.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: Legislators Support Israel
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 13 (AP)Sweden's parliament, at the closing of its fall session today, passed a resolution strongly supporting Israel.

title: Criminals At Large
description: It was in the American West that the privateeye mystery novel came to fruition. The progenitors were, of course, Hammett and Chandler, to be followed by Ross Macdonald. It was they who established the form and content of the species  the idea of the triumph of logic and rightness; the concept of the private eye as knight in armor (seedy and frustrated though his life may be); the complications of the plot; even the concept of womankind often being more dangerous than the male of the species (Kipling had said that years back, but he was a poet, and as such not to be taken seriously).

title: Cohalan Battling Islip G.O.P. Chief
description: ISLIPThe Suffolk County Republican Party, already reeling from unexpected defeats in last month's elections, has received another hard slap because of a bitter tend over the issue of bossism between the Islip Town Supervisor and the G.O.P. leader here.

title: News of The Realty Trade
description: The Standard Chartered Bank Limited has leased approximately 75,000 square feet of office and banking space at 160 Water Street for 20 years at an aggregate rent of more than $10million.

title: Colonial House Will Be Saved
description: LEBANON  Residents of this rural Hunterdon County area are drawing up plans for the restoration of a 200yearold fieldstone farmhouse on the grounds of the new $7.5million Voorhees High School.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Jobs Where the Need Is
description: In this period when few things go right in Washington, some reassurance can be drawn from the admirable job done by Congressional conferees last week in reconciling Senate and House versions of a bill to help stimulate employment in areas of maximum need through public works and special antirecession revenue sharing.

title: What makes Simpson Run?
description: Just ask him. There's nothing shy about O.J. Simpson: Running, man, that's what I do. All my life I've been a runner. At the playgrounds, when I was growing up, I was O.J. I came into the park and I didn't have to wait to play. Everyone wanted me on his team.

title: Digging Plants Instead of Drugs
description: From the barred windows of the grim monolith that is the Manhattan Psychiatric Center, a formal garden can be seen with a pond, stone benches, shrubs, trees and a spreading yew 70 years old.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market turned mixed last week in moderate trading with investors awaiting further indications of the scope and pace of the nation's economic recovery.

title: Editors' Choice
description: General

title: Ford and Rumsfeld Confer
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (UPI) President Ford met today with Defense Secretary Donald H. Rumsfeld and other top Pentagon officials to hear their arguments against his plans to cut military spending next year.

title: For young readers
description: Were I outside the law, I should not like to be stalked by Mr. Wyatt Blassingame. He has science on his side. I have only my wits, out of which (having read his book and fancying myself a criminal) I am very thoroughly scared. Scientific detection. I discover, is pitiless. Makes you long for bloodhounds and the bogs. I can't touch anything (fingerprints), can't say anything (voice prints), can't breathe (breath prints), can't smoke (saliva prints), can't even sweatsecretor that I amwithout leaving more incriminating prints. Nor can I buy a newspaper to see how close Blassingame is getting to my hideout, because a faithful likeness of me (for which no photograph exists) would be on the front page, done by a police artist with the aid of something called a MugaMinute or IdentiKit. I'll take the bloodhounds any time.

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: To the long list of ancient and historical ruins that figure in the annals of architecture, the United States has added a stunning example of instant 20thcentury archeology: the abandoned ABM site near Grand Forks, N.D. The announcement that this $5.7 billion investment in the miscalculations of the cold war is to become a dead installation virtually on completion could keep social commentators busy and bitter indefinitely. But as architectural commentary it is even more intriguing. The implicit message of this group of structures as design and symbolism could occupy a generation of polemicists.

title: Late. TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the opening paragraphs of his Point of View article [Nov. 30], Edward Sulzberger admits that new construction is virtually nonexistent here. One has the right to question why.

title: Soviet Population Growth
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)The population of the Soviet Union will exceed 320 million by the year 2,000, according to a Soviet demographer, Oleg Konstantinov, Tass reports.

title: Father's Tribute Is Read At Diggs Family's Rites
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 13Most of the 1,000 friends and relatives who packed a street here this morning wept as the five hearses bearing the coffins of Jean Diggs and her four children, who were shot to death a week ago in their home, drevir up in front of the. Presbyterian Church of Teaneck.

title: The MiniVietnam in Angola
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa The Angolan mess bears some resemblance to Vietnam, if on a smaller scale. The civil war started among rival nationalists after the principle of independence had been gained and foreigners intervened to suit their global interests. But, unlike Vietnam, no greatpower intruder came from regions near the chosen battlefield.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A:

title: DA VINCI TRIO HEARD IN RARE BEETHOVEN
description: A modest and engaging program of rarely heard works by Beethoven was played by the Da Vinci String Trio and guest artists in Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night.

title: The ChieftainsIrish Music From the Source
description: If it weren't for The Chieftains, the truth about Irish music might have remained a well  kept secret from Americans, buried by that assimilation process which pressured Irish and other immigrants to abandon their native culture once on American soil. Many Americans might persist in believing Irish music to be songs like MacNamara's Band, Danny Boy and the music of The Clancy Brothers (who were a sort of halfway house between authentic old songs and the American folk music industry a la Kingston Trio), rather than the wild jigs and reels, impish hornpipes and raucous slides played by this sevenman instrumental group on their latest album Chieftains 5.

title: Baseball's Musical Chairs: 82 Shift in 31 Deals
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 13  You probably couldn't blatne Bill Veeck for all of it, but In the 48 hours after the old whirling dervish got back into baseball this week, the talent market exploded into one of the fastest trading sprees in history.

title: Victorian Setting For Christmas
description: A tree strung with cranberries and popcorn in a room full of fine Victorian furniture conjures up an oldfashioned Christmas at Kingsland House, home of the Queens Historical Society.

title: Bill Allows CallUp Of 50,000 Reserves For 90 Days' Duty
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 13 (AP) The President could order up to 50,000 military reservists to active duty for 90 days under a bill cleared for Senate action.

title: DEVELOPER DROPS HOTEL PLAN HERE
description: Plans to build a spectacular 54story, $180 million luxury hotel that was to have been the centerpiece of a Times Square revitalization have been abandoned for lack of investor interest, John Portman, the Atlantabased architectdeveloper, said yesterday.

title: By 1980 It May Be Like Any Other Industrialized Nation
description: WARSAWThe hard work has paid off, according to Edward Gierek, leader of Poland's United Workers (Communist) Party. By 1980, the leadership hopes, food queues will have disappeared, housing will plentiful, washing machines available for all, traffic jams an everyday occurrence and Poland will a major European industrial power.

title: Polish Children Learn Tradition
description: RIVERHEADEvery Saturday morning, a group of 40 children forgo the pleasure of a day off from school for the rigors of a halfday session at the Maximillian Kolbe Polish Language School at St. Isidore's Church here.

title: Central State Triumphs
description: CRAWFORDSVILLE, Ind., Dec. 13 (AP)Central State Captured the Cannonball Classic basketball tournament today with an 8476 victory over Wabash. Cliff Bell of Wabash led all scorers with 26 points.

title: VERDICTS LINKED TO SPEECH STYLE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec 13Subtle differences in the way lawyers and witnesses speak in the courtroom can have a profound effect on the outcome of a criminal trial, two anthropologists said here recently.

title: WOMANSHOP OWNER IS SHOT IN ROBBERY
description: The 60yearold wife of the owner of a Brooklyn drycleaning store was shot and seriously wounded last night after her husband resisted two armed robbers in the shop, the police reported.

title: A FiveSense Center Delights Children
description: MORRISTOWN  Which fur feels like Arthur's? Mary Denny, director of preschool activities at the Morris Museum of Arts and Sciences, asks an eager group of 3and 4year olds. Arthur is a fat, contented rabbit.

title: Lefkowitz to Propose Measure To Restrict Use of Toxic PCB
description: The State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, says he will propose a law during the next session of the Legislature to restrict and possibly phase out the use of toxic PCB in electrical equipment manufactured, sold and used in New York State.

title: Right Turns on Red Proposed
description: NEWARKA proposal to permit New Jersey motorists to turn right, with caution, even when the red traffic light is against them is expected to be, presented to the Byrne administration for action shortly.

title: Pilot Brink Keeps School on Course
description: Feet on the desk, phone at his ear, Dave Brink sits in the pilot house of the 50yearold ferryboat. He is too busy keeping the Pioneer Marine School on course to pay much attention to the parade of barges, tugs and freighters plying the East River just off his bow. The school, located at the South Street Seaport Museum in the retired ferryboat Maj. William Hart, is an effort to help former drug addicts and unemployed young men by turning them into skilled marine mechanics.

title: 9 Women Set Mark In Nonstop Rowing
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13 (UPI)  A ninemember women's crew of the University of California, Los Angeles, established a world record for both, time and distance in marathon rowing today, covering 110.77 miles in 24 hours 1 minute.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on publicworks appropriations bill, which passed, 81 to 5, Dec. 5.

title: It's That Time of Year for Baby Sitters
description: Employment agencies handling baby sitters are urging parents to look now for New Year's Eve or resign themselves to greeting the Bicentennial at home.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: An acceleration in the shift of the United States population away from the industrialized North to the South and West has been documented by the Census Bureau. The trend, if it continues, could mean a tipping of the balance of political power toward the sunbelt regions when Congress is reapportioned on the basis of the 1980 census.

title: RoadFund Shift Could Aid Transit
description: The State Transportation Commissioner has raised the possibility of exchanging some of New Jersey's Federal allocations for interstate highway construction for transit construction funds.

title: ...Incumbency's Perils
description: The once influential Eastern Republicans of a more progressive bent have meanwhiledespite their continuing ability to win gubernatorial and Senate seats in their own statesseen their power in national G.O.P. affairs steadily dwindle. Nelson Rockefeller has shown himself unable to repeat the earlier intraparty triumphs of Wendell Winkle, Thomas E. Dewey and Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: Open letter to an Israeli friend
description: Dear Amos, For a while at least, we no longer have to live with the constant danger of another Middle Eastern war. A badly needed breathing spell began last August, when Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger finally succeeded in working out the new arrangements in the Sinai between Israel and Egypt.

title: New Luminous Fish Found
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Dec. 13. (Agence FrancePresse)A new luminescent fish has been discovered at a depth of 6,000 feet off Amboina Island in the south Moluccas, it has been announced here. The fish reportedly gave off such a bright light that all lamps in an expedition vessel's laboratory could be switched off during its examination.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: AROSA, Switzerland, Dec. 13 (UPI)Karl Anderson of Greene, Me., won a European Cup downhill ski race today, beating a teammate, Andy Mill of Aspen, Colo., by almost one second. The United States downhill coach, HansPeter Rohr, brought his team here, skipping the World Cup Races at Madonna Di Campiglio. With all the other top racers in Italy, the Americans faced little competition. Erwin Josi, Switzerland, was third and two other Americans, Billy Taylor of Orchard Park, N. Y., and Dave Currier of Madison, N. H., were sixth and seventh, respectively.

title: Balky Inmates on Rikers Island Finally Agree to Cell Transfers
description: Persuasion by the Commissioner of Correction, and a show of force by batonequipped correction officers yesterday averted what a spokesman said could have grown into a serious problem at the House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island, the scene of a 17hour revolt late last month.

title: Holiday Rappings Joyously Danced At Judson Church
description: Steeped in the innocent tradition of Christmas and wisein the ways of theater, Christmas Rappings returned joyously to Judson Memorial Church Friday evening. Absent for two years, the production shows some changes in detail, but Dan Wagoner's choreography retains its happy pulse, and the music of Al Carmines lovingly and amusingly embraces the lyrics of the Gospel.

title: It's Goodbye to Connelly's, a Venerable Irish Saloon
description: In 1915, Thomas Connelly, a County Sligo man, opened a saloon in New York. It had: one bar with cigar show case and brass foot rail, one 10tap combination ale and beer outfit with one water faucet, one National Cash Register machine.

title: Saving the earth from and for people
description: How to save your piece of the planet by the people who are already doing it. Thus the Sierra Club introduces its new Grass Roots Primer. While it aims to document and celebrate the role of this country's grassroots environmental activists and show others how to join their ranks,

title: Was Avon Calling at the Wrong Door?
description: Wall Street reacted to the news of Avon Products Inc.'s first proposed diversification by acquisition almost as though a beautiful and popular glamour girl had announced her engagement to an aging drifter.

title: N. Michigan Wins, 1614, in Camellia
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 13 (AP)Randy Awrey bolted 67 yards for the winning touchdown on the first play of the second half today, and Northern Michigan beat Western Kentucky, 1614, in the Camellia Bowl.

title: The Last Of the Optimists
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The most consoling things in print these days are the advertisements. The novelists seem to have given up on the human race. The reporters are hooked on disaster. Even the poets and preachers emphasize our sins and shortcoming, but the adwriters, bless their cunning souls are still appealing, not only to our vanity and greed, but to our better natures and even to the old values.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Time Is Past For Tedious Craft of Weaving Baskets
description: CLAREMONT, N.H When the hills are incandescent with fall's fires Vic Pomiecko of Claremont and. I often go forth for wild mushrooms, and I never cease to admire, the willow basket he carries, a basket made by this father years before.

title: Kicking Up Those Creative Heels, on SelfDesigned Holiday Cards
description: MT. KISCO, N.Y.There is only one appropriate way to say Merry Christmas at 1 Bittersweet Lane and that is to say it with foxes.

title: ART VIEW
description: The chase and capture of a great work of art is one of the most exciting endeavors lifeas dramatic, emotional, and fulfilling as a love affair. And love affairs, at least some of them, should be told about. With these words, which I quote from the opening of a new essaymemoir by Thomas P. F. Hoving, published to coincide with the opening of the current Patterns of Collecting show, the illustrious director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art emerges in yet another new rolethat of the Casanova, or at least the Frank Harris, of art collecting.

title: New Plan for U.S. Pavilion
description: If an imaginative planner has his way, the longabandoned United States Pavilion in Flushing MeadowsCorona Park will blossom as an international festival.

title: Death of Man Who Stopped Fight Puzzles Police
description: Queens detectives investigating the death of 52yearold Frederick C. Pirone, whose body was found in Queens Thursday night after he intervened to stop a fight between girls, said yesterday that they were puzzled by some aspects of the case.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: A gardenereven the greenestshould receive bad marks if he cannot name the kind of evergreen tree he buys for Christmas decorating. Pine Tree, the common sobriquet, is not always accurate for there are many types of evergreens sold for the annual holiday trimming ritual. And there are specific ways to know the identification of each.

title: Setback Held Blow To Dugan's Place
description: TRENTON  Governor Byrne's political victory over State Senator James P. Dugan in determining the Democratic leadership of the State Senate was reported last week to have seriously undermined the Hudson County Senator's position as Democratic state chairman and his continued influence in the Legislature.

title: Revenue Sharing Criticized in a Study
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 13The nation's fiveyear, $30.2 billion Federal general revenuesharing program, which was predicated on the idea of involving citizens in local spending decisions, instead has tended to insulate local officials from citizen involvement, according to a study of the program made in 67 communities.

title: State To Preserve Pine Barrens Tract
description: PEMBERTON TOWNSHIP More than 1,800 acres of historic pine barrens in this part of Burlington County have been saved by the Nature Conservancy and the New Jersey Conservation Foundation from the threat of possible development.

title: Lisbon to Add to Autonomy Of the Azores and Madeira
description: LISBON, Dec. 13Portugal agreed today to give greater regional autonomy to the Azores and Madeira.

title: Food News
description: MOUNTAINSIDE  Crme fraiche, the delight of the Frenchtrained gourmet sauce and pastry chef everywhere, is here at lastbut at a whopping $5 a pint.

title: Vote Is Due On a Bill to Aid Victims Of Violence
description: TRENTONThe police and hospitals in New Jersey would have to inform the victims of violent crimes of their right to compensation under the terms of a bill the Assembly leadership hopes to bring to a vote tomorrow.

title: Couple Makes Farm a Haven for Unwanted Animals
description: COLTS NECKTheir menageries having outgrown the properties they had in North Jersey and upstate New York, Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Brooke have established a haven for abandoned and neglected animals on a 50acre former horse farm here.

title: Sentiment Against Cubans Is Found Growing in Miami Over the Terrorism Linked to AntiCastro Exiles
description: WARSAW, Dec. 13A strong and growing antiCuban sentiment has become evident here in recent weeks, principally a result of a wave of terrorism attributed by law enforcement agencies to antiCastro exiles.

title: BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Christmas tree prices are up, but the business seems to be rebounding from a slump last season anyway.

title: Banks Pledge $170 Million To Rescue State Agencies
description: A syndicate of major banks and brokerage firms here agreed yesterday to furnish $170 million to rescue two state construction agencies from default tomorrow even if a bipartisan accord has not been reached on the state's budget crisis.

title: State's Presidential Primary in April Shapes Up as Democratic FreeforAll
description: Despite the efforts of Governor Carey and the Democratic state chairman, Patrick J. Cunningham, to promote an uncommitted proCarey delegation to the Democratic National Convention, a freeforall involving at least a halfdozen contenders is shaping up in the New York Presidential primary.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: ART

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Although children have long been one of the most popular of all photographic subjects, especially with parentphotographers, this is the time of year when they are the focal point of even more pictures than usual. All too often, however, the pictures that result are enough to make a true photographer's soul cringeyoungsters staring grimly into the camera, or smiling artificially while trying to say cheese, or squinting bravely into the sun.

title: Why Couldn't This Lady Have an Unhappy Ending?
description: LOS ANGELES In movies the question of how to end a story arises more frequently than audiences may realize. A fascinating case in point is the recent radical alteration in the ending of the expensive sea adventure, Lucky Lady, starring Liza Minnelli, Gene Hackman and Burt Reynolds, which opens in New York on Christmas day. The history of this film sheds light on the complex process of filmmaking and decisionmaking in Hollywood, the nature of popular storytelling and, quite possibly, the mood of the contemporary audience. Hollywood has always favored happy endings, but there may be times when the public is more desperate for upbeat endings and less receptive to disturbing endings.

title: Miss Coburn Wed To P. M. Goldberg
description: Deborah Kay Coburn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herschel James Coburn of East Brunswick, N. J., was married here early yesterday evening to Paul Michael Goldberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Goldberg of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: DAVID WEBB DIES; JEWELER WAS 50
description: David Webb, a trendsetting jewelry designer and maker, who won the favor of socially prominent women with his bracelets of enameled animals and, other creations in precious stones and metals, died Friday of cancer at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 50 years old and lived here.

title: Buffalo Musicians Are Pleasing In Avant Concert at the kitchen
description: Avantgarde concerts are often risky affairs, even if some of us actually enjoy the risk. So it's all the more welcome when a concert of new music comes along that is enjoyable pretty much from start to finish, and that was the case with the perceptively selected, imaginatively and conscientiously performed concert put on Friday night at the Kitchen by members of the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts of the State University at Buffalo.

title: Astronomy Courses Offered in Queens
description: A series of four Saturday courses about astronomy for youngsters ages 9 through 14 will be offered at the Hall of Science in Flushing beginning Jan. 3.

title: An Eggshell for All Seasons
description: The humble eggshell, which in most homes ends up in the garbage can, is the basic working material of a devoted and enthusiastic group of crafts people.

title: 'Skins Eliminated After a 100 Lead
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 13Spotting the Washington Redskins 10 points in the last minute of the first quarter, the Dallas Cowboys took command in the last three quarters and earned a place in the National Football League playoffs with a 3110 victory today.

title: Eva Le Gallienne Returns
description: WASHINGTONAbout a half a century ago, a vibrant young actress, the toast of Broadway, appeared at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, playing scenes from Macbeth in An Evening With Will Shakespeare, opposite Basil Rathbone.

title: Rolling Stones Concert On Easter Isle Rejected
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 13 (AP)  The Chilean Government has rejected plans for a Rolling Stones concert on Easter Island because the whole future of the island was going to be damaged, the Bureau of Tourism said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: In Warsaw : Party Talks And Tinsel
description: WARSAW, Dec. 13Despite the recent presence here of some of the world's mightiest Communists, Warsaw residents have been showing a much livelier interest in Christmas shopping than in oratory and ceremony.

title: Guide for ChooseandCuts
description: Following are some farms and nurseries from which chooseandcut trees may be obtained:

title: How Long Can ABT Depend on Its Galaxy of Stars?
description: When the repertory season of American Ballet Theater opens on the night of Dec. 22d with Mikhail Baryshnikov in Giselle, it will inaugurate a series of performances resplendent with guest stars. Besides Baryshnikov, ABT will be presenting Natalia Makarova, Erik Bruhn, Carla Fracci and Marcia Hayde. In the past, many dance companies have hired a guest star or two to add glitter to a season, but never in memory has one company booked as many as six superguests. Yet this burst of brilliance by ABTalthough sure to provide many glamorous and exciting evenings and keep the box office humming could turn out in the longrun, according to a number of its principal dancers, to be the company's undoing.

title: State Trustees Challenge Meyner's Eligibility for Pension
description: TRENTONThe State of New Jersey has challenged former Gov. Robert B. Meyner's eligibility for his $5,820 yearly state pension, and has asked Attorney General William F. Hylan to give a formal option.

title: Yankee HonestyThe Strength of Copley's Portraits
description: John Singleton Copley, the subject of a new exhibition at the Hirschl & Adler Galleries, was born in 1738 and died in 1815, which means that his span of 77 years was divided right down the middle by 1776. So was his art, for he began as an American colonial painter and ended as a star, of the Royal Academy in London, having leftor is the word fled?the notyetUnited States for the thenmother country in the crucial year of 1774.

title: A Small Town's Banker In Iowa
description: JEFFERSON, IowaGerald Clause, president of the Home State Bank of Jefferson, fell into banking at the age of 18 when he tumbled off a hayrack and broke his neck.

title: Dutch Government Is Thwarted in Its Efforts to Break Siege by East Asian Terrorists Holding Hostages
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Dec. 13The Dutch Government seemed at a loss today to end the sieges of two Ease Asian terrorist groups that are holding a total of 49 hostages on a stalled train and in a foreign consulate.

title: Richard Jones Jr. Planning to Wed Virginia White
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Bradford White of Woodmere, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Virginia Lawrence White, a physical education teacher at the Lawrence Country Day School in Hewlett, L.I., to Richard Steiner Jones Jr., assistant headmaster there. Mr. Jones is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jones of Southbury, Conn. A March wedding is planned.

title: Mallory Mullen, Mark P. Finger Plan Marriage
description: Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Francis Mullen of Pittsburgh have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mallory Forbes Mullen to Mark Peter Finger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Maxwell Finger of Rockville, Centre, L. I.

title: No. 2 Berth in Tennis Final Is a Headache for Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 13 (AP)  Will Lennart Bergelin, Sweden's nonplaying tennis captain, choose the young hero again or try a veteran who knows the center court better than any other player on the team for the No. 2 singles spot in the 1975 Davis Cup final against Czechoslovakia?

title: PANEL OF WOMEN VIEWS CITY CRISIS
description: Men make bad municipal housekeepers, Donna Shalala said yesterday at a conference called by the Women's City Club of New York on the city's fiscal crisis.

title: Asimina Katsampes Fiancee of Engineer
description: Dr. and Mrs. Chris P. Katsampes of Short Hills, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Asimina Constance Katsampes, to Robert John Fergusson Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Fergusson of Hanover, N.J.

title: CALLAWAY SCORE REAGAN IN SOUTH
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 13Howard H. Callaway, President Ford's campaign manager, accused Ronald Reagan today of ineptitude as Governor of California and irresponsibility as a Presidential candidate.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: A REAL ECONOMIC GROWTH RATE OF 5 PERCENT TO 6 PERCENT next year and overall growth continuing at 4 percent into 1977, were predicted by the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.... The University of Michigan's consumer confidence index from midOctober to midNovember held to previous bimonthly figure of 75.4 [February 1966=100] indicating continuing consumer fears on unemployment and business conditions.

title: SCHLESINGER GAVE WARNING ON SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13, (Reuters)  Former Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger gave a pessimistic appraisal last spring of the Soviet Union's willingness to abide by agreements reached in strategic arms talks, according to Congressional testimony made public today.

title: Senegal Plans Marine Park
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Dec. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)Senegal plans to turn a group of uninhabited islands off Dakar into a marine national park. The waters surrounding the islands are rich in fish of a variety of species and the islands themselves contain recently discovered Neolithic

title: SOUL CITY SYMPHONY OF VAN M'COY HEARD
description: Van McCoy brought a large orchestra, the Soul City Symphony, full of violins, singers and dancers, to Avery Fisher Hall on Friday, all on the strength of The Hustle. And it does have considerable power, being one of the major hit recordings in the discotheque world, a dance as well as a song.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: De Maio's, 1175 Route 10, Whippany. (201) 8875358

title: Princeton Debates Budget Disclosures
description: PRINCETONWhen a student member of the committee formulating Princeton University's budget made public last month a sheaf of confidential documents, he triggered a debate about the way the school goes about making its budget.

title: Pageant for Aged Is a Senior Salute
description: BELLEVILLE  Montclair State College is helping elderly residents of Essex County prepare a Bicentennial program called A Senior Salute to '76. The college plans to videotape the show and make prints available throughout the state.

title: Melville
description: Herman Melville had the habit of covering his deeper tracks. He left behind only two laconic journals and fewer than three hundred letters. He apparently destroyed Nathaniel Hawthorne's letters, and most of his correspondence with his family is lost.

title: Lawyer Opposes Gag Order
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 13 (AP)Joseph A. De Paul, the lawyer for Ernest N. Cory Jr., who was indicted with Maryland Gov. Marvin Mandel and four other persons by a Federal grand jury last month, has asked a Federal judge to deny the Government's request for a gag order in th case.

title: George Charney, Who Resigned As Top State Communist, Dead
description: George Charney, who resigned as New York State Communist Party chairman in 1958 after becoming disillusioned with the whoe Marxist conception, died yesterday of a heart attack in West Palm Beach, Fla. His age was 70.

title: Economic Indicators
description: MONTHLY COMPARISONS

title: Queens A.S.P.C.A. Offering Pickups
description: A truck to pick up stray animals at various police precincts in Queens has started, according to Encil C. Rains, executive vice president and general manager of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Wild Elephant Kills 9
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Dec. 13 (AP)A wild elephant trampled nine persons to death and injured 10 in two villages in Cox's Bazar, about 90 miles from Chittagong, authorities reported.

title: VERDICTS LINKED TO SPEECH STYLE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec 13Subtle differences in the way lawyers and witnesses speak in the courtroom can have a profound effect on the outcome of a criminal trial, two anthropologists said here recently.

title: A Focus on the Urban Scene
description: NEW BRUNSWICK George Tice, a photographer who celebrates the quiet eloquence of the urban landscape, has chosen New Jersey for the subject of his current exhibit at the Rutgers University Art Gallery.

title: 3514 Triumph, Is Pittsburgh's 1th in Row
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 13We're ready, said Chuck Noll, the coach of the Steelers after his Pittsburgh team routed the Cincinnati Bengals, 3514, today. Ready for the Super Bowl? Ready for whatever comes, replied Noll. We're a good football team.

title: Tanker Is Launched
description: QUINCY, Mass., Dec. 13 (AP) The first United Statesbuilt tanker capable of carrying 125,000 cubic meters of liquefied natural gas was launched today.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: FOR skeptics, pessimists, superstitious persons and those with long memories, there is considerable reason for apprehension in the texture of the yearend forecasts woven by the computers of the economic world in recent weeks.

title: ... As Hundreds Scratch for Jobs
description: PARAMUSLarge department stores in the shopping centers of New Jersey were deluged this holiday season with hundreds of applicants seeking temporary employment, and retailers attributed the high rate of applications to widespread unemployment and a shortage spending money for Christmas gifts.

title: Reagan Met Panamanian and Cuban Exile Leaders in Florida
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 Ronald Reagan, who is seeking the Republican Presidential nomination, had a meeting of minds with political exile leaders from Panama and Cuba last month, and expressed the hope that both countries soon would have their freedom again, an aide said yesterday.

title: 52 Shot Scores at Aqueduct
description: If one word could describe the plight of New York horseplayers 12 days before Christmas, a horse in yesterday's first race at Aqueduct provided it.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Ford Regroups For The Minicar Battle
description: DETROITThe Ford Motor Company is going over to the defensive.

title: STAMPS
description: To start the Bicentennial Year of 1976, the United States is issuing on the first day of the new year a setenant horizontal strip of three 13cent stamps that together make up the Spirit of 76, the painting that became the highlight of the nation's celebration a century ago.

title: He Owes the Soviets a Great Deal
description: WASHINGTONThe engagement of Cuban troops in support of the Sovietbacked Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola seems to indicate that Prime Minister Fidel Castro, faced with a choice between closer links to the United States or deeper commitment to a revolutionary cause, has opted for the latter.

title: Bill Allows CallUp Of 50,000 Reserves For 90 Days' Duty
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 13 (AP) The President could order up to 50,000 military reservists to active duty for 90 days under a bill cleared for Senate action.

title: Rough Riders Sign Coach
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 13 (AP)George Brancato signed a new threeyear contract today as head coach of the Ottawa Rough Riders of the Canadian Football League.

title: Museum Widens Its Vision
description: NEWARKEver since Samuel Miller became director of the Newark Museum in 1967, he has envisioned an institution that would serve Newark and New Jersey as a dynamic cultural center. He has broadened the educational programs, increased the number of exhibitions of a community interest and emphasized, in a variety of displays, the artistic and historic contribution of the state.

title: People/Business
description: It is highly possible that Lionel M. Levey is the best known shoe salesman in New Jersey  under a different name.

title: German Booters on Tour
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 13 (AP)  The Bayern Munich soccer team, which won the European Cup, will play the Universidad Mexico at the Oakland Coliseum the night of Jan. 10. The West German team, with five World Cup players including Franz Beckenbauer on its roster, will make a United States tour which also will include a game in Los Angeles Jan. 11.

title: Joanna Schoen Plans to Marry
description: The engagement of Joanna Tillson Schoen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Charles Schoen of Stony Brook, LI., to Steven Broughton Reminer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Hinck Remmer of Old Greenwich, Conn., has been announced by the future bride's parents.

title: Intelligence Investigations End Though Gaps Remain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The active Congressional investigations of United States intelligence agencies ended this week, though many committee members and staff aides acknowledged that there was a lot they still did not know.

title: Opportunity For the Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  The Democrats now have the opportunitythere may never be a betterto develop an economic and political issue of overriding importance for a 1976 campaign against either Gerald Ford or Ronald Reagan. The issue is full employment; the opportunity arises from Democratic control of Congress at time when the Ford Administration in effect is substituting welfare for an employment strategy, as the Joint Economic Committee recently put it.

title: Transfer Tax Pushing Investors Out of New York
description: Investors are saving money and Wall Street is losing business because of an unusual combination of taxes and technology.

title: Social Security's Weak Underpinning
description: Since its inception, the United States Social Security system has operated like a pyramid, with the wide base expected to pay for the narrow tip. But the base has begun to shrink and the pyramid is wobbling. For the first time this year Social Security income will not cover required benefit payments, making it necessary to dig into the system's reserve fund. If this trend continues, the reserve could be used up by 1982. Even if we shore up the structure in the short term, a major reconstruction job will be necessary to keep it sound after the year 2000.

title: Picking and Caring for a Tree
description: Nurserymen offer some advice on how to select a fresh cut tree and how to care for the tree after you get it home.

title: Camp Follower Offers Aid
description: MORRISTOWNCome on in, said Debbie Van Fleet.

title: Banking on Change
description: The banking legislation that cleared the Senate last week has been called the most sweeping reform of the system since the nineteenthirtieswhich shows just how little legislative reform there has been over the past four decades.

title: Uncertain Race...
description: A Gallup poll showing that former Governor Ronald Reagan has pulled ahead of President Ford among both Republican and independent voters is a startling political event, even though the sample of those polled was fairly small and is subject to possible error of 6 to 8 percentage points in either direction.

title: Christmas Sales Rise . . .
description: WAYNEWith Christmas less than two weeks away, shopkeepers across the state are reporting a surge of buying that in some instances will push sales as much as 25 percent above last year's, when inflation and high unemployment kept sales down.

title: Nassau Agency Starting Campaign to Protect Poor in 11 Areas From Crime
description: HEMPSTEAD  Declaring that poor people are most vulnerable to burglary, theft and a lack of police protection, the Nassau County Economic Opportunity CommisSon has announced that it is starting a community salety and protection campaign in the 11 poverty areas in the county.

title: Chiang Ching Presents Two Dance Premieres
description: As varied a dance concert as one could findand a highly successful onewas given Friday night at Hunter College Playhouse by the Chiang Ching Dance Company.

title: What's Doing in BOCA RATON
description: THE TOWNRumor has it that one of every 43 people in Boca Raton is a millionaire, but anyone expecting much flaunting of wealth will be disappointed. Boca Raton, 40 miles north of the razzledazzle of Miami Beach and 25 miles south of the elegance of Palm Beach, maintains a low profile. The elegant, expensive homes and beachfrost mansioris are wei?? hidden. Of the 52,000 residents, on estimated 50 percent are 65 or older, and except for brief shopping expeditions, these retirees' lives revolve around their private country clubs. The town's restrained atmosphere is seemingly allpervasive. There are no usedcar dealers. There is a Kentucky Fried Chicken Restaurant  minus the redandwhite striped roof. MacDonald's is shorn of its twinarch emblem.

title: Five pounds of odds and ends
description: Of The People's Almanac I can fairly say that I could hardly put it down. I should also say that I could hardly pick it up.

title: Making the Psalms new
description: Blues of the Sky may seem an overlyhip title for poems Interpreted From the Ancient. Hebrew Book of Psalms. But poet David Rosenberg has been at work on them for some two years now, as well as on the Book of Job, and I find these versions of the Psalms20 of themmoving and full of skill. Rosenberg has bunked archaism and chosen a simple diction that favors colloquial American speech without crossing into Are You Running with Me, Jesus? territory.

title: Bidding to Automate the CheckOut
description: The race for the money in product/price scanning devices for supermarkets is shaping up as a classic.

title: Bahia Key Scores By Head on Coast
description: SAN MATEO, Calif.,. Dec. 13 (AP) Bahia Key outdueled Fleet Velvet in the stretch and won the $54,200 Bay, Meadows Handicap by a head today. Holding Pattern, with Bill Shoemaker up, was third, 1 lengths back.

title: John Weeks Stewart to Wed Dorleese Joy Blanton on Jan. 31
description: Mr. and Mrs. Virney R. Blanton of Indian Harbour Beach; Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Dorleese Joy Blanton, to John Weeks Stewart. He is a son of Mrs. Arthur H. Stewart and the adopted. son of Mr. Stewart, of Demarest, N. J. and Southhold L. I. The prospective bridegroom's father, the late John Miran Weeks, was an associate editor of Time magazine.

title: Jordan Star As Rutgers Tops UConn
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 13 (AP)Ed Jordan scored 20 points in the second half and led undefeated Rutgers to its sixth victory of the season, 9683, over Connecticut tonight.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Right vs. Left
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Junior High Is Not Easy to Handle
description: Junior high school students are education's stepchildren, caught at an awkward, inbetween period. They are no longer the beneficiaries of the loving protection lavished on elementary children, but they are not yet getting the academic attention reserved for high school youths edging toward college and career decisions.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONIn The Implosion Conspiracy, his 1973 book on the case of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, trial lawyer Louis Nizer says that the question, Do you think the Rosenbergs were guilty? is a wrong question and can only result in a wrong answer,

title: RIGHTS UNITS SCORE H.E.W. ENFORCEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  A coalition of 57 groups wrote to Dr. F. David Mathews, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare this week outlining what they termed serious problems with the department's civil rights enforcement and calling for prompt, affirmative responses to their concerns.

title: Peter Cole Blasier to Marry Amy B. Nixon, Princeton Student, in June
description: Mrs. H. Howard Updegraff and Clarence B. Nixon Jr., both of Pittsburgh, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Amy Bovard Nixon, to Peter Cole Blasier, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cole Blasier, also of Pittsburgh. A June wedding is planned.

title: New Jersey
description: MUSIC

title: CHESS
description: It's often asserted that a player shows his capacity for positional chess by how well he handles the Ruy Lopez. This opening usually avoids early simplification and consequently leads to middle games where there is ample opportunity for complex maneuvering. Moreover, White's initial advantage is quite limited, so that success depends on fine Appreciation of the relative weights of the important squares.

title: New Jersey Notebook
description: Picatinny Arsenal had more going for it than the arguments of Congressional representatives and the prayers of its thousands of employees when the Defense Department decided to keep the installation open and expand it to become the Army's Armament Development Center.

title: On Lengthy Matters
description: How far should bigness be seen as an aspect of greatness? Does quantityreally conduce to quality? In the field of the American novel there are few doubts as to the answers. Eighty thousand words may be good enough for England, and forty thousand for France, but American novelists blithely put in for a million. I read fearfully of what Norman Mailer is doing: the ultimate Jewish family saga from Egyptian bondage to exodus by spaceship. I have looked at Gaddis's J.R. I tried to read Pynchon's Gravity's Rainbow, hampered by a freak of binding which gave me pp. 1200 twice but missed out on ?? 200400. I remember Marguerite Young's Miss Mackintosh My Darling, reputedly the longest novel ever written. As a mere 80.000worder I feel properly humbled, on my country's behalf as well as my own. In England we have long lost the knack of fictional longitude.

title: Manure Bid, $75; Stud Service
description: BRIDGEHAMPTONTo the standingroomonly crowd that came to bid at the recent Hampton Day School auction, a game of tennis with Clifford Irving, the author whose hoax on Howard Hughes put him in the public eye, was worth $35, while a pickup truck full of horse manure was valued at $75.

title: Can Joe DiMaggo Be 61?
description: Between items on a news broadcast, a message on the television screen read: Twentyfour years ago today, Joe DiMaggio retired from baseball. Twentyfour years. It is incredible, but that means there is a whole generation under 30 that cannot remember that classic. stancefeet wide apart the yellow bat held high beside the right ear. When people under 30 hear the name, chances are they picture a relaxed executivetype extolling the virtues of a coffee maker. Incredible.

title: L.I. Animal Shelter to Gain
description: An exhibition of sculptured jewelry by Manette is being held at the Livingstone Learmonth Gallery, 178 East 72d Street, through Dec. 21. The gallery will donate its share in proceeds from sales to the Hampton Animal Shelter in Bridgehampton, L. I. Hours are 10 A.M. to 5 P.M. on Tuesday through Saturday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A spokesman for Mayor Beame said yesterday that a meeting between administration officials and representatives of the New York Mets would be held this week to discuss the possibility of refurbishing Shea Stadium. The Mayor agreed to the meeting, it was said, after receiving a letter from M. Donald Grant, board chairman of the Mets, noting that the city had rebuilt Yankee Stadium and was contractually obligated to refurbish Shea Stadium, which the Yankees have been using temporarily.

title: Rego Park Housing Wins Small Victory
description: Developers of a proposed housing, commercial and garage complex at the intersection of Queens Boulevard and the Long Island Expressway in Rego Park have won narrow approval of their $150 million project from the City Planning Commission, but substantial community opposition is expected to be reasserted when the Board of Estimate considers whether to give final city assent to the plan.

description: 1MODEL BY ROGER LAW AND PETER PLUCK. PHOTOGRAPH BY BOB CRAMP

description: A set of safety regulations has been completed for molecular biologists to observe in laboratory experiments using recently developed techniques of genetic transplantation.

description: MINEOLAFrank A. Gulotta, presiding justice of the appellate division of the State Supreme Court, Second Judicial Department, announced last week that the court had designated new presiding justices of the two appellate terms in the department effective Jan. 1.

title: HISPANICS ALLEGE U.S. INSENSITIVITY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 The Forum of National Hispanic Organizations has issued a call here for greater Federal responsiveness to the needs of the Hispanic community in the face of what it considers insensitivity on the part of the Ford Administration.

title: Soviet Population Growth
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)The population of the Soviet Union will exceed 320 million by the year 2,000, according to a Soviet demographer, Oleg Konstantinov, Tass reports.

description: Christine Michelle Loomis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald H. Loomis of Stamford, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Dennis Peter Horler, secretary of

title: Canadian Wheat to India
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)Canada is to supply about $44 million worth of wheat to India under the international food aid program, it has been announced here.

title: Portuguese Enclave on Timor Is Declared a Part of Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Sunday, Dec. 14 (Reuters)A small Portuguese territory on the island of Timor has officially merged with Indonesia, the Indonesian radio said today.

title: After 25 Bare Years, Paris Cafe Is Thriving
description: PARIS, Dec. 13 (Reuters)The Crazy Horse Saloon celebrated this week its 25th anniversary as a shrine for striptease worshipers in Paris.

title: Knicks Down Bullets by 19
description: As the Knicks headed for the dressing room last night aftei they had beaten the Washington Bullets, 126107, before 18,111 fans at Madison Garden, Spencer Hay, wood said loudly, It's the beginning.

title: Miss Hill Triumphs In Skating
description: Priscilla Hill, a 14yearold from Lexington, Mass., won the 1975 Eastern Senior Ladies Figure Skating Championship tonight at the Sky Rink here. Opening with a triple loop jump, she later executed a triple Salchow jump in a spectacular performance.

title: Scholarship Set Up For the Over50's
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR  A scholarship for students over 50 years of age has been established at Montclair State College in memory of Ralph P. LaSalle Sr., who was en, rolled in the college's Second Careers program at the time of his death in September.

title: U.N. Backs Women Staffers
description: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 13 (Reuters)The General Assembly has urged the United Nations Secretariat to increase the number of women employees in professional positions. A resolution called on Secretary General Kurt Waldheim to step up recruitment Of women between 1976 and 1979. On Tuesday, United Nations women staffers demonstrated against what they regarded as discrimination in hiring, pay and promotion.

title: MADRID INSTALLS NEW GOVERNMENT
description: MADRID, Dec. 13  Spain's new Government took office today with a salute to the gigantic labor of Generalissimo Francisco Franco and a pledge to make use of it.

title: L.I. Cowboys Show Stuff
description: MEDFORDThe Long Island cowboy is not only alive and well, but is roping and bulldogging at a ranch on a main, thoroughfare of this still partially rural Suffolk community.

title: Robert Bruce Patterson Plans To Wed Caroline Webb Johnson
description: Caroline Webb Johnson and Robert Bruce Patterson, who both graduated from Emory University in Atlanta, plan to be married June 26.

title: L. B. J. Country Revisited
description: IF Lyndon Evanko of Collingsville, Ill., should be driving along U.S. 290 from Stonewall to Hye, Tex., he might want to drop ii and see the letter he wrote President Lyndon B. Johnson in October 1964. Or, Mrs. Mary Lou Hotchkiss of Paradise, Calif., might want to see the wall hanging she senta horse's head composed of buttons against a corduroy background.

title: The struggle of authority and autonomy
description: The chicken of authority has laid the egg of rebellion and inside it, pecking at the shell and trying to get out, is the authoritarian chicken once again. And so on. Or if you prefer, contrariwise:

title: U.S. Driver Faces A European Detour
description: Bobby Rahal is a promising American roadracing driver who had to go to Canada to get, start and who may, have to race in Europe to be discovered. It's all very frustrating, according to the 22year old driver, but that's the way the game is played.

title: Hark! The Pop Cash Register Rings
description: In order to capitalize on the holiday giftbuying season, many record companies save their biggest albums for release during the last month of the year. In December, record shops are packed with stacks of new disks by many of poplands s most revered superstars. The following records are this year's offerings by pop biggles. Earnest endeavors by and large, they tend to demonstrate that sometimes talent and earnestness are still not enough.

title: BRITONS DISPUTE NEW LABOR LAWS
description: LONDON, Dec, 13Four workers at a General Motors factory in Britain refused to join the company's unions, so last weekend they were fired. Because of peculiarities of new British labor laws, they now face losing unemployment pay for six weeks.

title: How to cure the ills of curing
description: Americans, we are reminded almost unceasingly, spend an unconscionably high fraction of their Gross National Product on health care that varies in quality, from barbaric to superlative; in effectiveness, from zero to spectacular; in thoughtfulness, mercy and humanity from technological mindlessness to a kind of tender rationality that, at its best, blends high science, devoted personal interest and real social concern.

title: Small Groups of Blacks in U.S. Focusing on Angola
description: Within a small but informed and sophisticated minority in the American black community, especially along the Eastern seaboard, interest and tension have been building about Angola.

description: ...Something new

title: 3 Men in Ski Masks Rob Brooklyn Jewelry Shop
description: Three men wearing ski masks, two of them armed with handguns, held up a boutique in the Flatlands section of Brooklyn yesterday evening and fled with about $1,100 in cash and jewelry valued at $25,000, the police reported.

title: Bonnie Baldwin Is Wed
description: Bonnie Baldwin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence C. Baldwin of Ridgefield Park, N.J., was married here yesterday to Charles R. Goldburg, a lawyer with the Miller Advertising Agency here and son of Mr. and Mrs. William Goldberg of Woodmere, L.I. The Rev. Martin Clarke performed the ceremony in the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral. Mr. Goldburg graduated from Swarthmore College and the Fordham Law School.

title: Community Service To Help the Vulnerable
description: In all the talk about the problems of the city, little enough is said about the vast numbers of citizens struggling in quiet desperation to make ends meet.

description: In good times and in bad times, the restaurant business is the bread and butter of the city's retail real estate market.

description: Today: Leading Events

title: AS THE TV WORLD TURN
description: The making and remaking (and bleeping and rebleeping) of a TV pilot is a soap opera itself. This week. One Day at a Time goes on the tube because Beacon Hill bombed. Will Day succeed?
